summary: rapid improvement of focal right upper and left upper lobe focal abnormalities, most consistent with resolving infection considering the rapid decrease in size during an approximately two-week interval.as an abnormality has been present in this area of the right upper lobe since ___, a followup chest ct in three months may be helpful to document complete resolution if warranted clinically.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolus to the subsegmental level.there has been interval improvement in aeration of the right middle and bilateral lower lobes and clearing of the consolidation.scattered ground- glass opacities throughout the lungs is most likely related to resolving infection.however, there is a new focus of ground glass opacity and mild bronchial wall thickening at the right apex (2:10) which may represent new infection or post-inflammatory change.the airways are patent without mucoid impaction.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable without evidence of aortic dissection or pericardial effusion.there is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.this study is not optimized for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis.within this limitation, there is an unchanged 1.2 x 1.2 hypodense lesion in the right lobe of the liver (3:70) that measures simple fluid attenuation, likely a simple cyst.amorphous appearance of the left kidney included only on the non- contrast sequence is likely related to recent partial nephrectomy.there is no suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesion.the bone island in the right scapula is unchanged.the previously noted left thyroid lesion is not appreciated on the current study, likely due to differences in technique.
summary: no evidence of pe to the subsegmental level.improved aeration of the lower and right middle lobes.scattered bilateral ground- glass opacity may be related to resolving infection.new right apical ground glass opacity may be post-inflammatory or infections.left thyroid hypodensity, not well appreciated on the current study may be due to differences in technique.postoperative appearance of the left kidney.

text: the thoracic aorta demonstrates no evidence of traumatic injury.there is no mediastinal hematoma.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pneumothorax or evidence of contusion.there are small patchy opacities at the posterior aspect of the lung bases likely consistent with aspiration.
summary: minimally displaced fractures of the l3 through l5 right transverse processes.no evidence of traumatic injury elsewhere throughout the chest, abdomen, and pelvis.mild bibasilar opacities likely relating to aspiration.findings discussed with trauma team immediately after the study.

text: the left subclavian port-a-cath remains in place.the great vessels and coronary arteries contain atherosclerotic calcification.the heart size is normal, without pericardial effusion.small lymph nodes in the mediastinum and right hilum are stable, with a paratracheal lymph node measuring up to 8 mm (3:22).the lungs are clear without consolidation or pleural effusion.there is mild dependent atelectasis bilaterally.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to segmental level.tiny subpleural pulmonary nodules on the right are unchanged.there are no new nodules or masses.
summary: minimal interval decrease in size of metastatic lymph nodes in the pelvis.stable appearance of lymph nodes within the chest and retroperitoneum.no new lesions.oncology table has been updated in careweb.left lobe hepatic hemangioma, unchanged.sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: there is a new area of consolidation with air bronchograms seen in the right lower lobe.in addition, there is bibasilar dependent atelectasis, less prominent than on prior study.the small bilateral pleural effusions seen on the prior study have also decreased in size.an additional area of focal atelectasis is seen in the right middle lobe, unchanged.enlarged lymph nodes are seen in the prevascular and pretracheal areas, the latter measuring 1.8 cm in short-axis diameter.degenerative changes are seen in the spine.
summary: new area of consolidated lung in the right lower lobe which could represent a new pneumonia in this patient with persistent fevers.the bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar atelectasis are somewhat improved when compared to the prior study.no significant interval change in abdominal and pelvic free fluid and fluid collections.

text: no significant axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the left hilar abnormality and radiation change is unchanged from the prior exam.contrast bolus was optimally timed for evaluation of the pulmonary arteries.there is no intraluminal filling defect suggesting pulmonary embolus.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart is normal in size.there is a tiny lentiform low attentuation at the left lung base wich could represent a pleural fluid.lung windows demonstrate some partial collapse of the lingula related to the hilar mass.this is not changed since the prior exam.there is underlying centrilobular lobular emphysema.new in the interval is an ill- defined 1 x 1 cm pulmonary nodule just posterior to the lateral segmental right lower lobe artery.its appearance is worrisome for neoplasm; however, given it was not visualized on the previous exam this makes a focal inflamatory process more probable.another alternitive wouldd be that the lesion could have been missed due to slice selection on the previous scan.bone elements demonstrate stable sclrosis of t11 vertebral body.
summary: no pulmonary embolus new 1 x 1 cm ill defined pulmonary nodule.this could be either neoplastic or inflamatory.given rapidity of development inflamatory is favored.would recomend follow up ct in one month to ensure resolution, emphysema stable left hilar mass with radiation change in the left lung.

text: there is a granuloma in the right upper lobe.there is lingular scarring.otherwise, both lungs appear clear with no focal consolidation concerning for pneumonia.the visualized heart and pericardium are within normal limits.mediastinal, hilar, and axillary lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.
summary: granuloma in the right upper lobe, lingular scarring.hypodensity in the interpolar region of the right kidney is too small to characterize but likely represents a simple cyst.apparent minimal wall thickening of the transverse colon to the rectum is most likely related to under-distension, however, colitis cannot be excluded in the correct clinical setting.few sigmoid diverticula with no evidence of sigmoid diverticulitis.please note ct is not sensitive for detection of intraluminal pathology.rn ___ ___ was notified of the results at 1427 p.m.on ___.

text: again demonstrated is an extensive class-b aortic dissection.there are extensive fenestrations between the two channels.the overall appearance is unchanged.the celiac axis, sma, left renal artery, and inferior mesenteric artery all originate from the true lumen.the right renal arteries likely do as well.there is no evidence of acute extravasation or surrounding hematoma.noted in the proximal descending aorta near the origin of the dissection is an area of iv contrast within the mural thrombus posteriorly.this is not in connection with the false lumen, but is likely related to the existing dissection.this area is located distal to the left subclavian artery, and was also present on the patient's prior study.a new left sided pleural effusion is present.this fluid has the density of ___ hounsfield units, which is below that of blood.it is associated with minor compressive atelectasis in the left lung base.a small right sided pleural effusion is also present.the pulmonary vasculature is well opacified and demonstrates no large central pulmonary emboli.no pericardial effusions are present.bibasilar atelectasis is present.no pneumonic consolidations are present.
summary: stable class b aortic aneurysm.both true and flase lumens still opacify.there has been no cranial progression of the aneurysm.there is no evidence of acute extravasation.bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right, associated with bibasilar atelectasis.attenuation values of the fluid are less than that of blood products.calculi within the bladder.these results were discussed with the e.d.housestaff at the time of interpretation.

text: there is no aortic dissection or aneurysmal dilatation.extensive multifocal atherosclerotic plaque is present in the thoracic and abdominal aorta, common iliac arteries, and external iliac arteries bilaterally.extensive atherosclerotic calcifications are present in the left anterior descending coronary artery and left main coronary artery, as well as some calcifications in the left circumflex and right coronary arteries.atherosclerotic calcifications are present in the proximal left common carotid, proximal left subclavian, proximal celiac, proximal superior mesenteric, and proximal renal arteries.there are no filling defects in the pulmonary vasculature to suggest pulmonary embolism.the heart is enlarged.interstitial pulmonary edema and small bilateral pleural effusions are present, consistent with mild congestive heart failure.there is no pericardial effusion.the patient is intubated.the endotracheal tube terminates in good position between the thoracic inlet and the carina.the airways are patent to the level of segmental bronchi.moderate emphysema is present.atelectasis is noted in the basilar lower lobes bilaterally, likely compressive in the setting of pleural effusions.
summary: no aortic dissection or aneurysm.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.extensive atherosclerosis in the aorta, coronary arteries, and multiple aortic branches as described.mild congestive heart failure with small bilateral pleural effusions.emphysema.incompletely characterized dense 4-cm lesion in the left kidney, which may represent a solid mass such as a renal cell carcinoma or a hyperdense cyst.further characterization by mri is recommended.multiple hypodensities in the liver and both kidneys, some of which represent cysts, and others are too small to characterize but probably also represent cysts.enlarged prostate.grade i anterolisthesis at l4/5.dfdkq

text: the study is somewhat degraded by motion artifact and the timing of the contrast bolus.there is no evidence of a filling defect in the central, segmental or sub- segmental pulmonary arteries, to suggest a pulmonary embolus.there are no parenchymal abnormalities in the lungs.there is no evidence of dissection.the heart and great vessels are normal.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is a probable traction diverticulum of the esophagus, best seen on images 3:12 through 3:19, which appears to impinge on the posterior (membranous) trachea.there is no evidence of a te fistula.there is no evidence in the lungs to suggest either acute or chronic aspiration.although this exam is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, the limited view of the abdomen is normal.there is very mild djd in the upper thoracic spine.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus or acute thoracic aortic dissection.findings suggestive of esophageal diverticulum without any the secondary signs to suggest a fistula.consider further evaluation with esophagram if warranted clinically.

text: the aorta opacifies normally and there is no evidence of dissection or contour abnormality.there are four vessels arising from the aortic arch, including an independent origin of the left vertebral artery, a common anatomic variant.the pulmonary arteries demonstrate patency and appear unremarkable.there is no lymphadenopathy.the heart is normal in size and shape.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.___-apical pleural parenchymal scarring is noted.scattered areas of atelectasis are noted, most predominantly along the dependent aspect of the lungs.no worrisome nodule, mass, or consolidation is seen.there is no evidence of pulmonary contusion or pneumothorax.
summary: left distal clavicle fracture, left fourth and fifth rib fractures (lateral).no lung or vessel injury.sesha

text: there is satisfactory contrast opacification of the pulmonary arteries with no pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.dense consolidation surrounded by peripheral ground-glass opacities in the right middle lobe and a small nodule in the superior segment of the right lower lobe (5.31)are new in addition to new bilateral non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions.the central airways are widely patent.multiple pathologically enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes have slightly decreased since the previous study, for example in the anterior mediastinum was 14 mm, is now 8.7 mm; however, the subcarinal lymph nodes have increased from 8 mm to 12 mm and right hilar nodes are larger which could be reactive due to the right lower lobe consolidation.the caliber of the aorta, pulmonary artery and heart size is normal with a trace pericardial effusion.although this examination was not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, pneumobilia is in the left lobe of the liver due to prior sphincterotomy.no destructive or sclerotic bone lesions are concerning for malignancy.degenerative changes in the mid thoracic spine with mild wedge compression fractures are unchanged.
summary: no pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.new consolidation in the right middle lobe, bilateral non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions and increasing lymph node enlargement in the subcarinal right hilar regions are most likely due to pneumonia

text: a thyroid isthmus low density nodule is again seen, measuring 24 x 18 mm, larger than the previous exam 16 x 13 mm.the right upper lobe lesion abutting the suture line is again seen, and is similar in size.however, in the interval, new lesions have appeared, for example, a 12 x 16 mm nodule medial segment.an ill-defined opacity is seen in the upper lobe anterior segment (series 3, image 28).on the left, there is endobronchial thickening of the proximal left upper lobe bronchus, lingular bronchus, and left lower lobe bronchus, with soft tissue filling of the bronchus to the left lower lobe lateral segment.there is also soft tissue plugging of bronchi and bronchioles to the left lower lobe posterior segment.a new soft tissue nodule was seen in the left lower lobe posterolateral aspect, measuring 11 x 12 mm.there is no pleural effusion.emphysematous changes are seen in the left lobe.there is extensive mediastinal and right hilar lymphadenopathy, the largest being a conglomeration in the subcarinal region measuring 24 x 48 mm, slightly enlarged since the last exam.limited evaluation of the abdomen again shows the large infiltrative lesion in the caudate lobe of the liver, and lesions replacing much of the spleen.a new permeative soft tissue lesion in the inferior scapula is identified (series 3, image 39).there is a sclerotic lesion in lateral aspect of the right sixth rib, which is unchanged.multiplanar reformats were essential in delineating the findings above.
summary: interval progression of known lung cancer, with endobronchial soft tissue lesions particularly in the left lower lobe, and new lung nodules.no evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.coronary vascular calcifications.similar/slightly enlarged appearance of metastatic disease in mediastinum, liver, and spleen.new permeative lesion in left scapula.

text: the patient is status post redo sternotomy.no abnormal fluid collections are identified adjacent to the sternum.a stent is present in the ascending aorta extending from the root of the aorta up to the distal aortic arch.the stent is patent with no contrast noted adjacent to the stent.the major vessels arising from the aortic arch are patent but the study was not timed to optimize opacification of the innominate and left carotid arteries.distal to the aortic stent is again noted a dissection with filling of both the true and false lumens.when compared with the prior study there has been interval slight increase in the diameter of the thoracic aorta at several levels.at the level of the confluence of the left pulmonary veins, the diameter of the thoracic aorta is 5.9 cm; this was 4.8 cm on ___.the major vessels arising from the thoracic and abdominal aorta are all patent.two false lumens are noted in the abdominal aorta, the lumen on the left appears to give rise in part to the celiac artery while the true lumen supplies the superior mesenteric artery.this is all unchanged compared with multiple prior studies.again noted is lack of opacification of what appears to be an axillary-femoral bypass graft tracking down the right anterior chest and abdominal wall; this is filling retrograde from below.this is also unchanged from the prior studies.the pulmonary arteries are widely patent with no filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolus.no consolidation or atelectasis is present in the lungs.no effusions are noted.no pericardial effusion is identified.the cardiac ___ are unchanged in size and appearance.a large thoracic sliding hiatus hernia is noted.
summary: status post redo sternotomy with no evidence for pulmonary embolus.the only change of note is an increase in the size of the thoracic aortic aneurysm which at the level of the confluence of the left pulmonary veins has increased from approximately 4.8 to 5.9 cm in diameter when compared to the study from ___.please note that the patency of the cervical vessels was not well evaluated due to the timing of the study but retrograde filling is noted of what appears to be an axillofemoral bypass graft in the right subcutaneous chest.

text: a 73 x 82 mm right upper lobe lung mass extending from thickened costal pleura to the right hilus has not changed in measurable dimensions, but now has a longer interface with the right hilar structures, particularly descending pulmonary artery.on ___ it was considerably smaller, (51 x 62mm, 2:42).as before, it enhances heterogeneously indicative of a substantial necrosis.it deflects but does not clearly invade the anterior and posterior segmental bronchi to the right upper lobe, but it probably invades the central and superior portions of both the middle and lower lobes by virtue of incomplete or transgressed fissures.a small nonhemorrhagic dependent right pleural effusion is smaller.postobstructive consolidation at the lateral periphery of the lesion in the right upper lobe has increased since the prior examination.bilateral paratracheal mediastinal adenopathy, nodes ranging in size up to 11 mm, and 6-mm left hilar and 7-mm prevascular nodes are unchanged.a very large thyroid mass displaces the trachea to the right, narrows the coronal diameter from 19 to 15 mm, extending from the base of the neck to the level of the crossing left brachiocephalic vein; at the level of its greatest area is 58 x 38 mm today (2:7), most recently 61 x 40 mm (2:7).this study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation except to note the absence of adrenal mass or lesions in the liver suspicious for malignancy.emphysema, predominantly paraseptal is moderate-to-severe in the upper lungs and superior segment of the right lower lobe, but mild elsewhere.chronic impaction of the posterior basal segment of the left lower lobe is stable.there are no new lung lesions of concern.
summary: very slight interval growth of a large predominantly right upper lobe lung lesion, which may invade the middle and lower lobes, compared to ___, after substantial growth since ___.similarly mediastinal adenopathy is stable since ___, but increased since ___, primarily in the number of mildly enlarged nodes.although small right pleural effusion has decreased since ___, the extent of locally thickened pleura has increased since ___ of last year.no evidence of new intrathoracic metastasis.partial impaction of a thick-walled posterior segmental bronchus, left lower lobe is stable since ___, probably inflammatory.large thyroid mass grossly unchanged, could be indolent malignancy.moderately severe paraseptal emphysema.

text: the patient is status post left lung resection.there is a tiny fluid collection at the apex of the left hemithorax which is stable since the prior study and is likely post-surgical.there is shift of the mediastinum into the left hemithorax.there are no infiltrates or consolidations.there is a sub-cm nodule within the right lower lobe which is stable since the prior study and is stable since multiple prior studies.no new nodules are present.
summary: no evidence of disease recurrence.

text: there has been interval resolution of the diffuse chest wall subcutaneous emphysema.a tracheostomy tube is well inflated in the proximal trachea, which measures 3.0 cm in diameter.reatined secretions are noted above the level of the tracheostomy.there is diffuse bilateral parenchymal consolidation with tree-in-___ opacities, slightly improved from prior examination.there is an unchanged right pneumothorax with right chest tube in place.there has been resolution of the left pneumothorax with removal of the two left chest tubes.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.
summary: mild improvement in bilateral pulmonary consolidation and tree-in-___ opacities, consistent with an improving infectious process.resolution of left pneumothorax and persistent right pneumothorax.resolution of chest wall emphysema, and marked decrease in right abdominopelvic wall emphysema.markedly increased fecal retention.

text: the thyroid gland is unremarkable.multiple axillary lymph nodes are mildly prominent.no mediastinal lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria is present.the heart and pulmonary arteries are unremarkable.in the proximal descending aorta distal to the left subclavian artery takeoff, there is a 2.1 x 3 x 3.4 cm outpouching of contrast that passes through a 14 mm neck.no evidence of extraluminal contrast or luminal aneurysm formation is noted.calcifications normally expected between the intima and media are located between the lumen and the pouch.no other areas of aortic dilatation or outpouching are noted.the lungs show small bilateral nonhemorrhagic effusions.ground-glass opacity present in both lungs are likely related to expiratory phase of imaging.
summary: 3.4 x 2.1 x 3 cm outpouching of contrast along the medial wall of the proximal descending aorta distal to the left subclavian artery takeoff either represents a pseudoaneurysm with a 14-mm neck or a chronic ulcerative plaque.diffuse calcific and non-calcific atherosclerosis of the arterial vessels without evidence of flow-limiting stenosis.small nonhemorrhagic bilateral effusions.mild retroperitoneal and axillary lymphadenopathy is nonspecific.rectal wall thickening with peri-rectal stranding may be related to proctitis.

text: there are multiple subcentimeter nodules within the right middle lobe along the fissure which appear unchanged from prior examination.a left thyroid hypodensity (2:5) is unchanged.there is right apical scarring.there are no pleural effusions or new nodules or opacities.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.the airways are patent to the segmental level.there is no lymphadenopathy.
summary: enhancing lesion in segment ___ slightly smaller on this examination.remaining liver lesions appear stable.stable pulmonary nodules 3-mm omental nodule of unclear significance.continued close attention to these areas on followup studies is recommended.

text: the pulmonary arteries are opacified to the subsegmental level.no filling defects to indicate a pulmonary embolus are seen.the aorta is normal in caliber without dissection or aneurysmal dilatation.remaining great vessels are normal.a left substernal thyroid goiter is present.a left internal jugular central venous catheter tip terminates in the svc.large left, and moderate sized right pleural effusions are present.additionally, curvilinear hyperdense material seen within the right pleural space on the non-contrast images may reflect prior pleurodesis (2:25).the patient is status post right mastectomy.there is a trace pericardial effusion.there is subcarinal lymphadenopathy measuring up to 20 mm in greatest short axis dimension (3:31).prominent left hilar lymph nodes are seen.no axillary lymphadenopathy is present.in the right perihilar region, involving both the right upper and lower lobes medially, there is an area of opacification with air bronchograms noted, and bronchiectasis with adjacent thickening of the minor fissure.there are several nodules within the left lung including a hazy opacity in the left upper lobe (2:14), measuring 7 x 10 mm; an opacity in the left upper lobe near the heart apex (2:24) measuring 11 x 11 mm; and a nodule in the posterior left lower lobe (2:31) measuring 12 x 12 mm.there is an ill-defined ground glass opacity in the right lung apex (2:9), measuring 6 x 17 mm, which is non-specific.there are tiny nodular opacities (2:37) in the right middle lobe suggestive of small airways infection or inflammation.in the right lower lobe (2:42), there is smooth septal thickening.additionally, mucus plugging of the right lower lobe bronchi are noted, with centrilobular nodular opacities compatible with small airways disease.geographic area of opacification in the anterior right upper lobe peripherally is compatible with post-radiation changes.the visualized portions of the upper abdomen are normal.
summary: right perihilar opacity with air bronchograms concerning for metastatic disease given the patient's history, or possibly a primary lung neoplasm.comparison with outside prior studies recommended.subcarinal lymphadenopathy may be involved by metastatic disease.multiple left lung nodules, highly suspicious for metastasis.non-specific ground glass opacity in the right lung apex, possibly infectious or inflammatory in etiology, but a neoplastic process is not excluded.bilateral, left greater than right pleural effusions.linear hyperdensity within the right pleural space may relate to prior pleurodesis and correlation with clinical history recommended.right lower lobe smooth septal thickening may be related to mild volume overload, but lymphangitic spread of tumor is not excluded.centrilobular nodules in the right lower lobe, as well as ill-defined nodular opacities in the right middle lobe, along with mucus plugging of right lower lobe bronchi suggest small airways infection or inflammation.

text: aside from bibasilar atelectasis, the lungs are clear and without evidence of nodules, consolidations, or effusions.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there are no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph nodes.
summary: bilateral renal hypodensities.the lesion in the right kidney is most consistent with a simple cyst.the lesion in the left kidney is too small to categorize.no evidence of metastatic disease or primary tumors in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.

text: the pulmonary arterial tree is well opacified, and there is no pulmonary embolism.there are no acute aortic abnormalities.however, severe atherosclerotic disease is seen within the aorta, with a large amount of calcified plaque along the entire descending thoracic aorta.this has a similar appearance to the previous study of ___.the heart appears unremarkable, with no right-sided cardiac enlargement or reflux of contrast material into the inferior vena cava.in the lungs, thickening of the interlobular septa indicates mild pulmonary edema.bilateral pleural effusions with associated dependent atelectasis are also seen.additionally, patchy airspace opacity is seen at the left lung base, which may represent a small amount of aspiration.the tracheobronchial tree contains an endotracheal tube, and is otherwise unremarkable to the subsegmental levels.a tiny, sub-4-mm nodule is seen in the right lower lobe (3:54).in the absence of risk factors for lung cancer, no followup is needed.an ng tube is seen in the esophagus and terminates in the stomach.while this examination is not optimized for evaluation of the abdomen, limited images of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.examination of osseous structures reveals mild degenerative disease of the thoracic spine.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.no acute aortic abnormalities identified.severe atherosclerotic disease of the aorta, with calcified plaque along the descending aorta.mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema.patchy airspace opacity at the left lung base may represent a small amount of aspiration.

text: there has been prior right mastectomy.in comparison with the examination of ___, the ground- glass and nodular opacity in the right upper lobe has decreased in the interval.a 2-mm nodule at the left lung apex (3:9) is unchanged.the right upper lobe nodule which previously measured 8 mm, now measures 6 mm, a difference, which may be due to differences in slice selection (3:15).no new pulmonary nodules are identified.there is linear atelectasis at the left lung base.calcification in the left extrapleural space with surgical clips, consistent with residual of postoperative change, are stable.there are no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph nodes.the parajugular node at the left supraclavicular region is unchanged measuring 6.5 mm in short axis dimension (3:6).a left-sided port-a-cath is in place with tip in the svc.
summary: innumerable new hypodense hepatic lesions consistent with progression of metastatic disease.marked interval atrophy of the left hepatic lobe.progression of osseous metastatic disease diffusely.right sided rib fractures.new nodularity in the omentum concerning for peritoneal implants.no ascites.unchanged pulmonary nodularity at the left lung apex and interval resolution of presumed infectious process in the right upper lobe.

text: soft tissue images demonstrate no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.the heart and pericardium are normal.no pericardial or pleural effusions.the lung window images demonstrate no pulmonary nodules or parenchymal consolidation.the airways are patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is soft tissue density measuring 5.0 x 3.5 cm is seen adjacent to the pericardium, is well-circumscribed, and may represent a pericardial cyst.the visualized portions of the liver and spleen are normal.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.soft tissue mass adjacent to the pericardium which may represent a pericardial cyst.further evaluation with echocardiography can be obtained.

text: minimal posterior bowing of the tracheal wall is indicative of tracheomalacia however this is not a dedicated study for the trachea.the esophagus is distended and fluid filled.there are prominent bibasilar atelectasis with superimposed consolidation that could represent pneumonia and/or aspiration, this is predominantly seen at the lung bases.there is no pleural effusion or pericardial effusion.the heart is not enlarged.there is significant calcification involving the annulus of the mitral valve, the aortic valve and some of the coronary vessels.the osseous structures are unremarkable showing no lesions suspicious for malignancy.the subdiaphragmatic structures show an incidental left adrenal gland which is well defined and partially enhancing measuring approximately 2.2 x 2.9 cm in maximum dimension.there is a right ij catheter with distal tip in the svc.
summary: bibasilar atelectasis with superimposed consolidation likely aspiration or pneumonia.probable tracheomalacia; for confirmation a dedicated ct examination of the trachea would be recommended if clinically warranted.incidental right adrenal gland lesion which is partially enhancing and should be further evaluated by another examination such as a dedicated adrenal mri study or ct examination.

text: pericardial effusion is now small.there is a lobulated soft- tissue density lesion in the right atrium (2, 41) abutting the tricuspid annulus.heart and great vessels are otherwise normal.small bilateral pleural effusions are unchanged.aside from mild dependent bibasilar atelectasis, lungs are grossly clear.central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph node.there is no supraclavicular lymphadenopathy, or any abnormal nodes in the visualized portions of the neck.
summary: decreased pericardial effusion, now small.stable small bilateral pleural effusons.2.6 cm lobulated soft-tissue lesion in the right atrium.this could represent thrombus, or mass related to the likely lymphoma.right atrial myxoma would be unusual.recommend correlation with echocardiography (recent echo reports describe limited visualization secondary to body habitus and overlying bandages), or cardiac mri if echocardiography is technically infeasible.no evidence of lymphadenopathy.

text: within the lungs, no solid, noncalcified lung nodules are identified to suggest the presence of metastases.however, within the left lower lobe posteriorly, an area of ground-glass attenuation is identified measuring 2.7 x 2.6 cm in diameter, surrounding an area of cystic lucency and associated with thickening of the medial wall of the cystic lucency with an associated 5 mm diameter solid nodular opacity (image 187, series 4).this finding is without change from the prior recent ct of ___.at a similar level within the right lower lobe, ground-glass opacities, reticulation and traction bronchiolectasis are present adjacent to lateral thoracic osteophytes, probably reflecting an exuberant form of localized fibrosis adjacent to osteophytes, but not all of the opacities are immediately in contact with an osteophyte.exam is otherwise remarkable for centrilobular emphysema, combined with paraseptal emphysema, overall moderate in severity with an upper lung predominance.nonspecific linear and nodular scarring is present in both lung apices, as well as scattered calcified granulomas within both lungs.no enlarged mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes.heart size is normal.coronary artery calcifications are present as well as evidence of previous coronary artery bypass surgery.no pericardial or pleural effusion.exam was not specifically tailored to evaluate the subdiaphragmatic region, but note is again made of three ill-defined focally enhancing areas within the liver, with relatively similar appearance to the prior ct abdomen study allowing for differences in phase of contrast administration.the remaining imaged portion of the upper abdomen is unremarkable on this limited assessment.skeletal structures demonstrate new compression deformity at the l1 vertebral body with central reduction in height of the vertebral body by about 50%.additionally, new high-density material is present within this vertebral body.vertebral structures are otherwise remarkable for degenerative changes in the spine.
summary: no ct evidence of pulmonary metastases.thickening of wall of bulla in left lower lobe with associated 5-mm diameter nodular opacity and surrounding ground-glass opacity.although nonspecific, this could potentially represent a primary lung neoplasm arising along the wall of an emphysematous space.consider followup ct scan in six months to assess for interval change.nonspecific ground-glass and reticular opacities in right lower lobe may represent localized fibrosis due to adjacent lateral osteophyte formation in the spine.attention to this area on followup ct would also be helpful, particularly to reassess areas of ground-glass that are not directly adjacent to the spine.emphysema.similar appearance of three liver lesions, possibly representing vascular anomalies or hemangiomas.as mentioned previously, mri of the abdomen may be helpful for more complete characterization.new compression deformity at l1 and apparent interval vertebroplasty procedure.correlation with recent treatment history recommended to confirm that the high-density material is related to vertebroplasty and not a sclerotic metastasis.this finding was entered in the radiology communications dashboard on ___.

text: paramediastinal widening, questionned on chest radiograph, ___, is due to combination of tortuous vessels and mediastinal fat.there is no goiter, lymphadenopathy or other mass.moderate-sized hiatus hernia is present just above the diaphragm.heart is mildly enlarged, particularly the left ventricle.atherosclerotic calcification is heavy in the aortic arch and in the left subclavian and innominate arteries and in the coronaries, including the left main, circumflex, and anterior descending arteries, and in the lower thoracic and abdominal aorta and proximal right renal artery.mild irregularity to the posterior costal pleural surfaces is due to extrapleural fat deposition.there is no pleural effusion.a solitary 8.5 mm wide right lung nodule lies close to the plane of minor fissure that may be incomplete medially, and therefore indeterminate as to lobe.lesion lies less than 3 mm from the mediastinal pleura, 102a:28, and thin section imaging shows both soft tissue and fatty components, 102b:154-159, a suggestion, but this is a benign lesion, but not a definitive finding.there are no other lung lesions of concern.hilar lymph nodes range up to 9 mm in width, on the left.this study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation except to note the absence of adrenal mass or any findings in the liver suggesting malignancy.
summary: normal mediastinum.solitary 9mm, right lung pulmonary nodule.any prior chest ct scans should be obtained to see if this is a new finding warranting further investigation.in the absence of prior imaging, followup scans should be obtained over the course of two years, starting in three months.findings were posted to the online record of critical radiology findings for direct notification of the referring physician, ___ the time of this dictation.

text: the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are within normal limits.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.there continues to be consolidation of the right upper and lower and left lower lobes.the consolidation has slightly improved compared to prior examination.there has been development of scattered patchy opacities in the left upper and lower lobes.no significant pleural effusions are identified.bilateral chest tubes are again seen.

text: a limited study was performed from the cardiac apex inferiorly to the aortic arch superiorly.the aortic root is dilated through the sinotubular junction.the maximum transverse diameter is 4.8 cm.no intimal flap is identified to indicate dissection.there is no pericardial effusion.the imaged portions of the lung parenchyma show only mild dependent atelectasis.there are no significant effusions.there is a mild thoracic scoliosis.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.there is no aortic dissection.heart size is normal.mild coronary calcification is seen in the left anterior descending coronary artery.central bronchi are patent to the subsegmental level.mediastinal lymphadenopathy has worsened slightly since previous exam, with nodes increased in both size and number.largest discrete node is right upper paratracheal 13-mm node (3, 33).postsurgical changes are noted in the right lower lobe.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there are diffuse, multifocal areas of dense centrilobular airspace consolidations, as well as diffusely increased background ground-glass attenuation.fibrotic changes, most severe at the lung bases are little changed, and remain consistent with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.there is no osseous lesion suspicious for malignancy.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.diffuse ground glass centrilobular airspace opacities.appearance is somewhat nonspecific, and differential diagnosis includes multifocal pneumonia (particularly viral etiologies), diffuse alveolar injury or hemorrhage, and drug reaction.pulmonary edema may be less likely given absence of significant septal thickening or effusions.fulminant progression of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is also possible.findings discussed with dr.___ at 5:10 a.m.on ___.

text: there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.multiple subcentimeter mediastinal lymph nodes are noted.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.these do not demonstrate any rim enhancement of the pleura.they appear slightly loculated over the lung apex bilaterally.there is consolidation of the lower lobes bilaterally.more nodular opacities are seen in the upper lobes bilaterally and in the middle lobe.the heart is enlarged.

text: no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph nodes are present.heart, pericardium, and great vessels are within normal limits.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion identified.there is mild bilateral pleural thickening, unchanged since the prior study.lung window images demonstrate interval increase in size of two round pulmonary masses within the left lower lobe.the largest mass is peripherally based and measures 3.6 x 3.9 cm, previously 2.7 x 2.6 cm.the second large mass which is located within the medial basilar segment of the left lower lobe measures approximately 2.8 x 2.5 cm, previously 1.6 x 1.6 cm.new tiny pulmonary nodules also identified within the periphery of the left lower lobe, measuring 5 mm in diameter.no areas of parenchymal consolidation are identified.airways are patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, there has been interval development of bilateral enhancing adrenal masses.the left adrenal mass measures 1.8 x 2.7 cm, and the right adrenal mass measures 1.7 x 2.5 cm.these masses are consistent with metastatic disease.additionally, a new, approximately 1cm low attenuation lesion is seen within the upper pole of the left kidney, which is only partially imaged.the visualized portion of the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, stomach appear within normal limits.
summary: interval progression of metastatic disease with increase in size of left lower lobe pulmonary masses, interval development of new bilateral adrenal masses, and new 5 mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule.no evidence of pneumonia.new low attenuation lesion within the left kidney, which is only partially imaged on this study, concerning for a metastasis.ct of the abdomen can be performed for further evalutation.

text: respiratory motion limits evaluation for subsegmental pe in the left lung base and the anterior left upper lobe.otherwise, no filling defect is seen to suggest pulmonary embolism.an et tube terminates in the mid trachea, and an et tube terminates in the distal esophagus.the heart and great vessels appear unremarkable except to note rightward shift of the mediastinum, of the right upper and lower lobes and also most of the the right middle lobe.the left lung demonstrates subsegmental plate-like atelectasis in the upper lobe, but also in the lower lobe.there is heterogeneous density in the aerated left lung which is likely due to air trapping.no pneumothorax, pneumomediastinum, or pleural effusion is seen.prominent soft tissue in both hila measure up to 11 mm thick.no definite hilar adenopathy is noted.limited views through the upper abdomen show colonic diverticula at the splenic flexure.the stomach is mildly distended.minimal pleural parenchymal scarring is noted at the left lung apex.no region of bony destruction is seen concerning for malignancy.multilevel degenerative changes are noted in the mid to the lower thoracic spine.
summary: no pulmonary embolism seen.atelectasis of the right upper and lower lobes and also partially the right middle lobe.mosaic appearance of the left lung likely due to air trapping rather than a perfusion abnormality.ot tube terminates in the distal esophagus and needs to be advanced.mildly dilated stomach.findings were posted on the ed dashboard upon completion of the study.

text: there are no pathologically enlarged axillary lymph nodes.there are multiple low attenuation enlarged lymph nodes within the mediastinum.there is a 1.2 x 1.2 cm left paratracheal lymph node.there is a 1.8 x 2.0 cm ap window lymph node.there is a 1.1 cm precarinal lymph node.there are multiple other smaller mediastinal lymph nodes.there is a 2.2 x 2.8 cm low attenuation lymph node in the carina.there is a 3.2 x 2.3 cm right hilar lymph node.there is a large 5 x 4.6 cm low density mass encasing the right pulmonary vein.there is low attenuation material within the right bronchus intermedius likely from invasion of this large mass.there are multiple smaller right hilar lymph nodes.there appears to be some calcification within this largest mass adjacent to the right bronchus.there are small bilateral effusions with bibasilar dependent atelectasis.no discrete pulmonary nodules.the heart and pericardium are normal.there is calcification of the aorta.there is a lytic lesion in the right 4th rib as well as possibly one in the left scapula.
summary: pneumoperitoneum.likely partial small bowel obstruction likely secondary to adhesions with two identified transition points in the same loop of small bowel within the right pelvis.findings consistent with metastatic disease within the liver, spleen, and left adrenal gland.this has progress significantly compared to prior ct.extensive ascites and bilateral pleural effusions.extensive mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy with a mass encasing the right pulmonary vein and likely invading the right bronchus intermedius.lytic osseous lesions as described and can be correlated with bone scan if appropraite .

text: the current study is viewed in conjunction with the prior preoperative exam of ___.since the prior study, there has been interval development of multiple bilateral small ground-glass opacities.though appearance is nonspecific, metastatic disease is the primary consideration.additionally, there is a nodule measuring 10 mm in maximum dimension involving the right middle lobe.there is no pathologically enlarged hilar or mediastinal adenopathy.the patient is status post esophagectomy with gastric pull-through.no evidence of local recurrence.there is a ring-enhancing mass with surrounding edema involving the right subscapularis muscle, consistent with metastatic disease.no pulmonary arterial filling defects, heart size is unremarkable, aorta and great neck vessels also appear normal.

text: no filling defect is noted within the main pulmonary artery and its branches to suggest pulmonary embolism.there has been interval decrease in the diffuse bilateral ground glass opacities of the lung.new areas of consolidation are noted within the right lower lobe (3:90), and in the right upper lobe suprahilar region (5:29).two new nodular foci of consolidation have developed in the right apex, the largest measuring 1.6 cm (3, 37).the previously noted foci of peribronchovascular consolidation of the middle lobe, lingula, and lower lobes have resolved.new foci of septal thickening at the bases.the centrilobular emphysema dominantly affecting the right upper lobe is unchanged.there has been no change in the central lymphadenopathy, dominantly affecting the prevascular space and left and right paratracheal regions.no pleural or pericardial effusion is noted.the visualized part of the upper abdomen including the liver, adrenal glands, and superior pole of the kidneys appear unremarkable.moderate splenomegaly is unchanged.no concerning osseous lesion is identified.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.interval resolution of patchy airspace consolidation within the lingula, right middle lobe, and bilateral lower lobes and decreasing widespread ground glass opacities.the findings could reflect interval improvement in previously reported clinical diagnosis of multifocal pneumonia.residual ground glass opacities and septal thickening could also reflect hydrostatic edema or hemorrhage in the appropriate clinical setting.development of new foci of consolidation and ground glass within the right upper and lower lobes, concerning for a new infection.considering nodular foci of consolidation in right apex, fungal infection (aspergillus) should be considered if the patient is neutropenic.unchanged centrilobular emphysema.resolution of bilateral pleural effusions.

text: there are multiple enlarged axillary lymph nodes bilaterally.several measure up to 1 cm in short axis dimension.there are no pathologically enlarged hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes, although subcentimer nodes are visible.the heart, great vessels, and pericardium are unremarkable.the pulmonary arteries are well opacified and demonstrate no pulmonary embolism.there are four tiny pulmonary nodules in the right lung, all measuring less than 6 mm in diameter.bibasilar atelectatic changes are observed.small areas of bulluous emphysema, predominantly in the upper lobes, are also observed.there is a small left-sided pleural effusion.as better seen on the accompanying study, there is a small area of diaphragmatic thickening or loculated fluid collection along the left lateral wall inferiorly.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.bilateral enlarged axillary lymph nodes.multiple tiny right pulmonary nodules, which require three-month follow-up.small left-sided pleural effusion and bibasilar atelectatic changes.

text: there is a subclavian central line with the tip located in the superior svc.there are no significant axillary or mediastinal lymph nodes.there are small prevascular and mediastinal lymph nodes that do not meet ct criteria for pathology.the largest one is located in the pretracheal region and measures 6 mm.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the pulmonary artery and its branches are patent and do not have filling defects.there are pathcy areas of ground glass opacity and this finding is inexpecific.the lung fields are clear.there are no focal consolidations or pulmonary nodules.there is no pleural effusion.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.pathcy areas of ground glass opacities throughout the lung fields.this finding is inexpecific.

text: compared to the prior ct of the torso there has been a marked decrease in the size of the pulmonary nodules including the right lower lobe pulmonary nodule (3:32), which now measures 3 mm, the right basilar nodule (3:51) which now measures 4 mm, and the right middle lobe nodule measuring 5 mm currently (3:35).tiny linear opacities in the right base posteriorly are compatible with areas of atelectasis.no new nodules are identified.the lung parenchyma is otherwise unremarkable.the central airways are patent without endoluminal lesion.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are unremarkable in appearance.there is no mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.this study was not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.however, there is an incompletely visualized at least 5.3 x 2.5 cm peripherally enhancing lesion containing multiple foci of air in the right retroperitoneal region abutting the psoas muscle, the area of known previous contained colonic perforation.a focus of air in the adjacent flank is likely along the tract of the prior pigtail catheter.in addition there is a peripherally enhancing approximately 14 mm rounded structure either situated within the posterior right lobe of the liver or directly adjacent to it, which may be slightly enlarged compared to the prior mri of ___.the liver is diffusely low in attenuation apart from this area, compatible with fatty infiltration.there is apparent filling defect within the inferior vena cava, very difficult to evaluate given the timing of contrast bolus on this study.a gastrostomy tube is noted to be coiled within the lumen of the stomach.osseous structures demonstrate mild sclerosis and cortical thickening of the right tenth through twelfth ribs which are immediately adjacent to the peripherally enhancing collection in the right retroperitoneum described above, compatible with reactive change.there are degenerative changes noted within the spine.
summary: decrease in the size of the pulmonary nodules.no new nodules.persistent retroperitoneal peripherally enhancing collection containing foci of air compatible with the known colonic contained perforation in this region.adjacent enhancing nodule which may be within the posterior right lobe of the liver or immediately adjacent to it, and appears to have slightly increased since the mri of ___.adjacent cortical thickening and sclerosis of the tenth through twelfth right ribs, probably reactive.apparent filling defect in the inferior vena cava may reflect contrast phase; however, given that this patient has known thrombus within the ivc documented on the ___, progressive thrombus cannot be excluded.both to further evaluate the abnormalities in the right retroperitoneum and to evaluate the patency of the ivc, a followup mr of the abdomen is recommended.these findings were entered into the critical communications dashboard for documented communication with the referring provider.

text: pulmonary arteries are well opacified and demonstrate no evidence for filling defect.evaluation of the subsegmental arteries in the lung bases is limited secondary to motion artifact.there is no pulmonary embolism appreciated.the ascending aorta, aortic arch, and descending aorta appear normal in size and contour, with no evidence for dissection or other acute aortic syndrome.the great vessels are normal in appearance.the heart size enlarged but appears unchanged.there is no mediastinal adenopathy.the trachea and central airways are patent.a soft tissue density seen dependently within the trachea (3:21), consistent with mucous/secretions.the thyroid, although incompletely visualized, appears normal.there is a moderate simple pleural effusion on the right, with associated compressive atelectasis.this appears slightly enlarged compared to prior abdominal ct, as evidenced by increased subpulmonic component.a small amount of fluid does track into the fissures.there is no pleural enhancement, internal septation or loculation.there is no significant effusion on the left.there is no focal consolidation identified within the aerated lung parenchyma.there are no pulmonary nodules or masses appreciated.prior left lower lobe pneumonia has resolved.the bony thorax and surrounding soft tissues are unremarkable, with degenerative change noted in the thoracic spine.
summary: no evidence for pulmonary embolism or acute aortic syndrome.moderate simple right-sided pleural effusion with associated atelectasis, demonstrating mild interval enlargement compared to prior examination.prior left lower lobe consolidation has resolved.trace ascites, reduced from prior study.there is no acute intra- abdominal process appreciated.unchanged appearance (inlcuding comparison across modalities to mr ______) of two hypodense lesions within the body and uncinate process of the pancreas.secretions within mid-trachea.patient at increased risk for aspiration.

text: there is mediastinal and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy.this is not significantly changed in comparison to the prior study.there is no definite evidence for a filling defect in the pulmonary arteries although the evaluation is limited due to the patient's body habitus and suboptimal contrast opacification and most prominently due to breathing artifact throughout the examination.however, there is worsening of the ground-glass opacities in both lungs.the depicted portions of the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands and upper portions of both kidneys are unremarkable.an et tube is seen in satisfactory position.an ng tube is identified passing into the stomach.
summary: no definite evidence for pe.however, the examination is limited by several factors, most importantly by extensive breathing artifact.significant worsening of the ground-glass opacities in both lungs.while this may represent worsening of the patient's known interstitiell disease, differential diagnosis includes pulmonary edema.mediastinal and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy is unchanged.findings were discussed with ___ ___.

text: there are multiple small left axillary lymph nodes that do not meet ct criteria for pathology.the largest one measures 8 mm.there are no significant mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes.the aorta is intact without evidence of aortic injury.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.there are minimal dependent changes in the left lung.there are no pleural effusions or focal consolidations.there are dependent changes in the lungs.the airway is patent to level of subsegmental bronchi.there is an ng tube with the tip in the stomach.the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, and visualized loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no free fluid or free air in the abdomen.there are multiple cysts in the kidneys bilaterally, suggestive of early polycystic kidney disease.
summary: no significant injury to the chest or abdomen/pelvis.findings consistent with polycystic kidney disease.minimal patchy opacities in the left lung most likely represent dependent atelectasis.

text: in the left lung apex, there is an 8-mm spiculated nodule which abuts the pleura.there is also a nodular opacity measuring 7 mm in the right upper lobe on series 3, 31.there is moderate centrilobular emphysema throughout the lungs.there is no mediastinal adenopathy.there is mild hypertrophy and dilatation of the left ventricle.
summary: dilated ascending aorta to 4.9 x 4.8 cm.dense aortic valve calcifications.severe coronary artery calcifications, noting a slightly medial and anterior location of the right coronary artery origin between the ascending aorta and right ventricular outflow tract.8-mm spiculated left apex pulmonary nodule and 7-mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule.these lesions are suspicious, particularly the left apical lesion, and further workup is recommended.emphysema.severe narrowing of the celiac artery origin.

text: soft tissue windows reveal multiple mediastinal and hilar lymph node enlargement, presumably representing reactive lymph nodes after recent cabg.the ct study is suboptimal in technique due to patient's inability to hold breath.the central and middle pulmonary arteries demonstrate no evidence of filling defects.the peripheral pulmonary arteries are difficult to evaluate.there are certain hypoattenuation areas in the peripheral pulmonary arteries, which could represent pulmonary embolus or artifacts from the suboptimal study due to patient's inability to hold breath.moderate to large size bilateral pleural effusion is present.there is also large pericardial effusion somewhat loculated to the left side of heart with an attenuation in the 20's ___.the patient is s/p mediansternotomy.anterior chest wall and mediastinal stranding is present, consistent with recent cabg.a cardiac drain is present.lung windows reveal extensive air space groundglass opacification involving all lung lobes, with relative sparring of the lower lobes.
summary: suboptimal study due to respiratory motion artifacts.there is no evidence of pe in the central or middle pulmonary arteries.the peripheral pulmonary arteries are difficult to evaluate.diffuse alveolar groundglass opacifications involving all lung lobes with relative sparing of the lower lobes.this most likely represent non cardiogenic alveolar edema (ards).although cardiogenic edema is a differential diagnosis.multi focal pneumonia should also be considered in the appropriate clinical setting.large pericardial effusion and pleural effusions.the pericardial effusion appears somewhat loculated to the left side of the heart with an increased attenuation (in the 20's ___), which could represent hemorrhage into the pericardial space.an echocardiogram can be performed for further evaluation if indicated.mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy, presumably representing reactive lymph nodes.diverticulosis with no evidence of diverticulitis.

text: the pulmonary vasculature is well opacified and demonstrates no intraluminal filling defects suggestive of pulmonary embolus.no pathologically enlarged mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes are seen.no pleural or pericardial effusions are present.the bronchi are patent to the subsegmental levels.the lung parenchyma is clear with the exception of minor linear atelectasis in both lung bases.osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.

text: there is no significant hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is evidence of coronary bypass surgery using two bypass graphs.there is mediastinal stranding consistent with the patient's history of cabg.there is no pericardial effusion and the heart, pericardium and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there is trace left-sided pleural effusion.evaluation of the lungs demonstrates no evidence of pulmonary embolism bilaterally.a 4-mm nodule in the left lower lung (series 3 image 79) is detected.there is also an area of focal atelectasis in this area.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen the visualized liver, spleen, and stomach are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.left lower lung nodule.fleischer guidlines recommend 1 year follow up to assess for stability.

text: the visualized portion of the thyroid appears unremarkable.there continues to be a large mass lesion occupying most of the region of the left upper lobe of the lung.the left upper lobe bronchus and left upper lobe pulmonary vasculature continue to be occluded.the left lower lobe superior segment pulmonary artery is narrowed but patent.the left lower lobe bronchus is narrowed and even occluded over a short segment, but it is unclear if this is the result of mass effect or mucus plugging.while the left upper lobe remains completely collapsed, there is minimally improved aeration of the left lower lobe.the pigtail catheter is in place and there has been a decrease in the inferior portion of the left pleural effusion, the components of which are minimally complex fluid.the upper portion of the left pleural effusion is also improved and the previously described pleural implants are unchanged.continued mediastinal lymphadenopathy is seen, most prominently in the subcarinal region where a 3 x 5 cm lymph node persists.the aorta is of a normal caliber along its course and its arch branches are patent.the heart and mediastinal have shifted into a more anatomically focus of consolidation is present in the right upper lobe (4:45), which either represents a persistent area of atelectasis from the previous mediastinal shift versus an additional focus of fracture of the posterior right eighth rib persists.
summary: status post left pleural pigtail catheter placement with improvement in the volume of left pleural effusion and minimally improved aeration of the left lower lobe.left lower lobe bronchus shows short segment occlusion, likely reflective of a mucus plug.continued large left upper lobe mass with mass effect on the adjacent bronchus and artery; mediastinal lymphadenopathy, most prominent in the subcarinal stations.new small consolidation in the anterior portion of the right lung apex may represent residual atelectasis versus a new focus of pneumonia; small right simple pleural effusion with minimal associated atelectasis.ascites.bone metastases as described above.findings were discussed with bracken ___ at 10:48 a.m.on ___ by ___ ___ over the phone.

text: the pulmonary arterial vasculature is normally opacified to the segmental level without filling defects.the aorta and other mediastinal great vessels are normal.heart size is normal with trace physiologic pericardial effusion.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusions.bibasilar atelectasis is minimal.the previously seen moderate right lower lobe focal air-space consolidation has resolved.a 2-mm right upper lobe nodule is smaller (4:36).the lungs are otherwise clear.the tracheobronchial tree is patent centrally.the study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, but no gross abnormality is noted.a 5-mm sclerotic focus in a low thoracic vertebral body is compatible with a bone island, unchanged from ___.
summary: no pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.interval resolution of moderate right lower lobe pneumonia.2-mm right upper lobe nodule is smaller.no specific follow-up is required.dr.___ ___ has discussed the preliminary findings to the ordering physician, ___ ___ ___, at 3:40 p.m.shortly after the initial interpretation of the study.

text: the thyroid gland is normal.there is no central filling defect within the main, segmental or subsegmental pulmonary arteries to suggest a pulmonary embolism.the main pulmonary artery is enlarged measuring 4 cm, suggesting pulmonary arterial hypertension.there is trace coronary artery calcification.calcification is also noted within the mitral valve.there is a moderate amount of aortic atherosclerosis.the aorta is of normal caliber.there is trace pericardial fluid.there is a moderate right-sided pleural effusion and trace left pleural effusion.there has been interval development of enhancing and necrotic supravlavicular, mediastinal and right hilar lymphadenopathy.markers are as follows: - the largest right pretracheal lymph node measures 3.8 x 4.7 x 5.7 cm (34: 2).- a prevascular lymph node measures 3.9 x 4.2 x 4.2 cm (31: 2).- there is a right hilar node measures 3.9 x 2.9 x 2.9 cm (55: 2).there is a background of centrilobular emphysema.there is prominence of the interstitial septal lines within the right lung compared to the left.airspace opacity is seen within the right upper lobe posteriorly abutting the major fissure with evidence of upstream bronchial obstruction (48:2).there is near complete atelectasis/collapse of the right lower lobe with sparing of the apical segment.this suggests an obstruction, either compression by a lung mass or by an endobronchial mass.there is a 5 mm nodule in the left upper lobe (44: 2), stable.linear atelectasis is seen within the lingula, stable.mucous plugging is also seen within the left lower lobe with downstream minimal left lower lobe atelectasis (89:2).
summary: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.1.there is massive right hilar, mediastinal, subcarinal and right supraclavicular lymphadenopathy.the nodes are enhancing and necrotic and appear to be metastatic likely from a lung primary.2.there is near complete atelectasis/collapse of the right lower lobe suggesting an obstructiion from compression of a lung mass or from an endobronchial mass.endobronchial evaluation is recommended to look for an obstructing mass.3.there is a moderate right pleural effusion and trace left pleural effusion.4.there is also asymmetric increased prominence of the septal markings within the right lung compared to the left, compatible with venolymphatic obstruction.5.nodular soft tissue thickening involving the posterior paravertebral soft tissues is most compatible with extramedullary hematopoiesis.the bones are diffusely osteoporotic with multiple vertebral fractures and old rib fractures on the right.the findings were discussed with ___,___ at the time of discovery of the findings, 3:15 p.m.by telephone.

text: there is very extensive lymphadenopathy in the mediastinum with an overall similar appearance also particularly involving the right hilum as well.there is atelectasis of a portion of the right upper lobe, with an unchanged appearance.although the right pulmonary artery is encased by the mass, there is little narrowing.the central airways are markedly narrowed, however, although little changed from the prior study.bilateral narrowing is most pronounded at the carina and is associated with massive lymphadenopathy.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.there are similar small bilateral effusions, right greater than left although the right effusion in particular is somewhat larger than before.there is increased opacity in the right middle lobe, which probably represents increased atelectasis.likely segmental atelectasis within the right upper lobe is unchanged.there are similar multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules consistent with metastases.these include a mass in the right upper lobe with a similar appearance.allowing for differences in technique these have an overall similar appearance.a known metastasis in the musculature of the upper left back is unchanged.adrenal masses were better characterized on the prior study.
summary: similar appearance of diffuse and massive mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and multiple pulmonary metastases.similar associated bilateral marked narrowing of central airways, especially at the carina.larger right effusion.increased opacity in the right middle lobe, most likely atelectasis.similar probable segmental atelectasis in the right upper lobe.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the findings were discussed with dr.___ on the same evening.

text: the thyroid is unremarkable.no axillary, supraclavicular, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.the heart is normal size.no pericardial effusion.a left upper lobe pulmonary nodule (4:81) measures 2 mm.no focal consolidation, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax.airways are patent to subsegmental levels.oral contrast is present within the distal esophagus and air distends the upper esophagus.there is no extraluminal gas, contrast, or fluid collection within the mediastinum.this study is not tailored for evaluation of the subdiaphragmatic organs.vague subcentimeter hypodense lesions in the left hepatic lobe are too small to further characterize.a tiny calcification is incidentally noted in the right adrenal gland.
summary: main, lobar, and segmental pulmonary arteries are opacified without filling defect.subsegmental pulmonary arteries are not well-evaluated due to suboptimal contrast bolus.unremarkable esophagus without extraluminal gas, contrast, or fluid collection.no pneumomediastinum.2 mm left upper lobe pulmonary nodule, for which no followup is necessary if there is low risk for malignancy.otherwise one year followup can be performed.

text: enhanced pulmonary vasculature demonstrates multiple bilateral filling defects consistent with acute pulmonary emboli involving most lobar, segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries with relative sparing of the left upper lobe branches.the aorta and major branches are normal.there is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.there is mild bibasilar atelectasis, but the lungs are without focal consolidation, effusion, or pneumothorax.a tiny granuloma is noted in the right apex (2:8).
summary: bilateral pulmonary emboli.calcified mass in the root of small bowel mesentery measuring approximately 7.9 x 2.3 x 1.9 cm with tethering of adjacent small bowel.ddx includes carcinoid tumor vs chronic sclerosing mesenteritis, vs less likely amyloidosis.these findings were discussed by dr.___ with dr.___ via telephone at 3:15 p.m.on ___.

text: small amount of subcutaneous air is seen inferior to the left chest wall port-a-cath catheter, new since the prior study with the tip of the catheter extending up to the superior cavoatrial junction.there is no axillary or supraclavicular adenopathy.there is moderate mediastinal adenopathy, some nodes are minimally larger in measurement since prior, largest of these in the right lower paratracheal station, measuring 1.5 x 1.5 cm, versus prior 1.1 x 1.3 cm.a prevascular node in the ap window, measures 1.7 x 0.9 cm compared to prior 1.5 x 0.9 cm.there is no hilar adenopathy.moderate atherosclerotic aortic calcification is unchanged.otherwise limited evaluation of heart and pericardium is unremarkable without pericardial effusion.a faint right lower lobe pulmonary nodule (2:37), measuring 2.6 mm, unchanged.there is a second punctate pulmonary nodule in the left upper lobe, unchanged (2:22).lungs are otherwise clear without consolidations, effusions, pneumothorax, pulmonary edema.
summary: minimal increase in the size of mediastinal adenopathy.no other evidence of lymphomatous involvement.no subdiaphragmatic adenopathy.stable pulmonary nodules, hepatic and renal low-attenuation lesions.

text: multiple small pulmonary nodules are again seen bilaterally.these appear relatively unchanged from prior.no pleural or pericardial effusions are noted.the previously identified prevascular lymph node measuring 12 x 6 mm on prior study now appears relatively unchanged measuring 10 x 7 mm on today's study.previously seen right hilar lymph node that measured 16 x 12 mm on prior study now appears slightly decreased in size measuring 12 x 10 mm.previously seen left hilar lymph node now appears markedly increased in size measuring 21 x 15 mm compared to the prior measurement of 9 x 6 mm.again seen is a 23 mm round lesion noted in the right breast, unchanged from prior study.
summary: increase in size and number of hepatic metastases.increased size of left hilar lymph node.other prevascular and hilar lymph nodes appear stable.increased size in left adrenal nodule concerning for metastasis.new right adrenal lesion concerning for metastasis.stable pulmonary nodules.stable round lesion in the right breast.slightly worsened bone erosion in l5 vertebra.

text: there is no central or proximal segmental pulmonary embolism.evaluation of distal pulmonary artery branches is limited due to the timing of contrast bolus.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber and contour, with unchanged mild atherosclerotic calcification.there is no pericardial effusion.there is no right pleural effusion.there is a small left pleural effusion.appearance of the heart is unchanged, with global cardiomegaly, prominent mitral annular calcification, coronary artery calcification, and left-sided pacemaker and two intracardiac leads in place, unchanged.central bronchi are patent to the subsegmental level.there is unchanged prominent calcification of the tracheobronchial tree.there is new, focal air space opacity in the lingula, and in the superior segment of the left lower lobe, most consistent with infectious pneumonia.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.
summary: no central or segmental pulmonary embolism.evaluation of distal branches is limited due to timing of contrast bolus.lingula and superior segment left lower lobe pneumonia.small left pleural effusion.multiple healing right-sided rib fractures, and distal right clavicular fracture.

text: there is a large homogeneous and confluent mass occupying the majority of the right upper lobe with narrowing of the right upper and right middle lobe bronchi and associated pulmonary artery branches.contrast enhancement of the pulmonary vessels is seen within the mass.there is a large soft tissue density occupying the precarinal and subcarinal regions, as well as soft tissue density within the left hilar region.it is unclear whether this is extension of the mass across the midline or represents lymph adenopathy within these regions.lung window images reveal thickening of the interstitium with a somewhat honeycombed appearance in the bilateral upper lobe periphery.innumerable nodules of varying sizes are also seen scattered throughout both lung fields.bronchial wall thickening is seen in both lung fields.there are no pleural effusions.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.no significant axillary lymph adenopathy is identified ct angiogram reveals no evidence of pulmonary embolus.the aorta is normal in caliber with no evidence of aortic dissection.soft tissues and osseous structures are unremarkable.no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions are identified.the visualized portion of the upper abdomen reveals numerous hypodensities seen throughout the liver consistent with metastases.the spleen is unremarkable.the adrenal glands are incompletely visualized, but appear normal.coronal and sagittal reformatted images confirm the above findings.
summary: large mass occupying essentially the entire right upper and a portion of the right middle lobe.it is unclear whether there is extension of this mass into the precarinal, subcarinal, and left hilar regions or if soft tissue mass seen in these areas represents lymph adenopathy.thickened interstitial markings which may represent underlying interstitial disease due to rheumatoid arthritis or possibly lymphangitic spread of cancer.numerous bilateral parenchymal nodules likewise may represent underlying rheumatoid lung disease, but may also represent metastatic disease.no pulmonary embolus.hypodensities scattered throughout both lobes of the liver concerning for metastatic disease.these findings were reviewed with the emergency room house staff caring for the patient at the completion of the study.

text: the visualized portion of the thyroid is unremarkable.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.again is seen a large mass in the left upper lung.its margins are ill defined but it dominates most of the left upper hemithorax.extensive septal thickening is seen surrounding this mass and in the lower lobes as well.while the bronchi of the left lower lobes are widely patent that of the lingula is slightly narrowed and the bronchi to the upper lobes are even more markedly narrowed at their origins.there is likely post-obstructive consolidation in multiple lobes on the left.additionally an area of ground-glass opacity is seen in the right lower lobe which may represent an area of infection or inflammation although given the patient's history of cancer, lymphangitic spread is also a concern.additionally, multiple ground-glass nodules are seen in the right upper lobe, also concerning for metastases.the aorta is of a normal caliber along its course without evidence of intramural hematoma or dissection.the pulmonary arterial trunk is of a normal caliber and while there are no filling defects to the subsegmental levels the left upper lobe and lingular branches of the pulmonary artery are markedly attenuated.there is no evidence of right heart strain.a small pericardial effusion is present.a small left pleural effusion is also seen.again are seen multiple hypodensities in the liver.in the left adrenal gland there is a nodule that measures 14 x 9 mm (3;117), and on the unenhanced images, it is not visualized, making this an indeterminate lesion.in the visualized skeleton, an ill-defined area of sclerosis is seen in the t6 vertebral body just below the superior endplate.additionally, in the t10 vertebral body adjacent to the inferior endplate is an ill-defined area of sclerosis.
summary: persisting large left upper/hilar mass with findings concerning for post-obstructive consolidation and lymphangitic spread.trace left pleural effusion.right lower lobe ground-glass opacity and multiple nodules, also concerning for lymphangitic spread.no pe but markedly narrowed lingular and left upper lobe pulmonary arterial branches; no aortic pathology.multiple hepatic hypodensities whose appearance is most consistent with cysts.indeterminate left adrenal nodule; a dedicated adrenal ct or mr may be considered for further characterization.
