text: the pulmonary arterial tree is well opacified, and there is no pulmonary embolus.the aorta is normal in caliber without dissection, pseudoaneurysm, or acute abnormality.a left-sided port-a-cath again terminates at the cavoatrial junction.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.there is no hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy by size criteria.a small hiatal hernia is noted.lungs are unchanged, with innumerable subcentimeter pulmonary nodules bilaterally, grossly unchanged.there is no consolidation, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax.there is mild dependent atelectasis bilaterally.a right breast nodular density is unchanged.
summary: no pulmonary embolus or acute aortic abnormality.interval development of moderate abdominal ascites, new since the prior ct ten days earlier.moderate small bowel wall thickening and edema, which could be reactive secondary to new ascites or could indicate enteritis.stable appearance of pulmonary nodules and multiple hepatic lesions, consistent with metastases.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: the visualized thyroid enhances homogenously.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.numerous but non-pathologically enlarged ap window and precarinal nodes are seen.the pulmonary artery is top normal in caliber.there is no central pe.evaluation for segmental pulmonary emboli is limited by atelectasis and respiratory motion.the aorta is normal in caliber and course.there is no aortic dissection.there are aortic and dense coronary artery calcifications in the left anterior descending and circumflex arteries.the heart is normal in size.there is an increased but still small pericardial effusion.an og tube is seen coursing into the stomach.on shallow inspiration the trachea is deformed and partly collapse as are the mainstem bronchi.there are paraseptal emphysematous changes with large bullae at the right apex.there are increased, now moderate pleural effusions, simple attenuation, with associated relaxation atelectasis.a 12-mm part solid nodule in the left lower lobe is new, likely inflammatory in etiology.scarring and fibrosis is seen at the right lung apex.there is a right lower lobe granuloma.the study is not optimized to visualize the abdomen but within this limitation there is a stable appearance to right renal and hepatic cysts.there is persistent cholelithiasis.there has been an interval splenectomy with improved appearance of stranding in the left upper abdomen.a drain and embolization clips are partly visualized at the operative site.acute rib fractures are seen in the right tenth and eleventh ribs.there is no suspicious osteolytic or osteoblastic lesion.multilevel degenerative changes are seen.
summary: no central pe with evaluation of segmental pulmonary arteries limited by atelectasis and respiratory motion.large bilateral pleural effusions and associated relaxation atelectasis.emphysematous changes with large right apical bullae.findings highly suggestive of tracheobronchomalacia.aortic and dense coronary artery calcifications.stable appearance to left posterior rib fractures.improved appearance of splenic abscess status post abdominal cleanout and splenectomy with drain in place.

text: lungs are clear.patient is status post median sternotomy and cabg with a lad graft seen.dense calcification of the native vessels.no pleural or pericardial effusion.no significant axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.note is made of a large paraesophageal hiatal hernia, unchanged.
summary: interval increase in size of known extensive abdominal aortic aneurysm, now measuring 6.3 cm in greatest dimension as described.no evidence of endoleak involving the previously stented thoracic aortic aneurysm.hiatal hernia.diverticulosis.dr.___ was notified of the findings by the.

text: there is no prior study available for comparison.left mastectomy findings are noted.pacemaker hardware is present in the left anterior chest wall.a focal calcification in the prevascular fat is likely from previous radiation of lymphoma.no enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes are identified.the heart size is slightly large.coronary arterial calcification is noted.there is no pericardial effusion.there are small left and minimal right pleural effusions.lung windows demonstrate paramediastinal fibrosis consistent with previous radiation.in the left lower lobe, there is an oval, relatively well- circumscribed nodule which measures 8 mm in maximum transverse diameter.there is also a rounded opacity posteriorly in the superior segment of the left lower lobe which may be pleural based.a tiny, nonspecific nodular opacity is noted medially in the right lower lobe.this has an elongated appearance, somewhat suggestive of an intrapulmonary lymph node but remains nonspecific.focal irregular opacity in the right middle lobe is suggestive of scarring.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.in the upper abdomen, there is a 4.1 x 2.9 cm enhancing soft tissue mass adjacent to the tail of the pancreas.this could represent enlargement of residual tissue after splenectomy, but malignant disease is not excluded.
summary: left pleural effusion and left lower lobe nodules which are nonspecific but suspicious for metastases.left upper quadrant abdominal soft tissue mass.

text: again seen is right-sided lung volume loss, marked bullous emphysema in the right upper lobe and right lung base, and shift of the mediastinum to the right, likely congenital.right pleural thickening, most significant at the posterolateral right lung base is noted.again seen is a round opacity in the right lower lobe with a broad area of contact with the thickened pleura.spiraling bronchi extend toward the opacity, in keeping with round atelectasis.this area of round atelectasis demonstrates increased density since the previous study.linear bands of scar and/or atelectasis extend from the mass-like area of atelectasis towards the right hilum.moderate centrilobular emphysema seen in the left lung.there is peripheral septal thickening with some confluent areas at the left lung apex, inferior left upper lobe, and the medial basal segment of the left lower lobe, new since ___.there is no left lung consolidation.there are no pleural effusions.there is no pulmonary embolus.the main pulmonary artery is mildly enlarged measuring 3.6 cm in diameter, increased since the previous study, and suggestive of possible pulmonary hypertension.the heart is normal in size and there is no pericardial effusion.enlarged prevascular lymph node measures 13 mm in short axis, increased significantly since ___.several other subcentimeter mediastinal lymph nodes are seen.images through the upper abdomen are within normal limits.there are no osseous lesions.mild old fracture deformity of a right lateral rib is noted.
summary: no pulmonary embolus.right lung volume loss could be due to a congenital anomaly or pulmonary infection early in life.persistent area of round atelectasis in the right lower lobe with increased size slightly since ___.new subpleural septal thickening in the left upper lobe and medial basal left lower lobe, new since ___ and suggestive of an interstitial fibrosis.mildly enlarged 13-mm prevascular lymph node.given the pulmonary interstitial findings and mildly enlarged lymph node, followup high-resolution ct is suggested, preferrably in 3 months if not needed earlier.

text: the visualized pulmonary arteries demonstrate no filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.the heart demonstrates evidence of prior cabg with median sternotomy wires and vascular clips.note is made of extensive venous collaterals extending along the left axilla into the scapula region and anterior left chest wall.a left subclavian line is noted with a diminutive appearing left subclavian vein.contrast appears to reach the svc through accessory pathways including a prominent azygous vein.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there is a prominent right hilar node measuring approximately 1.1 cm as well as a paratracheal node measuring approximately 8 mm.there is again demonstrated a cavitary right upper lobe mass which is not significantly changed in size measuring 4.3 x 3.0 cm.there again is demonstrated several adjacent patchy and nodular opacities in the right upper lobe which are not significantly changed compared to the prior study.the lungs are otherwise clear without pleural effusions.the bronchi are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.the visualized portions of the upper abdomen including the liver, spleen, stomach and kidneys are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.unchanged appearance of right upper lobe cavitary mass with associated hilar and mediastinal adenopathy.note of extensive left sided collateral venous circulation likely secondary to chronic occlusions or partial occlusion by the subclavian line.

text: there is a left subclavian central venous catheter, endotracheal tube, and ng tube present in satisfactory position.there has been interval repair of the previously identified pseudoaneurysm of the descending thoracic aorta with adjacent clips.a small amount of residual associated mediastinal hemorrhage is again demonstrated, without evidence of leak.this is unchanged compared to the prior study.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes.there is a small left-sided pleural effusion, which has developed in the interval.there is adjacent left lower lobe atelectasis.there is also a band-like area of presumable atelectasis in the right lower lobe.there are also diffuse bilateral patchy areas of ground-glass opacity.there has been interval resolution of the prior pneumothorax.the visualized portions of the upper abdomen are again remarkable for large laceration of the liver.there is a newly appreciated wedge-shaped area of hypoperfusion demonstrated in the inner polar region of the right kidney, which is most consistent with a small infarct.note is also made of a small amount of free fluid in the abdomen adjacent to the spleen, slightly increased compared to prior.
summary: bilateral diffuse ground glass opacities, which could reflect edema, inflammation or or sequella of trauma.left lower lobe dependent area of enhancing air-space disease, most typical for atelectasis with a smaller band-like area of atelectasis in the right lower lobe.small pleural effusions left greater than right.large liver laceration, unchanged.evidence of pseudoaneurysm repair.interval development of wedge-shaped hypoperfused area, most typical of an infarct in the right kidney.

text: as compared to the previous examination, the patient is after left upper lobectomy.the previously collapsed left postoperative lung is now better ventilated.however, the left pleura is both focally and diffusely thickened and shows multiple up to 2.5 cm large nodules.these are most obvious in the anterior and apical lung regions (3, 20) as well as in the inferior and posterior medial lung regions (3, 30).the left lung parenchyma also shows evidence of intraparenchymal nodules and one questionable endobronchial nodule at the level of the stump (4, 121).the entire left hemithorax shows volume loss.small areas of atelectasis are seen at the left lung bases.in the right lung, there are multiple soft tissue density nodules with maximum sizes of ___ mm.all these nodules are likely to reflect metastatic disease.the nodules show a peripheral and lower lobe predominance.there is no right pleural effusion.moderate pulmonary emphysema.unchanged coronary calcifications, several lymph nodes, for example in the precarinal and the subcarinal area, are borderline in diameter.moderate aortic calcifications.newly appeared is a 2.5 cm hypodense lesion at the level of the right adrenal gland, representing an adrenal metastasis.
summary: massive pleural metastatic disease in the left hemithorax, multiple left intraparenchymal metastasis and one endobronchial metastasis.multiple right lung metastasis.newly appeared right adrenal metastasis.borderline mediastinal lymph nodes.no evidence of osteolytic lesions.

text: multiple subcentimeter lymph nodes are seen within the mediastinum, the largest lymph node noted in the right paratracheal region measuring 9 mm.some of these lymph nodes are calcified, unchanged since the prior study.no pathologically enlarged axillary or hilar lymph nodes are present.heart, pericardium, and great vessels are otherwise normal.small bilateral pleural effusions present, right greater than left.there is no pericardial effusion.lung window images demonstrate a rounded opacity within the posterior segment of the right upper lobe; given its rapid development it is most consistent with an infectious etiology and represents round pneumonia.additionally, there has been interval worsening of bilateral diffuse ground-glass opacities throughout both lungs, suggestive of pulmonary edema versus an infectious process.again noted are multiple scattered pulmonary nodules throughout both lungs.the largest pulmonary nodule is located within the left lower lobe and measures 1 cm, which is unchanged in appearance since the prior ct scan.additionally, a calcified granuloma is noted within the right lower lobe.a bulla is noted within the right lower lobe.the airways are patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is calcification of the tracheobronchial tree.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, there is a tiny ill-defined hypodensity measuring 6 mm within the right lobe of the liver, not well characterized on this scan.imaged portion of the spleen and stomach appear unremarkable.
summary: right upper lobe rounded opacity, most likely representing round pneumonia especially given the rapidity of development.interval worsening of bilateral diffuse ground-glass opacities, which may represent a pulmonary edema vs.an infectious etiology.small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.relatively stable appearance of multiple scattered pulmonary nodules.subcentimeter ill-defined hypodensity within the right lobe of the liver, too small to fully characterize.dfddp

text: there is no main, branch, lobar, or segmental pulmonary embolus.heart is normal in size, with small physiologic pericardial effusion, and no evidence of right heart strain.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber.there are mild atherosclerotic calcifications involving the thoracic aorta, aortic valve, coronary arteries, and mitral annulus.lungs are clear, other than perifissural atelectasis/scarring.central airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.there are no pleural effusions.multiple calcified thyroid nodules are stable, measuring up to 1.2 cm on the left and 5 mm on the right.note is made of mediastinal lipomatosis.axillary, mediastinal, and hilar lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.there is a moderate mixed hiatal hernia.examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.mild multilevel degenerative changes in the thoracic spine.
summary: no pulmonary embolus or acute intrathoracic process.moderate hiatal hernia.multinodular thyroid.

text: heart, pericardium, and great vessels are normal.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.thoracic aorta is intact.lungs are clear, except to note minimal dependent bibasilar atelectasis.there is no significant adenopathy within the chest.
summary: no evidence of acute injury in the chest, abdomen or pelvis, and no fracture seen.

text: there are no filling defects in the pulmonary vasculature to suggest pulmonary embolism.the aorta and the heart appear unremarkable.there is new increased density in the left supraclavicular region, superior mediastinum, and portions of the pericardium, consistent with a hematoma which is likely venous.there is no evidence of contrast extravasation.this finding may be related to recent cardiopulmonary resuscitation.unchanged mild pleural thickening is noted at both lung bases, as well as at the left lung apex.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.there are no new pulmonary opacities.linear atelectasis is again noted in both lower lobes.surgical material is again noted at the left lung apex.there is a piece of tubing in the left lower lobe adjacent to the heart, possibly representing a retained pigtail catheter tip.blebs are noted at both lung apices.the patient is intubated, with the endotracheal tube tip in good position between the carina and the thoracic inlet.there is a nasogastric tube extending into the stomach.the visualized portions of the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and the left kidney appear unremarkable.the visualized osseous structures appear unremarkable.bilateral breast implants are again noted.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.new small hematoma in the left supraclavicular region, superior mediastinum, and portions of the pericardium, which is likely venous as there is no active extravasation.it may be related to recent cardiopulmonary resuscitation no pneumothorax.stable appearance of the lungs.dfdkq

text: no filling defect is noted within the main pulmonary artery and its branches to suggest pulmonary embolism.no evidence of aortic dissection is noted.there is significant dilatation of the ascending aorta measuring 3.4 x 3.5 cm.calcification is noted within the aortic valve annulus and aorta.no pathologically enlarged central node is noted.there is a large sliding hiatal hernia.patient is status post left mastectomy.the lung windows demonstrate bronchiectatic changes of the left upper lobe and both lower lobes.there is also bronchial wall thickening at both lower lobes.there is consolidation within the left upper lobe with air bronchogram which might represent aspiration.there are also diffuse nodular opacities within the right middle lobe and the lingula.few small cysts are scattered throughout both lungs.dependent atelectatic changes are also noted at the lung bases.small bilateral pleural effusion is visualized.no pericardial effusion is seen.the patient is also status post left mastectomy.the visualized portion of the upper abdomen demonstrates normal appearance of the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands.
summary: no pulmonary embolism or dissection is seen.diffuse bronchiectatic changes of both lungs with centrilobular nodule of the right middle lobe and lingula are suggestive of chronic mac infection.comparison to the prior study is helpful for further characterization.focal consolidation is noted within the left upper lobe which might represent a focus of aspiration.small bilateral pleural effusion .large axial hiatal hernia is visualized.mild enlargement of the ascending aorta as described.

text: there are again present median sternotomy wires and evidence of surgical repair at the aortic root.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there are no fluid collections or significant inflammatory changes seen.the bronchi are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.minor linear atelectatic changes or scarring are seen in the lingula.there are no pleural effusions.a small bleb is noted in the left upper lobe.there is a 3 mm nodular opacity seen in the right apex.this is unchanged compared to the prior study dated ___.there are no pathologically enlarged areas of adenopathy.
summary: postoperative changes of the aortic root without evidence of abscess or radiographic evidence of osteomyelitis.ectatic intra and extrahepatic ducts which may be within normal limits following cholecystectomy.no evidence of obstruction.

text: there is an intimal flap within the ascending aorta extending into the inferior aspect of the proximal aortic arch.this does not appear to involve the brachiocephalic branches.there is a bovine arch branching pattern.the dissection does not involve the descending aorta.high attenuation fluid c/w blood is seen within the pericardium.there are no pleural effusions.there is bibasilar dependent atelectasis.there are ground- glass opacities within the right upper lobe, predominantly centrally.there are foci of low attenuation within the left lobe of the thyroid.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph nodes.
summary: type a aortic dissection involving the ascending and proximal transverse thoracic aorta, with hemopericardium.these findings were discussed at the time of the ct scan with dr.___.

text: soft-tissue window images reveal an enlarged right hilar lymph node measuring 1.2 x 2.2 cm.this is slightly smaller than on the prior study where it measured 2.2 x 2.2 cm.there are several non-pathologically-enlarged left hilar, prevascular, mediastinal, subcarinal lymph nodes.there are no pleural effusions.the heart and pericardium are normal in appearance, other than coronary calcifications.there is no pulmonary embolus.lung windows again reveal extensive emphysema in the upper and mid lung zones and a large bulla at the right lung base.the right lung base bulla is new compared to the prior study.the previously noted spiculated right middle lobe mass is no longer seen.there appears to be a suture line from possible prior pneumonectomy seen.respiratory motion somewhat degrades the images.there are no focal consolidations.minimal atelectasis is seen at both lung bases.the trachea and bronchi are patent to the segmental level.bone windows reveal no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.degenerative changes are seen throughout the thoracic spine.the visualized portion of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.extensive calcification is seen throughout the arterial vasculature.there is a small hiatal hernia.
summary: no pulmonary embolus.extensive emphysematous changes, largely unchanged from the prior study.right hilar lymph node slightly smaller than on the prior study.interval resection of the patient's right middle lobe lung cancer.

text: there is no main, branch, lobar, or proximal segmental pulmonary embolus.ascending aortic ectasia persists, measuring 4.5 cm.dense calcifications are noted throughout the thoracic aorta and coronary arteries.heart is normal in size, with small simple pericardial effusion.no evidence of right heart strain.mild, apical-predominant centrilobular emphysema persists.there is bibasilar atelectasis, right greater than left.no pleural effusions are present.6-mm nodule in the anterior segment of the left upper lobe previously measured 4 mm.right upper lobe nodule is stable at 4 mm (2:10).nonspecific ground glass opacity in the right middle lobe.axillary, mediastinal, and hilar lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, but reveals dense calcifications in the abdominal aorta and renal arteries.again seen are multilevel degenerative changes, t7 compression fracture with 50% loss of height, t8 compression with near-complete loss of height and partial fusion to t9, and t12/l1 superior endplate deformities.
summary: no pulmonary embolus or acute intrathoracic process.copd and atelectasis.small but increased lul nodule requires 6-month follow-up chest ct, given increase; pet-ct could also be considered although it would be hard to exclude malignancy with a negative result owing to its small size.the possibility of malignancy is an important consideration despite the small size of the nodule.this was paged to dr.___ ___ on ___ at 10:20 p.m.similar ascending aortic ectasia, which could be followed with ct surveillance in ___ years.unchanged multiple compression fractures.

text: the partially imaged thyroid gland is unremarkable.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria.the heart is unremarkable.no pericardial effusions are present.there is mild centrilobular emphysema in the left lung but no nodules are noted.there is mild left lower lobe atelectasis with a possible tiny pleural effusion.the left-sided airways are patent down to the subsegmental level.the left-sided pulmonary arteries are patent down to the subsegmental level as well.the patient is status post a right vats and right upper lobectomy with a chest tube on the right that courses superiorly up to the apex and then courses posteriorly to terminate in the region of the posterior diaphragm.sutures are noted at the expected location of the takeoff of the right upper lobe bronchus and the artery supplying the right upper lobe.a moderate-sized area of soft tissue is noted medial to the lateral most sutures which shows a mild outward bulge (4:70).a single vessel is noted coursing within this region with a severe narrowing noted at its origin from the main pulmonary artery (4:98).this eventually becomes of normal caliber distally (4:88).just medial to this vessel, there is an amorphous area of contrast (4:91) which is concerning for active extravasation.the right bronchus intermedius is patent as are the right lower lobe superior segmental bronchi.the basilar truncus is patent up to the takeoff of the subsuperior subsegmental bronchus.just inferior to this takeoff, there is a mucus plug (4:113) that causes partial obstruction of the distal segmental bronchi supplying the basilar segments of the right lower lobe.the right middle lobe bronchus is not definitively seen; however, a tubular air-filled structure just anterior to the takeoff of the superior segmental bronchus (4:108) most likely represents an area of the middle lobe bronchus that is proximally and distally obstructed.normal enhancement is not noted within the atelectatic right middle lobe.there is mild consolidation of the superior segment of the right lower lobe (4:92).there is a small simple right pleural effusion.mild subcutaneous emphysema is noted along the right chest as is expected given the placement of a chest tube.although this examination was not intended for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, the partially imaged abdomen shows cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis, mild calcific atherosclerotic plaque in the abdominal aorta and a simple left renal cyst.the partially imaged bowel loops are unremarkable.
summary: area of contrast extravasation in the expected location of the right middle lobe.a severe narrowing, just distal to the origin of the artery supplying the right middle lobe and incomplete visualization of the right middle lobe bronchus are concerning for right middle lobe torsion with active extravasation into a small hematoma in the region.atelectasis in the superior segment of the right lower lobe.cholelithiasis.these findings were discussed with the attending thoracic ___, ___ ___, and the cardiothoracic fellow, ___ ___ via telephone soon after completion of the examination.

text: there has been continued interval improvement compared to ___ in the right upper lobe.at the site of prior large nodule, there is now only a small area of residual ground-glass opacity (2:22).additionally, small airways disease with associated peribronchial tree-in-___ opacities in the lower lobes have similarly resolved.there is no new pulmonary nodule or mass and no focal consolidation to suggest ongoing infectious or inflammatory process.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there is no pneumothorax.while there is again no central adenopathy identified, there has been interval development of a large soft tissue mass in the right axilla, most likely confluent adenopathy,measuring up to 7 x 6.5 x 6.5 cm.this encases the right axillary artery, and compressed the right axillary vein, where no opacification is seen.the trachea and central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there are no endobronchial lesions.the heart is unremarkable without cardiomegaly or effusion.there is no coronary calcification.the aorta and great vessels are normal in caliber and configuration, as are the central pulmonary arteries.there is no central embolus identified.the esophagus is normal.the thyroid enhances normally.
summary: interval development of extensive right axillary confluent adenopathy, encasing the right axillary artery and compressing the adjacent vein.continued interval improvement of previously large right upper lobe nodule with only small residual ground-glass opacities now apparent.small airways disease in the bilateral lower lobes has also resolved.no new pulmonary nodules or masses are identified.single left paraaortic lymph node is unchanged in size compared to ___.normal appearance of the liver and biliary tree without imaging explanation for transaminitis and elevated ldh.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.

text: post-operative appearance of the bronchial stump s/p right lower lobectomy is stable, with accompanying volume loss.new paramediastinal radiation fibrosis both superior and inferio to the hilus is limited to a narrow cuff of tissue, less than 2 cm wide.there is no pathologic lymph node enlargement, with a right lower paratracheal node measuring up to 9 mm.heart size is normal, and the tiny pericardial effusion is unchanged.previously small, nonhemorrhagic right pleural effusion has decreased in size, now tiny.lateral right fifth and sixth rib fractures are related to prior thoracotomy.16-mm nodule in the medial left is stable since ___ and may be normal fibrofatty tissue but should be evaluated with mammography.this exam is not for tailored subdiaphragmatic assessment.the adrenal glands and imaged portion of the liver are normal.there are no bone findings of malignancy.
summary: new limited paramediastinal radiation fibrosis.no evidence of tumor recurrence.16-mm left breast nodule, stable since ___; however, mammographic correlation is recommended.findings to be conveyed to dr.___ via the radiology communications dashboard.

text: there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification in an aneurysmal thoracic aorta measuring up to 4.1 cm in its ascending aspect.there is no evidence of acute aortic syndromes.noted within the right upper lobe apical segment (4:19) there is a centrally based intraluminal filling defect most compatible with acute pulmonary embolism.there are no other definite areas of pulmonary embolism, though assessment of basilar segments is limited secondary to motion.there is marked cardiomegaly with right atrial enlargement.note is made of extensive coronary artery atherosclerotic calcification.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.multiple extensive mediastinal lymph nodes and left hilar lymph node (4:27) are grossly stable since the recent examination from ___.the largest lymph nodes are noted within the subcarinal region (4:34) measuring up to 17 mm in transverse diameter.in addition, a left hilar lymph node is noted in this region measuring up to 15 mm in transverse diameter (4:33).there is a posterior bowing of the central airway of the trachea and the mainstem bronchus that is compatible with a component of tracheobronchomalacia.there is a moderate right and small left pleural effusion that are increased in size since the prior examination.there are calcified pleural plaques indicative of prior asbestos exposure.there is extensive new left upper lobe airspace consolidation.in addition, right upper lobe airspace consolidation has worsened.there is new peripheral ground-glass opacification and interlobular septal thickening suggesting a component of superimposed interstitial pulmonary edema.calcified pleural plaques are indicative of prior asbestos exposure.note, this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.on this examination, multiple foci of intraperitoneal free air is noted immediately adjacent to the liver capsule, for example (2:43) and (2:38).these foci of free air are newly apparent since the post-surgical abdominal ct from ___.a mixed air and contrast containing structure lateral to the right hepatic lobe (2;57) is better assessed on subsequent abdominal ct.there is a moderate amount of intra-abdominal ascites.note is made of atherosclerotic calcification within the abdominal aorta.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the visualized upper abdomen is otherwise unremarkable.there is a small to moderate sized hiatal hernia.
summary: acute pulmonary embolism involving a right upper lobe apical segmental branch.new left upper lobe airspace consolidation and worsening right upper lobe airspace consolidation that is concerning for multifocal spread of infection.superimposed mild interstitial pulmonary edema.stable prominent mediastinal and left hilar lymph nodes, likely reactive in nature.several foci of intraperitoneal free air, newly apparent since post-surgical ct from ___.calcified pleural plaques indicative of prior asbestos exposure.findings compatible with tracheobronchomalacia.findings were discussed with dr.___ by dr.___ ___ telephone at 8:30pm on ___, and the patient is scheduled to have a ct of the abdomen and pelvis for further evaluation of the intraperitoneal air.

text: there are multiple small mediastinal lymph nodes, the largest one is seen in the precarinal region and it measures 1 cm.other small lymph nodes are seen in the prevascular, precarinal and right paratracheal regions.the heart is normal in size.there are coronary artery calcifications.there is no pericardial fluid.there is no evidence of pneumomediastinum.the esophagus is slight distended, there is no evidence of contrast extravasation.the stomach is distended and contains a large amount of debris.the visualized portions of the liver, adrenals, kidneys and loops of small bowel are unremarkable.there are clips in the region of the pancreatic tail.lung windows reveal radiation changes in the medial lung fields.there are dependent atelectases.
summary: no evidence of pneumomediastinum or esophageal perforation.given the gastric contents may represent subacute blood, a mucosal tear of the esophagus should be considered which may not be demonstrated on ct.

text: there is a partially visualized, rim-enhancing, partially calcified soft tissue structure in the superior mediastinum to the right and posterior of the trachea.this may reflect a low- lying exophytic mediastinal thyroid goiter (though typically more anterior), and other processes such as an enlarged necrotic lymph node should also be considered.calcifications and possible smaller nodules are present within the left lobe of the thyroid.within a right lower lobe branch is an equivical filling defect seen on a single slice and cannot be confirmed on the reconstructed images.however, given the attenuation which closely matches that of a pulmonary embolus, this should still be considered.there is atherosclerotic calcification of the aorta and coronary arteries as well as dense mitral annular calcifications.an endotracheal tube is in situ terminating in the mid thoracic trachea.the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.aside from the previously mentioned superior mediastinal abnormality, there is no pathologic axillary, mediastinal, or hilar adenopathy.the heart is normal size.there is bibasilar atelectasis, right greater than left with very small bilateral effusions.there is a 7-mm ill- defined pulmonary nodule in the superior aspect of the left lower lobe (3:23), a 4-mm pulmonary nodule in the left upper lobe (3:17).multiple smaller pulmonary nodules are also noted.the ng tube terminates in the stomach.a right central venous catheter terminates at the right brachiocephalic svc junction.the partially visualized portions of the abdomen demonstrate a 2-cm left adrenal nodule that may represent an adenoma but is incompletely characterized as well as a partially visualized gallstone.no suspicious lesions are identified within the osseous structures.
summary: equivocal for right lower lobe pulmonary embolus.partially visualized right paratracheal 3.3-cm enhancing mass located in the superior mediastinum that may represent a mediastinal goiter, though indeterminate.alternatives include a necrotic lymph node.repeat cta chest with extension into the lower neck on post-contrast imaging may be helpful to further characterize these two findings.multiple pulmonary nodules as described.in the absence of known malignancy, a six-month followup is a recommendation.2-cm completely evaluated left adrenal nodule.adrenal mr would be the modality of choice for evaluation if clinic.small bibasilar atelectasis and very small effusions.findings discussed with dr.___ ___.

text: there is a large filling defect starting at the branching of the main pulmonary artery and extending into both the right and left main pulmonary arteries.this low attenuation material extends into multiple branches of the left and right pulmonary arteries.there is bibasilar atelectasis.tiny bilateral pleural effusions are present.an endotracheal tube and an ng tube are both present.the right ventricle is enlarged.the soft tissues and osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: large saddle embolus extending into both main pulmonary arteries and their branches.an enlarged right ventricle suggests right heart strain.findings were related to the surgical team while the patient was on the gantry.

text: there are no central or segmental pulmonary emboli.the pulmonary arteries are slightly enlarged.severe cardiomegaly with severely dilated right atrium is again noted.a left-sided pacemaker is seen with leads in standard position.there is a small pericardial effusion.coronary artery calcifications are noted in the right coronary as well as the left anterior descending coronary artery.within the lungs, there is a large right-sided pleural effusion, similar in size to the prior study.patchy opacities in the right upper lobe, however, have resolved in the interim.atelectasis is noted in the right middle lobe adjacent to the major fissure.there is a moderate pleural effusion on the left with likely atelectasis of the lingula, and poor aeration of the remaining lung, thought marginally improved from prior.the left pleural enhancement is unchanged since ___.the chest tube has been removed.the caliber of the thoracic aorta is within normal limits.in the visualized upper abdomen, no definite abnormalities are detected.inferior vena cava is markedly dilated.

text: 4 x 3.4 cm right upper lobe cavitary mass (4:61) measured 4.2 x 4.2 cm one month prior.it now has a more necrotic core and less peripheral wall thickness, now 7 mm from 10 mm one month prior.there is no new lung lesion identified.there is marked improvement in mild diffuse ground-glass opacities involving both lungs.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.heart size remains slightly enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion there is no central or axillary lymphadenopathy.although this exam was not optimized for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, the imaged intra-abdominal organs are unremarkable except to note marked splenomegaly measuring up to 17 cm, similar to multiple prior exams.several borderline mediastinal lymph nodes are calcified, likely related to prior granulomatous infection exposure.bone windows demonstrate no lesion concerning for metastasis or infection.

text: there is a type a aortic dissection originating at the level of the aortic root, extending throughout the aortic arch, descending aorta, and into the abdomen.the left main coronary artery is supplied by the true lumen.the supply of the right main coronary artery is not well visualized due to motion artifact.the brachiocephalic artery is supplied by the true lumen.dissection flap extends into the left common carotid and left subclavian arteries.the thoracic aorta is aneurysmal measuring up to 5.2 x 5.1 cm at the level of the bifurcation of the main pulmonary artery.the descending aorta measures up to 3.5 x 3.3 cm (3:37) at the same level.the inferior extent of the dissection is not well evaluated due to mixing of contrast; however definitively, the dissection extends to at least the level of the sma and likely reaches to the iliac arteries.the dissection flap appears to involve the ostia of the celiac artery and sma.the right renal artery appears supplied by the true lumen and the left renal artery by the false lumen.the kidneys enhance symmetrically.the supply of the ___ is not well evaluated.the lungs appear grossly clear without focal consolidation.no filling defect to suggest pulmonary embolism is seen.no evidence of endobronchial lesion.no lymphadenopathy is identified.there is no pericardial effusion.the liver contains two sub-cm hypodensities in the left lobe, too small to characterize (6:17).the patient is status post cholecystectomy.no focal abnormality is identified in the spleen.the pancreas and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.the kidneys contain hypodensities compatible with simple cysts bilaterally.the kidneys enhance symmetrically.loops of small and large bowel are normal in size and caliber.there is diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.the bladder, distal ureters and prostate gland appear within normal limits.no free air, free fluid or lymphadenopathy is seen.several benign-appearing sclerotic foci are noted within the ribs.no concerning osseous lesion is seen.
summary: type a aortic dissection extending from the aortic root throughout the thoracic aorta and into the abdomen.the inferior extent is not well evaluated due to mixing of contrast; however, the dissection extends to at least the sma and likely the iliac arteries.if further delineation is required, this may be performed with repeat cta or mra.the true lumen supplies the great vessels with dissection flap extending to the left common carotid and subclavian arteries.dissection flap appears to involve the ostia of the celiac and sma.

text: there are multiple prominent mediastinal lymph nodes.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.there is no pericardial effusion.assessment of lung parenchyma shows near complete collapse of the basilar segments of the right lower lobe.there is diffuse emphysema with hazy areas of increased ground-glass opacity which is slightly asymmetrically increased on the left compared to the right.patchy atelectasis is also present in the left lower lobe.assessment of the trachea and bronchi shows severe narrowing of the bronchi, particularly the right lower lobe bronchus, during expiratory portions of the ct.questionable areas of mild tracheal narrowing are also present.note is also made of a rounded soft tissue filling defect within the trachea at the level of the thyroid gland posteriorly, which is incompletely characterized.
summary: no definite pulmonary embolus.assessment of the right lower lobe is particularly limited due to respiratory motion.potential tiny subsegmental emboli are present, but these are thought to be artifactual.severe bronchomalacia, particularly involving right lower lobe bronchus.questionable filling defect in trachea posteriorly at level of the thyroid gland.this could represent volume averaging with a severe area of tracheomalacia or represent a rounded area of secretions.less likely possibilities would also include a papilloma.emphysema with superimposed congestive heart failure.asymmetric ground- glass opacity in the left upper lobe is likely asymmetric pulmonary edema.differential diagnosis also includes a superimposed infectious process.results were relayed to the emergency department dashboard at 2 p.m.on ___.

text: a right pigtail pleural catheter placed since ___, which runs posteriorly from the base of the hemithorax to the level of the aortopulmonic window.there is no pneumothorax.the bulk of the previously seen large right pleural effusion has been removed.the right hemithorax shows extensive, pleural mass, most severe at the right apex, to invade the intercostal plane, but not the ribs or extrathoracic fat.only one definite pulmonary nodule is identified, 1.5 cm wide, in the periphery of the inferior portion of the right upper lobe (2:33).asymmetric septal or lymphatic thickening in the right may represent lymphatic spread of tumor.the left lung is clear.mild to moderate centrilobular emphysema is upper lobe predominant.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to the subsegmental level.the heart size is normal.small pericardial effusion is likely physiologic.athereosclerotic coronary calcification is moderate.the central lymph nodes are enlarged, 1.3 cm in the subcarinal mediastinum (2:28) and 2.1 cm in the right hilus (4:107).borderline enlarged right diaphragmatic lymph nodes measure up to 7 mm (4:183).the supraclavicular and axillary lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.no bone metastasis is identified.this exam is not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation except to note a 1.8 x 1.9 cm left adrenal nodule (4:263).focal thickening of the gallbladder wall at the fundus is incompletely imaged
summary: extensive right pleural tumor with probable intercostal invasion at the apex, lymphatic involvement of the right lung, and ipsilateral hilar and subcarinal mediastinal lymph node enlargment.only one definite pulmonary nodule distinct from the pleural abnormality.differential diagnosis is malignant mesothelioma or pleural extension of small primary lung neoplasm.removal of majority of previously identified right pleural effusion status post placement of pigtail pleural catheter.no pneumothorax.left adrenal lesion, concerning for metastasis.

text: no dissection flap is present within the aorta.no pericardial or pleural effusions.dense coronary artery calcification along the left anterior descending artery.no axillary, mediastinal or hilar adenopathy per ct size criteria.small axial hiatal hernia.the major airways are patent down to the subsegmental level.small amount of tree-in-___ opacity within a peribronchovascular distribution in the lateral right upper lobe and superior segment of the right lower lobe suggesting aspiration versus infection.

text: there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.at the left lung apex, there is a new 5 mm pulmonary nodule which was not present on the examination dated ___.no other pulmonary nodules are seen.the heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.the central airways are patent to the segmental bronchi bilaterally.

text: soft tissue windows show several small mediastinal lymph nodes, the largest in prevascular area measuring 1.4 cm.no axillary or hilar lymph node enlargement is present.the heart, pericardium and intrathoracic great vessels are unremarkable.there are no pleural effusions.lung windows show severe bullous emphysema of the right lung.several bullae are also seen at the left lung apex.there is linear atelectasis in the right lower lobe.nodular opacity at the left lung apex could represent parenchymal scar or tumor involvement.no areas of parenchymal consolidation are seen.there is minimal dependent atelectasis.the airways appear patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.the visualized upper abdomen shows slight thickening of the distal esophagus.subcentimeter lymph node is seen in the precardiac region.there is extensive lymphadenopathy in the portocaval and celiac areas of the abdomen.large low attenuation lesions are seen in bilateral adrenal glands.low attenuation area is also seen at the upper pole of the right kidney.several low attenuation areas in the imaged regions of the liver likely represent cysts.imaged areas of the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, stomach, bowel, and intra- abdominal great vessels show no abnormalities.the osseous structures show minimal degenerative changes of the spine.

text: there is no significant axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.the heart and great vessels are normal in appearance.extending from the posterior aspect of the left ventricular wall, there is a 4.5 cm simple cyst.the esophageal wall is mildly, diffusely thickened.there is a tiny focus of hyperdensity noted within the anterior right lateral aspect of the esophagus at the level of the right mainstem bronchus which may represent residua from the prior barium swall and the origin of the fistula.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.there are diffuse tiny ground-glass opacities noted throughout the right lung.there is a 2 mm nodule in the left lung base.no focal consolidations are identified.there are no pleural effusions.there are no cavitary areas within either lung.

text: there is no mass identified.although this study is not optimized for evaluation for pulmonary embolus, there is a filling defect in a segmental branch in the right lower lobe centrally which is compatible with acute pulmonary embolus (4:124, 400:47).there may be a second filling defect in a branch of the right upper lobe pulmonary artery (4:64) which could also represent an acute pe.there are small bilateral pleural effusions with simple fluid attenuation and associated compressive atelectasis with near-complete collapse of the left lower lobe.multiple mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are noted, some of which are subcentimeter; however, the mediastinal lymph nodes measure up to 1.4 cm (2:7).hilar nodes measure up to 1 cm (4:86) on the right.there is a 3-mm nodule in the left upper lobe (3:24).the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion.there is mild atherosclerotic calcification of the aortic arch.visualized portion of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.

text: there is no evidence of aortic injury with the heart and great vessels appearing unremarkable.there is a moderate-to-large sized left-sided pneumothorax with a small medial loculated component and there are scattered areas of atelectasis within the lungs dependently bilaterally.no large pleural effusions are identified.small amount of pneumomediastinum is also present.the patient is noted to be status post intubation with the endotracheal tube properly positioned and a nasogastric tube terminating within the stomach.calcifications within the aorta and coronary vascular tree with no evidence of pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.

text: there is no evidence for aortic dissection.there are no filling defects in pulmonary arteries to suggest presence of pulmonary embolism.there is no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymph nodes.again noted are calcified mediastinal lymph nodes.with the exception of lingular granuloma, lungs are clear.the airways are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.the appearance of the heart post mitral valve repair is stable.sternotomy wires are intact.there is no fracture.limited evaluation of upper abdominal organs is unremarkable.

text: an 11 mm paratracheal and a 9 mm subcarinal lymph node are stable compared to the prior chest ct.no new lymphadenopathy is identified in the axillary, mediastinal, or hilar regions.the heart and pericardium appear normal.the thoracic aorta is of normal caliber throughout.contrast is seen throughout the esophageal lumen.the central airways are patent.in the lungs, there has been a slight increase in the lingular atelectasis, and there are new patchy opacities in the right middle lobe and right lower lobe.there is no pleural effusion.a calcified granuloma in the right lower lobe is unchanged.

text: examination of the pulmonary vascularity reveals intraluminal thrombus in both the right and left main pulmonary arteries.the thrombus burden is more extensive on the right and filling defects extend into the superior lobe trunk, middle lobe artery and lower lobe trunk.intraluminal thrombus on the left is most prominent in the upper lobe branches with relative preservation of flow to the lower lobe.contrast is concentrated within the right heart and refluxes inferiorly into the hepatic veins.the heart itself is unremarkable and there is no pericardial effusion.the aorta is unfolded and calcified.soft tissue windows reveal no significant adenopathy in the mediastinum, hilar or axillary regions.there is a small fluid collection in the left breast, perhaps related to recent surgical intervention in this patient with a history of breast cancer.there are no pleural effusions.bone windows reveal largely clear lungs with minimal atelectasis at the left base.there is a 5 mm nodule with associated ground-glass opacity in the right upper lobe posteriorly.no areas of consolidation are identified.the osseous structures demonstrate marked degenerative changes with significant kyphosis of the upper thoracic spine.no destructive bone lesions are seen.limited evaluation of the liver demonstrates a small low attenuation lesion, which is too small to characterize with accuracy but may represent a tiny hepatic cyst.
summary: bilateral pulmonary emboli within both right and left main pulmonary arteries and throughout the smaller arterial branches in both lungs.these findings were immediately telephoned to dr.___ ___ in the emergency department.

text: pulmonary arteries appear well opacified and there is no evidence of acute pulmonary embolism.heart and great vessels appear unremarkable.again seen are several mediastinal lymph nodes, however, none appear to meet ct criteria for pathological enlargement.there is no evidence of pathologically enlarged hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.there has been interval improvement of previously seen small right-sided pleural effusion.again seen are diffuse emphysematous bullous changes bilaterally.three poorly-defined peripheral opacities are present in the right lung.the opacity seen on series 3, image 39, does not appear significantly changed from prior study.new linear/nodular opacities seen on series 2, image 34, possibly represents atelectasis.also seen is a smaller irregular peripheral opacity, best seen on series 3, image 55.peripheral opacity in the left lung (series 3, image 49) appears improved compared to prior study.again seen is a paraspinal abscess collection anterior to the mid thoracic region.small amount of fluid is again seen, decreased compared to ___.compared to ___, the fluid collection is likely not significantly changed to slightly larger in size.soft tissue inflammation is also seen in this area.again seen is destruction of the t7 through t9 vertebral bodies.

text: a port-a-cath terminates at the cavoatrial junction.there is no pericardial effusion.a trace pleural effusion is present on the right side.a mildly prominent left upper anterior mediastinal lymph node of 9 mm in shortest dimension is unchanged.smaller mediastinal lymph nodes also appear unchanged.aside from patchy bibasilar areas of atelectasis on each side, a focal bronchovascular opacity has increased somewhat in density within the right upper lobe and measures about 8 mm in extent, somewhat more prominent.however, it is more likely to reflect an inflammatory or potentially infectious process in the appropriate setting than lymphoma.a band-like opacity in the right lower lobe suggests minor atelectasis.no discrete nodule persists in the right lower lobe, although area is partly obscured by superimposed atelectasis.

text: no filling defects can be seen in the pulmonary artery branches suggestive of pulmonary embolism.large consolidation in posterior region of the left upper lobe and lingula associated with a small amount of pleural effusion on the left side is pneumonia.no obstructing mass.there is dependent atelectasis bilaterally at the bases.there are non-pathologically enlarged small lymph nodes in the mediastinum.calcified pleural plaque isolated in the right lower lobe without other plaques to suggest asbestosis or other pulmonary diseases.paraseptal and centrilobular emphysema is seen bilaterally.scattered small ground- glass opacities are likely small infectious fosi.there are at least two lung nodules, one located in right upper lobe measuring 3 mm (series 4, image 41), and other measuring 7 mm located in the left upper lobe (series 4, image 46).the left atrium is moderately enlarged.calcifications in the aorta and coronary arteries indicate atherosclerosis.

text: allowing for the limitation of significant image noise due to body mass index, there is no evidence of a central (first to third order) pulmonary embolism.distal pulmonary arterial visualization is limited.two central venous catheters are in situ with their distal tips at the upper svc.a right paratracheal lymph node measures 9 mm (2:14).pulmonary arterial enlargement is moderately severe (4:72).moderate global cardiac enlargement is present.there is no pericardial effusion.a right pleural effusion is tiny.the central airways are patent, anterior indentation of the posterior tracheal membrane indicates image acquisition during expiration.there is a generalized mild decrease in lung volumes.left lower and right lower lobe consolidation is moderately extensive.air trapping in the right middle and left lower lobes is mild.the study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, only to confirm a 16 cm moderately enlarged spleen, a mildly hypoattenuating liver, possibly representing steatosis.lower thoracic spine anterior osteophytosis is mild.

text: an esophageal stent is noted to be in place, extending from approximately the t2 to t5 level.an ng tube is in place terminating in the stomach.fluid is noted within the esophagus, to the level of the upper intrathoracic esophagus.there has been new placement of a gastrostomy with a gj- tube.a right ij central venous catheter terminates in the lower svc, and a left upper extremity picc terminates also in the lower svc.the et tube is seen terminating 1 to 1.5 cm above the carina.the cervical y- stent is not radiopaque.the left main bronchus stent is seen and appears patent.however, the left airways distal to the stent are attenuated diffusely.as seen on chest radiograph, there is collapse of the left lung with sparing of the lingular region only.there is moderate pleural effusion on the left and smaller right pleural effusion.atelectasis in the dependent right lung is milder.the aerated right lung and lingula appear clear.the heart size is mildly enlarged, and there is no pericardial effusion.again note is made of a right-sided aortic arch.filling defect within the left atrium which could represent direct invasion of tumor versus a right atrial thrombus.while the current study is not designed for evaluating the pulmonary vessels, no filling defects are seen centrally within the pulmonary arteries.no evidence of adenopathy is noted in the mediastinum or axilla.while the current study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, no adrenal mass is seen.small paraaortic and celiac axis lymph nodes are noted, not meeting ct size criteria for adenopathy.a small amount of subcutaneous gas is noted relating to recent g-tube and gj-tube placement.small amount of ascites is also noted surrounding the spleen.no region of bony destruction is seen concerning for malignancy.multilevel degenerative changes are noted with anterior osteophyte formation at multiple levels of the visualized cervical, thoracic and lumbar spine.
summary: as seen on chest radiograph, there is collapse of the left lung with partial sparing of the lingula.left main bronchus stent is seen in place and is patent, although there is diffuse attenuation of the airways distal to the stent on the left.moderate left and small right pleural effusions.mild right dependent atelectasis related to pleural effusion.filling defect along posterosuperior wall of left atrium (2:26) could represent direct extension of tumor or intraluminal thrombus.while the current study is not designed for evaluating the pulmonary vessels, no central or large pulmonary embolism is seen.status post placement of esophageal stent, with ng tube in place and new gastrostomy and gj-tube placement.fluid is noted in a nondilated, esophagus to the level of the upper intrathoracic esophagus.small ascites surrounding the spleen.while evaluation of the et tube is difficult on ct, there is suggestion that the et tube tip is low, terminating 1 to 1.5 cm above the carina.

text: there are innumerable bilateral axillary lymph nodes measuring up to 1 cm in greatest short axis dimension.no mediastinal or hilar adenopathy is appreciated.there are faint calcifications within the coronary arteries.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.limited images of the upper abdomen demonstrate innumerable upper abdominal lymph nodes, abnormal in number if not in size.there is a small hiatal hernia.minimal amount of high-density material layers within the gallbladder, possibly sludge.assessment of the lung parenchyma redemonstrates moderate diffuse emphysema.there is radiation change along the left mediastinum with traction bronchiectasis and volume loss.new in the interval is a faint 6 mm ground-glass nodule in the left lower lobe (series 3 image 30).within the right lower lobe, there is a patchy focus of ground-glass opacity and consolidation with some central lobular faint ground-glass opacities, increased in extent in the interval.a tiny sub 5 mm noncalcified nodule at the extreme right lung base is unchanged.the airways are patent.

text: a right-sided pacemaker is identified with leads in standard position.the heart and pericardium are otherwise unremarkable.the great vessels demonstrate extensive atherosclerosis of the thoracic aorta, with a focal area of ulceration best seen on series 2, image 43.there is no evidence of central or segmental pulmonary embolism or of aortic intimal flap.no pathologic axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy is identified.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.the distal esophagus is mildly dilated with an air-fluid level.the lungs demonstrate some mild dependent atelectasis as well as trace pleural effusions bilaterally.pleural calcifications are seen in the left posterior pleura consistent with prior asbestos exposure.no pneumothoraces are identified.

text: there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph nodes.there is a 15-mm enhancing mass in the right breast, with biopsy clip within it.central airways are patent to the subsegmental levels bilaterally.there are no concerning pulmonary nodules.mild scarring or atelectasis is seen in the lung bases bilaterally.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.coronary artery calcifications are noted.

text: in comparison to the prior study, there is now an 11-mm, round filling defect in the right main pulmonary artery, consistent with acute pulmonary embolus (3:44, 3:45).more distally in the right interlobar pulmonary artery (3:52), additional pulmonary embolus is identified.in the left superior lobar pulmonary artery (3:41), a small central filling defect again consistent with pulmonary embolus is identified.in comparison to the prior study, there is no definite evidence of right ventricular strain or abnormal bowing of the intraventricular septum.the heart, aorta, and great vessels are significant for aortic calcifications.the trachea and bronchi are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no mediastinal, axillary, or supraclavicular lymphadenopathy.limited axial imaging of the upper abdomen is unremarkable, although the exam was not suited for this purpose.osseous structures demonstrate mild degenerative changes in the thoracic spine.

text: there is bibasilar dependent atelectasis and small bilateral pleural effusions.no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.the ascending aorta and aortic arch are normal in appearance.there is high attenuation material around the lower descending thoracic aorta, consistent with a hematoma.the dissection starts at the level of the t10-11 vertebral body.
summary: descending aortic dissection beginning at the t10-11 vertebral body level extending into the right external iliac artery.paraaortic hematoma.

text: airways are patent to subsegmental levels bilaterally.there is no pneumothorax.note is made of a trace amount of pericardial fluid.the heart and great vessels are notable for coronary arterial calcification.there is no mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy.note is made of gynecomastia.
summary: right 3rd-8th rib fractures and small nondisplaced superior sternal fracture.extensive atherosclerotic disease including coronary arterial calcification.diverticulosis.

text: the heart and great vessels are within normal limit.the aorta is of normal caliber.no free fluid is identified in the mediastinum.there is no evidence of enlarged adenopathy in the mediastinum, hilar or axillary regions.no pericardial or pleural effusions are seen.there are diffuse emphysematous changes, particularly noted at the lung bases.two tiny pulmonary nodules are identified in the right lung, one which is pleural based where the major fissure terminates and the second of which is peripherally located in the right lower lobe.there is no pneumothorax.
summary: wedge-shaped low attenuation region at the periphery of the right hepatic lobe most likely represents the diaphragmatic slip.less likely, this could represent a small hepatic contusion.no other evidence of acute traumatic injury involving the chest, abdomen or pelvis.cystic lesion in the neck of the pancreas with possible second smaller cyst in the pancreatic head.along with the possible focal dilatation of the splenic artery, which could represent an aneurysm, these could represent sequelae of pancreatitis.if clinically indicated, a follow-up exam, perhaps with mr, is recommended to assess stability.emphysema involivng the lung bases predominantly.

text: there has been interval insertion of a tracheostomy tube in adequate position.small right-sided pleural effusion unchanged compared to the previous study.there is more extensive overlying atelectasis involving the right lower lobe now, however.no concerning pulmonary nodule is seen.no axillary lymph nodes.there is a 1.5-cm right hilar lymph node, which was not identified on the previous studies.the heart, great vessels and pericardium are unremarkable in appearance.
summary: small right pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis.considerable improvement in the appearance of the right lobe of the liver laceration.small amount of free fluid in the pelvis.fractures of the left first and right fourth and fifth ribs.fracture of the right transverse process of t1.

text: the thyroid is unremarkable and there is no supraclavicular lymph node enlargement.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph node enlargement by ct size criteria.there is a pulmonary embolus in the right main pulmonary artery extending to the superior and inferior lobar segmental levels.there is also a pulmonary embolus in the left lingula segmental area (3;26-3;30).bilateral subsegmental pes are also identified.no hiatal hernia or any other esophageal abnormality is present.lung windows do not demonstrate any focal opacity.no pleural effusion or pneumothorax is present.
summary: no evidence of new distant metastatic lesions.bilateral pulmonary emboli as described above.infrarenal aortic ectasia with mural thrombus, as described above.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at 10:24 am by dr.___ ___ by telephone.

text: this examination is not designed for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis.allowing for these limitations, there is stable pneumobilia likely from previous ductal procedures but clinical correlation is needed.
summary: interval development of mild to moderate pleural effusions (right worse than left) with concurrent ground glass opacities in a dependent distribution suggesting pulmonary edema secondary to chf.no significant interval change in previously noted foci of probable adenocarcinoma of the lungs.no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic syndrome.chronic conditions including atherosclerosis and emphysema are again seen.

text: no dissection flap is present within the thoracic aorta.there is significant approximately 50% calcified atherosclerotic plaque narrowing the proximal aspect of the left subclavian artery (series 3: image 5).no filling defects are present within the pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolism.there is a left-sided picc line with tip terminating in the mid svc.a right subclavian central venous catheter tip terminates in the proximal right atrium.there is no cardiac enlargement.three-vessel coronary artery calcifications noted.no pericardial effusion.there is a large simple-appearing left pleural effusion which is grossly unchanged from ___ (direct comparison limited to lower half of the chest).moderate centrilobular and periseptal emphysematous changes are present within the lung apices.linear opacity / consolidation is present within the right upper lobe posteriorly with a somewhat nodular appearance near the apex measuring 2.3 x 1.4 cm (series 3: image 5).this study was not performed to evaluate structures below the diaphragm.however, there is a moderate amount of ascites surrounding a shrunken, nodular-appearing liver consistent with cirrhosis.
summary: no pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.large left pleural effusion with complete left lower lobe collapse,grossly stable since ___.linear opacity / consolidation within the right upper lobe (new since ___) with nodular components possibly representing an infectious versus inflammatory process.followup imaging recommended after treatment to exclude underlying malignancy given moderate emphysematous change.moderate intra-abdominal ascites and cirrhotic liver.coronary artery calcifications.

text: there are ground-glass as well as alveolar opacities within the left upper lobe.compared to the previous study, the focal consolidation appears improved although the amount of surrounding ground-glass opacity is slightly more extensive.there is a persistent small left-sided pleural effusion.there is bibasilar atelectasis.no pulmonary masses to indicate an av malformation are identified.there is cardiomegaly as well as a dual lead left-sided pacer in place.there is no significant axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.there is again a heterogeneous nodule within the right lobe of the thyroid.limited views of the upper abdomen show multiple, hypoattenuating lesions within the right lobe of the liver which are too small to definitively characterize but likely represent cysts.
summary: evolving left upper lobe pneumonia.persistent small left- sided pleural effusion with bibasilar atelectasis.no lung masses identified to indicate an av malformation within the limits of this study.right thyroid lobe nodule.

text: there is almost complete consolidation of the left lower lobe with an associated small simple left parapneumonic effusion.the superior segment bronchus of the left lower lobe is minimally narrowed between an area of periaortic atelectasis and the upper segment pulmonary artery (2:24).there is no evidence of a hilar mass causing this narrowing.no evidence of pulmonary or pleural abscess formation.the remainder of the lungs appears clear.there are multiple lower paratracheal enlarged lymph nodes, measuring up to 12 cm in short axis (2:19).there is a subcarinal lymph node, measuring 11 mm in short axis (2:25) and a 10 mm aortopulmonary window lymph node.there is no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial effusion.moderate calcification of the aortic arch and the aortic valve.the pulmonary artery is enlarged, measuring 3.4 cm at the bifurcation consistent with pulmonary hypertension.
summary: left lower lobe consolidation, consistent with infectious pneumonia in the setting of acute fever and cough.small parapneumonic effusion.no evidence of abscess formation.follow up cxr in four weeks after completion of antibiotic therapy is recommended.mediastinal lymphadenopathy is likely reactive in nature.compression fracture of the t7 vertebral body is of indeterminate age.multiple hypoattenuating liver lesions are too small to characterize size, but statistically most likely represent cysts or hemangiomas.enlarged pulmonary artery consistent with pulmonary hypertension.

text: there is a stent graft seen within the aortic arch and the descending aorta, proximally extending to the region between the left subclavian and left common carotid arteries, and distally to just below the main pulmonary artery.there appears to be a new dissection of the proximal left subclavian artery, with thrombus filling the false lumen, and distal to this, there is poor opacification.the patient is status post median sternotomy and cabg.a graft to the left anterior descending artery is patent.a graft to the right coronary artery is occluded.calcifications are seen within the native coronary arteries diffusely.note is made of a left axillary to femoral bypass graft in the anterior soft tissues, the imaged portion of which opacifies well with contrast.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.the pulmonary arteries demonstrate no central or segmental filling defects.no pleural effusions are identified.the lung windows demonstrate irregular apical consolidative opacities bilaterally.small areas of ground- glass opacity are seen in the lingula and left lower lobe.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.borderline lymph nodes are seen in the pericardial, pretracheal, and ap window regions.no pathologic axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy is seen.
summary: status post aortic arch and descending aortic stent graft.new short- segment, partially-flow-limiting dissection of the left subclavian artery, with thrombus in the false lumen.short-segment, non-flow limiting infrarenal abdominal aortic dissection unchanged since the prior study.focal area of stranding within the mesentery adjacent to the ascending colon, which was not present on the prior study.there is no clear bowel pathology present in this location such as an inflamed diverticulum or bowel wall thickening, and there is no mesenteric fluid.this could represent a subacute occult mesenteric injury.clinical correlation is recommended.ground-glass opacity in the lingula and left lower lobe could be inflammatory in nature, or possibly relate to respiratory motion.12 mm hypodensity in the left lobe of the liver, stable since the prior study and likely represents a simple cyst.borderline lymphadenopathy in the mediastinum is likely reactive and related to the recent mediastinal injury and surgery.occlusion of the bypass graft supplying the right coronary artery.bilateral, minimally displaced subacute rib fractures in the superior ribs.subacute burst fractures of the t4 and t5 vertebral bodies.

text: mdct images of the chest were obtained both without and with intravenous contrast using a cta protocol.multiplanar reformations were essential to interpretation.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.known mass replacing the majority of the right lung and significantly compressing both the pulmonary arterial and bronchial trees.there is extensive associated thoracic adenopathy.patchy left lung opacity has an appearance more suggestive of an infectious or inflammatory process.extensive upper abdominal adenopathy is incompletely imaged.

text: moderate bilateral effusions are associated with relaxation atelectasis.there is no focal consolidation or definite pulmonary nodule.heart size is normal.there is no pericardial effusion.endotracheal tube terminates 5.5 cm above the carina.nasogastric tube courses through the esophagus to terminate in the mid stomach.
summary: post transverse colectomy with likely intact anastomotic site.locules of air adjacent to the splenic flexure anastomosis likely represent post surgical change.areas of nondependant ascites raise the possibility of loculation.there is no rim enhancement to suggest abscess.anasarca and moderate bilateral pleural effusions.findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of dictation.

text: there are 2 right-sided chest tubes and a single left-sided chest tube.there are loculated effusions bilaterally with extension into the fissures and around the aorta internal loculated air.the effusions appear increased in size when compared to the previous study.there is subcutaneous air within the right chest wall near the chest tube entry sites.a surgical drain is seen near the upper mediastinum, surrounding the esophagus.the esophageal wall is diffusely thickened throughout with some fluid surrounding it.no definite mediastinal collections are identified.no significant axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy is seen.there is a right- sided picc terminating at the junction of the brachiocephalic vein and superior vena cava.a percutaneous gastric tube is seen within the stomach.
summary: slight interval increase in bilateral loculated effusions with air.the interval increase in size and loculation of the pleural effusions makes infection of the effusions likely.

text: the aorta is normal in course and caliber without evidence of dissection or aneurysmal dilatation.the pulmonary artery is normal in caliber, without intraluminal filling defects.there are extensive venous collaterals, notably in the anterior left chest wall.there is moderate-to-severe narrowing of the left subclavian vein.prominent azygos and hemiazygos venous supply is noted.there is left ventricular hypertrophy, consistent with reported hypertension.there are dense coronary artery calcifications.similarly, there are dense diffuse calcifications involving many arteries, much greater than expected for patient's age.no focal infiltrates.no pleural or pericardial effusions.there are multiple prominent bilateral axillary lymph nodes, none of which pathologically enlarged.no hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.note is made of bilateral mild gynecomastia.there is a right chest port and a right central venous catheter in place.the liver is normal, without focal lesions.no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation.the gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands and spleen are normal.note is made of a prominent ampulla projecting into the duodenum (sequence 3a, image 127) that likely is a normal finding.the bowel is unremarkable.the kidneys demonstrate symmetric enhancement without hydronephrosis or focal lesions.no abdominal free fluid or lymphadenopathy.the urinary bladder, rectum, prostate and sigmoid colon are unremarkable.no pelvic free fluid or lymphadenopathy.no suspicious osseous lesions.
summary: no evidence of aortic dissection, as clinically questioned.left ventricular hypertrophy, consistent with reported history of hypertension.diffuse, dense vascular calcifications, including coronary artery calcifications, much greater than expected for patient's age.extensive collateral venous drainage with associated focal narrowing of the left subclavian vein.

text: there is a 11 x 7 mm hypodensity in the left thyroid gland.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.there is good opacification of the pulmonary arteries without evidence of filling defect to the subsegmental level.there is no nodule, mass, or pleural effusion.subcentimeter bleb in the right upper lobe is unchanged.there is minimal dependent subsegmental atelectasis bilaterally.
summary: no evidence of acute pulmonary embolus or ivc or iliac thrombus.11 mm left thyroid nodule.follow up ultrasound can be obtained for further evaluation if not previously performed.finding entered into the critical findings database for communication to the patient's pcp.
