text: in comparison with the most recent prior ct imaging of the chest, dated ___, there is new lymphadenopathy within the left supraclavicular region, displacing the left lobe of the thyroid anteriorly and the left internal carotid artery medially and posteriorly.there is additional increase in size in numerous mediastinal lymph nodes, including several prevascular nodes measuring up to 13 mm in short axis diameter.there is no pathologic appearing axillary lymphadenopathy.numerous surgical clips are seen within mediastinum.aortic calcifications consistent with atheromatous disease.disrupted sternal suture wires and evidence of sternal dehiscence, with interval increase in separation of the sternal fragments in comparison with the previous examination of ___.the pericardium appears unremarkable.within the retrocrural region, there is a 12 mm lymph node, unchanged since the prior ct of the abdomen but increased in size since ___.small right pleural effusion, unchanged from the most recent prior.there are numerous pulmonary nodules, which are stable from the preceding ct of the abdomen but new since ___.the largest of these is located within the left lower lobe, measuring 12 mm in diameter.additional nodules are identified within the right middle lobe and right lower lobe, as well as in subpleural location within the right upper lobe.limited images of the upper abdomen demonstrate hypodensity of the liver consistent with fatty infiltration.slightly unusual contour of the left adrenal gland is again noted but unchanged from multiple previous examinations.an infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm is partially imaged.
summary: numerous pulmonary nodules consistent with metastatic disease, not present on the ___ examination.interval development of lymphadenopathy within the thorax, also suggestive of metastatic disease.sternal dehiscence with increased separation of the sternal fragments.small right pleural effusion.infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm, incompletely imaged.

text: the airways are patent to the segmental levels.new non-enlarged subcentimeter lymph nodes are seen in the prevascular region.there is no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pneumothorax, pleural or pericardial effusion.central venous catheter tip terminates in the lower third of svc.new ill-defined round opacity is seen in the right upper lobe (3, 15) measures 5 x 5 mm.in the left upper lobe, at the site of previously demonstrated thin- walled cyst, now there is a noncalcified nodule measuring 9 x 8 mm (4, 48).the adjacent 3-mm small solid nodule is unchanged (4, 56).3-mm noncalcified nodule in the right middle lobe (3, 27) and a 2-mm subpleural nodule in the left lower lobe (3, 42) are stable.a lobulated cavitating nodule in the left lower lobe measures 29 x 23 mm, was 26 x 22 mm (3, 28).no new nodules are present.radiation changes in the anterior right upper lobe and lingula are stable.small hiatal hernia.patient is status post left mastectomy.subcentimeter hypodensities within the left lobe of the liver are stable, too small to be characterized.patient is sp cholecystectomy.no bone findings of malignancy.small sclerotic focus in the sternum is stable.
summary: new bilateral upper lobe noncalcified lung nodules.followup in three months is suggested to re-evaluate for stability or resolution.stable less- than 3-mm nodules in the left upper lobe, middle, and left lower lobe.cavitating nodule in the left lower lobe is grossly unchanged.

text: oral contrast is seen flowing through the lumen of the fundoplication.however, just above the wrap of the nissen fundoplication seen on series 2, images 42 and 41 is a thin linear focus of extravasating oral contrast.this represents a small leak in this region.there is a small focus of air adjacent to this region.there is a small amount of free air under the left hemidiaphragm medially.this is relatively unchanged compared to the prior study.furthermore, in the anterior abdominal wall in the midline incompletely imaged on this ct study seen on series 2, image 54 inferior to the surgical clips, likely representing a small postoperative seroma.the abdominal portion of the study was read in conjunction with dr.___ ___.no pathologically enlarged axillary lymph nodes are seen.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is a left-sided chest tube which courses adjacent to the pericardial fat and abuts the left chest wall.previously seen hydropneumothorax on the left has nearly resolved with a tiny intrafissural component remaining on today's exam.there is residual lingular and left lower lobe atelectasis on today's exam.there is a small left-sided pleural effusion with surrounding enhancement.the size of the effusion has decreased from the prior study.however, the surrounding enhancement (split pleura sign) is radiologically suggestive of a complex effusion or empyema.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ on ___.
summary: linear small area of oral contrast extravasation just above the wrap of the nissen fundoplication connecting to a small pocket of air just below the diaphragm, consistent with a small leak.interval reduction in size of left-sided hydropneumothorax.split pleura sign surrounding left effusion, suggestive of a complex exudative effusion such as empyema.

text: there are large bilateral pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis/collpase of lower lobes and dependent portions of upper lobes.air bronchograms in the right lower lobe may indicate some aspect of an infiltrative process.further evaluation of lung parenchyma is limited by these large effusions.aerated upper lobes demonstrate multiple foci of ground glass attenuation predominantly in the apices.there is a single 5 mm nodule in the right middle lobe which is likely inflammatory.however, repeat evaluation after resolution of pleural effusions is recommended to evaluate remainder of the pulmonary parenchyma.there are filling defects within the distal trachea in a dependent position consistent with secretions.there is an 8 mm prevascular lymph node and several smaller pretracheal lymph nodes which do not attain ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no significant axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are atherosclerotic calcified plaques of the aortic knob and aortic valve.the heart is enlarged.all of the soft tissues of the torso are edematous.bone windows reveal moderate degenerative changes of the thoracic spine.
summary: large bilateral effusions with near complete collapse of the lower lobes.re-evaluation of the lungs is recommended after pleural tap or resolution to evaluate the lung parenchyma for consolidation or masses.6 x 4 cm soft tissue mass just superior to the right inguinal region.further evaluation is recommended with ultrasound to distinguish high attenuation cyst vs.solid lesion.lytic lesion of the l2 vertebral body is concerning for metastatic disease.further evaluation with bone scan is recommended.

text: there is no supraclavicular, mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.a right chest wall port-a-cath terminates at the cavoatrial junction.the heart size is normal and there is no pericardial effusion.the aorta is of normal caliber, without dissection.the remainder of the great vessels appears normal.a 13 x 9 mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule previously measured 12 x 7 mm (2:23).a smaller adjacent 3 mm nodule is unchanged.there are no new pulmonary nodules and aside from increased bibasilar atelectasis and focal air trapping at the left lung base, the lungs are otherwise clear.there are tiny pleural effusions.
summary: persistent cecitis and ascending colitis with persistent and perhaps slightly increased wall thickening and also greater inflammatory fat stranding.the appearance suggests neutropenic colitis given the patient's history.left lower lobe pulmonary nodule, increased in the short one-week interval since the prior study, worrisome for an ongoing infectious etiology.

text: the airways are patent to segmental levels bilaterally.heterogeneous attenuation throughout the lungs is likely related to air-trapping.there is a small amount of dependent atelectasis bilaterally.a nodular opacity posterolaterally in the left lower lobe is 13 x 9 mm.this correlates to a small nodular opacity, which was described on a ct from ___, and has now grown minimally in size.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.a hypodense pretracheal node is borderline in size, measuring 10mm in shortest diameter.the heart and great vessels are notable for coronary arterial calcification as well as aortic valvular calcification.in addition, calcification is visualized along the length of the aorta, which is ectatic, unchanged from the previous studies, measuring approximately 37 x 38 mm in the ascending aorta.dense calcification is also prominent at the origin of the left subclavian artery.the main as well as right pulmonary arteries are prominent in size measuring ~29 mm, suggesting pulmonary hypertension.note is made of cardiomegaly, in particular with left atrium appears enlarged.
summary: extensive atherosclerotic disease as well as ectatic dilation of the ascending aorta, similar to that seen in ___.left lower lobe pulmonary nodular opacity, appearing minimally enlarged from ___.given the size of this lesion, followup with a pet study or dedicated ct of the chest within three months, is recommended.diverticulosis left renal hypodensity.while this is likely a cyst, it is new/enlarged from the previous study and could be correlated to u/s for further characterization.stable hepatic hypodensities too small to characterize but likely cysts.wedge compression deformity in the mid thoracic spine and degenerative changes in the remainder of the spine as cataloged above.

text: the contrast bolus and timing of acquisition were adequate.there are no pulmonary arterial filling defects to the segmental levels bilaterally.pulmonary arterial size is normal.the thoracic aorta contains atherosclerotic calcifications but is not dilated, and there is no evidence of dissection or intramural thrombus.the patient is status post sternotomy with intact sternal cerclage wires.the patient is also status post cabg as well as multiple coronary arterial stenting.an aicd is noted in the right chest wall with leads appropriately located in the right atrium and right ventricle.a left subclavian hemodialysis catheter terminates at the cavoatrial junction.the heart is stably enlarged with right-sided predominance.there is no pericardial effusion.marked reflux of contrast can be seen traversing the dilated ivc and hepatic veins, indicative of right-sided heart failure.the imaged portion of the thyroid gland appears normal.there is no supraclavicular, axillary, or hilar lymphadenopathy.a single 1.6 cm enlarged lymph node is noted in the pretracheal station, just superior to the carina (3:25).no other pathological lymph nodes are detected.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level bilaterally.there are moderate bilateral pleural effusions as well as adjacent compressive atelectasis of the lower lobes.there is no evidence of focal consolidation concerning for infectious process.no discrete pulmonary nodules are seen.there is diffuse mild pulmonary edema.there is no pneumothorax.this study is not optimized for the evaluation of subdiaphragmatic structures.within this limitation, ascites is noted in the upper abdomen.no other gross abnormality is identified.there are mild degenerative changes of the spine.no fracture or malalignment is noted.there are no osseous lesions concerning for malignancy.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic syndrome.findings of congestive heart failure including moderate bilateral pleural effusion, pulmonary edema, cardiomegaly, and reflux of contrast into a dilated ivc are seen.ascites is noted in the upper abdomen.

text: the heart is enlarged and there is a moderate to large size pericardial effusion.there is also bilateral pleural effusions.there are no filling defects in the pulmonary arteries to the segmental levels.a low attenuation focus along the wall of the left pulmonary artery is felt to represent artifact.there is ground- glass opacities and increased prominence of the septal lines seen throughout the lungs, also scattered areas of airspace opacity seen.the trachea and the major branches of the airway are patent.there is a 2.5 x 2.0 cm left breast mass which has some peripheral enhancement.there are pericardial lymph nodes the largest of which measures 1.7 x 1.0 cm.the largest lymph node in the left axilla measures 1.0 x 0.6 cm.limited evaluation of upper portion of the abdomen shows ascites.
summary: no pe.left axillary breast mass with metastatic foci to the thoracic spine.bilateral pleural and pericardial effusions.cardiomegaly with bilateral ground-glass opacities and septal prominence consistent with interstitial edema.

text: no filling defects are seen within the pulmonary arteries bilaterally which are concerning for acute pulmonary embolus.again seen in a segmental left upper lobe pulmonary arterial branch is a small filling defect at the location of a prior embolus, consistent with chronic clot, unchanged.the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber without evidence for dissection.there are coronary artery calcifications.small pericardial effusion is unchanged in size.the patient is status post placement of an esophageal stent extending from the mid esophagus beyond the gastroesophageal junction.the esophageal stent is surrounded by soft tissue mass of similar extent with moderate compression in the mid stent narrowing the luminal diameter to 7 mm.the proximal esophagus is fluid filled to the level of the thoracic inlet.there is interval increase in size of several gas pockets adjacent to the mid stent.no air is seen tracking within the superior mediastinum.while these air foci may be retained within the mass, the possibility of a small focal perforation is not excluded.the lungs demonstrate interval increase in a moderate right pleural effusion measuring up to 6 cm in maximal thickness, previously 4.6 cm on ___.there is moderate adjacent compressive atelectasis at the right base.the left lung is grossly clear.no pneumothorax is seen.airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no short interval change in several prominent mediastinal lymph nodes.no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy is seen.in the upper abdomen, the imaged hepatic dome and spleen appear grossly unremarkable.
summary: no evidence for acute pulmonary embolus or aortic dissection.residual chronic pulmonary emboli.status post placement of an esophageal stent with interval increase in foci of gas adjacent to the right mid stent.while these foci may be retained within the mass, the possibility of a focal perforation is not excluded, especially given the increased size of the adjacent pleural effusion.stable mediastinal lymphadenopathy.findings were discussed with dr.___ at 1:30 a.m.on the date of dictation.

text: the heart, pericardium and great vessels are within normal limits.again seen are bilateral venous stents extending on the right from the right axillary vein to the svc, and on the left the left brachiocephalic vein into the svc.the contrast bolus is given through the left arm and the left-sided stents are patent.the right-sided stents are narrowed as they pass between the clavicle and first rib.there may be fragmentation of the stent at this location as well.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.mediastinal bronchiectasis, more prominent on the right, is again noted and consistent with post-radiation changes.again seen is a 3 mm nodule in the left lower lobe.it is unchanged from prior examinations.there is a moderate-sized right pleural effusion.visualized portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.
summary: stable 3 mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule.interval development of moderate right pleural effusion.stable post-radiation changes.narrowing and possible fragmentation of the right subclavian stent as it passes between the clavicle and first rib.

text: there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.mediastinal clips from prior cardiac surgery versus vascular calcifications are seen along the path of the coronary arteries.marked vascular calcifications are seen along the aortic arch and visualized portions of the aorta.examination of lung windows demonstrate severe changes of centrilobular emphysema.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, with biapical pleural thickening.left lower lobe atelectasis is also seen.limited evaluation of the visualized upper abdominal structures are unremarkable.osseous structures appear unremarkable.coronally and sagittal reformatted images were also reviewed, which do not demonstrate evidence of pulmonary embolism.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.severe emphysema.small bilateral pleural effusions.left lower lobe atelectasis.

text: the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.there are no filling defects in the pulmonary arterial vasculature to indicate pulmonary embolism.there is some atelectasis at the left lung base.no pleural or pericardial effusions are seen.there are extensive coronary artery calcifications and pacemaker wires seen.no active extravasation of contrast is seen in the esophagus.the aorta is tortuous, however, there is a well defined fat plane between the aorta and the esophagus.in the lower chest, the esophagus drapes over the tortuous aorta, however, three dimensional reconstructed images demonstrate a well defined plane between these two organs without active extravasation.there are no significantly enlarged axillary lymph nodes seen.there is an enlarged right paratracheal lymph node measuring 13 x 20 mm.there is a subcarinal lymph node measuring 9 x 14 mm.there are smaller prevascular lymph nodes seen as well.there is a 3 mm nodule in the right middle lobe.a few images through the abdomen demonstrate some calcified granulomas at the dome of the liver, a small low attenuation focus in the right lobe of the liver that is too small to fully characterize, atrophic appearance of the kidneys, and contrast in the gallbladder seen even on the i- study likely from a prior examination.
summary: no active extravasation identified to suggest an aortoesophageal fistula.

text: a tracheostomy tube is in place, with tip approximately 3.5 cm above the carina, oriented posteriorly.there is a right subclavian central venous catheter, with tip in the mid svc.a nasogastric tube is present in the esophagus, with tip located at the ge junction.there is minimal/mild fluid in the pleural spaces, and dependent density in both lung bases is largely due to atelectasis/consolidation with air bronchograms, left greater than right.the atelectasis/consolidation is increased bilaterally compared to ___, now moderate on the left.ground-glass density is seen elsewhere within the aerated lungs, which may in part be related to respiratory motion during the study.it is difficult to assess for underlying lung nodules.the central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial effusion.dense coronary artery calcification versus a stent in the left circumflex artery.
summary: no significant change in the fluid collection anterior and superior to the pancreas, contiguous with the stomach.findings related to pancreatitis are essentially unchanged, except for resolution of the distal cbd stone.minimal/trace pleural fluid.density in the dependent portion of both lungs is largely related to atelectasis/consolidation, left greater than right, increased from ___.unchanged tubular hypodensity in the left lobe of liver, not fully characterized on this study.this finding could be related to a focally dilated intrahepatic bile duct though it is difficult to exclude thrombus within a left portal vein branch.doppler ultrasound is recommended to better characterize this finding.persistent stone in the porta hepatis region, potentially within the cystic duct.however, gallbladder distention is decreased, and there is no ct evidence of gallbladder inflammation or obstruction.orogastric tube tip is located at the ge junction, and could be advanced into the stomach if clinically indicated.the targetted doppler ultrasound recommendation to characterize the left hepatic lobe finding was discussed with dr.___ on the morning of ___.the og tube position was also textpaged to her.

text: multiple subcentimeter mediastinal lymph nodes are noted.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are normal in appearance.there is a small right pleural effusion.there are numerous small filling defects within segmental pulmonary arteries in the right upper and left lower lobes, suspicious for emboli.there is extensive atelectasis in the basal segments of the right lower lobe, and there is discoid atelectasis in the left lower lobe.there is a small amount of residual air within the right pleural space.the skeletal structures are unremarkable.
summary: atelectasis of the basal segments of the right lower lobe and discoid atelectasis in the left lower lobe.probable small pulmonary emboli within segmental pulmonary arteries in the right upper and left lower lobe.if more definitive evaluation is required, pulmonary angiography should be considered.

text: multiple segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli are noted involving the pulmonary arteries supplying the left upper lobe, the left lower lobe, and lingula.no evidence of pulmonary embolism is noted on the right.no evidence of right heart strain is noted.the patient is status post right upper lobectomy.there is right-sided pleural effusion which has been shown to be increasing over multiple recent prior chest radiographs.in addition, there remains a small locule of air in the non-dependent position on the right consistent with the history of recent surgery.in addition, small locules of subcutaneous gas are noted along the lateral and posterior chest wall as well as along the region of chest wall reconstruction.rounded opacity in the right lung base could represent rounded atelectasis, although infection cannot be excluded.there is adjacent compressive atelectasis along the right lower lobe.on the left, there is new reticulation with ground-glass attenuation along the posterior aspect of the left upper lobe which could represent aspiration or infection.subpleural fibrosis in the left lung base is not changed.centrilobular emphysematous changes are again noted.calcified granuloma in the left lower lobe is as before.there is also trace pleural effusion on the left.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted along the aorta and the coronary arteries.no pericardial effusion is noted.prevascular and paratracheal lymph nodes are increased in number.lymph nodes in ap window measure up to 13 mm in short axis.bilateral hilar lymph nodes are also noted, measuring up to 10 mm on the right and 9 mm on the left.the central airways appear patent.note is made of a large hiatal hernia.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable except to note colonic diverticulum along the splenic flexure, as well as a right renal cyst.
summary: multiple left-sided segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli.post- operative changes on the right after right upper lobectomy including increasing fluid and small amount of residual air within the pleural space, and subcutaneous gas along the chest wall.rounded opacity in the right lung base could represent rounded atelectasis, although infection cannot be excluded.new reticulation with ground-glass attenuation along the posterior left upper lobe could represent aspiration or infection.trace left pleural effusion.large hiatal hernia.dfddp

text: the lungs appear clear without pleural effusions, consolidations, atelectasis or evidence for pulmonary infarction.no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy is seen.the heart appears normal without evidence of pericardial effusion.the aorta and great vessels appear unremarkable without evidence of dissection.the pulmonary vasculature is well opacified without evidence of intraluminal filling defect to suggest pulmonary embolus.the incompletely visualized upper abdominal organs including liver, spleen and pancreas appear unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or other acute cardiopulmonary process.

text: soft tissue windows reveal enlarged mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes.the study is somewhat suboptimal due to patient's respiratory motion artifact.in some subsegmental pulmonary artery branches there is heterogeneous opacification which probably is caused by respiratory motion.no definite pulmonary embolus is identified.the central pulmonary arteries and lobar pulmonary arteries appear unremarkable.there is trace amount of bilateral pleural effusions.lung windows reveal significant emphysematous changes most prominent in the upper lung zones.there is also coarsened interstitium and subpleural honeycombing most significantly in the left lower zones consistent with chronic interstitial disease.there is also bibasilar small atelectases.
summary: somewhat suboptimal study due to patient respiratory motion.there is no central or lobar pulmonary artery filling defects.mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.emphysema and interstitial disease.bibasilar atelectases and trace pleural effusions.distended stomach of uncertain etiology.bilateral extrarenal pelvis with mild hydronephrosis and proximal hydroureter in the setting of markedly distended urinary bladder.

text: there is marked kyphosis of the thoracic spine.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are unremarkable other than a few scattered aortic calcifications.there is an enlarged lymph node in the precarinal region measuring 1.4 cm in the short axis which exceeds ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there are no other pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum, hila, or axillae.there is minimal scarring at the lung bases bilaterally but the lungs are otherwise clear.there are no pleural effusions.the airways are patent through the segmental level bilaterally.
summary: increase in stranding of the right lower quadrant mesenteric fat with an associated new cluster of enlarged lymph nodes is concerning for tumor infiltration.there is a pathologically enlarged precarinal lymph node in the mediastinum.the chronicity of this lesion is indeterminate as no prior study is available for comparison.this is a somewhat nonspecific finding, however, in the setting of known malignancy, this may represent metastasis.small cystocele.

text: the thyroid gland is unremarkable.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.no pericardial effusions are present.the lungs show no pleural effusions.there is left greater than right bibasilar atelectasis, and an additional wedge shaped area of consolidation and atelectasis in the right lower lobe.ground-glass opacities in the right upper and middle lobe could represent sequelae of aspiration or pneumonia.however, given the traumatic history, pulmonary hemorrhage is a diagnostic consideration.
summary: compression fractures of the t12 and l1 vertebral bodies and fracture of the t12 spinous process as described above.fracture of the right distal clavicle (features are consistent with a chronic finding).ground-glass opacities in the right upper and middle lobes and atelectasis and consolidation in right lower lobe could represent sequelae of aspiration or pneumonia.however, given the history of trauma, pulmonary hemorrhage cannot be excluded.

text: the pulmonary arteries are well opacified and demonstrate no intraluminal filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are stable in appearance and unremarkable.the airways are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.there is stable elevation of the left hemidiaphragm.the lungs again demonstrate evidence of paraseptal emphysema at the apices.the lungs are otherwise clear without focal areas of consolidation or effusion.there are no pathologically enlarged areas of adenopathy.the limited visualized portions of the upper abdomen again demonstrate evidence for splenomegaly and a small amount of free fluid adjacent to the spleen.clips are noted adjacent to the intrahepatic portion of the ivc consistent with patient's history of transplant.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.

text: the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.the patient is status post right pneumonectomy.the right hemithorax is filled with fluid.there is nodular peripheral enhancement of the pleura in the base on the right side.there are no mediastinal lymph nodes.cardiac size is normal.there is no pericardial or left pleural effusion.the aorta is normal in caliber.the left lung is clear with no lung nodules.centrilobular emphysema predominates in the upper lobe.the upper abdomen is unremarkable.there are no bone findings of malignancy.postoperative changes are in right sixth and right seventh ribs.
summary: right pneumonectomy, fluid-filled.nodular enhancement of the right pleura is highly suspicious for pleural implants.pet/ct can be performed for further evaluation .minimal emphysema.findings were posted in the critical result reporting system to be convey to dr.___ dr.___ ___ ___

text: the aorta is intact.the heart is enlarged.there is a prosthetic mitral valve.the patient is status post median sternotomy.there is no pericardial effusion.there is no evidence of pneumothorax or pleural effusions.examination of the lung windows demonstrates right apical scarring with traction bronchiectasis.there is also right middle lobe ground glass opacity and peripheral opacities in the lower lobes.these findings may be chronic and recommend correlation with patient's history.there are emphysematous changes of the lungs bilaterally.the right main stem bronchus is slightly narrowed which could be due to mild tracheomalacia.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.there are no pleural effusions.there is no pericardial effusion.the ascending aorta is mildly dilated measuring 4.4 cm.
summary: no evidence of significant trauma in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.bilateral lung opacities are most likely due to chronic granulomatous disease.ground glass opacities in the middle lobe are most likely chronic.however, the possibility of aspiration or contusion cannot be excluded.mildly enlarged right paratracheal lymph node measuring 11 mm.diverticular disease of the colon.severe calcifications of the coronary arteries.mild cardiomegaly without evidence for chf.

text: the pulmonary arteries are normal in appearance and caliber.there are no filling defects identified within the pulmonary arteries or branching vessels to indicate pulmonary embolism.the aorta is normal in appearance and caliber.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are normal in appearance.coronary artery, and intramural aortic calcifications are identified.there is no significant mediastinal, axillary, or hilar lymphadenopathy.small calcified right hilar and subcarinal lymph nodes are seen consistent with prior granulomatous infection.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.lung windows reveal bibasilar dependent atelectasis.diffuse emphysematous changes are seen bilaterally.a tiny, too small to characterize, subpleural nodule is best seen on series 2, image 24 in the left lower lung.within the right lung, there is a calcified approximately 5 mm nodular density best seen on series 2, image 26, most likely representing prior granulomatous disease.additionally, within the right middle lobe, best seen on series 2, image 34 there is a poorly defined area of increased opacification possibly representing focal atelectasis versus nodule.surrounding soft tissues with no significant axillary lymphadenopathy.images through the abdomen reveal multiple small calcified foci within the spleen, also consistent with prior granulomatous infection.
summary: no evidence of acute pulmonary embolism.multiple right hilar, and subcarinal calcified lymph nodes consistent with prior granulomatous infection.5 mm right middle lobe calcified nodule consistent with prior granulomatous infection.additionally, two smaller non-specific nodules as described above.diffuse atherosclerotic disease.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 6:10pm on ___ 15, ___.

text: the patient is status post sternotomy for cabg.again seen is lytic destruction of the sternum, most pronounced at the fifth wire, unchanged in appearance from ___.fat stranding surrounding the sternum with slight extension into the anterior mediastinum is unchanged, likely related to a combination of osteomyelitis and post-surgical changes.no associated drainable fluid collection is seen in the anterior subcutaneous tissues or within the mediastinum.no other bone finding of infection or malignancy is seen.small mediastinal lymph nodes are not enlarged by ct size criteria, ranging up to 8 mm in the prevascular space, unchanged from ___ and likely reactive.no pathologically enlarged axillary or hilar lymph nodes are identified.no nodules in the thyroid gland.a central venous catheter ends in the svc.the aorta and pulmonary artery are of normal caliber.dense calcifications in the native coronary arteries with post cabg changes.there is no pericardial effusion.left basilar atelectasis has increased from ___ with a very small left pleural effusion.scarring in the lingula and right middle lobe are unchanged.a 3-mm right middle lobe nodule (4:128) and a 2-mm right middle lobe nodule (4:137) are unchanged since ___ and no further follow up is necessary.the transverse diameter of the trachea is greater than the anterior-posterior diameter, raising the possibility of tracheobronchomalacia.airways are patent to the subsegmental level bilaterally.this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, but no abnormality is seen in the imaged upper abdomen.
summary: no change from ___ in sternal osteomyelitis.fat stranding in anterior mediastinum is likely due to a combination of sternal osteomyelitis and post-surgical changes.no drainable fluid collection identified.increased transverse tracheal diameter relative to the ap diameter raises the possibility of tracheobronchomalacia.finding #1 was discussed with dr.___ ___ by phone at 5:08 p.m., ___.

text: there are multiple bilateral rib fractures, involving the lateral second through ninth ribs on the right and the second through eighth ribs on the left, most of which are comminuted, displaced, and with bony overriding.there are bilateral chest tubes terminating medially between the fifth and sixth ribs on the right and the fourth and fifth ribs on the left.there is a tiny amount of residual air bilaterally at the bases consistent with tiny pneumothoraces.there is a large amount of subcutaneous gas.there is bibasilar airspace opacification consistent with bilateral lower lobe collapse which may in part be due to aspiration, underlying parenchymal contusion is not excluded.parenchymal opacity is also noted in the right upper lung.hyperdensities are noted in right lower lobe bronchus and right lower lobe, which may represent teeth or fragments of aspirated teeth.there is also a hyperdense structure in the esophagus, which may represent a swallowed tooth.the endotracheal tube is 2.5 cm from the carina.there is mild anterior mediastinal haziness without evidence of aortic injury or sternal fracture, but a small hematoma may be present.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart is mildly enlarged.there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: multiple bilateral displaced, comminuted rib fractures with overriding, as above.tiny residual ___-basilar pneumothoraces.lower lung collapse bilaterally.underlying contusion not excluded.high density structures in right lower lobe segmental bronchus and in the esophagus, most likely representing aspirated and swallowed teeth, respective.subtle anterior mediastinal haziness may represent a small hematoma, without evidence of acute aortic injury or sternal fracture.no evidence of acute intra-abdominal or pelvic injury.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of interpretation on ___.

text: there are bilateral nonhemorrhagic pleural effusions, moderate on the right and small on the left with compression atelectasis of portion of the right lower lobe and minimal left lower lobe dependent atelectasis.there is mild interstitial pulmonary edema.areas of ill- defined ground glass opacities within the lingula are likley related to underlying pulmonary edema with pneumonia felt to be less likely.no other focal consolidation suggestive of pneumonia are identified within the lung and there is stable appearance to a 6 mm calcified granuloma within the left upper lobe.surgical changes from cabg and avr are noted.there is cardiomegaly with extensive biatrial enlargement with reflux of contrast into the hepatic veins suggestive of rv failure.additionally, there is mild dilatation of the ascending aorta measuring approximately 4.5x 5 cm and dilatation of the main pulmonary artery measuring 4 mm, suggestive of underlying pulmonary hypertension.extensive calcifications are noted throughout the aorta, left atrium, and mitral annulus.there is no pathologically enlarged intrathoracic lymphadenopathy.airways are patent to the subsegmental level.endotracheal tube remains approximately 3 cm from the carina and there is unchanged appearanace to malpositioned left- sided picc catheter which may be extravascular.limited examination through the upper abdomen displays mild ascites, and a small calcification within the left lobe, likely related to prior granulomatous disease.
summary: right lower lobe atelectasis surrounded by moderate sized simple right pleural effusion.ground glass opacities within the lingula are likely related to pulmonary edema.mild interstitial pulmonary edema, cardiomegaly with biatrial enlargement and rv failure, and 5cm ascending aorta dilatation.mild dilatation to main pulmonary artery suggestive of underlying pulmonary hypertension.unchanged appearance to appropriately positioned endotracheal tube and malpositioned left-sided picc catheter with tip in unclear location and possibly extravascular.

text: this examination completes the ct examination from ___, 13:25 p.m., and is performed only for detecting potential pulmonary embolism.the quality of the contrast injection is sufficient to exclude the presence of pulmonary embolism in the central and segmental parts of the pulmonary arterial tree.no indirect signs for pe.no right heart enlargement, no bulging of the intraventricular septum.all other changes are constant, including the partial left lower lobe collapse and the small bilateral pleural effusions.unchanged minimal air in the mediastinum.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.

text: the thyroid gland is normal.there is a tracheal stent in place.again seen is a soft tissue density to the right of the esophagus, measuring 2.9 x 2.2 cm, which is smaller than the prior pet ct.there are a number of prominent mediastinal lymph nodes which do not meet ct size criteria for enlargement but have grown in size since the prior study and may represent hypertrophic reaction.there is no pathologic enlargement of hilar, mediastinal, supraclavicular, or axillary nodes.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.the central intravenous line terminates in the right atrium close to the inlet of the svc.heart size is normal with no evidence of pericardial effusion.the great vessels appear unremarkable.there are bilateral focal opacities of the dependent portions of both lungs.compared to the prior scan, there has been interval improvement in the left lung but more extensive involvement of the right lower lobe and new disease in the right middle lobe.there is a stable lung nodule (2:28) in the left upper lobe.there is also a stable 5mm nodule in the left upper lobe (2:36).there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
summary: percutaneous gastro-jejunal tube in appropriate position with normal contrast opacification of the bowel distal to it.no evidence of bowel obstruction.patchy opacification of the dependent portions of both lungs, consistent with aspiration pneumonia.interval improvement in the left lower lobe but worsening of the right lower lobe and new involvement of the right middle lobe since ___.stable lung nodules splenomegaly.stable and patent tracheal stent with interim decrease in size of paraesophageal soft tissue mass with likely reactive hypertrophy of mediastinal lymph nodes.

text: the patient is status post total right pneumonectomy with unchanged volume loss, rightward mediastinal shift, and fluid in the right hemithorax.diffuse thickening and mild enhancement of the pleura within the pneumonectomy bed is unchanged.aside from scarring at the left lung base, associated with mild bronchiectasis, the left lung remains clear without pleural effusion.a right paratracheal lymph node measures 13 mm, unchanged.the thoracic aorta is tortuous, though of normal caliber.there is no pericardial effusion.although this exam is not tailored to evaluate subdiaphragmatic structures, limited evaluation of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.there are no bone findings of malignancy.
summary: status post right pneumonectomy with unchanged thickened pleura and right paratracheal lymph node.

text: the airways are patent.no pneumothorax or pleural effusion is present.minimal dependent atelectasis is present in the right lower lobe.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are present in the axilla, hilum, or mediastinum.the tip of a central line catheter terminates in the right atrium.the heart and great vessels appear normal.no pericardial effusion is present.two nodules in the right upper lobe measuring 2- and 1-mm each (2:14) are stable.
summary: increased size of a left hepatic lobe metastasis in a patient status post whipple procedure.increased volume of abdominopelvic ascites.increased mesenteric and subcutaneous tissue anasarca.stable sub-4-mm right upper lobe pulmonary nodules.stable soft tissue surrounding the superior mesenteric artery.

text: this exam is technically limited by suboptimal bolus and patient's body habitus.although no central pulmonary emboli are seen, this exam does not excluide pulmonary embolism.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.prevascular lymph nodes are noted slightly more prominent than on the previous exam.paratracheal lymphadenopathy is also noted.several subpleural nodules are noted bilaterally, which were not seen on the previous study and are likely infectious or inflammatory in etiology.there is a 7 mm noncalcified nodule at the right lung apex.extensive degenerative changes are noted throughout the spine.there is no suspicious lytic or sclerotic bony lesions.there is no pericardial effusion.
summary: interval decrease in size of retroperitoneal hematoma.no new hematoma seen.technically limited evaluation of the chest.pulmonary embolism is not excluded.non-calcified nodule at the right lung apex.

text: evaluation of the main pulmonary artery and its major branches demonstrate no filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolus.the thoracic aorta is minimally calcified.no aneurysmal dilatation is seen.the heart size is normal.scattered coronary calcifications are present.no pericardial effusion is present.there is no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are several subcentimeter paratracheal lymph nodes measuring up to 9 mm in size.evaluation of the lungs demonstrates patchy airspace disease in the right upper lobe and bilateral lower lobe consolidations with air bronchograms.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.differential diagnosis includes infectious etiologies.there is no pneumothorax.limited views of the upper abdomen are grossly unremarkable.examination of the osseous structures demonstrates a compression deformity of a mid thoracic vertebral body with superior endplate sclerosis of uncertain chronicity.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.bilateral lower lobe consolidation and small bilateral pleural effusions.patchy right upper lobe airspace opacity.differential diagnosis includes infectious etiology.followup is recommended.mid thoracic vertebral body compression deformity of unknown chronicity.

text: again seen are bilateral pleural effusions which have increased in the interval.there are large bilateral dependent atelectases.there is fluid in the right minor fissure.there are no filling defects within the main pulmonary artery and its branches.there are a few lymph nodes in the prevasular, precarinal and right paratracheal region.the largest lymph node in the precarinal region contains a fatty hilum and meaures approximately 14 mm.the prevascular and right paratracheal larger lymph nodes measures approximately 9 mm.the heart is normal.there is no pericardial fluid.the lungs reveal multiple areas of patchy consolidation distributed throughout both lung fields.they appear worse in bilateral upper lobes.there is thickening of the intralobular septa.there are degenerative changes of the spine.multiple right rib fractures are again seen.multiplanar reconstructions demonstrate the above findings.
summary: bilateral moderate size pleural effusions with bibasilar dependent atelectases.areas of patchy consolidation may represent pulmonary edema or pneumonia.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.

text: there has been interval worsening of disease.the left apex mass measures 2.6 x 3.5 cm, previously 2.3 x 3.1 cm.there is a new lesion in the right lung apex measuring 8 mm in diameter.innumerable lesions are noted throughout the remainder of the pulmonary lobes, which are also new.there has been interval enlargement of the left superior hilar mass measuring 3.5 x 2.5 cm (previously 2.2 x 1.8 cm).there is interval appearance of a small left pleural effusion, which is likely malignant in etiology.
summary: significant interval worsening of pulmonary disease with innumerable new nodules throughout all lobes and enlargement of previously measured nodules.new small left pleural effusion, likely malignant.bilateral adrenal masses, left larger than right, are equivocally larger in the interval.

text: the left diaphragm is slightly elevated.there is a small, predominantly anterior loculated fluid collection.in addition, there is linear scarring in the lung bases.there are no nodules, masses or focal areas of consolidation.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi.the heart is normal in size.there is a small pericardial effusion.there are sternotomy wires and evidence of prior cardiac surgery.the great vessels are intact.there is no significant axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the visualized portion of the upper abdomen is unremarkable except for bilateral atrophic kidneys.on bone windows there are no suspicious lesions.in the right breast there is a 2.4 x 1.6 cm soft tissue mass.
summary: the left hemidiaphragm is elevated.there is a small left anteriorly loculated pleural effusion.lobulated and enhancing right breast mass.recommend correlation with physical exam and with mammography.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.there has been slight interval increase in size of moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.there is associated atelectasis bilaterally.diffuse areas of patchy ground-glass opacity are seen within the lungs bilaterally with likely septal thickening suggesting a component of pulmonary edema.coronary artery calcifications again seen.there is no pericardial effusion.again seen is evidence of repair of thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm.no definite extravasation of contrast is seen to suggest leak or rupture.again seen is evidence of repair of thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm, with aortobi-iliac grafts originating from the mid thoracic aorta.there is no evidence of retroperitoneal hematoma.there is no definite evidence of contrast extravasation to suggest endoleak.small area of linear hyperdensity seen adjacent to the graft repair (3:48) is apparent on the pre-contrast images (2:44) as well as on the prior study (___, series 3, image 41), and does not appear to represent endoleak.at least two areas of nodular ground-glass opacity are seen at the right base (3:54), not significantly changed from prior study.when measured in a similar fashion compared to prior study, the size of the thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm does not appear significantly changed compared to prior study, measuring upwards of 6.5 x 6.2 cm at the diaphragmatic hiatus.the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands appear unchanged.again noted are several right renal cysts, not significantly changed in appearance compared to prior study.the left renal conduit again appears thrombosed, with no perfusion of the left kidney seen.the iliac artery conduits supplying the celiac trunk and sma again appears patent.visualized loops of bowel appear unremarkable.there is no free air within the abdomen.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.status post repair of thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm.no evidence of contrast extravasation to suggest endoleak.no evidence of rupture.left renal artery conduit occlusion again seen, with absence of perfusion in the left kidney.increase in moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left with associated atelectasis.evidence of pulmonary edema.nodular opacities at the right base again possibly representing atelectasis or inflammatory change since they are new from ___.attention will be paid on follow-up imaging.the results of this study were discussed with dr.___ ___ at 7:45 p.m.on ___.

text: enlarged mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes located in the prevascular, paratracheal, precarinal, subcarinal, and right and left hilar regions, are little changed from ___.a paratracheal node measuring 1.8 x 2.5 cm (3:16), previously measured 1.8 x 2.3 cm.a prevascular node measuring 2.0 cm in short axis diameter previously measured 2.0 cm.a precarinal node measuring 1.9 x 2.9 cm previously measured 2.1 x 2.8 cm.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels appear unchanged.the central airways are patent.extensive bilateral fibrotic changes in the lungs are again noted with severe honeycombing involving the upper lobes diffusely and the peripheral and basal aspects of the lower lobes.minimal consolidation in the dependent aspect of the lingula is unchanged.a couple of nodular appearing areas in the left upper lobe (3:13, 17), are little changed.there are no pleural effusions.
summary: no significant interval change in mediastinal adenopathy consistent with metastatic renal cell carcinoma.new right adrenal nodule consistent with metastasis.unchanged right renal lesion consistent with neoplasm.increase in bilateral destructive soft tissue masses, consistent with metastases, involving the symphysis pubis and pubic rami.progression of right inferior pubic ramus metastasis.little change in lumbar vertebral metastases.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber and contour.heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.chronic volume loss in the right hemithorax consistent with prior lobectomy is unchanged.chronic atelectasis of the posterior segment of the right lower lobe due to abrupt change in caliber of the right lower lobe bronchus is also unchanged.there has been interval improvement in consolidation within the left lung base.no new areas of consolidation are identified.there is no pulmonary nodule.enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes are unchanged.visualized portions of the upper abdomen demonstrate stable pneumobilia, and numerous surgical clips.osseous structures redemonstrate 6-mm lucency within the posterior left eighth rib, unchanged.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.stable appearance of chronic changes within the right hemithorax.interval improvement in consolidation at the left lung base.

text: no pulmonary embolism is identified to the segmental level.there is respiratory motion such that a subsegmental pulmonary embolism cannot be entirely excluded.note is made of aberrant, retroesophageal course of the right subclavian artery.no evidence of acute aortic syndrome is seen.there are emphysematous changes of the lungs with an apical predominance.mild dependent atelectasis is present.no pneumothorax is identified.the airways are patent to the segmental level.the patient is status post coronary artery stenting and aortic valve replacement.a median sternotomy is seen.atherosclerotic plaque is seen within the descending aorta.the heart is mildly enlarged.no pericardial effusion is seen.limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate fatty infiltration of the pancreas.a simple-appearing cyst of the left kidney is partially imaged.additional vascular calcifications are also seen.no concerning osseous lesion is seen.a compression of mid thoracic vertebral body appears unchanged.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism to the segmental level.respiratory motion limits evaluation of subsegmental branches in the lower lobes.copd.aberrant (retroesophageal) course of the right subclavian artery, a known variant.

text: there is no pathologic axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are no pleural effusions.lung window images demonstrate minor atelectatic changes at both lung bases.there is a small 2 mm left upper lobe nodule located peripherally.there is no consolidation or pneumothorax.moderate centrilobular emphysema is seen throughout both lung fields.the bronchi are patent to the segmental level.ct angiogram demonstrates no evidence of pulmonary embolus or aortic dissection.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.images of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.soft tissues and osseous structures are normal.multiplanar reformatted images confirm the above findings.
summary: no aortic dissection or pulmonary embolus.minimal bibasilar atelectasis.small left upper lobe nodule.statistically this is benign.in the absence of history of malignancy, one-year followup may be considered.moderate copd.

text: compared to the previous study dated ___, there has been interval sternotomy and the previously noted bilateral upper lobe masses are no longer visualized.there is interval collapse and/or fibrosis of the medial aspects of both lungs.there is a new 15 mm right pleural effusion and a fluid density medial loculated effusion in the base of the right lung.a few aortopulmonary window nodes measuring up to 5 mm in short axis are present, as well as an 11 mm pre-carinal node, which is slightly increased from the previous study.a 7 mm pre-tracheal node is also slightly increased from the previous examination.a 16 x 7 mm right axial node is unchanged from the previous study.a 10 x 16 mm subcarinal node has slightly increased since the previous exam, as well.a 7 mm pre-aortic node is slightly larger than previously noted.no new nodes are present in the lungs.
summary: evidence of previous sternotomy and mediastinal radiation therapy.the previously noted bilateral upper lung masses are not seen on the current examination, no new lesions are seen.there are a few small lymph nodes present, not pathologically enlarged, but slightly larger than the previous examination.fibrosis and/or atelectasis involving the medial aspects of the bilateral lungs, with a 14-15 mm right effusion with partial loculation medially.interval placement of an inferior vena cava filter, with no evidence of metastatic disease involving the abdomen.no evidence of lymphadenopathy or masses involving the pelvis.atherosclerotic disease and degenerative disc disease, as described.

text: thyroid gland is normal in size without focal masses.there is no supraclavicular lymphadenopathy.there is again seen a left supraclavicular soft tissue mass which has a fiducial seed embedded in it.the amount of enhancement of this mass is decreased compared to the prior study and also the size if we compare at the same level.this mass measures 5.3 x 5.1 cm (2:2), compared to 5.8 x 5.8 cm.there is again seen marked mass effect on the left subclavian vein, however, which is not occluded.there are tiny lymph nodes in the mediastinum, stable, not enlarged by ct criteria.thoracic aorta and pulmonary artery are normal in caliber without evidence of aneurysmal dilatation, dissection or proximal thrombosis.there are small lymph nodes at the level of the left axilla, not significantly changed from the prior study.there are some collaterals within the left chest wall.there is no pleural effusion.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart is normal size.there is no pneumothorax.evaluation of the lung parenchyma demonstrates presence of small left upper lobe nodule which measures 4 mm, unchanged from the prior study (2:18).there are two right upper lobe nodules (2:19 and 2:24), stable compared to the prior study, subcentimeter in size.
summary: slightly smaller left supraclavicular metastasis, measuring 5.3 x 5.1 cm compared to 5.8 x 5.8 cm, with stable mass effect on the left subclavian vein.the vein is markedly narrowed and possibly infiltrated by the tumor, however, is still patent.stable tiny bilateral pulmonary nodules.interval placement of fiducial seeds within the pancreatic mass which is slightly larger compared to the prior study, measuring 3.8 x 3.6 cm compared to 3.4 x 3 cm.some of the changes may be secondary to edema post-cyberknife treatment.right inguinal node measuring 2 x 1.8 cm which is larger compared to the prior study and has lost its fatty hilum.this may be another area of metastatic focus versus reactive in nature.

text: there has been interval placement of a right-sided pigtail catheter, which is coiled within the posterolateral portion of the right pleural space resulting in near complete resolution of moderate right pleural effusion, with only a small component of simple pleural fluid remaining.small left pleural effusion has not significantly changed.there is persistent partial atelectasis of the right lower lobe, with no other focal airspace opacities identified.well-defined lobulated 10 x 12.5 mm right upper lobe nodule has slightly increased in size from ___ exam when it measured 8.5 x 11 mm.no other suspicious nodules are identified, although the exam was slightly limited by respiratory motion.no pathologically enlarged central or axillary lymph nodes are identified with stable appearance to atherosclerotic disease previously described and prominent pericardial recess adjacent to the ascending aorta.the right hemidiaphragm remains elevated.please note that this evaluation was not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.limited evaluation of the included upper abdomen displays post- surgical changes from prior right hepatic lobe resection and no significant interval change in multiple hypoattenuating hepatic lesions, consistent with patient's known metastatic disease when compared to ___ evaluation.known splenic lesion has also not significantly changed.right-sided adrenal nodularity is stable as is the thickened appearance of left adrenal gland.there is mild persistent pneumobilia and air within a decompressed gallbladder with slightly enhancing rim.fluid collection adjacent to the hepatic surgical bed with a drain in place does not appear significantly changed from ___ exam.a small focus of air is noted within the pericardial fat, likely related to recent chest tube placement.there is a biliary stent in place.
summary: interval placement of right-sided pigtail catheter, with significant reduction in right pleural effusion with minimal component now remaining.improved right lower lobe atelectasis.persistent small left pleural effusion.slight interval increase in size of right upper lobe nodule, likely representing metastatic disease.unchanged appearance of multiple hepatic and splenic lesions in addition to a small fluid collection adjacent to the hepatic resection bed.pneumobilia with biliary stent noted to be in place.

text: pulmonary arterial opacification is adequate on the post-contrast series and there is no evidence of pulmonary embolus.consolidations in both lung bases are due to a combination of pneumonia and/or aspiration.these, as well as low lung volumes, likely underestimate the degree of metastatic involvement of breast cancer, however, there is clear increase in lymphadenopathy in the right hilum, with a confluent node cluster measuring 2.2 x 2.3 cm (3:38) clearly increased.additional enlarged mediastinal nodes include a 1.3 cm node in the right infrahilar region insinuating along the right lower lobe superior segmental pulmonary artery (3:50).multiple prevascular and right upper paratracheal 7-8 mm nodes are slightly increased (3:24, 3:31).several right middle and lower lobe 4 mm nodules are not apparently changed in size, given mentioned study limitations.mild cardiomegaly is unchanged but increased septal thickening is diffuse; the latter is smooth in the lung apices but elsewhere difficult to characterize due to a combination of respiratory motion and low lung volumes.the partially imaged upper abdomen appears unremarkable, but soft tissues findings include a left breast nodule measuring 9 mm, increased since ___ (3:44).numerous levels of apparent metastatic involvement in the thoracic spine include t4, t6, t8, and t9, but appear unchanged since ___.
summary: no pulmonary embolus.progression of metastatic disease involving mediastinal and right hilar nodes.true extent of malignancy likely underestimated by low lung volumes and bibasilar consolidations, due to combination of aspiration and pneumonia.given septal thickening at least in part due to pulmonary edema, lymphangitic spread of carcinomatosis would be difficult to exclude.left breast nodule, though subcentimeter, is larger than in ___.

text: there is a 3.8 x 3.8 cm right thyroid mass which enhances heterogeneously.there is soft tissue hematoma within the right anterior chest wall as well as substernal.there is fluid surrounding the anterior portion of the aortic arch and extending into the superior pericardial recess.this fluid measures approximately 15 hounsfield units.there are small subcentimeter right paratracheal, prevascular, and precarinal lymph nodes.there is no pneumothorax.there is bibasilar atelectasis.there is atelectasis of the left lower lobe.there is thickening along the right minor fissure.there airways are patent to the level of the subsegmental bronchi bilaterally.there is atherosclerotic calcification of the ascending aorta, aortic arch, and descending aorta.there is no evidence of aortic dissection.
summary: acute rib fractures including right third, fourth, and fifth.there is surrounding hematoma.left lower lobe collapse/contusion.retrosternal hematoma and sternal fracture.small aortic hematoma around the aortic arch.small fluid in the superior pericardial recess.low attenuation within the right hepatic lobe.given the rounded appearance, this is less likely to be a contusion, although it is a consideration.right heterogeneous thyroid mass.

text: the heart and pericardium are unremarkable, without evidence of a pericardial effusion.there are a few scattered mediastinal nodes, with a prevascular node in the epicardial fat measuring up to 9 mm in short axis, right paratracheal node measuring 7 mm in short axis, and subcarinal node measuring 8 mm in short axis.additional mildly prominent hilar nodes are present bilaterally.the great vessels are within normal limits, without evidence of aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism.dependent atelectases are present within the lungs bilaterally.there is no evidence for pneumonia or pulmonary edema.no pleural effusion or pneumothorax is identified.a tracheostomy is present, as well as right central venous catheter line, with tip terminating in the cavoatrial junction.
summary: pancreatic pseudocysts, smaller in size from ___, but now containing high-attenuating material within the dominant pseudocyst.this may represent debris or intracystic hemorrhage.new fluid collection seen inferior to the hepatic flexure of the colon, suggestive of ongoing inflammation, as acute pancreatitis.secondary reactive changes involving the distal stomach, duodenum, as well as the hepatic flexure of the colon, with mild wall thickening, likely secondary to adjacent pancreatitis.stable mild intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.no evidence of pulmonary embolism or thoracic aortic dissection.dfddp

text: the visualized portion of the thyroid appears unremarkable.there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.multiple scattered lymph nodes are seen throughout the mediastinum, although none meet pathologic size criteria.the heart demonstrates calcified atherosclerotic disease of the coronary arteries.great vessels appear normal.there is no pericardial effusion.a small simple pleural effusion is noted on the right.innumerable pulmonary nodules are seen throughout both lungs, the largest of which is seen in the right upper lobe and measures 9 mm in diameter (3b; 36).many of the remaining nodules are new from prior study, and those that were seen on prior study have now increased slightly in size.
summary: status post trisegmentectomy, caudate resection, and cholecystectomy, now with two regions of peripheral hepatic arterial enhancement, concerning for hepatic metastasis.innumerable new and enlarged pulmonary nodules, consistent with pulmonary metastases.lytic lesions of the posterior elements of l4 vertebral body, right iliac bone, left acetabulum, concerning for bony metastases.l4 lesion partially impinges about the thecal sac (below the level of the spinal cord).new compression deformity involving t7.small right pleural effusion.these findings were posted to the critical results dashboard at 15:40 on ___ for direct communication to the requesting clinician.

text: there is a tiny subsegmental filling defect in the left lower lobe (3:46), consistent with a small pulmonary embolism.no aortic dissection or aneurysm.the heart is markedly enlarged and there is enlargement of the pulmonary artery which is associated with tortuosity of the subsegmental pulmonary arteries and distal tapering.there is also evidence of right heart strain with bowing of the intraventricular septum into the left ventricle and enlargement of the right atrium and right ventricle.a hemodialysis catheter passes through the right side of the heart with its tip in the distal ivc.no pericardial effusion.left upper and lower lobe atelectasis is noted, the lungs are otherwise clear.airways are widely patent to the subsegmental levels.in the limited views of the upper abdomen, the liver has a nodular outline consistent with cirrhosis and there is extensive intra-abdominal ascites.review of the bones does not reveal any destructive or sclerotic bone lesions.
summary: small left lower lobe subsegmental pulmonary embolism.pulmonary arterial hypertension with right heart strain manifested by enlargement of the right atrium and ventricle with bowing of the intraventricular septum into the left ventricle.contrast is also seen to reflux into the ivc and azygos.cirrhosis with diffuse intra-abdominal ascites.dr ___ ___ contact___

text: there is no intrathoracic lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the aorta and great arteries are unremarkable except for mild atherosclerosis.the patient is status post sternotomy with an artificial aortic valve present.lung windows demonstrate no nodules or consolidation.bone windows demonstrate no lytic or blastic lesions in the thoracic bony structures.
summary: no aortic aneurysm or dissection.cholelithiasis.mild atherosclerosis.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.there is no dissection.diffuse atherosclerotic calcification of the thoracic aorta is unchanged.left-sided pacemaker, and two intracardiac leads are unchanged in alignment.the central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.mediastinal and prevascular lymphadenopathy is again noted, with largest node again seen in the ap window, measuring 11 x 15 mm.there is slightly increased number of smaller nodes in the anterior prevascular space.there is also an 11-mm subcarinal lymph node (3, 33).coronary artery calcification is unchanged.the heart is enlarged.the thyroid appears unchanged, with stable enlargement and bilateral nodules, including a calcified nodule within the right.multiple thyroid nodules are not significantly changed.there are new small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right.notably, left pleural effusion has markedly decreased in size since radiographs obtained the same day at approximately 14:30 hours.there is also a small pericardial effusion, which is increased since prior ct.there is no pneumothorax.moderate apical predominant centrilobular emphysema is unchanged.azygous fissure in the right upper lobe is again noted.there is moderate left basilar consolidation.two scattered nodules in the right upper lobe and calcified nodule within the right middle lobe are unchanged from prior chest ct.bronchiectasis within the upper lobes bilaterally is also similar to prior study.limited views of the upper abdomen redemonstrate slight enlargement of the left adrenal gland, previously characterized as an adenoma.there is no fracture.degenerative changes in the thoracic spine are stable.chondroid lesion within the left proximal humerus is partially imaged, and may be an enchondroma or bone infarct.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right, with left lower lobe consolidation, possibly atelectasis, but an infectious process is not excluded.notably, the left effusion appears markedly decreased since prior radiographs.diffuse centrilobular emphysema.small pericardial effusion, increased since prior ct.unchanged atherosclerosis, and coronary artery calcification.unchanged thyroid nodules.dfddp

text: an et tube is in position.the central tracheobronchial tree is patent to the subsegmental level.there are bilateral nonhemorrhagic pleural effusions, moderate-to-large on the right and small on the left with associated compressive atelectasis and air bronchograms in both lower lobes.peripheral ground-glass opacities are present in the right upper and middle lobes.there is no evidence of hemothorax.several subpleural hematomas are noted posterior to the lungs bilaterally and localized to adjacent rib fractures.a right-sided central venous catheter is seen terminating in the svc.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.the aorta is normal in caliber with calcifications at the aortic arch.the great vessels are grossly patent.small mediastinal lymph nodes measuring up to 8 mm in short axis (2:27) are noted.a small 8 mm node is also noted in the left axilla.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are identified in the chest.there is a superior sternal fracture with associated hematoma anterior and posterior to the sternum measuring 5.4 x 1.4 cm posteriorly (2:24) 4.0 x 0.8 cm anteriorly (2:29).
summary: large amount of intraperitoneal free air suggests perforated viscus with highest concentration of localized extraluminal air at the gastric antrum suggesting possible site of perforation.two large hepatic cysts in the right and left lobe of the liver.no evidence of solid organ trauma within the abdomen.bilateral nonhemorrhagic pleural effusions, moderate-to-large on the right and small on the left with associated compressive atelectasis and air bronchograms which may obscure consolidation.no hemothorax.localized subpleural hematomas adjacent to rib fractures of posterior left fifth and right seventh, eighth and ninth ribs.sternal fracture with surrounding hematoma anterior and posterior to the superior sternum.fractures involving multiple vertebral bodies and posterior elements as detailed above without significant retropulsion of fracture fragments.findings were discussed by dr.___ ___ and dr.___ ___ with a member of the surgical team at 1:50 p.m.on ___.

text: there is no central pulmonary embolus.there is no pericardial effusion.great vessels are unremarkable.thyroid gland is unremarkable.no axillary or supraclavicular lymphadenopathy is noted.there is a subcarinal lymph node (2:30) measuring up to 13 mm.below the diaphragm, no gross abnormalities are noted.the right adrenal has 1 cm lesion, most likely is a lipoma.the left adrenal appears unremarkable.there are several heterogenous lesions of varying sizes with hypodense centers surrounded by hyperdense rims throughout the patient's thorax.the largest of these abuts the right pulmonary veins (2:38) and measures 3.3 x 6.4 x 3.2 cm.several additional lesions are seen including one along the right side of the sternum (2:35) as well as one in the prevascular space of the mediastinum (2:23).an additional one in the paraaortic area at about the level of t10 (2:50) and three distinct lesions above the liver (2:45).an additional lesion (2:51) is anterior along the ribs (2:51).there is moderate right-sided pleural effusion as well with several areas of nodular thickening and enhancement within the effusion (2:28).within the bones, there is at least one area of cortical destruction in the posterior ribs, 2:32, but additional areas are also concerning for desctruction (2:43).
summary: numerous heterogeneous masses in the patient's thorax, along with pleural effusion with nodules and cortical destruction, all concerning for metastatic disease with a lung primary.these nodules may be biopsiable via ultrasound or ct.consultation with the body radiology/interventional radiology service to further assess the accessibility for biopsy is appropriate.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ by dr.___ ___ at 2:30 p.m.via telephone on the day of the study.

text: there is no pneumothorax, no pericardial or pleural effusion and no mediastinal hematoma.there is bilateral dependent atelectasis.the airways are patent to the segmental levels bilaterally.the endotracheal tube terminates 3.3 cm above the carina.note is made of slight overinflation of the endotracheal tube cuff.
summary: no evidence of acute traumatic injury in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.nonacute fractures of the right lateral ribs and right scapula.slight over-inflation of endotracheal tube cuff.

text: there is no pneumomediastinum, mediastinal hemorrhage or pericardial effusion.there are moderate-to-severe atherosclerotic calcification of the thoracic aorta, mild calcifications of the coronary arteries, moderate-to-severe calcifications of the mitral annulus and the aortic valve.there is no pulmonary embolism.no acute aortic syndrome.there is a moderate right and a small left pleural effusion with bibasilar atelectasis.diffuse ground glass opacities likely reflect mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema.there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are scattered mediastinal lymph nodes measuring up to 8 mm (prevascular) (series 2, image 19), not meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.endotracheal tube ends in the right main stem bronchus.an ng tube is seen with the tip out of view.partially visualized upper abdomen demonstrates no acute pathology.
summary: no pulmonary embolus and no aortic dissection.moderate right and small left pleural effusion with bibasilar atelectasis.mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema.right mainstem bronchial intubation.

text: heterogeneity and asymmetry of the left thyroid lobe is stable when compared to the prior examination.there is no evidence of pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the lungs are clear.no pulmonary parenchymal consolidation or pulmonary nodules are seen.there is evidence of atelectasis within the dependent portions of both lungs.
summary: no evidence of adenopathy or extranodal masses within the chest, abdomen, and pelvis.cholelithiasis.perisplenic varices with a probable splenorenal shunt.1.7 cm splenic artery calcified aneurysm at the splenic hilum.diverticulosis.

text: a subcarinal node which measured 22 x 11 mm in axial dimensions is somewhat smaller than before, now measuring 14 x 9 mm.likewise, two left-sided subcentimeter hilar nodes are slightly less prominent than before.there are no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph nodes which are enlarged by ct size criteria.a left-sided picc line again terminates at the cavoatrial junction.there is no pericardial effusion.a very small right pleural effusion of low density is smaller than before.a trace left pleural effusion is also present.the major airways appear patent.a persistent low-density consolidation is present within the posterior right lower lobe, but the appearance is markedly improved since the prior study, and much of the central and anterior right lobe is now normally aerated.the right upper lobe is mostly clear with a few patchy peribronchovascular ground-glass opacities noted.in the left lung, again noted is an entirely unchanged well-circumscribed ground-glass opacity within the lingula of 21 x 18 mm in axial dimensions, which could represent inflammation but would be compatible with bronchoalveolar carcinoma.an even more suspicious irregular mass with spiculations in the more inferior lingula (series 3, image 35) is also entirely unchanged and measures 30 x 31 mm in axial dimensions.there is overall improved aeration of the right lower lobe with less extensive atelectasis.several patchy ground-glass opacities in the right upper lobe have also improved.however, there is a slightly more extensive mixed solid and ground-glass opacity along the major fissure near the right apex and considerably more extensive mixed glass and consolidative opacity in the superior segment of the left upper lobe.these regions represent the only area of worsening opacity in the lungs.there are two unchanged hypoattenuating foci in the liver which are too small to characterize, although their low density is suggestive of cysts.a suspicious lesion in the right kidney, noted previously, is not imaged on this study.there is again pneumobilia in the central bile ducts of the liver, which are not dilated.this appearance can be seen in the setting of prior sphincterotomy and is unchanged.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.
summary: improving right lower lobe consolidation and lymphadenopathy.improving left basilar atelectasis.stable suspicious mass in the lingula.a nearby area of well-marginated ground-glass opacity may be inflammatory or also raises suspicion for malignancy.the opacities are unchanged.new mixed patchy ground glass and consolidative opacity in the superior segment of the left lower lobe, which could be infectious, inflammatory or due to aspiration.no evidence of bony metastases, but several rib fractures, which are unchanged.pneumobilia, which could be seen in prior sphincterotomy.suspicious renal lesion not imaged.
