text: 4 mm right thyroid lobe hypodense nodule is unchanged.axillary, supraclavicular, mediastinal, and hilar lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.the great vessels are normal caliber.the brachiocephalic artery and the left common carotid artery have a common trunk.the heart size is normal.the pericardium is intact without effusion.small amount of dependent secretion is present within the lower trachea (2:27).the airways are otherwise patent to subsegmental levels.centrilobular and paraseptal emphysema is severe in the upper zones and mild elsewhere.no new pulmonary nodule.no pleural effusion, focal consolidation, or pneumothorax.the patient is status post esophagectomy with gastric pull through.the intra thoracic anastomosis appears intact without extraluminal fluid or air.the lumen of the neo esophagus is incompletely evaluated without administration of oral contrast.no gross soft tissue mass is visualized.the appearance of the pericardial fat buttress is similar to prior.3.0 cm left renal hypodensity is unchanged and consistent with a simple renal cyst.several subcentimeter right renal hypodensities are too small to characterize.
summary: status post esophagectomy with gastric pull through.no evidence of recurrent or metastatic thoracic malignancy.intrathoracic anastomosis appears intact and no new soft tissue mass is visualized, although ct evaluation of the neoesophagus lumen is incomplete without oral contrast.small amount of secretion within the lower trachea, similar to prior.severe upper zone predominant centrilobular and paraseptal emphysema.

text: there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are no pleural effusions.multiple nodules are identified in both lungs.a nodule in the left upper lobe has decreased in size, previously measuring 9 mm, currently measuring 5 mm.a nodule in the right upper lobe is stable, currently measuring 11 mm, previously 12 mm.a nodule in the left upper lobe is decreased in size, currently measuring 1.1 x 0.8 cm (previously 1.3 x 1.0 cm).another nodule in the left upper lobe is also decreased, currently measuring 4 mm (previously 7 mm).additional nodules bilaterally are decreased in size and density.a nodule in the left lower lobe (___ 27, currently measures 1.0 cm in largest dimension, previously 1.1 cm).additional nodules in the right lung are decreased in size, a nodule in the right middle lobe currently measures 1.2 x 1.0 cm and previously measured 1.7 x 1.6 cm.no new lesions are seen.there is no consolidation.
summary: decrease in size of multiple lung nodules consistent with improvement of metastatic disease.stable hepatic hypodensities are too small to characterize, but likely represent cysts.no evidence of new lesions.stenosis of the celiac trunk, unchanged.

text: there is a partially visualized left scapular fracture involving the acromion.there are multiple minimally displaced left rib fractures involving the posterolateral aspect of left third, fourth, fifth ribs.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.there are bibasilar dependent atelectasis.there are no focal consolidations.emphysematous changes are noted in the lung apices.tracheobronchial tree is patent to subsegmental levels.there is prominence of the main pulmonary artery trunk and may relate to pulmonary hypertension, given emphysema.there is no evidence of mediastinal hemorrhage or aortic pseudoaneurysm or other segment of vascular injury.atherosclerotic aortic arch calcifications are incidentally noted.heart size is mildly enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.there is no mediastinal, hilar or axillary adenopathy.small amount of fluid is noted in the pericardial recess.limited evaluation of the imaged upper abdomen demonstrates a low-attenuation right hepatic lobe lesion measuring 2.2 x 2.8 cm, a simple cyst or hemangioma.cholelithiasis is noted without cholecystitis.the spleen demonstrates heterogeneous enhancement due to phase of imaging.the imaged portion of the bowel loops and pancreas is unremarkable.both adrenals are normal.a partially imaged right renal interpolar region low-attenuation lesion, possibly a cyst is noted, measuring 1.1 cm.
summary: multiple left-sided rib fractures and a partially imaged left acromion fracture.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.right hepatic lobe lobulated hypodensity, either a cyst or hemangioma.partially imaged right kidney interpolar hypodensity, likely a simple cyst.emphysema and enlargement of the main pulmonary artery suggestive of underlying pulmonary arterial hypertension.

text: there is a saddle embolus involving the bifurcation of the main pulmonary artery as well as extensive clot in the right and left main pulmonary arteries.there is near complete occlusion of the majority of segmental left lower lobe arteries with thrombus.non-occlusive thrombus is seen in left upper lobe segmental arteries.thrombus extends into the proximal portion of the ascending and descending branches of the right main pulmonary artery.more distally, the right segmental and subsegmental arteries appear clear of thrombus aside from scattered subsegmental non-occlusive thrombi in the right lower lobe.there is evidence of right heart strain with enlargement of the right ventricle and loss of the normal right convex configuration of the interventricular septum.aside from subsegmental dependent atelectasis, the lungs are clear.there is no evidence of pulmonary infarction.tiny bilateral pleural effusions are seen.the imaged portions of the great vessels are unremarkable.this study was not optimized for evaluation of the abdominal organs.the visualized portion of the abdomen is unremarkable, however.
summary: saddle embolus involving the bifurcation of the main pulmonary artery and with extensive clot burden in the left lung, specifically involving the left lower lobe segmental and subsegmental arteries.extensive thrombus is also present in the ascending and descending portions of the right pulmonary artery.scattered bilateral segmental and subsegmental thrombi are present.evidence of right heart strain with enlargement of the right ventricle and loss of the normal right convex configuration of the interventricular septum.no evidence of pulmonary infarction.these findings were reported to ___ ___ at 9:30 a.m.via telephone on the day of the study.

text: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are within normal limits.there is no evidence of axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymph node enlargement.there is no evidence of pulmonary parenchymal consolidation.there are innumerable subcentimeter pulmonary nodules within both lungs (right more than left).some of these lesions in the lung bases are new when compared to the imaged portions of the lung bases on previous scans.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.interval appearance of innumerable pulmonary nodules and possible new liver lesions.(please note that this was not a dedicated liver examination, which limits evaluation for hepatic lesions.) there is also new biliary ductal dilation, no cause for which is definitively identified, but the pancreatic head is close to the site of recent surgical resection.small fluid collection adjacent to the right common iliac artery that is likely post surgical in nature.left common iliac ___ thrombus,(an expected finding given the patients ivc resection.)

text: there is neither axillary nor hilar lymphadenopathy.a single ap window lymph node is again identified and measures 8 x 12 mm.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.post radiation changes are identified medially within the right upper and medial lobes.this is not significantly changed from previous exam.although described on a prior report, no right hilar masses are well visualized on this study.there are no pulmonary or parenchymal nodules.there are no consolidations.there are no pleural effusions.no chest wall masses are identified.
summary: significant interval increase in retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.a lesion previously identified within the left adrenal gland is now identified separately as an enlarged retroperitoneal lymph node.no significant change in thorax.extensive radiation changes to the right lung.

text: there is lymphadenopathy in the right supraclavicular region and in the mediastinum.this has decreased in comparison to the prior study.a nodule in the precarinal region measures 1.5 x 1.9 cm.on the prior study this measured 2.7 x 3.2 cm.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is bilateral hilar adenopathy, left greater than right, which is also improved in the interval.the prior seen left hilar mass has decreased in size.there is decreased compressive effect on the main left upper lobe bronchus and segmental branches.post obstructive changes in the left upper lobe are present but have significantly improved in the interval.there are scattered subcentimeter bilateral pulmonary nodules.one in the left lower lobe was not seen on the prior study.multiple new subcentimeter nodules are present in the right upper lobe.bibasilar atelectasis is present.there is soft tissue thickening of the right upper chest wall with destruction of the lateral aspect of the second rib.this is new since the prior study.the chest wall soft tissue density measures up to 3 cm in thickness.rounded lytic foci are present within t11 and l1.these are suspicious for metastatic foci.several rounded low attenuation lesions are present within the liver.these are not fully characterized on this study.the visualized portions of the liver are unremarkable.there are multiple gallstones within the gallbladder.the adrenals are normal.in the mid portion of the right kidney there is a section of discontinuous cortex measuring approximately 1 cm.this is difficult to characterize.there is a 1.1 cm simple cyst within the mid portion of the right kidney.multiple punctate calcifications are present within the pancreas.there are several cystic lesions within the body of the pancreas.the largest measures 1.5 x 0.9 cm.it is unclear whether these connect with the pancreatic duct.there is no ductal dilatation.
summary: interval mixed response with decrease in size of mediastinal lymphadenopathy and hilar masses, but with new pulmonary nodules and new right upper chest wall soft tissue lesion.lytic lesions within the lower thoracic/upper lumbar spine, suspicious for metastatic disease.cholelithiasis.low attenuation splenic lesions.these are incompletely characterized on this study.cystic pancreatic lesions.given the presence of punctate calcifications in the pancreas which suggest chronic pancreatitis, these lesions may represent pancreatic pseudocysts.ipmt vs.other mucinous neoplasm is possible.further characterization with pancreatic cta is recommended.focal right kidney cortical defect likely representing an area of scarring.

text: the pulmonary arterial trunk is normal in caliber with no filling defects.the pulmonary arterial tree is patent and well opacified to the segmental level.the aorta is normal in caliber throughout its course without evidence of intramural hematoma or acute aortic syndrome.minimal calcified atherosclerosis of the thoracic aorta is noted.the heart is slightly enlarged, without pleural effusion.diffuse calcified atherosclerosis of the coronary arteries is seen with calcification of the aortic valve.multiple surgical clips are consistent with prior cabg.the thyroid is unremarkable.there is no axillary or supraclavicular lymphadenopathy.small mediastinal lymph nodes are seen, but none are pathologically enlarged by ct size criteria.the esophagus is normal.the trachea and airways are patent to the subsegmental level.innumerable pulmonary nodules and masses are scattered throughout the lungs, which appear increased in size and number from the prior pet-ct from ___.the largest pulmonary mass measures 3.1 x 2.4 cm (2:30) in the left lower lobe.a lesion in the left lateral mediastinum adjacent to the left lingula (2:25) and closely approximates the coronary bypass graft traversing towards the left circumflex and may represent a pulmonary mass but a thrombosed aneurysm of the coronary artery bypass graft cannot be completely excluded on this non-gated exam.atelectatic changes are seen in the dependent portions of the lungs posteriorly.there are no pleural effusions, pneumothoraces or focal consolidations.although this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, the visualized portions of the liver, spleen, stomach, bilateral adrenal glands and pancreas are unremarkable.multiple vascular calcifications are noted.
summary: no pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.innumerable pulmonary nodules and masses increased in size and number from the prior pet-ct on ___ are consistent with progressive metastatic disease.the largest pulmonary mass measures 3.1 x 2.4 cm in the left lower lobe.a lesion seen in the left lateral mediastinum adjacent to the left lingula is intimately associated with a coronary bypass graft, coursing towards the left circumflex artery.this may represent a metastasis or, alternatively, raises the possibility of a thrombosed coronary bypass graft aneurysm.this may be further assessed with a dedicated gated cardiac ct or mri.

text: ct chest with iv contrast.there is a dense consolidation occupying much of the right upper lobe with associated air bronchograms consistent with lobar pneumonia.there are additional scattered areas of opacification bilaterally that likely represent multiple additional foci of pneumonia.there is left basilar atelectasis as well as bilateral pleural effusions that are moderate in volume with right greater than left.pleural effusions layering posteriorly.there are multiple mediastinal lymph nodes primarily as well as right paratracheal and precarinal.the largest of these lymph nodes is right paratracheal and it measures 10.3 x 8.1 mm.this is nonspecific and can be seen can be seen in infectious inflammatory conditions.the thyroid gland is of heterogeneous attenuation particularly the right lobe with an exophytic component that is of low density that extends posterior to the thyroid gland that likely represents a thyroid goiter.there is calcification throughout the aorta.patient is status post sternotomy.there are multilevel degenerative changes of the vertebrae.
summary: findings consistent with multilobar pneumonia with predominant consolidation involving the right upper lobe.thyroid heterogeneously enlarged right lobe of thyroid likely represents thyroid goiter with extension posterior to the trachea.mediastinal lymphadenopathy likely reactive nature.moderate bilateral pleural effusions right greater than left.

text: there is an 11-mm left axillary lymph node.there are coronary artery calcifications.pericardium is unremarkable.there are mild emphysematous changes of the lungs.there is a 4-mm nodule in the right upper lobe (series 3, image 21).there is dependent atelectasis.airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is mural calcification of the aorta.

text: soft tissue windows confirm the presence of a moderate to large right-sided pleural effusion which is partially loculated.densely irregular and enhancing portions of the effusion inferiorly are consistent with metastatic studding of the pleural space.no left-sided pleural effusion is seen.there is a soft tissue mass medially within the left hemithorax at the t6/7 level which corresponds to the metastatic disease seen at this location on the recent thoracic mri.there are numerous enlarged lymph nodes seen, particularly in the left pericardial and right supradiaphragmatic regions.also seen, are numerous nodules within the subcutaneous tissues in keeping with metastastic deposits.a mass in the right-sided paraspinus muscles along the lower cervical spine is again seen, as described on the mri.evaluation of lung windows shows bilateral pleural and pulmonary nodules, all in keeping with diffuse metastases.there is collapse of the right lower lobe which appears to be secondary to compression by the adjacent effusion, as the right lower lobe bronchus appears patent.images through the upper abdomen again reveal diffuse metastatic disease in the liver.there is a mass in the left adrenal gland.a mass in the region of the right adrenal gland may represent metastases or recurrence of tumor in the post-surgical bed.small nodules are seen in the posterior pararenal space on the left.there is also extensive soft tissue thickening in the previous surgical bed on the right and the hepatic flexure of the colon in this region may also be involved by metastatic disease, as there is nodular thickening seen just along its posterior wall.evaluation of the osseous structures shows diffuse metastatic disease,as described on the prior mr.pathological fractures are seen.one metastases to the left 5th rib anteriorly demonstrates a large soft tissue component.the metastases involving the spine have been shown to encase the cord on the prior mri.
summary: diffuse metastatic disease in the thorax and upper abdomen.the metastatic disease includes right pleural studding with a moderate pleural effusion resulting in right lower lobe collapse, numerous pulmonary and pleural metastatic nodules.numerous soft tissue masses, many of which were described on the patient's prior mri.extensive osseous metastases have also been described, with known encasement of thoracic cord.marked burden of disease in the upper abdomen includes numerous vary large hepatic metastases, a left adrenal metastases, a right adrenal metastases vs local recurrent disease, and soft tissue thickening in the post-surgical bed which is currently occupied by the hepatic flexure of the colon.

text: coalescent fibrosis with bronchiectasis at both lung apices is stable since ___, could be the residua of radiation or tuberculosis.there is no evidence of active tuberculosis.small lung nodules in portions of the lungs not previously imaged are of indeterminate age, including 4-mm right upper lobe nodule, 4:97, a cluster of five nodules 2 to 6 mm wide in the lateral basal segment of the right lower lobe, 4:130-136, a 6 mm subpleural nodule right lower lobe, 4:173 and 4:181, a 6-mm right lower lobe nodule posterior basal segment, 4:168, a 5 mm subpleural left lower lobe nodule, 4:167.mild ground-glass opacification at the left lung base could be due to aspiration or atelectasis and there is minimal dilatation of subsegmental segments in both lower lobes but no appreciable bronchial wall thickening and no retained bronchial secretions.as it was in ___ the upper esophagus is distended with air above the subcarinal level where there may be mild periesophageal wall thickening; more superiorly the esophageal wall is normal caliber.mild gaseous distension of the lower esophagus is also present.subcentimeter lymph nodes are found in both hila, and right paraesophageal lymph nodes may be as large as 11 mm, but lymph nodes elsewhere in the mediastinum are not pathologically enlarged.small amounts of filamentous secretions are present in both the trachea and at the origin of the left upper lobe bronchus.there is no endobronchial lesion.emphysema is moderate-to-severe in the extreme lung apices, mild or minimal elsewhere.pulmonary arteries are not enlarged but there is mild posterior bowing of the inferior portion of the interventricular septum which is sometimes an indication of right ventricular pressure elevation or early decompensation, although there are no other signs of elevated right heart pressure.

text: mild paraseptal and centrilobular emphysema is compatible with history of smoking.multifocal small patchy ground-glass opacities are noted with upper lobes predominance, non-specific, but could represent infection or inflammation.there is no focal airspace consolidation, pneumothorax or pleural effusion.dependent bibasilar atelectasis is mild.there is no suspicious pulmonary nodule or mass.the esophagus appears normally collapsed without ct evidence of pathology.the central tracheobronchial tree is patent.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.scattered coronary calcifications are noted.the aorta is normal in size and caliber without acute aortic pathology.there is an aberrant right subclavian artery with an independent origin at the distal aortic arch (image 3:17).the remaining great mediastinal vessels are normal.a borderline enlarged mediastinal lymph node measures 10 mm in the precarinal station (image 3:25).a right hilar lymph node measures 9mm (image 400:27), not pathologically enlarged by ct criteria.there is no axillary or left hilar lymphadenopathy.

text: comparison made with a ct dated ___ and ___.the right apical 9 x 6-mm lesion is unchanged in size and appearance.bilateral apical smooth septal thickening has progressed since the previous ct and now involves both upper lobes (4:64).the small left pleural effusion and left lower lobe linear atelectasis are stable.one focus of linear atelectasis in the posterior basal segment of the left lower lobe (4:125) now has a more nodular appearance measuring 9 x 10 mm.extensive mediastinal adenopathy has decreased in size, a right paratracheal node now measures 16 x 22 mm (2:18) compared to 14 x 24 mm; the largest subcarinal node now measures 23 x 14 mm (2:28) compared to 26 x 13 mm.the small pericardial effusion is smaller.the spinal fixation device in the lower thoracic spine is unchanged in position.lytic lesions in the body of the sternum (4:43), and upper thoracic spine have increased in number and size, the largest lesion in the middle column of t6 abuts the posterior wall of the vertebral body (401b:35)and a lytic lesion thins the cortex of the right pedicle of t9 (401b:31), with no evidence of fracture.this study is not tailored for evaluation of the abdomen but shows a new large non hemorrhagic lesion in the upper pole of the spleen, probably an infarct, normal appearing adrenal glands and moderately severe hepatic steatosis.

text: compared to the prior study, there are two areas of contour abnormality in the ascending aorta concerning for pseudoaneurysm.the larger of these is located anteriorly at the distal aspect of the ascending aorta at the level of the manubrium.there is a bilobed pseudoaneurysm at this location measuring approximately 1.7 cm across its base.the anterior aspect of the pseudoaneurysm appears to abut the manubrium.more inferiorly and just above the aortic valve there is a smaller outpouching from the aorta measuring approximately 1 cm oriented anterolaterally.the great vessels to the neck are patent.there is no interval change in nonenhancing relatively high attenuation material in the retrosternal region as well as about the aortic root within the pericardial sac.there is a collection that appears dense (___ units of 51) located anterior to the manubrium and anterior to the level of the larger pseudoaneurysm that measures 3.0 x 3.3 x 5.6 cm.in the prior study, there were two circumscribed collections in the suprasternal notch region which were different in size and location than the present collection.while this study is not optimized for detection of aortic dissection, there is no evidence of dissection seen.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy, though multiple small lymph nodes are again noted in the prevascular space and right paratracheal region.the central bronchi are patent.small nodular densities are again seen at the posterior aspects of the lung apices bilaterally (series 7 image 35 and 36).the nodule in the right lung appears slightly more prominent than before.there is stable scarring at the left lung base.there are no consolidations or pleural effusions.the organs of the upper abdomen are incompletely visualized.no gross abnormalities are detected.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions.scoliosis of the thoracic spine is present.

text: there is no bony fusion of the sternum nine weeks after sternotomy, the sternotomy fragments are either separated or overriding, and the incised margins are not sclerotic and at some levels deminineralized.there is a superficial soft tissue ulcer adjacent to the lower sternum.there is a faint track extending from the soft tissue ulcer to the sternum (2:34).no foreign body material is present.there is particular osteolysis of the incised surfaces of the sternum at the level of the soft tissue ulcer with no evidence of sclerosis or healing of the sternum locally.at the level of mid body of the sternum, is another discrete focus of lysis.in the manubrium, a third focus of osteolysis is adjacent to a small soft tissue hematoma.inferior to that, where the sternal cortex is intact, are two small pockets of retrosternal fluid (2:9, 16).multiple non-pathologically enlarged central nodes are noted.the patient is status post aortic valve replacement.severe calcifications of the mitral annulus, coronary arteries and descending thoracic aorta and aortic arch are visualized.mild scarring is noted at the right lung base.atelectasis at the left lung base is mild.no pulmonary nodule, parenchymal opacification, or pleural effusion is visualized.the visualized part of the upper abdomen including the liver, gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, superior pole of the kidneys, and pancreas appear unremarkable.there is a 2-cm tubular catheter fragment in one of the distal branches of the left basilar pulmonary artery, best seen on (401:43) and is unchanged since ___.___ windows: other than multiple foci lysis described in the body of the report, there is also evidence of fracture at the mid body of the sternum (400b:36).

text: ct of the chest: there are extensive areas of nodular and ground-glass density within the left lung, consistent with extensive pulmonary hemorrhagic contusion.multiple pneumatoceles are also noted in the left lower lobe with air-fluid levels.areas of ground-glass opacity within the right lower lobe are also seen and may represent contusion versus aspiration.intrathoracic vascular structures appear intact.there is a small area of soft tissue density within the anterior mediastinum.however, there is a clear fat plane between the soft tissue density and the aorta and this is likely due to residual thymus in a patient of this age.heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.there are no pleural effusions.there is no pneumothorax or pneumomediastinum.
summary: shattered spleen extending to the hilum, consistent with grade v splenic injury with surrounding small amount of hemoperitoneum which is also seen within the right and left paracolic gutters.extensive pulmonary contusion of the left lung with multiple pneumatoceles.areas of ground-glass density within the right lower lobe, which may also represent contusion versus aspiration.large distended fluid-filled stomach for which ng tube placement is recommended.left clavicular and left scapular fracture.findings were discussed with the trauma surgical team including dr.___ at the time of review on ___.

text: a large round low-attenuation lingular mass is identified measuring 3.4 x 3.0 cm (4, 128).bulky left hilar lymphadenopathy is present adjacent to the lingular mass, with conglomerate nodes measuring up to 2.3 x 2 cm (122, 4).both the lingular mass and the left hilar nodes have a predominantly low attenuation appearance.the left hilar nodes results in displacement and narrowing of the lingular bronchus as well as the left lower lobe bronchus distal to the superior segment takeoff.assessment of the remainder of the lungs is somewhat limited due to motion artifact, but no additional nodules or masses are identified.mild centrilobular emphysema is demonstrated as well as nonspecific areas of subsegmental atelectasis within the lower lobes, middle lobe and lingula.no suspicious endobronchial lesions are identified.thyroid gland appears heterogeneous with multiple low-attenuation foci and mild enlargement of the right and left lobes.borderline 8-mm enhancing lower left paratracheal lymph node is noted.small subcentimeter right hilar nodes are also evident.the heart size is normal.no pericardial or pleural effusion is present.although the examination was not specifically tailored to evaluate the subdiaphragmatic region, no suspicious abnormalities are identified to suggest metastatic disease.however, incomplete imaging and single phase of contrast administration limit assessment and reduce sensitivity for detecting metastatic disease.skeletal structures demonstrate no suspicious lytic or blastic skeletal lesions.
summary: lingular mass with adjacent bulky left hilar lymphadenopathy, highly suspicious for bronchogenic carcinoma in this patient with history of presumed brain metastases.as the lingular bronchus courses directly to the mass, bronchoscopic biopsy should have a high diagnostic yield.if warranted clinically, whole-body pet- ct imaging could be performed for complete staging purposes.as the mass is apparently necrotic, pet may also be helpful to direct biopsy to the metabolically active component of the mass.

text: pre-contrast images of the thorax demonstrate no dense intramural hematoma within the aorta.a central venous catheter is present with its tip in the svc.the patient is status post aortic valve replacement.post-contrast images demonstrate no intrathoracic lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the main pulmonary artery is mildly dilated measuring 2.9 cm.lung windows demonstrate no nodules or consolidation.increased linear opacities at the bases are most consistent with subsegmental atelectasis.the airways are clear.images of the upper abdomen demonstrate mild central biliary dilatation.
summary: no pulmonary embolism to the level of the subsegmental pulmonary arteries.no pneumonia.mild central biliary dilatation is noted on limited views of the upper abdomen.correlate with bilirubin levels.

text: no pulmonary emboli are identified.again seen is bilateral axillary lymphadenopathy, not significantly changed from the prior study.there are surgical clips seen in the lower neck.there are multiple regions of ground glass opacity with focal consolidations in the right lung that are most likely of an infectious nature, however, these have decreased compared to the prior study.again seen is a right apical nodule at the periphery measuring 3 mm in diameter, not significantly changed from the prior study.there are prominent right hilar nodes.
summary: no pulmonary embolus.prominent right hilar nodes.

text: there is dependent subsegmental atelectasis, but the lungs are otherwise clear, without nodule, mass or pleural effusion.there is no pneumothorax.the aorta is of normal caliber, without evidence of acute injury.the heart is normal without pericardial effusion.endotracheal and enteric tubes are noted in situ.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.

text: opacification of the pulmonary vasculature demonstrates no filling defects to suggest a pulmonary embolus.the aorta and great vessels are within normal limits.the heart is enlarged.bilateral pleural effusions are visualized and are small to moderate in size, greater on the right than the left, with adjacent airspace opacities.there are mild bilateral perihilar ground glass opacities which may represent mild pulmonary edema.otherwise, there is no evidence of distinct consolidations in the lungs.multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes are visualized, likely reactive in nature and stable in comparison to prior study.this study is not tailored for evaluation of subdiaphragmatic structures, and the visualized portions of the dome of the liver and stomach are within normal limits.

text: there is a new soft tissue mass adjacent to the esophagus, measuring 2.7 x 2.2 cm.no other pathologically enlarged thoracic lymph nodes are identified.there are coronary artery calcifications.otherwise, the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.lung windows demonstrate post-surgical changes in the left lung, without nodule on the left.minimal atelectasis is noted at the right lung base.there is a vague 4 mm ground-glass nodule in the right upper lobe near the fissure seen on image 40 of series 2, and a punctate nodule is seen on image 30 of series 2.these are indeterminate, but may be infectious or inflammatory.the central airways are patent, without endobronchial lesions.
summary: new pathologically enlarged lymph node adjacent to the left aspect of the esophagus, highly concerning for metastatic disease.subcentimeter right upper lobe nodules are indeterminate, but may be infectious or inflammatory.findings were entered into the critical results dashboard at 9:06 a.m.on ___.

text: the thyroid gland appears within normal limits without focal lesion identified.no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar adenopathy is present.no dissection flap is present within the thoracic aorta.no filling defects in the pulmonary arteries, although this study was not optimized to evaluate for this finding.coronary artery calcifications of the proximal left coronary artery noted.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the major airways are patent down to the subsegmental level.no concerning nodule, opacity, or effusions are present within the lung parenchyma.

text: the heart size is normal.the great vessels are unremarkable.there is no significant mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial effusion.the central airways are patent to the segmental bronchi.diffuse background emphysema is present.postoperative changes in the right apex are again noted.pleural thickening is present on the right.a subpleural calcified nodule is again noted at the superior segment of the right lower lobe.linear scarring or atelectasis is noted in the right lung base.there is no focal lung consolidation.a loculated hydropneumothorax measures 6.3 x 2.3 cm in the axial plane.comparing the scout image of this examination with the most recent chest radiographs, the overall size of this hydropneumothorax is unchanged.the walls of this collection remains thin, and there is no exuberant surrounding inflammatory reaction.small amounts of subcutaneous air are noted, significantly decreased since the most recent radiographs.this air is more pronounced on the right than the left and extends inferiorly at least as far as the iliac crest.in the limited imaging of the upper abdomen, no focal hepatic or adrenal lesion is seen.a probable cyst is present in the right kidney, but its attenuation values are slightly greater than expected for a simple cyst.

text: the heart is enlarged, with coronary artery calcifications.there is no pericardial effusion.atherosclerotic calcifications of the aortic arch are seen.otherwise, the great vessels are unremarkable without pulmonary embolism.there are enlarged mediastinal nodes, with the largest in the right paratracheal region measuring approximately 1.8 cm in short axis dimensions.additionally, a few mildly enlarged hilar nodes are seen.within the lungs, patchy areas of ground-glass opacities involving both upper lobes are present.these were present on chest radiographs from ___, but are new from ___ allwoing for differences in modality.additionally, a small left pleural effusion is present, with generalized anasarca.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.limited views of the upper abdomen reveal gallstones.the liver is nodular, suggestive of cirrhosis.there is a small amount of perihepatic ascites.a coarse calcified nodule is located adjacent to the liver near the hepatic dome, could represent a calcified lymph node.the spleen also appears to be enlarged, with a punctate area of calcification seen, likely reflecting a calcified granuloma.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.patchy bilateral airspace opacities, likely infectious or inflammatory.bulky mediastinal lymph nodes, may be reactive in nature.cardiomegaly, with a small left pleural effusion.nodular liver, with a small amount of perihepatic ascites, suggestive of underlying cirrhosis.

text: the patient is status post combined right upper and right middle lobe resections, with similar postoperative appearance at the resection site.previously reported tree-in-___ opacities within the right lower lobe posteriorly have resolved, but there are new endoluminal opacities within the right lower lobe airways posteriorly extending from a segmental to the subsegmental level (images 105 through 141 of series 4).additionally, a new nondependent endoluminal polypoid opacity is seen more centrally in the left lower lobe bronchus on image 109 of series 4 measuring about 2 mm in diameter.retained secretions are also present in the nondependent portion of the right main bronchus with small gas bubbles, best visualized on image 96 of the same series.upper lobe predominant emphysema and nonspecific biapical micronodules appear unchanged.a 2 mm perifissural nodule in the left lower lobe (103, series 4) is also without change.subcentimeter mediastinal lymph nodes show no interval increase in size since the prior study.right pleural effusion has decreased in size with only a small residual pleural effusion remaining.there is no left effusion.exam was not specifically tailored to evaluate the subdiaphragmatic region, but appearance of the adrenal glands and remaining imaged upper abdomen is unchanged since the previous examination.postoperative changes are seen in the right hemithorax consistent with prior thoracotomy.bilateral calcified implants are present in the breasts.
summary: no ct evidence of local recurrence following right upper and right middle lobe resections.central airway secretions and new impaction of right lower lobe bronchi posteriorly.this is most likely due to inflammatory or infectious secretions, but attention to this area on followup ct would be helpful to ensure resolution and to exclude any fixed endobronchial abnormality.

text: the lung windows again demonstrate the two focal regions of slight nodularity along the peripheral aspect of the right major fissure.there is also a region of linear scarring in the left lung base.these are all unchanged from the prior study.there are no new focal opacities.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.the soft tissue windows demonstrate an unremarkable heart, pericardium and great vessels.again seen is the vague ill defined filling defects within the segmental lower lobe pulmonary arteries, which are not grossly changed.there is minimal linear filling defects within the interlobar pulmonary arteries supplying the right middle and lower lobes.no new filling defects are identified.there are no pleural effusions.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: minimal residual filling defect in the interlobar portion of the right pulmonary artery supplying the middle and lower lobes, which is grossly unchanged.minimal ill defined filling defects in the subsegmental pulmonary artery supplying the left lower lobe, which is also stable in appearance.there are no new emboli.there is no evidence of an av malformation.unchanged regions of pulmonary scarring, without evidence of new focal pulmonary opacities or effusions.

text: the quality of vascular opacification allows to exclude the presence of acute pulmonary embolism in the central and lobar arteries.there is no indirect sign for pe.no ___ hump or other peripheral opacities, no pleural effusions and no evidence of right heart strain is visualized.in both lungs, left more than right, both central and peripheral areas of opacities are seen.these opacities are ill-defined and show obvious air bronchograms.the appearance of these opacities is nonspecific and could represent areas of hemorrhage or contusion.otherwise, the lung parenchyma appears unremarkable, but its assessment is clearly limited by severe motion artifacts.in the displayed parts of the upper abdomen, there is no evidence for pathology, except for small hiatal hernia.no evidence of hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.minimal paratracheal calcification (3, 7).no evidence of supraclavicular, infraclavicular, or axillary lymphadenopathy.no evidence of rib fractures.however, a known left clavicular fracture is visualized.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.uncharacteristic bilateral and relatively extensive parenchymal opacities, potentially representing hemorrhage or contusion.no pleural effusions, no evidence of major vascular trauma.displaced known left clavicular fracture.

text: there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes within the mediastinum, hila, or axilla.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there are no appreciable pulmonary nodules although evaluation is limited due to respiratory motion.there is atelectasis within the lower lobes bilaterally, obscuring detailed evaluation of the pulmonary vasculature.again demonstrated is diffuse hypoattenuation of the liver consistent with fatty replacement.no focal liver lesions are identified.the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and left kidney are unremarkable.the right kidney contains a stable cyst in the interpolar region.the small and large bowel are unremarkable.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.an ivc filter is present below the level of the renal veins.
summary: unchanged innumerable diffuse osseous metastases with stable appearance of t9 compression fracture.diffuse fatty replacement of the liver.status post prostatectomy and pelvic lymph node dissection.sesha

text: there are no filling defects present within the pulmonary arterial vasculature consistent with pulmonary embolism.the pulmonary artery is normal in size.the heart is moderately enlarged in size.calcification of the left anterior descending and left circumflex arteries is noted.calcification and atherosclerotic disease of the thoracic aorta is also noted.atherosclerotic ulcers of the aortic arch are unchanged.there is no pericardial effusion.several, subcentimeter calcified mediastinal lymph nodes are noted but unchanged compared to the most recent previous examination.no pathologic hilar, mediastinal, or axillary lymph nodes are present.scattered tree-in-___ opacities involving the lingula, right upper lobe and right middle lobe are again appreciated and relatively unchanged in appearance or distribution compared to ___.no focal areas of consolidation are noted.there is no pleural effusion.bilateral thyroid nodules with rim calcification are again noted.the largest is located within the right lobe of the thyroid and measures 2 cm in diameter (4:3).measurements are similar to the previous examination of ___.a low-attenuation lesion of the right adrenal gland measuring 3.7 x 3.1 cm has increased in size compared to previous measurements of 2.5 x 1.8 cm demonstrated on a ct of ___.the apparent attenuation has also increased in hounsfield units of 5 compared to 24 on today's evaluation (4:101).this area demonstrates no focal enhancement.otherwise, limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.no suspicious lytic or osteoblastic lesions are identified.extensive degenerative changes of the thoracic spine are again noted.

text: there is no aortic dissection or abnormality of the aortic root.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are normal.small mediastinal lymph nodes are noted, which do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.a right hilar lymph node measures up to 9 mm in short axis.the bronchi are patent to the subsegmental level and the lungs are clear with minimal dependent atelectasis.no bone findings of malignancy.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.there is a tiny pericardial effusion unchanged compared to the previous day's ct.no pathologically enlarged axillary or mediastinal lymph nodes are seen.there are bilateral pleural effusions (right greater than left) with associated compressive atelectasis.opacity at both lung bases is present representative of atelectasis or infiltrate.the previously described nodule within the left lung base is not well seen on today's examination.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.a left-sided picc line terminates within the svc.fluid surrounding the liver appears unchanged when compared to the prior examination.

text: there are extensive atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications.otherwise, the heart and pericardium are unremarkable, without pericardial effusion.there are atherosclerotic calcifications of the aortic arch and thoracic aorta.no thoracic aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism is identified.there are a few scattered prevascular nodes, measuring up to 1 cm in short axis and enlarged right hilar lymph node measuring 1.5 cm in short axis.mild inter lobular septal thickening is present within the lung apices bilaterally.there are patchy opacities within the dependent portion of the lungs bilaterally, likely reflecting atelectasis.a tiny left pleural effusion is seen.

text: there are no pleural effusions, nodules or opacities present in the lungs and there is no mediastinal, hilar or axillary adenopathy.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion but there are large paraesophageal varices which are unchanged.there is minimal dependent atelectasis.

text: a left subclavian approach central venous catheter terminates in the mid svc.prominent new multicompartmental mediastinal lymphadenopathy measures up to 1.5 cm in the pretracheal station (2, 20).no significant hilar lymphadenopathy is noted.small axillary lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.the heart is top normal in size without pericardial effusion.multivessel coronary arterial calcifications are present.patient is status post feeding tube placement.layering fluid is present within the esophagus, suggestive of possible increased aspiration risk.new multifocal central and peripheral peribronchiolar ground-glass opacities predominating the left lung (upper and lower lobes) but present diffusely are suggestive of infectious etiology.left greater than right basal consolidation is also present, which could represent infection or aspiration and/or atelectasis.central airways are patent.there is no large pleural effusion.

text: the pulmonary arteries are patent with no intraluminal filling defects down to the subsegmental level.the main pulmonary artery is mildly dilated measuring 3.3 mm in the axial dimension.no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria is present.the heart and aorta are unremarkable.no pericardial effusion is present.there are mild coronary artery and aortic valvular calcifications.the patient is status post ___ ___ esophagectomy with the anastomotic site in the superior portion of the posterior mediastinum.no mediastinal air to suggest perforation is noted.an ng tube is noted within the lumen of the intrathoracic stomach extending past the diaghragmatic hiatus.there is a small-to-moderate right-sided simple pleural effusion with an intrafissural component in the major fissure (4:39) as well as a small hydropneumothorax in the medial portion ofthe lower lobe (4:43).a simple pleural effusion is noted on the left which is moderate in severity without associated pleural thickening.the left-sided effusion causes collapse of the left lower lobe.also noted is a small right pneumothorax.the lungs show mild ground-glass opacity which is likely related to the expiratory phase of imaging, but the presence of smooth interlobular septal thickening is also noted suggesting mild hydrostatic edema.a right-sided chest tube and mediastinal drain are noted in appropriate positions.the airways are patent but appear narrowed likely secondary to expiratory phase of imaging.although this examination was not intended for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, the partially imaged abdomen is unremarkable.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism to the subsegmental levels.the thoracic aorta is grossly unremarkable, without evidence of dissection or intramural hematoma.the heart is normal in appearance.the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels bilaterally.there is severe, predominantly apical emphysema.within the right lower lobe, there is new, extensive ground-glass opacification, consistent with lobar pneumonia and/or aspiration.a small right pleural effusion is new compared to the prior study.the remainder of the lungs are clear.a right upper lung spiculated nodule measuring 10 mm is not significantly changed in size compared to the prior study (2:24).an additional spiculated nodule in the left upper lobe is also not significantly changed in size, measuring 18 mm.multiple additional subcentimeter bilateral pulmonary nodules are not appreciably changed in size.there are multiple prominent mediastinal and right hilar lymph nodes.the largest right paratracheal node measures 1 cm and the largest right hilar node measures 1.4 cm (3:51), both of which are increased in size compared to the prior study.no pathologically enlarged left hilar or axillary lymph nodes are seen.the visualized portion of the thyroid gland is unremarkable.this study was not optimized for evaluation of the intra-abdominal contents.limited views of the abdomen are grossly unremarkable.

text: the study is somewhat limited due to artifacts from the cardiac pacemaker and its leads.small pretracheal node is seen, measuring up to 8 mm, however, there is no significant lymphadenopathy.there is small left pleural effusion.thoracic aorta is tortuous.coronary arteries are calcified.again note is made of dilated upper and middle esophagus with fluid.again note is made of 5-cm air- and fluid-containing cystic structure in the left posterior mediastinum, most likely corresponding to epiphrenic diverticulum seen on the prior barium esophagogram, unchanged since prior study.in the lung windows, previously noted consolidation in left upper lobe extending from the hilum has decreased in its extent.there is faint consolidation in lingula, which is new compared to the prior study.there is atelectatic opacity adjacent to the diaphragm in left lower lobe, unchanged compared to the prior study.calcified granuloma is seen in the right middle lobe.there is diffuse underlying interlobular septal thickening, overall unchanged compared to the prior study, most likely representing underlying pulmonary edema.small right effusion versus pleural thickening is seen on the right.the central airways are patent, and there is no filling defect seen at the level of segmental bronchi, however, for the distal airway, the evaluation by ct may be limited.bronchoscopy can be considered if clinically indicated.there is 1.1 cm lobulated opacity centrally in the right upper lobe (2:14).in the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, there is calcifications in the spleen, otherwise, no gross abnormality is noted.there is no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion in skeletal structures.again note is made of severe scoliosis.there is healed fracture in the posterior segments of the left ___ ribs.

text: there is a small right apical pneumothorax.there are also right apical lung blebs.there is right-sided dependent consolidations which could represent aspiration or pulmonary contusion.the left lung is unremarkable.the heart is normal in appearance.there are no pericardial or pleural effusions noted.the aorta and great vessels are normal in appearance.the patient is intubated and an endotracheal tube is in satisfactory position.there is an ng tube passing through the esophagus and terminating within the stomach.there is a hiatal hernia.there is no mediastinal, axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.

text: the endotracheal tube is seen with its tip located approximately 2 cm above the carina.the ng tube is not visualized.the mediastinal great vessels are intact and there is no mediastinal hematoma.the heart is normal in size and shape.no pericardial effusion.the imaged portion of the thyroid gland is normal.a chest tube is seen entering the left lower chest wall with the chest tube tip lodged in the medial left lung base.there is a tiny left pneumothorax best seen anteriorly adjacent to the heart.there is consolidation adjacent to the chest tube likely related to the chest tube insertion.in addition, there is a focal small opacity in the anterior left mid lung on series 2, image 26, which could represent an area of contusion.bibasilar opacities are small, which likely represent a combination of atelectasis and aspiration.there is no pneumothorax on the right and there is no pneumomediastinum.there is no lymphadenopathy.no hemothorax is present.

text: the right ica and right brachiocephalic trunk are markedly narrowed at their origin.there are no filling defects to the level of the segmental pulmonary arteries bilaterally to indicate pulmonary embolism.there is atherosclerotic disease of the aorta.the lungs are grossly clear without evidence of nodules or pleural effusions.there is a single focal left pleural calcification.note is made of a heterogeneous thyroid gland with 1.3 cm hypodensity.scattered mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet the ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.

text: right upper lobe atelectasis has resolved.minimal right middle lobe atelectasis in the medial segment persists.diffuse areas of ground- glass opacity and smooth thickening of the interlobular septa are new.there is a new small focal area of opacity in the left upper lobe (3:10).mild increase in small pericardial effusion.marked increase in still mild cardiomegaly.bilateral moderate pleural effusions are new.mildly enlarged left supraclavicular, left upper paratracheal, prevascular lymph nodes are unchanged, likely reactive.there is no pe.aberrant right subclavian artery is again noted.the esophagus is mildly dilated, is unchanged.there are no bone findings of malignancy.the upper abdomen is unremarkable.

text: there is total collapse of the right lung.a stent is identified in the right main stem bronchus, as well as the region of the bronchus intermedius.there is a large right pleural effusion.also noted is a moderate-large left pleural effusion.a right-sided chest tube is in place and there are small bubbles of gas along the tract of the tube.the size of the extensive tumor in the right chest is difficult to ascertain due to the collapsed lung and pleural effusion.there is a non-obstructing thrombus identified in the right brachiocephalic vein and svc.there may also be tumor involvement of the right atrium.limited views of the upper abdomen reveal slight fullness of the left adrenal gland.there is fluid in morison's pouch.lung windows demonstrate no focal lesions in the aerated portion of the left lung.there is collapse of the left lower lobe.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic abnormalities.

text: compared to the outside hospital ct, there is new acute mediastinal hematoma.the hematoma is centered in the posterior mediastinum at the level of the great vessels, and extends superiorly to at least the hypopharynx and inferiorly to the subcarinal station.the hematoma extends across the midline, and into the right upper pleural space, measuring 11 x 6.2 cm in greatest axial dimension.there is an area of more hyperattenuating hematoma adjacent to the descending aorta (3:17) in the region of the previously seen descending aortic dissection, and this may represent sentinel clot and an area of aortic wall disruption.on the outside hospital ct, an aortic dissection with low attenuation within the false lumen extending from approximately the level of the left subclavian artery to the inferior thorax was seen.the aortic wall and false luminal wall was intact at that time (approximately six hours prior).on the current ct, there is poor definition along the entire medial wall of the dissection from the level of the left subclavian artery to the subcarinal area and there is no fat plane between the hematoma and the false lumen.there is a focal but ill- defined area of contrast, abutting the aorta and the proximal descending aorta, which may represent contrast within the false lumen or possibly extravasation of contrast (3:16).there is a common origin of the left carotid and right brachiocephalic artery.due to the extensive hematoma, the true origin of the false lumen is obscured, and is presumably at the region of the left subclavian artery takeoff.there is no evidence of ascending aortic dissection or hemopericardium.the false luminal/aortic wall reconstitutes at the inferior thorax (3:37) where well-opacified true and false lumen are identified continuing to the level of the esophageal hiatus.there is a new right-sided pleural effusion measuring simple fluid density extending inferiorly from the large right apical hematoma.there is associated atelectasis.smaller left effusion is also new compared to the outside hospital ct.a 3-mm right middle lobe nodule is noted (3:37).there is also a 4-mm ground-glass nodule along the right major fissure (3:24).
summary: extensive mediastinal and right pleural hematoma, new since the outside hospital ct of six hours prior, and thought most likely to reflect rupture of the false lumen of the known aortic dissection.probable type b aortic dissection with indistinctness of the true origin of the false lumen due to extensive hematoma.the dissection flap likely originates just proximal to the left subclavian artery.there is a common origin of the right brachiocephalic and left common carotid arteries.there is no apparent ascending aorta involvement cystic pancreatic body mass, which can be evaluated on a non-emergent basis with mrcp.differential consideration includes adenocarcinoma, ipmn (intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm), and serous cystadenoma.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ and the cardiothoracic surgical team immediately after the completion of the exam.

text: there are moderate atherosclerotic calcifications at the origin of the left vertebral artery (series 3, image 6).the thoracic aorta demonstrates only mild atherosclerotic calcification at the arch and the descending aorta.there is no acute aortic syndrome including no evidence of aortic dissection or aortic aneurysm formation.there is no pneumomediastinum, mediastinal masses or mediastinal hemorrhage.the previously on the chest radiograph seen widening of the mediastinum can be explained by mediastinal lipomatosis.the main pulmonary artery is normal.there is no pulmonary embolism.there is no pericardial and no pleural effusion.there are atelectatic changes at the right upper lobe along the major fissure and at the lung bases bilaterally.there are no suspicious focal lung consolidations to suggest pneumonia, and there are no suspicious pulmonary nodules.stents are seen in the left anterior descending and circumflex coronary arteries.partially visualized upper abdomen demonstrates two small 1 cm hypoattenuating lesions in segment ii of the left liver lobe, incompletely characterized but likely representing a simple cyst (series 3, image 93).the partially visualized adrenal glands, spleen, and pancreas appear normal.a transverse colon diverticulum is seen, series 3, image 108, without evidence of diverticulitis.a ng tube ends in the corpus of the stomach.
summary: no acute cardiothoracic process including no evidence of no pulmonary embolism, aortic dissection, aortic aneurysm formation, mediastinal hemorrhage, pneumonia or pneumothorax.incidentally found hypoattenuating left lobe liver lesions likely represent simple cysts, however, further workup with ultrasound might be considered on a nonurgent basis.

text: there is a normal postoperative appearance of the sternum with the sternal wires intact and well positioned.there is no evidence of sternal dehiscence or osteolysis.the sternum is well aligned without evidence of fracture.there is diffuse fat stranding mostly involving the upper anterior mediastinum without focal fluid collection.the ascending aorta is normal in caliber with a normal postoperative appearance of the repair graft.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are otherwise normal.the lungs are clear with the exception of minimal right basilar scarring/atelectasis.limited imaging through the upper abdomen demonstrates a tiny hypodensity at the hepatic dome and a wedge-shaped hypodensity involving the periphery of the right lobe.there is an exophytic cystic lesion off the posterior aspect of the right kidney measuring 37 hounsfield units on this contrast-enhanced study, higher than a simple cyst.no osseous lesions are seen.coronal and sagittal reformatted images confirm these findings.

text: there is no evidence of mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the heart is normal in size, and there is no evidence of pericardial or pleural effusion.the patient is status post cardiac pacemaker placement.again note is made of infiltrating mass in the right axilla, and right anterior chest wall beneath the muscles, unchanged compared to the prior study.there is a small soft tissue in the left breast, unchanged compared to the prior study.in the lung window, beneath the muscle, overall unchanged compared to the prior study.

text: there is adequate opacification of the pulmonary arterial tree, and there is no filling defect identified to suggest pulmonary embolus.the main pulmonary artery is normal in caliber.the aorta and great vessels are similarly unremarkable.there is normal three-vessel configuration of the arch.the heart is normal in size.there is no pericardial effusion.the trachea and central airways are patent.there are no endobronchial lesions identified.the esophagus is normal.there is a non-hemorrhagic left pleural effusion, moderate in size, which is increased compared to ___.a trace right pleural effusion is also minimally larger.there is no associated pleural enhancement or nodularity identified.there is dependent left basilar atelectasis.prior peribronchiolar opacities and bronchial wall thickening in the lower lobes have improved, though there is slightly increased peripheral peribronchiolar opacity seen laterally in the right upper lobe (2:25-27).there is no pulmonary nodule or mass identified.there is no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.in the included portions of the upper abdomen, note is made of marked splenomegaly.additionally, on post-contrast images, there is an incompletely imaged peripheral wedge-shaped region of hypoattenuation (4:67), concerning for splenic infarct.the included portions of the liver, adrenal glands, and pancreas are normal.

text: an endotracheal tube is in place.there are secretions predominantly within the right main stem bronchus as well as the right lower lobe bronchus.moderately severe atherosclerotic calcifications of the coronary arteries and thoracic aorta are noted.the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber.the pulmonary arteries are enlarged, measuring 3.5 mm, suggesting underlying pulmonary arterial hypertension.no pulmonary embolus is appreciated.the lungs demonstrate upper lobe predominant emphysema, both centrilobular and paraseptal, greater on the right.there are small bilateral pleural effusions with bilateral partial lower lobe atelectasis.additionally, there are multifocal parenchymal opacities predominantly within the right upper, right middle and right lower lobes consistent with pneumonia/aspiration pneumonia.there is a prominent 8 mm prevascular lymph node as well as scattered additional adenopathy which is presumably reactive.this includes enlarged hilar adenopathy measuring up to 2.3 cm.there is bilateral gynecomastia.there is a large 5.4 x 2.6 cm sebaceous cyst in the posterior paraspinal soft tissues at the t7 level.

text: thyroid gland is normal in appearance with symmetric enhancement.mediastinum is unremarkable with soft tissue in the anterior mediastinum likely reflecting residual or hyperplastic thymus.the heart and pericardium are normal without pericardial effusion.the aorta and major branches are patent with normal three-vessel arch.nasogastric tube is seen passing through the esophagus which does contain a small amount of material in the mid esophagus within its lumen.trachea and central airways appear patent to the segmental level aside from the right upper lobe bronchus which is not well evaluated due to complete right upper lobe collapse from presumed aspirated material.the lungs are otherwise clear aside for some left basal atelectasis.there is no supraclavicular, hilar, mediastinal or axillary pathologic adenopathy.in the descending aorta at the level of the diaphragmatic hiatus, extending downward from the level of t10 to l1, there is an intimal flap which is likely a focal traumatic dissection.

text: as compared to the previous examination, the pre-existing left upper lobe consolidation, likely representing a large inflammatory lesion, has almost completely resolved.the only remnant changes seen in the location of the previous consolidation are minimal ground-glass like scars.in the right lower lobe, peripheral nodular opacities, with associated contact to bronchovascular structures and areas of pleural thickening are seen.in conjunction with the volume loss seen in the right lower lobe, these lesions fulfill the classical criteria for rounded atelectasis.there is no evidence of other nodular lesions in the thorax.notably, no lesions suggestive of metastases are seen.minimal scar-like changes at the bases of the middle lobe and of the lingula.mild apical centrilobular pulmonary emphysema.wall adherent mucus is seen in the trachea and the right main bronchus.the airways are patent.irregularities and thickening of the airway walls suggest mild chronic airways disease.no pericardial or pleural effusion.numerically increased borderline sized lymph nodes in all mediastinal compartments and in the axillary compartments.moderate coronary calcifications.aerobilia, clips in the abdomen, status post splenectomy.degenerative bone disease, but no evidence of osteolytic lesions.
summary: the pre-existing left upper lobe consolidation has almost completely resolved.the pre-existing changes in the right lower lobe represent rounded atelectasis.no lung nodules suspicious for pulmonary metastasis.mild mediastinal and axillary lymphadenopathy.no pleural effusions.

text: there is extensive soft tissue density occluding the left main stem bronchus and extending to the left upper lobe bronchus, causing complete left upper lobe collapse.small amount of soft tissue density is also identified within the left lower lobe bronchi, although the segmental bronchi remain patent distally.there is heterogeneous attenuation of the collapsed left upper lobe, although no definite mass lesion is identified.mucus plugging of the bronchi within the collapsed left upper lobe is also identified.the main pulmonary artery is markedly enlarged and measures approximately 4.0 cm.this is consistent with pulmonary hypertension.extensive calcifications of the arch of the aorta and coronary calcifications are noted.there is no pericardial effusion.there is mild cardiomegaly.there is no pleural effusion identified.within the right upper lobe, there is a ground-glass nodule measuring approximately 1.6 x 1.0 cm.there is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.incidental note is made of a bovine arch with the left common carotid artery arising from the left brachiocephalic artery.limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate a 6-mm arterial enhancing focus at the dome the level of the right lobe of the liver (5, 41).this is incompletely characterized.the left kidney appears atrophic.a large hypodense lesion arising from the right kidney is incompletely imaged.
summary: extensive soft tissue density occluding the left mainstem and upper lobe bronchus with subsequent left upper lobe collapse.no definite hilar or lung parenchymal mass seen.bronchoscopy is recommended for further evaluation.1.5-cm right upper lobe ground-glass nodule, which is nonspecific and may be neoplastic, infectious or inflammatory in etiology.pulmonary arterial hypertension.cardiomegaly and coronary artery calcifications as well as aortic calcifications.6- mm arterially enhancing liver lesion.differential diagnosis includes flash-filling hemangioma or fnh.if clinicallly indicated, an mri of the liver can be performed for further evaluation.8-mm sclerotic focus within the t2 vertebral body, for which correlation with bone scan is recommended.

text: there is mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the largest lymph node in the aortopulmonary window measures 1.6 cm in short axis.multiple other lymph nodes are seen in the pretracheal space as well as subcarinal (1.4 cm in dimension).the subcarinal lymph nodes demonstrate some calcification consistent with prior granulomatous infection.there are bilateral pleural effusions, moderate in size, left greater than right.an et tube is identified with its tip in the mid trachea.there is a 1.9 cm spiculated lesion in the right upper lobe with spiculations extending to the pleura.in the superior segment of the right lower lobe, there is a 5.6 cm mass with an irregularly enhancing rim and an air-fluid level as well as multiple additional air inclusions.throughout both lungs, there are patchy opacities that are concerning for multifocal pneumonia, particularly seen in the left upper lobe and in the lower lobes bilaterally.there is an element of atelectasis in the lower lobes.the heart size is in the upper limits of normal and there is only a minimal if any thickening of interstitial septate consistent with heart failure.there are bullae in the lungs bilaterally, particularly in the upper lobes.

text: the lungs are clear.the airways are patent to the level of subsegmental bronchi.there is no pleural effusion.there is minimal pericardial effusion.heart and great vessels are normal.there are bilateral breast implants.lymphadenopathy in both axillae is increased since the last examination; for example, a 21 x 26 mm lymph node in the left axilla was previously only 16 x 17 mm (series 2, image 21).a right axillary node measuring 29 x 20 mm was previously 21 x 13 mm (series 2, image 14).enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum are also now better appreciated on today's study; for example, a superior right paratracheal node, 12 x 16 mm was previously only 8 x 13 mm.a right hilar node measuring 12 x 13 mm was faintly seen previously, and only measured 10 x 10 mm.this study is not targeted to the abdomen; however, limited images show a liver that has increased in size since the last exam, now stretching clearly across the midline into the left upper quadrant (series 2, image 58).the spleen is also is borderline enlarged at 11.6 cm.no definite lymphadenopathy is seen within the imaged portion; the visualized kidneys, pancreas, and adrenals are normal.

text: ct of the chest with i.v.contrast: no axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.no pericardial or no pleural effusion.no significant atherosclerotic calcifications of the coronary arteries or the thoracic aorta.small bilateral pleural effusion with associated atelectasis.no suspicious pulmonary nodules.ct of the abdomen with i.v.contrast: no focal hepatic lesions.multiple stones are seen within the gallbladder without evidence of cholecystitis.no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands are normal.hypoattenuating wedge-shaped ill-defined lesions in the mid pole of the left kidney (series 2, image 66, series 301b, image 36) as well as multiple wedge-shaped right hypoattenuating lesions (series 2, image 81 and series 301b, image 31) are consistent with acute pyelonephritis.the adrenal glands are normal.no evidence of hydronephrosis or hydroureter.no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.the portal venous, systemic venous and systemic arterial system of the abdomen and pelvis are normal.incidental note is made of a common origin of the celiac axis and the sma.no free air and no free fluid.the esophagus, stomach, and small bowel are normal.mild diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon and descending colon without evidence of diverticulitis.ct of the pelvis with i.v.contrast: the urinary bladder, seminal vesicles, and prostate are normal.no pelvic hernias and no pelvic lymphadenopathy.no evidence of fluid collections in the chest, abdomen, and pelvis including no evidence of soft tissue masses or collections.mild anasarca.atherosclerotic calcification at the dorsum of the the penis (series 2, image 128 and series 301b, image 37), possibly due to prior trauma, infection or due to dorsalis pedis artery atherosclerosis.
summary: findings are consistent with acute pyelonephritis.small bilateral pleural effusion and associated atelectasis.multiple gallstones without cholecystitis.

text: the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.there are multivessel coronary arterial calcifications and aortic valve and mitral annular calcifications.there may be bovine configuration of arch vessels.atherosclerotic calcifications involve the aortic arch extending into proximal left subclavian artery.there is extensive mediastinal lymphadenopathy, measuring up to 17 mm in the lower pretracheal station and 13 mm in the right hilum (2, 24).there is pericardial lymphadenopathy, measuring up to 2 x 3.6 cm (2, 46).there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.there are bilateral small non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions, left greater than right.there are lobulated confluent masses in the left lung, encasing multiple small airway branches.largest of these appearsto preoccupy the left upper lobe, measuring 8 x 4.3 cm, encasing and flattening the left upper lobe segmental bronchi.a lingula mass measures 6.8 x 5.8 cm, with similar compression of subsegmental airways.a 8.2 x 6.4 cm dminant left lower lobe subpleural mass measures 8.2 x 6.4 cm, with adjacent peripheral atelectasis and attenuating and obstructing of all left lower lobe segmental bronchi.the right lung exhibits ill-defined ground glass opacities involving the right upper lobe, right middle lobe and right lower lobe, in certain areas more confluent and solid appearing.while some of this could represent a known legionella pneumonia, concurrent malignant involvement by b cell lymphoma is likely, particularly given multiple smaller nodules.there is fluid density endobronchial material within the proximal bronchus intermedius (2, 26), which could represent secretion.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.proximal lobar bronchi appear patent.right subsegmental airways are largely patent, with the exception of attenuation in the lower lobe.

text: patient is status post repair of the ascending thoracic aorta that today measures up to 31 mm (prior to repair measured up to 6 cm) (4:43).the size of aortic arch is unchanged, measuring up to 53 mm and the excluded lumen is mostly thrombosed.the descending aorta measures 38 mm below the level of the carina (4:30), and is similar as in prior study.the anastomoses of the great vessels appear unremarkable.unchanged appearance of multiple hypodense nodules in thyroid gland.there are small mediastinal lymph nodes that do not meet ct size criteria for adenopathy.the airways are patent to subsegmental levels bilaterally.previously described subpleural plaque and small lung nodules are unchanged (as follows: 4:8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 46, 69).there is interval development of small right pleural effusion associated with atelectasis of adjacent lung in the left lung base, probably related to recent surgery.

text: the patient is status post right pneumonectomy.a marked amount of soft tissue density throughout the mediastinum appears slightly more prominent when compared to the prior examination.the largest measurable component of this infiltrative process located anterior to the carina measures 4.5 x 2.4 cm.this area of soft tissue density measured 4.5 x 2.2 cm on the prior examination.this soft tissue mass invades the pretracheal, precarinal, and ap window.a pericardial effusion is unchanged when compared to the previous examination.extensive enhancement is again seen within the pleural fluid on the right.within the left lung, there is a minimal amount of centrilobular patchy opacity within the left lung base, probably inflammatory in nature.within the visualized portions of the upper abdomen, low attenuation lesions within the liver are unchanged.the adrenal glands, and visualized portions of the spleen and kidneys are within normal limits.bone windows show extensive post-surgical changes within the right thorax with no evidence of bone destruction.an incidental note is made of a lipoma anterior to the right scapula.
