text: the lung bases are clear.again noted is the evolving hematoma lateral and posterior to the posterior right hepatic lobe.there is some heterogeneous enhancement of the posterior right hepatic lobe as well which may represent some evolving intraparenchymal hematoma.there is marked narrowing at the portal vein anastomosis.the diameter of the lumen is approximately 6 mm at this location and more distally it measures 17 mm.this likely accounts for the ultrasound findings.no arterial enhancing lesions are seen.note is made of some mild narrowing of the hepatic artery as it courses in the porta hepatis.however, given the normal waveforms and ultrasound, this is unlikely to be significant.some kinking is seen at the apex of the tortuous hepatic artery as well, also likely not significant.there are markedly enlarged collateral veins with numerous paraesophageal varices.there is marked splenomegaly.the pancreas, adrenal glands and kidneys appear normal.again noted is a soft tissue nodule in the right retroperitoneum just posterior to the ivc and superior to the adrenal gland.this has been previously biopsied revealing normal hepatocytes.this lesion is stable to decreased in size compared to the prior mri.the small bowel loops are unremarkable.there is no ascites.there is no significant lymphadenopathy.note is made of an accessory right renal artery.
summary: portal vein stenosis at the anastomosis consistent with the ultrasound findings.stable to slightly decreased right retroperitoneal nodule, which again has been previously biopsied revealing normal hepatocytes.portal hypertension with marked splenomegaly and collaterals including paraesophageal varices.evolving posttransplant hematoma surrounding the posterior right hepatic lobe.

text: coarse calcification in the right lobe of the thyroid is again noted.heart size is enlarged without pericardial effusion.there is coronary artery atherosclerotic calcification as before.the aorta is of normal caliber without evidence of acute dissection.a left picc line follows a normal course terminating in the distal svc, as before.small mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.a large heterogeneous left pleural fluid collection is compatible with the partially organized hemopneumothorax.the component of the collection extending to the lateral left upper hemithorax has increased slightly from the prior study.at comparable levels, the increased portion of the collection measures 4.8 x 2.8 cm compared to 4.4 x 2.5 cm previously (4:31).no source of active extravasation is identified.the remainder of the exam is essentially unchanged including a mass-like opacity in the left upper lobe which could represent infection; however, it has been seen on the prior chest radiographs dating back to ___.extensive linear opacity within the right upper lobe is compatible with a chronic process or scarring.additional scattered ground-glass opacity throughout the right lung suggests superimposed infection.airways are patent to the subsegmental level.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen a small hiatal hernia and evidence of hepaticojejunostomy are unchanged.

text: evaluation of the lungs is limited by motion artifact.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.bibasilar atelectasis is present.more confluent opacity at the right lung base may represent pulmonary contusion.no discrete nodule is identified.no pneumothorax.no pleural effusions.no pericardial effusion.the heart and great vessels are of normal caliber and appearance.there is no evidence of active extravasation.there is no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the thyroid enhances homogeneously.prominent soft tissue hematoma is present anterior to the thoracic spine, anterior to fractures of t7 and t8.

text: the heart and great vessels appear unremarkable.there is no significant hilar, mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is a small lymph node in the precardial space, with central low attenuation, which does not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.there are no pulonary masses or nodules.the airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.ct abdomen w/o & w/iv contrast: again noted are two small peripherally located hepatic lesions with brisk enhancement during the arterial phase but are not distinguishable from liver parenchymal during the portal venous phase.the lesions appear wedge-shaped and remain unchanged from the prior exam.the liver otherwise is unremarkable.patient is status post cholecystectomy.there has been interval removal of a biliary drain and placement of a biliary stent, associated with minimal stranding that is presumably secondary to postprocedure change.there is a small amount of ascites just anterior to the liver.again noted is enlarged lymph nodes in the porta hepatis, unchanged from the prior study.the pancreas, spleen, kidneys, adrenals, visualized small and large bowel loops appear unremarkable.

text: the heart and great vessels of the chest opacify well.there is no evidence of aortic dissection, aneurysm or pulmonary embolism.there are calcifications of the aortic arch and extensive coronary artery calcifications.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes are again demonstrated.small subcentimeter prevascular lymph nodes appear slightly increased in size.a large precarinal lymph node is stable at 22 mm.bulky right hilar lymphadenopathy is probably slightly larger, although measurement is complicated by adjacent consolidation.right hilar lymphadenopathy causes extrinsic compression of the right upper lobe and middle lobe bronchi.there has been significant increase in a large area of right upper lobe and middle lobe consolidation which is likely post- obstructive.the right pleural effusion has increased in size and is now moderate.there are multiple new pulmonary nodules of the left lung, the largest measuring 9 mm of the left lower lobe.the previously reported ovoid nodular opacity with central lucency of the right lower lobe is now obscured by pleural effusion.again demonstrated is severe centrilobular emphysema in the aerated portions of the lungs.the visualized portion of the upper abdomen again demonstrates a small axial hiatal hernia.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.significant worsening in consolidation of the right upper and middle lobes, which is likely post-obstructive pneumonitis given the bulky right hilar lymphadenopathy and right upper and middle lobe bronchial compression.bronchoscopy may be helpful for further assessment.multiple new left lung pulmonary nodules, possibly representing metastases.interval worsening in now moderate right pleural effusion.er dashboard wet read placed at 5 p.m.on ___.

text: the endotracheal tube is above the carina.the aorta, heart, and other great vessels appear normal.there is no pneumothorax, pleural effusion, or pericardial effusion.there is bibasilar atelectasis.there are secretions in the lower lobe bronchi.no pathologically-enlarged axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes.

text: ct of the chest: ascending aorta is dilated.at the level of main pulmonary trunk, the ascending aorta measures 36 x 34 mm and the descending aorta measures 26 x 24 mm.no evidence of aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism.the main pulmonary artery measures 33 mm, which is evidence for pulmonary hypertension.ground-glass opacity is seen diffusely in both lungs and could be related with hyperventilation and edema.persistent septal lines suggest evidence of pulmonary edema.air trapping is noted in the left lung base.focal atelectases are noted in the right lung base.there is no pleural effusion.stable cardiomegaly when compared to prior study in ___, but increased in size when compared to ___.coronary artery calcifications are consistent with atherosclerotic disease.no pericardial effusion.prominent right hilar and subcarinal lymph nodes, but not pathologically enlarged according to ct size criteria.the contrast injection was performed from the right side and there is opacification of multiple collateral veins in the chest wall that drain into the azygos vein and subsequently into the svc, suggest occlusion of the right subclavian vein (probably related to prior catheter placement).this appearance is similar as seen in prior studies.
summary: negative examination for aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism.diffuse ground-glass opacity could be related to hypoventilation and/or pulmonary edema.similar appearance of collateral veins in the chest wall suggesting occlusion of right subclavian vein.stable appearance of calcified right renal mass.no contrast enhancement of the kidneys compatible with history of esrd.evidence of pulmonary hypertension.dilated ascending aorta.stable cardiomegaly since ___, but increased in size when compared to ___.an echo study is suggested for evaluation.

text: the heart is normal in size and there is no pericardial effusion.the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber and contour.the lungs are clear.there are no pulmonary nodules or opacities or pneumothorax.
summary: acute laceration of the liver located with segments v and viii consistent with a grade 3 injury .no areas of active bleeding identified on the initial images or on delayed imaging.no other acute intrathoracic, abdominal, or pelvic injury.

text: secretions are again layering within the mid-trachea.otherwise, the central airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.there are multifocal bilateral predominantly peripheral nodular and mass-like areas of consolidation, compatible with septic emboli.right lower lobe areas of consolidation are newly apparent; these were probably previously present but obscured by the now improved right lower lobe collapse.otherwise, no new consolidation is seen.none of the previously visualized lesions are larger, and many show some decrease in size.also while some lesions show new cavitation, others previously demonstrating cavitation no longer demonstrate an air cavity.for example, mass-like consolidation in the peripheral right upper lobe has decreased from 3.0 cm to now 2.7 cm, and now shows new central cavitation (3:29).mass-like consolidation abutting the pleural surface in the lingula has decreased from 3.2 x 5.7 cm to now 3.0 x 5.5 cm (3:33); central air cavity in this lesion is no longer visualized, and it is noted that some areas within this lesion measure fluid density.mild emphysematous changes at the right apex are as before.the bilateral pleural chest drains seen on ___ ct have been removed, and there is a new pigtail pleural catheter on the right.small bilateral pleural effusions with heterogeneous density, enhancing rind, and loculated appearance is unchanged on the left but decreased on the right.there are tiny scattered foci of pneumothorax on the right as well as minimal overlying subcutaneous gas near the entry site of the new catheter.while the right lower lobe has reexpanded, there remains dependent atelectatic changes adjacent to the pleural effusions, particularly in the left lower lobe.small right upper paratracheal, prevascular, and bilateral axillary nodes are increased in number but do not meet size criteria for adenopathy.an aortopulmonary window node has increased from 10 mm to now 13 mm in short axis (2:26).a lower right paratracheal node measures 8 mm in short axis (2:26).hilar nodes measure up to 11 x 22 mm on the right (2:29), and 13 x 20 mm on the left (2:28).an epicardial node has decreased from 8 to now 7 mm (2:47).there is no pericardial effusion.the aorta is of normal caliber.while the current study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, no mass is seen arising from the visualized portions of the adrenal glands.a 2.7 cm rounded structure containing fluid and layering high density is seen arising from the gastric cardia, probably representing a diverticulum, also previously present.no region of bony destruction is seen.old lateral right third rib fracture is noted.rudimentary cervical ribs are also noted bilaterally.degenerative endplate changes are present along the inferior endplates of t6 and t7.
summary: multiple peripheral, nodular, and mass-like areas of consolidation in both lungs are compatible with septic emboli.while lesions in the right lower lobe are newly apparent due to reexpansion of the right lower lobe, no other new or enlarging lesion is seen.some lesions have decreased in size.some show new cavitation while others previously shown to have cavitation no longer have apparent cavitation.bilateral small complex loculated pleural effusions with enhancing rind, smaller on the right since ___.adjacent relaxation atelectasis involves nearly the complete left lower lobe, with sparing of the anterior segments only.dependent atelectasis also in the right lung.minimal right pneumothorax, with pleural catheter in place.mediastinal and hilar adenopathy.

text: there is no filling defect in the pulmonary arteries to the subsegmental level.the main pulmonary artery is normal in caliber.there is no right heart strain.the aorta is normal in caliber.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.right coronary artery stent.there is no pericardial effusion.the esophagus is normal.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no axillary, supraclavicular, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the thyroid is normal.the there are mild emphysematous changes at the lung apices.there is mild bilateral dependent atelectasis.no focal consolidations or nodules are seen.no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.again seen is air in the bile ducts, unchanged.no acute abnormality of the visualized upper abdomen.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.mild emphysema in the lung apices.mild dependent bilateral atelectasis.

text: contrast opacification of the pulmonary vasculature is sufficient to exclude pulmonary embolism in the central and segmental arteries.in general, there is a massive progression of disease.the size of the mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes has substantially increased.the hilar and mediastinal lymphatic material now occupies large parts of the mediastinum, surrounding and partially compressing the left and right pulmonary arteries, the aorta, the carina as well as the left and right main bronchus, the superior vena cava, and the azygos vein.instead of the previously visible metastasis in the left lower lobe, the entire left lower lobe is now occupied by a large parenchymal opacity, representing a combination of atelectasis and pneumonia.in addition, newly appeared foci of infection are visible in both upper lobes as well as in the middle lobe.nondependent thickening of the interlobar septa as well as thickening of the peribronchial lymphatics strongly suggests the presence of lymphangitis carcinomatosa.this is further supported by newly appeared bilateral pleural effusions.newly appeared relatively extensive pericardial effusion.there is no safe evidence of osteodestructive lesions.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.massive progression of disease with substantial generalized severe mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy, newly appeared bilateral pleural effusions, newly appeared pericardial effusion, newly appeared multifocal pneumonia, and evidence of lymphangitis carcinomatosa.the findings were discussed by dr.___ with dr.___ on ___, 5:20 a.m.

text: ct of the chest with iv contrast: the bolus timing is slightly suboptimal.however, there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism in the central or segmental pulmonary vasculature.small subsegmental pulmonary embolisms cannot be entirely excluded.there is bibasilar atelectasis.the heart size is within normal limits without pericardial effusion.there is no mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy.
summary: suboptimal bolus of the pulmonary arterial vasculature slightly limiting evaluation.however, no evidence of central or segmental pulmonary embolism.cannot exclude small subsegmental emboli.no acute intra-abdominal or intrapelvic pathology.

text: again noted is an arteriovenous malformation in the right lower lobe anteriorly abutting the pericardium.of note is that no contrast opacification occurs due to occlusion of the supplying pulmonary artery.in addition, the malformation now measures 16 x 21 mm, whereas previously this measured approximately 34 x 24 mm.also, the center has now low attenuation suggesting cystic degeneration.no other vascular malformations are seen within the lungs.a small nodule is again noted and is unchanged in the left lung in the left upper lobe, specifically series 4a, image 62.this measures approximately 3 x 3 mm in size.no other lung nodules are identified.no pleural effusions are present.no supraclavicular or axillary adenopathy is identified.no significantly enlarged mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes are present.the main, left, and right pulmonary arteries are widely patent, extending down to several coils in the right lung which are located within the arteries supplying the av malformation.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions identified within the skeleton.the tiny nodules in the right lower lobe are again identified and unchanged in size and appearance.please note that the inferior portion of the right lobe of liver is not included in the acquisition region.
summary: satisfactory embolization and occlusion of vessels supplying a right lung arteriovenous malformation with marked decrease in size, absence of perfusion, and cystic change within the malformation.stable small lung nodules.

text: mild dependent atelectasis is seen throughout both lungs.no nodules or masses are detected.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the heart size is normal.there is no mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy.great vessels are patent and normal in caliber.no pulmonary embolus is detected to the subsegmental levels.
summary: no pulmonary embolus detected to the subsegmental levels.persistent hyperdense ascites, with a small amount of hyperdense material along the left paracolic gutter which may represent layering blood products.no definite active extravasation or active bleeding is seen.widely metastatic gist as seen on the ___ examination, including extensive peritoneal involvement.

text: an abandoned left-sided cardiac pacer is noted.bilateral lungs are clear with no evidence of pneumonia or congestive heart failure.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.tracheobronchial tree is patent.the visualized thyroid gland appears unremarkable.multiple subcentimeter mediastinal lymph nodes are not enlarge by ct size criteria.the aorta, pulmonary artery and heart appear grossly unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion.suboptimally evaluated, partially visualized upper abdominal organs appear grossly unremarkable.there are few enlarged upper abdominal lymph nodes, one measuring 1.2 x 2.0 cm adjacent to the lesser curvature of the stomach as well as a porta hepatis lymph node measuring 1.6 x 2.6 cm which are stable when compared to prior study.
summary: no intrathoracic abnormality.mildly enlarged upper abdominal lymph nodes which are stable when compared to prior study.clinical correlation is recommended.

text: the lungs are clear, without nodules or masses.no mediastinal lymphadenopathy.there are shotty axillary lymph nodes bilaterally.azygos vein is dilated, likely from prior hepatic failure.pulmonary arteries are normal in size.no definite coronary artery calcifications.heart size is normal.no thoracic soft tissue abnormalities.
summary: fluid collection with rim enhancement within the right hepatic lobe that could represent a biloma.while comparison by measurement is difficult to the ultrasound, it does not appear larger and may be slightly smaller in size.no evidence of hepatoma.portal vein stent is patent.hepatic arteries and hepatic veins are patent.no other concerning abnormality within the chest, abdomen or pelvis.

text: ct chest: multiple pulmonary nodules are noted bilaterally, the majority of which have increased in size since the previous study.the largest right upper lobe pulmonary nodule measures 1.5 cm x 1.4 cm (2:23), previously 1.2 cm x 1.1 cm.the largest right lower lobe nodule measures 1.4 cm x 1.2 cm (2:34), previously 0.8 cm x 0.8 cm.additional multiple smaller pulmonary nodules throughout the right lung have also slightly increased in size.the left lung also demonstrates multiple pulmonary nodules, the majority of which have increased in size.the largest nodule in the left upper lobe measures 1.9 cm x 1.7 cm (2:33), previously 1.1 cm x 1.0 cm.multiple other smaller nodules throughout the left lung have also increased in size.however, no new pulmonary nodules are identified.there are moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions which are similar in size to the recent cardiac mri.there is extensive mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy, which has also increased since the prior ct.for example, a lymph node in the superior aspect of the anterior mediastinum just anterior to the left pulmonary artery measures 2.3 cm x 1.7 cm (2:25), previously 1.8 cm x 1.3 cm.multiple other smaller lymph nodes have also increased in size.in addition, there is significant supraclavicular lymphadenopathy with the largest lymph nodes seen on the right measuring up to 2.3 cm x 1.6 cm, previously 1.4 cm x 1.2 cm (2:10).there is mass effect on the adjacent right internal jugular vein from the extensive lymphadenopathy.a nodal conglomerate to the left of the of the thyroid cartilage measures 5.9 cm x 2.3 cm which is stable in size; however, now there is more central hypodensity, most consistent with necrosis.there is significant left axillary lymphadenopathy, which has also markedly increased since the prior study.the largest measures 5.6 cm x 2.8 cm (2:29), previously 5.2 cm x 1.9 cm.a small-to-moderate sized pericardial effusion is stable in size since the cardiac mri of ___.
summary: overall worsening burden of metastatic disease.significant increase in size of left axillary, supraclavicular, mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.increase in size of the majority of existing multiple pulmonary nodules.no new pulmonary nodules identified.multiple hepatic cysts but other smaller hypodensities within the liver are too small to characterize.at least three of these are new, measuring up to 7 mm, and are worrisome for metastatic disease.small-to-moderate-sized pericardial effusion which is stable from the recent cardiac mr ___ ___.bilateral moderate-sized pleural effusions which are stable in size when compared to the cardiac mri.slight increase in size of sclerotic foci within vertebral body t12 and s1, concerning for metastases.no new osseous lesions are identified.stable size and appearance of right renal lesion again which could represent a primary neoplasm or metastasis.an oncology table was created online.

text: no high-density fluid is seen surrounding the aorta to suggest the presence of an intramural hematoma.there is aortic dissection.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are normal in appearance.pneumomediastinum is seen from the tracheal bifurcatiom to the carina, and tracking anteriorly along the pulmonary artery.a small left-sided pneumothorax is seen anterior to the left lower lobe.dependent changes, and a tiny pleural effusion are also seen within the left lung.the right lung is grossly clear.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.multiple rib fractures are identified within the left hemithorax, including the left fourth through sixth ribs laterally.lung windows demonstrate an irregular focus of soft tissue density, primarily within the lung apex, at the level of the rib fractures, consistent with a pulmonary contusion in this area.no focal nodules or masses are identified bilaterally.
summary: pneumomediastinum.there is no localized communication between the trachea, or esophageal lumen in the surrounding soft tissues.small, left-sided pneumothorax.left lateral rib fractures, involving ribs 3 through 6.

text: the imaged thyroid gland is normal.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.there is dense atherosclerotic calcification of the coronary vessels.the ascending aorta is borderline enlarged measuring up to 4.2 cm, similar to prior.the descending aorta is markedly tortuous with atherosclerotic calcification.the known complex saccular descending thoracic aortic aneurysm is unchanged in overall size at 5.8 (trv) x 5.0 (ap) cm and extends into the upper abdominal aorta as before.however, there has been an increase in adherent mural thrombus.given the tortuosity of the aorta at this location, it is difficult to exclude a component of dissection although there is no change in the appearance from prior studies.a hyperdense upper left paratracheal lymph node measures approximately 2.3 x 1.0 cm and is compatible with a hyperemic lymph node (2:14) and was probably present in ___.additional small mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for enlargement.there is no hilar adenopathy.the previously noted right basilar opacification has improved with minimal residual bronchiectasis.there is right middle and lower lobe atelectasis and probable scarring in the lateral basal segment of the right lower lobe.in the left lower lobe, atelectatic lung drapes over the large saccular aneurysm.lungs are elsewhere clear without new nodule or mass.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.in the imaged upper abdomen, an enhancing 5-6 mm lesion is noted in the upper pole left kidney adjacent to an unchanged 3.6 x 3.2 cm hypodense exophytic cyst.
summary: interval resolution of right basilar opacity with minimal residual scarring, bronchiectasis and atelectasis.no new concerning lung lesion.specifically, there is no hilar adenopathy or left basilar mass or consolidation.stable overall size of a complex descending aortic saccular aneurysm with slight increase in adherent mural thrombus.borderline ascending aortic enlargement up to 4.2 cm.enhancing 5-6 mm lesion in the upper pole of the right kidney which is incompletely assessed on this single-phase ct and stability from prior studies is difficult to determiine due to differences in technique.followup of this lesion should be based on clinical circumstances.if indicated, ultrasound or mri would be a reasonable approach.nonspecific borderline hyperemic upper mediastinal lymph node which is probably unchanged from ___ allowing for differences in technique.findings discussed by phone with ___ ___, np for dr.___ ___ at 9:30 am on ___.

text: lymph nodes are seen in the axilla although none meet pathologic size criteria.one periaortic node measures 8 mm in diameter (2;18).the heart and great vessels are normal appearing.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.multiple nodules are seen in the lungs as follows: -in the right upper lobe there is a 4-mm nodule (2; 17) that has not changed from previous study.-further down in the right upper lobe an additional 4-mm nodule is seen (2; 22) that is not changed from previous study.-more anteriorly to that nodule in the right upper lobe is a nodule measuring 6 mm (2; 23) that does not look changed from previous study.-two pleural nodules are seen in the right lower lung, each measuring approximately 3-4 mm, the lateral one does not appear changed from previous study.the posterior one is not seen on the previous study (2;36).-in the right lower lobe is a 3-mm nodule (2; 38) that is not changed from previous study.-in the left lower lobe is a 5-mm nodule (2;43) that is unchanged from previous study.a 38 x 28-mm soft tissue density in the right breast is most consistent with the recent procedure performed.
summary: stable lung nodules.slight decrease in enhancing hepatic mass in the right lobe.unchanged gastrohepatic lymph nodes.sclerotic area in the inferior sacrum most consistent with degenerative changes, stable since ___.

text: ett tip located approximately 2.3.1 cm above the carina.ngt tip located in the mid body of the stomach.the mediastinal great vessels are intact and normal in caliber.there is no mediastinal hematoma.the heart size is normal, and there is no pericardial effusion.there is no lymphadenopathy.left lung opacity is noted most confluent posteriorly, and apical, and ground-glass opacity noted elsewhere.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.the right lung is clear aside from minimal basilar atelectasis.there is mild leftward deviation of the esophagus (2:36).the left segmental and subsegmental airways appear patent.
summary: left lung consolidation is concerning for a combination of aspiration pneumonitis and associated edema, atelectasis.markedly distended urinary bladder.

text: careful inspection of the pulmonary arteries reveals no definite filling defects to suggest the presence of intraluminal thrombus.there is a large right pleural effusion extending to the right apex with a small loculated component at the apex.there is also a small to moderate left pleural effusion.lung windows reveal consolidation involving the right lower lobe and right middle lobe with air bronchograms present.there is also consolidation in the left lower lobe with air bronchograms.there is partial collapse of both right middle and lower lobes.the remainder of the lungs are clear without focal pulmonary nodules.there is no pneumothorax.soft tissue windows reveal a normal appearing heart with vascular calcifications.there is no pericardial effusion.there are a few small lymph nodes within the mediastinum, none of which reach ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.no significant adenopathy is identified in the axillary or hilar regions.the airways appear patent to the segmental bronchi.the osseous structures demonstrate degenerative changes but no focal destructive bone lesions are seen.multiplanar reconstructions confirm the above findings.
summary: no ct evidence for pulmonary embolus.partial collapse and consolidation of the right middle and lower lobes as well as the left lower lobe.no obstruction of the airways is identified.these findings are concerning for multilobar pneumonia.large right pleural effusion with small to moderate left pleural effusion.

text: the soft tissue window images reveal prominent mediastinal lymph nodes.these are present in the prevascular, ap window and precarinal region.the largest lymph node measures 1 cm in the short dimension and is present in the precarinal region.there is no significant axillary lymphadenopathy.the heart, pericardium and the great vessels are unremarkable.there are no filling defects in the pulmonary vasculature to suggest the presence of pulmonary embolism.calcification of the aortic wall is visualized.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.a small hiatal hernia is present.the lung window images reveal mild bibasilar atelectasis right greater than left.a small 2-mm nodule is visualized in the right middle lobe best seen on series 3a image 20.there are no areas of consolidation.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.pancolitis involving the transverse, descending and sigmoid colon.this could represent an infectious, inflammatory or less likely an ischemic insult due to the extent of involvement.the pattern of wall thickening can also be seen in pseudomembranous colitis.is there a history of recent antibiotic usage? small 2-mm nodule in the right middle lobe.in the absence of a malignancy a one-year followup is recommended to ensure stability.in the presence of a known malignancy or a high risk a three to six-month followup is recommended.prominent mediastinal lymph nodes.

text: the thoracic aorta demonstrates no evidence of aneurysmal dilatation or dissection.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are unremarkable.the lungs are clear without effusion or consolidation.the bronchi are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.
summary: infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm with dissection extending from the sma to the right iliac artery.renal arteries originating from different lumens with symmetric enhancement.patent celiac, sma and ___.unremarkable thoracic aorta.results were discussed with the clinical team immediately following completion of the study.

text: there are multiple subcentimeter mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes that do not individually meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.these measure up to 8 mm in short-axis diameter and are located in the pretracheal, paratracheal, prevascular, precarinal, subcarinal, and right and left hilar regions.there is marked enlargement of the central pulmonary arteries, consistent with pulmonary arterial hypertension.within a branch of the right upper lobe pulmonary artery (series 4, image 57), there is an area of subtle hypodensity centrally within the vessel that does not appear to expand the vessel wall and demonstrates ill-defined margins.no other areas of questionable filling defects are identified within the pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolus.the central airways appear patent.there is severe emphysema with extensive bullous changes, most prominent within the right lung.no definite focal masses are identified within the pulmonary parenchyma.limited images of the upper abdomen demonstrate a small hiatal hernia.the visualized portions of the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.there is a rounded protrusion from the upper pole of the left kidney that is incompletely evaluated on this examination, although its measured density suggests assessed.
summary: questionable tiny central filling defect within a right upper lobe pulmonary artery, a finding that is felt likely to represent artifact, although small nonocclusive pulmonary embolus at this location cannot be entirely excluded.clinical correlation is recommended.severe emphysema.pulmonary artery hypertension.hiatal hernia.hypodense lesion projecting from the upper pole of the left kidney is incompletely characterized.the findings were discussed with dr.___ at 5:11 p.m.on ___.

text: the pulmonary vasculature is well opacified and demonstrates no intraluminal filling defects suggestive of pulmonary emboli.no pathologically-enlarged axillary or hilar lymph nodes are seen.there is a single borderline enlarged precarinal lymph node which measures 10 mm in short axis.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.evaluation of lung parenchyma is somewhat limited secondary to respiratory motion.there are some emphysematous changes in the lung bases, with areas of dependent atelectasis.two right-sided upper lobe pulmonary nodules are present, the larger of which measures 6 mm in greatest dimension.degenerative changes are seen throughout the spine.no suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions are identified.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.large left-sided neck mass with extensive rightward tracheal deviation.the mass encases but does not obstruct the left common carotid artery, along its entire course.the mass extends substernally to the level of the aortic arch.a right sided 11mm jugulodigastric lymph node is seen.small mass within the trachea.patent internal carotid arteries and basilar artery bilaterally.the basilar artery is enlarged without focal aneurysmal dilatation.single prominent pretracheal lymph node which does not meet ct criteria for pathological enlargement by ct scan.two right upper lobe pulmonary nodules, the largest of which is 6 mm.continued followup of these lesions is recommended.comparison with prior studies would be helpful.

text: lower lobe consolidation and pleural effusions have resolved with residual linear atelectasis in the superior segment of the right lower lobe and in the basal segments of the left lower lobe.centrilobular nodules involving the posterior segment of the lower lobes bilaterally are mild and probably due to resolving infection or inflammation.there is mucous plugging and peribronchial wall thickening in the airways of the posterior segment of the left lower lobe causing the linear atelectasis.no new consolidation, mass, pneumothorax, pleural effusion or pericardial effusion.proximal airways are widely patent to subsegmental levels.no pathologically enlarged mediastinal or axillary lymph nodes by ct size criteria.the aorta and pulmonary artery are normal.the thyroid is symmetrically enlarged, unchanged.no focal lesions or tracheal compression.the esophagus is patulous and distended containing food debris in its lower third, which may be a cause of recurrent aspiration.in the limited views of the upper abdomen, intrahepatic and extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation is unchanged (the cbd measures 10 mm).the spleen is not enlarged.no sclerotic or destructive bone lesions.
summary: resolution of the bilateral lower lobe consolidation with residual bronchiectasis and mild centrilobular nodularity with a tree-in-___ configuration in the right lower lobe suggest most likely sequela of near completely resolved infection or inflammation.mild peribronchial wall thickening in the left lower lobe with distal small airway mucous plugging, associated with linear atelectasis.intrahepatic and extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation is unchanged, but incompletely evaluated.

text: the thyroid gland is normal.no calcification of the coronary arteries.mild calcification of the aortic valve.no pericardial effusion.no mediastinal fluid collections.pulmonary artery is enlarged measuring 4 cm.no axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.small bilateral pleural effusions with associated bibasilar atelectasis.multifocal right middle lobe (series 2, image 31) and left upper lobe (series 2, image 27) groundglass opacities likely represent infectious or inflammatory foci.unchanged sub-3 mm right pulmonary nodules.
summary: multifocal bilateral ground-glass opacities represent either infectious or inflammatory foci.small amount of new, intermediate density peritoneal and pelvic fluid, but no evidence of organized chest, abdominal or pelvic fluid collections to suggest abscess.unchanged, enlarged pulmonary artery measuring 4 cm consistent with pulmonary hypertension.

text: the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes measure up to 8 mm and do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.hilar and axillary lymph nodes do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is scarring atelectasis noted within the right lung base.minimal atelectasis is seen within the left lung.lesion with calcified rim in the periphery of the liver is concerning for old torsed epiploic appendage or pseudolipoma of the ___ capsule and is unchanged since ___.the spleen, pancreas, and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable.there is evidence of cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.the kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis.bilateral renal cysts are noted, the largest in the left lower pole measures 32 x 28 mm.there is no free air within the abdomen.there is free fluid within the abdomen, which likely represents volume overload status, but there is no evidence of organ injury.intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.note is made of retroaortic left renal vein.
summary: new scarring atelectasis at the right lung base.minimal atelectasis in the left lung.cholelithiasis without evidence of cholecystitis.bilateral renal cysts.extensive free fluid within the abdomen and pelvis, but no evidence of organ injury.fluid within the right inguinal hernia is noted.left anterior fourth, fifth, sixth and seventh ribs show acute angulation which may represent nondisplaced fracture.correlate with clinical exam.nonspecific mediastinal lymph nodes up to 8 mm.lesion with calcified rim in the periphery of the liver is concerning for old torsed epiploic appendage or pseudolipoma of the ___ capsule and is unchanged since ___.dr.___ was notified of the updated findings at 5 p.m.on ___.

text: two hypodensities are seen in the right thyroid lobe.the aorta is patent with a normal three-vessel arch.the heart is normal with trace pericardial fluid.right-sided port terminates in the right atrium as before.the mediastinum is otherwise unremarkable with numerous mediastinal nodes, the largest is a 14-mm precarinal node and a 9-mm subcarinal node.no axillary, supraclavicular or hilar adenopathy is seen.pulmonary arterial opacification is limited due to the hand injection of contrast; however, there is no large central pulmonary embolus.innumerable pulmonary metastases are again demonstrated which appear larger than on the prior study.for example, left apical lesion previously measuring 1.2 x 1.2 cm now measures 1.6 x 1.4 cm (3:20).adjacent second left apical nodule is also enlarged.pleural-based nodule adjacent to the left upper lobe is increased in size measuring 1.8 x 1.5 cm (3:32), up from 1.3 x 0.8 mm.several lesions have a central hypodense appearance compatible with necrosis.these necrotic areas have also increased in size.large right basal lesion currently measures 3.1 x 3.0 cm, previously measuring 2.8 x 2.7 cm (3:67).ground-glass opacification in the right middle lobe likely reflects infectious process.there are new small-to-moderate bilateral right greater than left pleural effusions.though this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, imaged upper abdomen is unremarkable.
summary: no pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.ground-glass opacification in the right middle lobe likely reflects infectious process with new right greater than left small-to-moderate pleural effusions.innumerable pulmonary metastases, many of which are increased in size.unchanged left sixth rib, left pectoral and t11 vertebral body metastases with interval vertebral fusion, which is incompletely characterized.

text: there has been an interval increase in size in now moderate bilateral simple pleural effusions.there is studding of the pleural surface seen bilaterally along its posterior aspect, which may reflect pleural implants of lymphoma.ground-glass opacity is seen in the anterior segment of the right upper lobe abutting the minor fissure and is new compared with prior.pleural thickening along the lingula (2; 36) is unchanged compared with ___.along the anterior aspect of the anterior segment of the left upper lobe, there is an 8-mm nodule which appears new.there is bibasilar atelectasis abutting the pleural effusions.there is no pneumothorax.the central airways are notable for a y configuration stent which is seen from the distal trachea into the bilateral main stem bronchi.this stent maintains its shape, without areas of abnormal narrowing.the heart is unchanged in size and configuration.there is marked atherosclerotic calcification of the aorta and its major branches.while the aorta and its great vessels are encased by soft tissue, this degree of encasement is decreased compared with the prior study on ___, and there is no new narrowing of the visualized arteries.the pulmonary artery remains patent to the segmental levels.the right main pulmonary arterial branch may be mildly narrowed by soft tissue, though this is improved compared with prior study.the superior vena cava remains markedly narrowed by mediastinal soft tissue.two pacemaker leads are again noted within the svc, one terminating in atrial and the other terminating in a ventricular dilatation.the pulmonary veins remain patent.there is no concerning lytic or blastic osseous lesion.note is again made of a healed fracture in the anterior left sixth rib.the bones are diffusely osteopenic.
summary: interval decrease in size of soft tissue encasing the mediastinum.the tracheal y-stent has been placed in the interim, and remains widely patent, without extrinsic compression.the svc remains markedly narrowed, and is not significantly changed in appearance compared with ___.interval increase in now moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions, with bibasilar atelectasis.multiple foci of irregular pleural thickening are noted, concerning for lymphomatous implants.ground-glass opacity within the anterior segment of the right upper lobe abutting the minor fissure is new compared with prior, is nonspecific.an 8-mm nodule in the left upper lobe appears new.left breast mass, with adjacent surgical clips and skin thickening, better evaluated with mammography.

text: bibasilar consolidations are redemonstrated and not significantly changed in comparison to the ___ chest ct examination.small pleural effusions, greater on the right, are slightly worsened.there is now an increased amount of ground-glass opacification involving the upper lung zones, predominantly within the right side, concerning for increased inflammatory changes.these findings are compatible with progressive multifocal pneumonia.a previously seen air collection adjacent to the left hemidiaphragm is currently filled with hypodense fluid.two small foci of air are present (2:41).this is most compatible with a loculated fluid collection.the neighboring pleura is not thickened, and there is no rim enhancement to suggest an abscess or empyema.however, early infectious process cannot be excluded within this region.the patient is status post intubation and placement of a central venous catheter which terminates at the cavoatrial junction.a gastric tube terminates within the proximal duodenum.the great vessels are normal in caliber and patent.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.no pericardial effusion is present.
summary: increased ground-glass opacities within the bilateral upper lung zones, compatible with worsening inflammation.bibasilar consolidations are compatible with multifocal pneumonia, as seen on the prior chest ct examination.the previously seen air collection adjacent to the left hemidiaphragm is better viewed on the current study with iv contrast, and is filled primarily with fluid, now containing small foci of air.this is most compatible with loculated fluid collection.there is no ct evidence of abscess; however, an early infectious process within this collection cannot be excluded.no acute intra-abdominal or intrapelvic process.there is a trace amount of free fluid, but no focal collections or abscesses are present.

text: although not optimized for it, no pulmonary embolism is identified.aortic and coronary calcifications are identified.the heart size is normal.mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are patchy bilateral lower lobe opacities as well as bibasilar atelectasis.no pleural or pericardial effusions are identified.endotracheal and nasogastric tubes are noted.
summary: large left ureteropelvic junction stone which is causing mild hydronephrosis.dilated small bowel loops with decompressed but fluid-filled distal small bowel and colon suggestive of an ileus pattern or partial small-bowel obstruction.bilateral lower lobe patchy opacities concerning for aspiration or developing pneumonia.redemonstration of 2.5-cm enhancing solid and cystic left renal lesion concerning for renal cell carcinoma.ddx includes very unusual manifestation of abcess or wall thickening about a cyst.further evaluation with mri is strongly recommended.

text: atelectasis involving a large portion of the left lung is associated with elevation of the left hemidiaphragm and a moderate left effusion.no pneumonic consolidation is observed.minimal atelectasis is noted at the right base.the airway appears patent at the subsegmental levels.atherosclerotic calcifications involve the tortuous thoracic aorta and coronary arteries.there is no pericardial effusion.no pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymph nodes are noted.question is raised of a filling defect in a short segment of the proximal left internal jugular vein.although this exam is not tailored to evaluate subdiaphragmatic structures, limited evaluation of the upper abdomen demonstrates moderate central biliary ductal dilatation, unchanged.scattered hypodense left kidney lesions also appear unchanged, but are incompletely characterized.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions.severe dextroconvex scoliosis and bilateral degenerative glenohumeral changes are noted.
summary: left lung atelectasis with elevation of the left hemidiaphragm and left effusion.no pneumonic consolidation.question of nonocclusive thrombus in the left internal jugular vein.ultrasound is recommend to further evaluate.

text: the patient is status post intubation where the endotracheal tube terminates approximately 2.3 cm above the carina.there are mild bibasilar atelectasis.the lungs are otherwise symmetrically expanded, without pneumothorax, pleural effusions, or focal airspace consolidations.there is no suspicious pulmonary mass or nodule.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.the great mediastinal vessels are intact without evidence of acute vascular injury.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.
summary: right distal radial fracture, incompletely assessed on this study.possible deformity of the right elbow.dedicated radiographs of these regions are recommended.no acute traumatic injuries in the torso.nasogastric tube terminates in the distal esophagus for which advancement is recommended.mildly distended stomach.

text: there is no evidence of major vascular injury.the aorta is intact.the heart appears grossly normal.lung windows demonstrate scattered areas of air-space opacity within both lung fields, most confluent and extensive within the left lower lobe posteriorly.in addition, there is a moderate amount of high-density pleural fluid on the left, compatible with a hemothorax.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.
summary: extensive pulmonary contusions, most severe at the left lung base with an associated small hemothorax.multiple splenic lacerations with small amount of perisplenic hematoma.splenic hilum appears intact.left renal laceration with a small perinephric hematoma.right superior sacral fracture and bilateral superior and inferior pubic ramus fractures with associated pelvic hematoma.limited evaluation of the bladder due to underfilling and lack of intravenous contrast within it.

text: a right upper lobe nodular opacity previously measuring 2.9 x 1.7 cm (___) has decreased in size to 1.5 x 0.4 cm today.another nodule in the right middle lobe appears unchanged.new nodular, tree-in-___ appearing opacifications are seen in the right lower lobe likely representing an infectious etiology.there is bibasilar atelectasis.the heart and great vessels appear essentially normal, although note is made of vascular calcification.there are unchanged non-pathologically enlarged mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.
summary: decreased size of right upper lobe nodular opacity.new nodular, tree-in-___ opacification in the right lower lobe, most suggestive of infection.new right hydroureter without clear demonstration of an obstructing soft tissue mass or stone.mri could be performed for further characterization.

text: within the lateral segment of the right middle lobe, there is an enhancing soft tissue abnormality which appears increased in size since the previous exam.the appearance is most concerning for an enlarging pulmonary mass.there is near total collapse of the right lower lobe.while no obvious focal external compression of the right lower lobe bronchus is seen, there is extensive soft tissue density surrounding the airway.there is a right-sided pleural effusion which has increased since the prior study.a small left pleural effusion persists.increased lymphadenopathy is noted with a subcarinal node measuring 2.0 x 2.7 cm in size.smaller bilateral hilar nodes are seen.no axillary lymphadenopathy is noted.coronary artery calcifications are present.there is no pericardial effusion.there is a right-sided picc with tip terminating in the lower svc.an ett is present with tip terminating 2 cm above the carina.a ngt extends into the upper stomach.lung windows demonstrate compressive atelectasis at the bases.no other focal nodules are seen.there is rather significant underlying emphysema.images through the upper abdomen reveal no focal abnormalities in the visualized portions of the liver, adrenal glands, pancreas, or spleen.the patient is s/p cholecystectomy.evaluation of the osseous structures reveals degenerative changes but no destructive bone lesions are seen.
summary: enlarging mass in the lateral segment of the right middle lobe along with near total collapse of the right lower lobe, highly concerning for a neoplastic process.given the gradual interval growth of this lesion and the fact that the lesion was pet negative, the mass most likely represents a carcinoid tumor or bronchoalveolar cell carcinoma (which can be pet negative).bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.large subcarinal lymph node, a nonspecific finding which could represent a hyperplastic node in the setting of a collapsed lobe, or may be neoplastic.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber and contour throughout.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are normal.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.minor coronary artery calcification is present.there is no pathologically enlarged lymphadenopathy in the chest.the central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there are ill-defined bibasilar parenchymal opacities, predominantly in a peribronchial distribution.additionally, there are scattered ill-defined peribronchial opacities in the superior segment of the right lower lobe, the basal segments of the right upper lobe, and in the lingula.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable, except to note marked diffuse fatty infiltration of the liver.there is a focal area of probable fatty sparing in the periphery of the right lobe of the liver (3, 103).a 1.4 cm right adrenal nodule is too small to definitively characterize.there is no fracture.there is no osseous lesion suspicious for malignancy.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.patchy bilateral peribronchial airspace opacities, predominantly in a bibasilar distribution, but also seen in the right middle, right upper lobes, and in the lingula.although a portion of this opacity could relate to atelectasis, the possibility of aspiration or infection should also be considered.marked diffuse fatty infiltration of the liver, with probable areas of focal fatty sparing.a 1.4 cm right adrenal nodule.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber and contour, and demonstrates minor atherosclerotic calcification of the aortic arch and descending aorta.note is made of left-sided pacemaker device, with two leads extending into the right atrium and ventricle, respectively.there is no pericardial effusion.there is a large right pleural effusion, containing simple fluid (5 hounsfield units).there is associated right lower lobe atelectasis, and partial collapse of the medial segment of the right middle lobe.there is also a small left-sided effusion, and left basilar atelectasis.there is moderate global cardiomegaly.lung windows demonstrate no focal consolidations.there is a 6-mm noncalcified pulmonary nodule in the periphery of the right lower lobe.note is made of mild underlying apical predominant centrilobular emphysema.
summary: large right pleural effusion.there is associated partial collapse of the medial segment of the right middle lobe.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.evidence of underlying cirrhosis and portal hypertension, which could relate to large right pleural effusion.areas of nodular opacity in the right lung base are incompletely evaluated due to large effusion and adjacent collapse.reevaluation would be best performed with followup chest ct once the patient's clinical status is stabilized.no evidence of trauma within the abdomen or pelvis.above findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ and dr.___ ___ at approximately 7:30 p.m.on ___.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the patient's endotracheal tube terminates above the carina.ng tube passes into the stomach.a left-sided subclavian line terminates within the svc.there are new bilateral pleural effusions that are moderate in size (left greater than right) with associated atelectasis.there is ground glass as well as more confluent patchy opacity within both lung apices.there is also patchy opacity within both lung bases that appears unchanged when compared to ___.the patient's left-sided pneumothorax has resolved.within the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, limited views of the liver and spleen are within normal limits.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.new moderate bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.worsening lung disease with ground glass opacity as well as patchy areas of pulmonary parenchymal opacities that are most prominent within both upper lobes.this finding could represent aspiration event or could reflect inhalational lung injury.

text: there are multiple pulmonary nodules in the lungs bilaterally: an 11-mm nodule in the right upper lobe (4:35), 4-mm nodule in the left upper lobe (4:86), 6-mm nodule in the right lower lobe (4:132), and 11 mm x 9 mm pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe (4:134).these are fairly well-circumscribed and round.the airways are clear.small mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.a prominent right hilar lymph node measures 12 mm in short axis diameter (4:85) and is anterior to the mid right mainstem bronchus at the level of the right pulmonary artery.there is mild cardiomegaly without pericardial effusion.there are trace bilateral pleural effusions with bibasilar atelectasis.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.however, there remains marked distention of the imaged small bowel loops in the upper abdomen, measuring up to 5.3 cm in diameter, similar to the abdominal ct performed one day prior.the stomach is compressed posteriorly.ng tube ends within the stomach.high-density material within the gallbladder likely reflects contrast excretion from the ct study performed one day prior.
summary: four pulmonary nodules measuring up to 11 mm within the lungs bilaterally are most consistent with metastatic disease.none of these are located centrally and would probably not be amenable to endobronchial biopsy.12 mm right hilar lymph node, immediately anterior to the right mainstem bronchus at the level of the right pulmonary artery.marked distention of proximalsmall bowel loops up to 5.3 cm in diameter, unchanged.trace bilateral pleural effusions.mild cardiomegaly.

text: the soft tissue window images demonstrate lymphadenopathy in the axillary, mediastinal and hilar regions.the axillary lung nodes are not pathologically enlarged.the mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are enlarged up to 1 cm in the short axia.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are normal.bilateral pleural effusions are seen with associated atelectasis and air bronchograms in the lung bases.the lung window images reveal the presence of multinodular opacities in the right lung base, consistent with pneumonia.the airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilterally.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.bilateral pleural effusions with atelectasis and air bronchograms in the lung bases.micronodular opacities are present in the right lung base, consistent with pneumonia.

text: the lung windows demonstrate atelectasis in the lung bases, adjacent to the large left pleural effusion and loculated right pleural effusion.the upper lobes are relatively clear.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.the soft tissue windows reveal an unremarkable heart, paracardium and great vessels are unremarkable.the ___-___ gastric pull-up is noted along the right posterior mediastinum and right aspect of the vertebral body.no evidence of pulmonary arterial filling defects.there is a small amount of gas within the loculated collection along the right lateral hemithorax, consistent with recent operation.no significant lymphadenopathy.the osseous structures demonstrate the posterior right thoracotomy changes.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.moderate sized left pleural effusion and loculated right fluid collections.a small amount of air within the right pleural fluid collection is within normal limits given the recent surgery.___-___ esophagectomy and gastric pull-up noted, with adjacent atelectasis.

text: the previously described mediastinal soft tissue mass appears smaller in size.however, it continues to be associated with erosion of the adjacent sternum.several prevascular and paratracheal lymph nodes are evident.the lungs demonstrate moderate sized pleuaral effusions, right greater than left.these are associated with compression atelectasis of the adjacent lung parenchyma.the heart and great vessels are grossly normal.note is made of extensive calcifications involving the left main, lad, circumflex, and diagonal-1 coronary arteries.
summary: no evidence of abscess.

text: central soft tissue filling defects in the right pulmonary artery and several of the proximal segmental branches.soft tissue opacity is also identified within the left pulmonary artery and its common basilar trunk.these findings represent acute bilateral pulmonary emboli with a larger thrombus starting in the right pulmonary artery system.thrombus is also identified in the right superior pulmonary vein.the heart is enlarged with a right ventricular predominance.there is a moderate sized pericardial effusion.there is a tiny amount of loculated fluid along the left posterior costophrenic angle and a very large right pleural effusion.associated with this pleural effusion is right lower lobe atelectasis but there is also frank right lower lobe consolidation with low density component in the center of the consolidated lung which could represent necrosis.there is no frank extraluminal air in this consolidated lung.there is atelectasis in the medial segment of the right lower lobe.no worrisome blastic or lytic bony lesions are identified.there is an incompletely imaged simple cyst in the upper pole of the left kidney.the gallbladder is now seen.the visualized portions of the spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, right kidney and liver are within normal limits.these results were discussed with the clinical team caring for the patient at approximately 2 p.m.on ___.
summary: extensive pulmonary emboli present in the right pulmonary arterial system more than the left pulmonary artery system as described above, involving central, lobar and segmental levels.this finding was communicated to the clinical service caring for the patient.large right effusion.right lower lobe consolidation with low density components suggesting possible lung necrosis.cardiomegaly with a right ventricular predominance.moderate pericardial effusion.

text: the heart and great vessels appear unremarkable.there is a stable appearance of previously described left hilar mass, measuring 4.4 x 4.2 cm, not significantly changed from the prior measurement of 4.1 x 4.4 cm.there is persistent narrowing of the left upper lobe bronchus.there is interval increase in the pericardial lymph node, currently measuring 2.2 x 1.3 cm.also noted is a small left-sided pleural effusion.there is slight increase in the atelectasis in the left upper lobe.also noted is slight interval increase in size of previously described posterior left lower lobe nodule.again noted is minimal atelectasis present within the right middle lobe.there is no new pulmonary nodule or mass identified.there are several small pretracheal lymph nodes identified, which do not meet the ct criteria of pathologic enlargement.there is no pericardial effusion.the airway is patent to the level of segmental bronchi.
summary: there is interval development of numerous low attenuation liver lesions, highly suspicious for metastatic disease.interval development of lymph adenopathy along the celiac axis, porta hepatis, and the pericardial region.stable appearance of left hilar mass, currently measuring 4.4 x 4.2 cm and compressing the right upper lobe bronchus.heterogeneous pattern of the lumbar spine and the bilateral iliacs, which could represent a mixed lytic and sclerotic phase, concerning for metastatic disease.

text: small layering, non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions have increased since ___.there is no pleural thickening.small pericardial effusion is new.heart size while normal, has increased mildly since ___.the previous peribronchovascular nodular opacities scattered through both lungs have all resolved, and discrete region of peribronchial infiltration in the right lower lobe has been replaced by atelectasis also seen in the left lower lobe close to the major fissure.new ground-glass opacification and more confluent areas of peribronchial infiltration have developed in both upper lobes, extending from the hila to the anterior pleural surfaces.at the lung bases, there is marked septal thickening.the rapid disappearance of most of the nodular lung abnormalities suggests cleared viral infection, vasculitis, or drug reaction, less likely bacterial sepsis.the new ground- glass opacification and septal thickening, and increased heart size and pleural effusions point to cardiac decompensation, though a new infection could be responsible.borderline enlargement of mediastinal lymph nodes in the right upper and lower paratracheal stations is new, approximately 9 and 10 mm wide, respectively, probably reactive.prevascular lymph nodes along the aorta are stable at 7 mm wide and subcarinal nodes not appreciably changed at 13 mm across.this examination is not designed for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis except to note the absence of free intraperitoneal gas in the upper abdomen.generalized increase in density of the subcutaneous tissue is likely edema infiltrating the subcutaneous fat, is also consistent with volume overload or cardiac decompensation.
summary: previous viral infection, vasculitis, or drug reaction cleared since ___.new mild pulmonary edema, or, less likely, manifestations of new viral infection responsible for large scale ground-glass opacification, increasing small bilateral pleural effusion, and increasing heart size.

text: the patient is intubated.a left subclavian central venous catheter terminates in the superior vena cava.the heart, great vessels, and pericardium are unremarkable.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions, or pneumothorax.the lungs are clear.there are tiny peripheral non-specific opacities, as well as slight non-specific ground glass opacity in the right middle lobe.
summary: no evidence of traumatic injury.marked fatty infiltration of the liver.

text: no focal pulmonary nodules or opacities are identified.the previously identified right pleural effusion has resolved.there are focal densities in the right lung base adjacent to the pleura, likely atelectasis.post-surgical changes are identified along the right anterior chest wall, without evidence of residual hernia.surgical mesh and suture material are seen.tiny amount of fluid is seen in this area but there is no rim-enhancement to suggest abscess formation.there are coronary calcifications, but otherwise the heart and great vessels are normal.there is no pericardial effusion.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to subsegmental levels.
summary: thinning of the right anterior abdominal wall musculature and associated bulging of intra-abdominal contents.no abdominal wall hernia.post-surgical changes with minimal fluid in the right chest wall.resolution of the right-sided pleural effusion.small fat-containing hiatal hernia, umbilical hernia, and bilateral inguinal hernias.

text: soft tissue windows show no significant axillary or mediastinal lymph node enlargement.several sub-cm lymph nodes are seen in bilateral hila.the heart is mildly enlarged.the pericardium is unremarkable, with no pericardial effusions.intrathoracic aorta has a normal caliber.pulmonary arterial tree is well opacified by contrast, with no filling defects to suggest the presence of pulmonary emboli.pulmonary veins are prominent, possibly representing vascular congestion.there are bilateral pleural effusions (left larger than right).lung windows show collapse of the left lower lobe and lingula, possibly compressive in nature from moderate left pleural effusion.the extreme lung bases are not included on this study.there is peripheral septal thickening involving bilateral lungs, suggestive of mild interstitial edema.the airways appear patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is minimal background emphysema.osseous structures show degenerative changes of the spine.multiplanar reconstruction images confirm the above findings.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary emboli.collapse of the left lower lobe and lingula, possibly compressive in nature from moderate left sided pleural effusion.bilateral pleural effusions (left larger than right).cardiomegaly, vascular congestion and mild pulmonary edema are suggestive of mild to moderate chf.minimal background emphysema.

text: there is an ng tube coiled in the stomach.endotracheal tube is in satisfactory position in the mid trachea.the trachea itself demonstrates a saber-like configuration, widest along its posterior margin, and is extremely short in ap diameter inferiorly.there is severe malacic change involving the left mainstem bronchus, and to a lesser degree, the right mainstem bronchus.bronchi in the consolidated lower lobes appear dilated/ectatic.there is redemonstration of multiple enlarged mediastinal and bilateral hilar lymph nodes, the largest of which is a 13 x 21 mm right hilar lymph node.diffuse edema in the mediastinal fat and subcutaneous tissues is unchanged.there are small bilateral pleural effusions which are unchanged in size.assessment of the lung parenchyma again demonstrates nodular areas of opacity and consolidation in the aerated portions of the right upper and middle lobe and left upper lobe.the opacities in the posterior right upper lobe appear to have progressed since the prior study, while some of the previously visualized left upper lobe opacities appear slightly improved.there is superimposed diffuse ground-glass opacity and mild interlobular septal thickening.there is also bronchial wall thickening and mild bronchiectasis in the aerated lung.no lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions are identified.there are changes in the right scapular tip, likely post-traumatic, which are unchanged.there is fusion of a right upper rib.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.redemonstration of multifocal parenchymal opacities.some of the right lung opacities appear to have progressed, while others in the left upper lobe, appear slightly better than on ___.bilateral lower lobe consolidation, unchanged.unchanged bilateral pleural effusions.severe tracheobronchomalacia.suggestion of bronchiectasis in multiple areas, difficult to assess given the presence of intubation/positive-pressure ventilation.dr.___ ___ ___

text: no pulmonary embolism is identified from the level of the main pulmonary arterial trunk to the segmental pulmonary arterial vessels bilaterally.there are bilateral pleural effusions, moderate to large on the right and small to moderate on the left.both effusions demonstrate areas of loculation within both major fissures and posteriorly at the apex as well as anteriorly at the base on the left.no hilar or axillary lymph node enlargement is seen.there are multiple mediastinal lymph nodes appreciated, the largest measuring approximately 1.2 cm each within the ap window and right paratracheal space.the heart is enlarged.the pericardium is normal.there are bilateral diffuse patchy areas of consolidation.these are worst within the right upper lobe, lingula, and left lower lobe.the imaged portions of the upper abdomen show no abnormalities.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.anterior osteophytic degenerative changes of the thoracic spine are seen.coronal reconstructions: images reconstructed in the coronal plane show no pulmonary embolism.
summary: no pulmonary embolism seen.diffuse bilateral patchy air space consolidation, severe within the right upper lobe, lingula, and left lower lobe consistent with multifocal pneumonia.bilateral pleural effusions, moderate to large on the right and small to moderate on the left.both effusions demonstrate areas of loculation as described above.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes, the largest measuring 1.2 cm each within the ap window and paratracheal space.

text: no pathologic supraclavicular or axillary lymphadenopathy is identified.scattered mediastinal nodes are identified, though none meeting ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.the thyroid gland is symmetric and within normal limits.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to subsegmental levels.the visualized heart and great vessels are unremarkable.no focal pulmonary nodules are identified.there is a small left pleural effusion with associated minimal atelectasis.
summary: stable appearance of the diffuse osseous metastatic disease without evidence of new lesions compared to prior ct.no pathologic lymphadenopathy in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.no evidence of local recurrence at the prior left nephrectomy site.increasing size of the left adrenal mass with areas of hyperattenuation suggestive of enhancement, concerning for metastatic disease.stable infrarenal ivc filter.

text: coronary artery calcifications are widespread.the heart is normal in size.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.no enlarged lymph nodes are demonstrated.the pulmonary arteries are well opacified for review and show no evidence for filling defects.moderate-to-severe emphysema is most pronounced in the upper lungs, as seen previously.there is an area of mucus plugging in the right lower lobe (4:111).patchy dependent opacities are most suggestive of minor atelectasis.a patchy new peripheral consolidation with air bronchograms is situated in the posterior left upper lobe.it lies slightly posterior and inferior to an irregular nodular opacity which had been previously detected on multiple prior studies and most recently characterized on pet-ct without evidence for change since that time.in addition, there is a small soft tissue nodule with surrounding ground-glass measuring 4 mm, which is unchanged since at least ___.in the anterior left upper lobe, there is also a new patchy opacity which is partly solid and consolidative but largely characterized by ground glass and suggestive of bronchopneumonia.a calcified granuloma appears unchanged in left upper lobe.there is a very small anterior eventration of the right hemidiaphragm.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.small osteophytes are noted along the mid thoracic spine.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic bone lesions.
summary: unchanged irregular nodular opacity in the left upper lobe, previously evaluate with pet without evidence for change.patchy new opacity since the prior ct studies within the left upper lobe most suggestive of pneumneumonia.since these are visible on radiography, follow-up chest radiographs are recommended in order to ensure resolution without eight weeks.if opacities were to persist above background, then chest ct follow-up could then be considered.the etiology of suspected infection is not specific; pyogenic, mycobacterial and other atypical etiologies could be considered although the findings can be explained by bronchopneumonia with a pygogenic organism.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.severe emphysema.coronary artery calcifications.

text: no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph nodes are seen.coronary artery calcifications are identified.small bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis are seen.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi.a 6 x 3 mm nodule adjacent to the major fissure on the right (series 3, image 24) and a similar nodular opacity measuring 6 x 5 mm on the major fissure (series 3, image 25) are seen.remainder of the visualized lungs are clear.a small amount of ascites is present within the abdomen.percutaneous drainage catheters in place within the right upper quadrant near the porta hepatis.limited views of the pancreas, liver, adrenal glands, and spleen are within normal limits.a probable splenule is seen anterior to the inferior tip of the spleen.along the lateral aspect of the left kidney, there is stranding/soft tissue density, which is asymmetric, left relative to right.this area of stranding/soft tissue density is better assessed on previous abdominal ct.bone windows show no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: two 6-mm nodules adjacent to the major fissure on the right.given the patient's history of an abdominal mass, three-month followup ct could be performed to better assess for stability.bilateral small pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.small amount of intra-abdominal ascites.asymmetric left perirenal stranding/soft tissue density is identified that is better assessed on the patient's previous abdominal ct.

text: there is an esophageal stent in place and appears unchanged compared to the prior study.external to and along the posterolateral aspect of the proximal to distal stent there is a collection of hyperdense fluid with several locules of gas, which has increased in size compared to the prior study done on ___ and likely represents focal extravasation around esophageal stent.the approximate measurements of this collection are 19 x 23 mm, extending along the right paramediastinal space and ending in the right pleural space.the small right-sided pleural effusion is unchanged.the right chest tube is in the proper position and is draining the barium consistent with active extravasation of the barium.the mediastinal tube enters through the right side of the chest wall and exits through the right paramediastinal space and terminates above the diaphragm in the paraesophageal region.persistent thickening and induration of the right posterior pleural space with apparent extension of pleural fluid through the intercostal space may indicate persistent infection which appears unchanged compared to the prior study.this is best seen on series 2, image 37.persistent atelectasis of the lungs bilaterally appears relatively unchanged.no pneumothorax is identified.soft tissue windows demonstrate cv line within the distal svc.the coronary arteries are calcified.no pericardial effusion is seen.multiple shotty mediastinal and hilar nodes are identified none of which meet the ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: interval worsening of the esophageal leak adjacent to the right pleural cavity which is drained through right chest tube.unchanged moderate bilateral atelectatic changes at lung bases, which is more severe on the right side.small bilateral pleural effusion is unchanged.extension of inflammation within the right posterior chest wall is also unchanged.pancreatic stent is in place.unchanged appearance of peripancreatic edema and small pseudocyst.no intraabdominal or pelvic fluid collection is identified.small amount of free fluid tracking along the porta hepatis is unchanged.
