text: the thyroid gland is unremarkable.there are no enlarged supraclavicular, axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes.the heart is enlarged, but there is no pericardial effusion.the aorta is of normal caliber, there is no acute aortic pathology.the pulmonary artery is of normal caliber and there is no evidence of acute pulmonary embolism.there was scarring seen in the right lower lobe from prior pulmonary embolism.the lungs are otherwise clear without any focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax.the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.the study is not tailored for evaluation of subdiaphragmatic structures, but demonstrates no acute abnormality.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.scarring in the right lower lobe from prior pulmonary embolism.

text: within the medial aspect of the right lower lobe, there is a 2.7 x 1.9 cm, slightly lobulated mass as noted on prior ct of the abdomen.there are additional numerous round pulmonary nodules located bilaterally throughout the remainder of the pulmonary parenchyma diffusely.these measure up to 5 mm in diameter.there are bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right and low in density.there is adjacent opacity and volume loss within the left lower lobe consistent with atelectasis.no pneumothorax.there are numerous sub cm mediastinal lymph nodes located in the pretracheal, prevascular, paratracheal, precarinal, subcarinal, and right and left hilar regions.these do not individually meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.there are coronary artery calcifications.the heart and pericardium appear otherwise unremarkable.the central airways are patent.limited images of the upper abdomen again demonstrate complex fluid collections within the region of the pancreas extending to the left anterior pararenal space.a right-sided percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage catheter is in place.a percutaneous pigtail catheter is in place within the fluid collection.a percutaneous gastrostomy tube.these changes of the patient's known severe pancreatitis are better evaluated at the time of abdominal ct of one day prior.
summary: 2.7 x 1.9 cm mass within the right lower lobe medially, with numerous pulmonary nodules located diffusely throughout the remainder of the lungs.the findings are consistent with primary lung cancer with metastatic pulmonary lesions.correlate clinically and prior outside studies if available.bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right, and left lower lobe atelectasis.no evidence of pathologic appearing lymphadenopathy within the mediastinum or hila.stable appearance of changes of severe pancreatitis with peripancreatic fluid collections.

text: there are multiple bilateral pulmonary emboli including segmental emboli, for instance in the anterior segment of the right upper lobe, and subsegmental emboli including to the right apical segment, superior segment of the right lower lobe, anterior segment of the left upper lobe, the lingula and at the left base.there is some flattening of the interventricular septum.additionally, there is a rounded aneurysm of the ascending aorta measuring up to 7.2 x 6.6 cm (3:69).no evidence of intramural hematoma or dissection is seen.there is bilateral dependent atelectasis.no pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen.an ng tube and endotracheal tube are in place with the tips in the appropriate positions.within the trachea and bilateral mainstem bronchi fluid secretions are seen.there are coronary artery and aortic calcifications.below the diaphragm, a hypodensity measuring up to 1.6 cm is seen within the dome of the liver (2:51).additionally, there is ascites.
summary: multiple bilateral segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli.large ascending aortic aneurysm.no evidence of intramural hematoma or dissection.ascites.hypodensity in the dome of the liver, incompletely assessed on this examination.fluid secretions within the trachea and bilateral mainstem bronchi.

text: there is no evidence of axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.within the right upper lung, there are scattered ill-defined nodules, the largest measuring approximately 7 mm (3, 20).these are in a tree-in-___ configuration, which suggests infectious process.bibasilar atelectasis is noted.within the left lung base, a pleural- based enhancing area measuring approximately 10 x 7 mm is noted (3, 46).it is unclear if this represents atelectasis or a pulmonary nodule.however, superior and medial to it is a 12 x 7 mm irregular nodule (se 3, im 40 and se 400b, im 37).the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no evidence of frank consolidation.
summary: irregular pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe as described above.while this may be infectious in nature, particualrly in the presence of the other pulmonary nodules, it is concerning for malignancy.a pet ct may be considered to further evaluate this finding.ill-defined pulmonary nodules in the right upper lobe in a tree-in-bu configuration suggest infection process.left lung base subpleural enhancing are may represent a second nodule or atelectasis.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes identified.non-specific ill-defined slight increased sclerotic focus within the left iliac ___ is identified (3, 106).

text: the lung windows reveal confluent bilateral alveolar groundglass opacities.in the right lower lobe, separate foci of alveolar ground glass nodularity is clearly visualized (3:74).these findings are most consistent with pulmonary alveolar hemorrhage.there is no interstitial septal thickening or pleural effusion.foci of nodular opacity in the right upper and middle lobe adjacent to the fissure may also represent hemorrhage vs.aspiration.dependent atelectasis is also noted, right greater than left.there is a nonocclusive 6 mm filling defect in a segmental branch of the right upper lobe pulmonary ___ (403b:23 and 3:27), which may represent a chronic pulmonary embolus.the remaining pulmonary tree is well opacified and unremarkable.cardiomegaly is noted with small amount of coronary artery calcification.the aorta and great vessels appear unremarkable.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there is no lymphadenopathy.the trachea and bronchi are patent to the subsegmental level.an endotracheal tube terrminates 4.5 cm above the carina, in satisfactory position.
summary: diffuse bilateral ground-glass alveolar opacity concerning for pulmonary alveolar hemorrhage.the cause is unclear but may be related to underlying pulmonary -renal syndrome (vasculitides) such as goodpasture's syndrome, wegener's granulomatosis, and systemic lupus erythematosis.recommend clinical correlation.bilateral dependent atelectasis, right greater than left.small, likely chronic segmental pulmonary embolus in right upper lobe.hepatic hypodensity in the right lobe, too small to characterize.large calcified right upper pole renal lesion of unclear etiology, may be a calcified cyst.this lesion was previously seen on ultrasound.ett and cv catheter in standard positions.findings were posted to the ed dashboard at 12 p.m.on ___ and discussed with dr.___ ___ shortly after.

text: the pulmonary arterial tree is moderately well opacified, and there is no central or segmental pulmonary embolus.due to technical factors, assessment of subsegmental vessels is limited.however, there is no infarct or secondary sign of pulmonary embolus.the aorta is normal in caliber, without dissection, pseudoaneurysm, or acute abnormality.moderate atherosclerotic calcifications are noted at the arch and the origin of the great vessels.the heart size is top normal, without pericardial effusion.diffuse coronary artery calcifications are present in the right and left coronary arteries (circumflex and lad).there is no hilar, mediastinal, or axillary lymphadenopathy by size criteria.in the lungs, a small right pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis is unchanged.there is no new consolidation or new left pleural effusion.in the right main stem bronchus, there is a small focus of aerosolized material layering dependently, likely sequelae of aspiration, or secretions.this appears nonocclusive.the left tracheobronchial tree is patent to subsegmental levels.while this examination is not optimized for assessment of the abdomen, no acute abnormalities are noted in the upper abdomen.linear high-attenuation material in the central right liver is likely arterial flow, although this is incompletely imaged.
summary: no central or segmental pe.limited assessment of subsegmental vessels due to technical factors, but no infarcts or secondary sign of pe.unchanged small right pleural effusion.lungs are otherwise clear.aerosolized material in the right main stem bronchus, nonocclusive, likely reflecting secretions or aspirated material.please note this places the patient at increased risk of sequelae of aspiration.redemonstration of acute minimally displaced fractures of right anterior ribs 2 through 5.diffuse coronary artery calcification.

text: the pulmonary arterial vasculature is suboptimally visualized.allowing for this, no large pulmonary embolism is identified within the main pulmonary arterial vasculature.evaluation of the pulmonary arteries at the segment and subsegmental level is limited.additionally, streak artifact from the patient's arms limits study.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels appear within normal limits otherwise.no pleural effusions or pericardial effusion is present.single superior right-sided chest tube is again identified.no significant axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy is present.lung window images reveal the presence of a tiny right anterior pneumothorax.the left-sided pneumothorax is no longer present.bilateral lower lobe consolidations with air bronchograms are present, which may represent aspiration versus pneumonia.there is some consolidation within the right upper lobe which may also represent extension of pneumonia.no pulmonary nodules are identified.an endotracheal tube is seen with tip just inferior to the thoracic inlet.airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, the liver, kidneys, adrenal glands, spleen, and stomach appear unremarkable.a nasogastric tube is seen with tip in the fundus of the stomach.surgical staples are again seen overlying the anterior abdomen.
summary: suboptimal study secondary to quality of contrast bolus.allowing for this, no large pulmonary embolism is identified within the main lobar pulmonary arteries.evaluation of the segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries is limited.bilateral lower lobe consolidation with air bronchograms, which may represent aspiration or pneumonia.consolidation extends into the right upper lobe.sternal fracture with interval resolution of previously seen subcutaneous emphysema.tiny residual right-sided anterior pneumothorax.complete resolution of the left-sided pneumothorax.

text: small hypoattenuating 9-mm isthmic nodule is noted within the thyroid.there is dense atherosclerotic disease involving the aorta, aortic arch, and coronary circulation as well as dense calcification in the region of the aortic valve, mitral valve, and mitral annulus.the left atrium appears enlarged and there is probable underlying lvh.no pathologically enlarged central or axillary lymph nodes are present.no pericardial effusion is identified.moderate-to-large bilateral simple pleural effusions are noted with left greater than right adjacent compressive atelectasis involving the lower lobes.there is moderate apically predominant paraseptal emphysema; however, no suspicious pulmonary lesions are noted within the aerated lung.right lower lobe calcified granuloma was present in ___.
summary: no occult malignancy identified.moderate-to-large bilateral simple pleural effusions with left greater than right adjacent compressive atelectasis involving the lower lobes.moderate paraseptal emphysema.extensive atherosclerotic changes involving the aortic arch, coronary circulation, and aortic and mitral valve.probable underlying left atrial enlargement and lvh.cirrhosis with extensive collateral vessel formation noted within the abdominal cavity likely related to underlying portal hypertension and probable chronic splenic vein occlusion in the region of the splenic hilum.incompletely characterized but stable probable benign cyst within the left hepatic lobe.unchanged region of avascular necrosis involving the right femoral head.small thyroid isthmic nodule.colonic diverticulosis.

text: the study is somewhat limited due to respiratory motion artifact.the visualized pulmonary arteries demonstrate no intraluminal filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.there are extensive calcified prevascular, mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary nodes.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there is bilateral dependent consolidations.there is also a tiny left sided pleural effusion.there is also patchy perihilar opacities, greater on the right side, and two patchy apical opacities.the visualized portions of the upper abdomen including the liver, spleen and adrenals are unremarkable.an ng tube is present within the stomach.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism on study slightly limited due to respiratory motion.bilateral dependent consolidations consistent with moderate aspiration pneumonia.patchy perihilar and apical opacities concerning for spread of pneumonia.tiny left pleural effusion.extensive calcified mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes which could be consistent with a history of prior granulomatous infection.

text: there is extensive aberrant soft tissue air overlying the chest, as well as extensive pneumomediastinum and a small right pneumothorax.a chest tube is seen entering the right chest anteriorly at the second intercostal space, extending to the right apex.this is seen to closely abut and possibly traverse the right aspect of the mediastinum, a finding of uncertain significance.there is also a focal defect noted in the right chest wall anterolaterally in the third interspace (2:31), likely reflecting a site of prior chest tube placement.aside from the extensive air, the mediastinal structures are unremarkable.the heart is normal in size with trace coronary calcification and no pericardial effusion.the aorta, great vessels, and pulmonary arteries are normal in caliber, contour, and configuration.there is no central pulmonary embolus identified.prominent mediastinal nodes are likely reactive.the trachea and central bronchial tree is patent, with no endobronchial lesions identified, though some secretions are seen in the upper trachea, at the level of the brachiocephalic vein (4:53).the rul bronchial stump is unremarkable.the esophagus is normal.the patient is status post right upper lobectomy.there are extensive consolidative opacities noted in the right lower lobe.while predominantly dependent, these areas demonstrate hypoenhancment not consistent with atelectasis.additionally, there is a large air-and-fluid collection in the posterior sulcus, without peripheral enhancing rim to suggest organization and abscess formation.these findings are most consistent with necrotizing pneumonia.there is a small associated effusion.additionally, in the left lower lobe there is a peripheral pleural-based nodular opacity with some central hypoattenuation, most likely representing an additional focus of infection.however, comparison with prior imaging would be most helpful to ensure that this does not represent a malignant lesion.there are no lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions concerning for malignancy.in the included upper abdomen, note is made of multiple hypoattenuating liver lesions, incompletely characterized.these could be further characterized by ultrasound or mri if clinically indicated and not already characterized elsewhere.
summary: right lower lobe necrotizing pneumonia, with cavitation in the posterior segments.small adjacent effusion.pleural-based consolidation in the left lower lobe most likely represents additional focus of infection, though correlation with prior imaging would be most helpful to exclude a pre-existing malignant lesion.mediastinal nodes are most likely reactive.large soft tissue air and pneumomediastinum, with small-moderate right pneumothorax.3.5 weeks following vats lobectomy, this is concerning for an air-leak, though the site cannot be determined on this study.right third interspace anterolateral chest wall defect (2:31) likely reflects prior chest tube tract.unremarkable appearance of the bronchial stump status post right upper lobectomy.numerous hypoattenuating liver lesions, incompletely evaluated on this study.if clinically indicated and not performed elsewhere, these can be further evaluated with ultrasound or mri.

text: there are bilateral pleural effusions, greater on the right than on the left.there is adjacent compressive atelectasis bilaterally, also more prominent at the right base.there is a diffuse, mild hazy ground glass opacity throughout the lung parenchyma, but no focal airspace opacities are appreciated.the central airways are patent bilaterally.no evidence of mucus plug or other obstructive lesion is seen.an endotracheal tube is seen, with its tip approximately 6.5 cm above the carina.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.a nasogastric tube is seen, coursing below the diaphragm.a left subclavian central venous catheter is seen with its tip in the superior vena cava.a second, larger catheter, presumably the pa line is seen coursing from the right internal jugular, and also terminating with its tip at the junction of the superior vena cava and right atrium.in the posterior left upper lobe, there is a pleurally based soft tissue density measuring 1.8 x 0.8 cm, which may represent a focal area of pleural thickening, but a focal infectious process cannot be entirely excluded, and attention should be paid to this area on followup examination.there is extensive atherosclerotic disease of the thoracic aorta, with extensive calcification, but no evidence of dilatation or aneurysm.limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate an incompletely evaluated low- attenuation lesion within the left lobe of the liver measuring roughly 5 x 4.5 cm.it is unclear whether this represents an area of heterogeneous perfusion or a focal low attenuation mass lesion, or postoperative change.further evaluation is recommended when the patient's condition stabilizes.osseous structures are unremarkable.surgical clips are seen in the anterior abdominal wall.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.bilateral pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis, greater on the right than on the left.bilateral increased mild ground glass haziness with mild cardiomegaly may be indicative of congestive failure.low attenuation area within the liver is incompletely evaluated on the ct of the chest.further evaluation is recommended when the patient's condition stabilizes.1.8 cm left upper lobe pleurally based nodular soft tissue density most likely represents pleural reaction, but attention on followup is recommended.

text: despite two attempts, the bolus remains somewhat suboptimal; however, there is no filling defect within the central pulmonary arteries.evaluation of the subsegmental branches of the pulmonary arterial system is somewhat limited but no definite thrombus is appreciated.there is extensive consolidation involving the posterior aspect of the right upper lobe as well as the posterior aspects of the lower lobes bilaterally, right worse than left.these findings are consistent with either aspiration or multifocal pneumonia.the thoracic aorta is not optimally opacified for evaluation for dissection but is normal in course and caliber.limited imaging through the upper abdomen demonstrates no abnormalities.no focal osseous abnormalities.
summary: suboptimal study, however no pulmonary embolism identified.consolidation in the right upper lobe and bilateral lower lobes.findings consistent with either aspiration or multifocal pneumonia.findings discussed with covering resident, dr.___ ___, after the study.

text: punctate subpleural right lower lobe lung nodules, 4:186, 199 are stable since ___, but another punctate nodule, 4:206, may be new.a punctate ground-glass left upper lobe nodule, 4:70 is unchanged since ___, but can be located on the scan from ___.a punctate subpleural nodule in the right upper lobe, incorrectly localized in the right middle lobe on the ___ ___ report, is stable since that time, 4:132, as is a lesion close to the minor fissure but also probably in the upper lobe, 4:145.another perifissural punctate nodule in the left lower lobe, 4:180, is also stable since ___.there are no new nodules in the left lung.central lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged by size criteria and there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.this study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, but shows there is no adrenal mass.there are no bone findings suspicious for malignancy.
summary: there is only one new punctate lung nodule, small enough to have been present but not appreciated on prior imaging.the remainder of a handful of punctate lung nodules all stable since ___.subpleural location of all of these nodules and their stability argue for a benign etiology, rather than metastasis.all in all, i think the likelihood of intrathoracic malignancy is low, but six month followup chest ct is recommended.

text: the thyroid gland is enlarged with multiple hypodense nodules, the largest in the left lobe measuring 2.8 x 2.2 cm, stable since the prior study.coarse calcifications are seen in the right thyroid lobe.the heart is normal in size, without pericardial effusion.the mediastinal great vessels are unremarkable, except for mild aortic atherosclerosis limited to the arch and descending thoracic aorta.the pulmonary arteries are unremarkable.multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes including a 11 mm right lower paratracheal, 9 mm left lower paratracheal (3:24) and left infrahilar lymph nodes measuring 7 mm (3:36), are either new or slightly enlarged since the prior study.the patient is status post right pneumonectomy, with mild decrease in the loculated air-fluid collection in the pneumonectomy bed since ___.a persistent linear track of air leading from the main bronchial stump to this collection, suggesting patent bronchopleural fistula (3:28) is unchanged.the major airways are patent.multifocal centrilobular ground-glass nodular opacities seen throughout the left lung, are worrisome for infection or aspiration of secretions from the right pneumonectomy cavity.in addition, more focal well-defined solid nodules including a 2-mm left upper lobe (5:64), 3-mm subpleural left upper lobe (5:148), a 7-mm partially spiculated left lower lobe (5:182), and 2-mm left lower lobe (5:203) are either new or more conspicuous since the prior study (accurate comparison is difficult given the lack of thin section imaging and prior comparison cts from an outside hospital).a 3-mm subpleural left lower lobe nodule (5:260) is larger since the prior study.no left pleural effusion is seen.this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic assessment, except to note a stable 16 x 12 mm left adrenal nodule (3:63) with (low attenuation on prior ct) consistent with an adrenal adenoma.additional small left paraaortic lymph nodes measuring up to 10 mm (3:68) are similar.a poorly defined subtle hypodensity seen in segment ivb of the liver (3:50), not completely assessed in this study.at the level of the diaphragm, an enlarged left para-aortic lymph node measuring 18 x 11 mm (3:57) is larger since the prior study, 15 x 12 mm.
summary: interval decrease in the amount of air-fluid collection in the right pneumonectomy bed, with a linear track of air extending from the bronchial stump, worrisome for a persistent bronchopleural fistula.new centrilobular ground-glass opacities in the entire left lung, worrisome for infection versus aspiration.multiple left pulmonary nodules including a spiculated 7-mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodules are either new or more conspicuous since the prior study and are worrisome for either infection or slowly growing neoplasm.mild interval increase in the mediastinal hilar adenopathy.recommended short interval follow up in three months.

text: there is no intraluminal filling defect from the level of the main pulmonary artery to the subsegmental pulmonary arteries.the patient is intubated and an ng tube is present.there are two left- sided chest tubes seen within the left posterior costophrenic angle.there is small left pneumothorax and a small left effusion.there is partial consolidation of the left lower lobe air bronchograms.there are no pulmonary nodules.there is a left pleural rind, likely related to the previously described embyema.there are scattered areas of ground glass opacity within the right lung.there are several non- pathologically enlarged subcarinal lymph nodes.there is no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.reformatted images confirmed the above findings.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.consolidation of the left lower lobe, consistent with left lower lobe pneumonia.two left-sided chest tubes and small residual left pneumothorax.

text: within the bilateral pulmonary arteries, there are multiple filling defects consistent with pulmonary emboli.emboli within the right upper lobe branches, right middle lobe branches and right lower lobe branches are identified.in addition, emboli in the left upper lobe branches and left lower lobe branches are identified.the lingular branches remain patent.there is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.

text: posterior mediastinal hematoma extends into the prevascular space most likely related to complex thoracic spine injuries which will be described subsequently.there is no definite evidence of an acute aortic injury.a small crescent of mediastinal air is noted laong the descending aorta (2:28) the heart and great vessels appear unremarkable and there is no evidence of pericardial or pleural effusion.scattered atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications are noted.lung windows reveal a tiny anterior right pneumothorax.subpleural blebbing is noted at the lung apices and there is bilateral dependent.
summary: complex unstable fractures at t3 and t4 with severe abrupt angulation of the canal highly worrisome for underlying cord injury.mri will be persued on an emergent basis to further evaluate.a superior endplate fracture of l1 with demonstrates slight posterior propulsion of a frgament.mediastinal hematoma likely originates from spinal fractures with no definite aortic injury identified.correlate clinically.small focus of mediastinal air as described.tiny right pneumothorax.manubrial, right clavicle, and superior rib fractures as described.findings discussed with trauma team immediately following study.

text: there is mild centrilobular emphysema seen throughout the lungs.no nodules or mass lesions are seen.there are small bilateral layering pleural effusions, left greater than right.there is dense calcification of the three coronary arteries.there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the airways are patent without endoluminal mass lesion.the cardiac size is enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.
summary: patient is status post endovascular repair of descending thoracic aortic aneurysm, with persistent inferior attachment site endoleak.there has been interval increase in size of the aneurysm at the site of the endoleak from 4.3 x 5.4 cm on ___, to 4.5 x 5.9 cm.coils from attempted intravascular treatment are seen adajcent to the endoleak site.stable appearance to remote infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm repair via dacron graft.interval development of severe hydronephrosis and cortical atrophy of the right kidney which is fed from the true lumen.as the left kidney is fed from the partially thrombosed false lumen, repair and attempted conservation of the right kidney is recommended.findings communicated to ___ ___, rn at pager ___ at the time of dictation.

text: the heart and great vessels are normal.there is no mediastinal, axillary, or hilar lymphadenopathy.imaged portions of the upper abdomen are normal.airways are patent to subsegmental levels bilaterally.the lungs are clear.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.soft tissue structures reveal a faint asymmetry of the right medial pectoralis major in the right upper paramedian chest (602a:32).there is no evidence of abnormal enhancement or ing fluid collection.the subjacent ribs, cartilage and sternum appear normal.overall, this area is unchanged from comparison osh ct study from ___.

text: a pigtail catheter is seen at the right lung base.there is trace residual pleural effusion.small locules of intrapleural gas are present.there is patchy opacity at the left base, possibly re-expansion edema, hemorrhage or infection.there is minimal atelectasis at the left base.no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar adenopathy is present.the heart size is normal.there is no pericardial effusion.the thyroid gland is unremarkable.in the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, marked heterogeneity of the liver is compatible with known liver laceration.

text: a left-sided port is seen with tip terminating in the proximal right atrium.filling defect within the right main pulmonary artery has markedly decreased compared to ___ and is relatively unchanged compared to ___.there are no enlarged mediastinal or axillary lymph nodes.trace bilateral pleural effusions.a 1.6 x 1.0 cm right thyroid lobe nodule is unchanged.a 2.2 x 1.4 cm cardiophrenic node is stable.lung windows mild emphysema.again seen are multiple nodules in both lungs representing metastatic disease.these have increased in size and number compared to the prior examination.for example, a right middle lobe pulmonary nodule (series 2, image 67) measures 13 x 13 mm and previously measured 8 x 7 mm.a lingular nodule measures 14 x 13 mm and previously measured 12 x 11 mm.the largest pulmonary nodule abuts the right inferior pulmonary vein and measures 26 x 18 mm, previously measuring 25 x 16 mm.tiny pulmonary nodules in both lungs are new.a large left hepatic mass and multiple liver metastases are incompletely evaluated.an ivc filter is partially visualized.there is a splenic granuloma.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic foci.

text: bilateral small pleural effusions with pleural thickening and small atelectasis are noted.there are bibasilar patchy atelectasis.otherwise, there is no consolidation noted.the main trunk of the pulmonary artery measures 37 mm in diameter, which may represent pulmonary artery hypertension.in the contrast enhanced study, there is a delay of contrast enhancement, with extensive ________ in the left subcutaneous regions.the narrowing of the middle left subclavian vein is noted where it enters the left thorax.small mediastinal lymph nodes are noted, some of which are calcified.the patient has coronary artery calcification.
summary: bilateral small pleural effusion with pleural thickening and atelectasis.there is no consolidation in the lung fields.the main trunk of the pulmonary artery is enlarged in size.this may represent the patient pulmonary hypertension.there is a delay of contrast enhancement, with extensive ________.the narrowing of the medial portion of the left subclavian artery is suspected.

text: there is no significant axillary lymphadenopathy.there is diffuse soft tissue infiltration of the mediastinum.this is nonspecific in appearance and likely represents conglomerate lymphadenopathy.additional consideration would include diffuse mediastinal fibrosis.an mri could be performed to better characterize this finding.the esophagus is distended in the superior mediastinum with some debris.this may be related to the known web at this location.however, some asymmetric soft tissue thickening is seen on the left side and a followup barium swallow is recommended.the contrast bolus was optimally timed for evaluation of the pulmonary arteries.no intraluminal defect is seen to suggest pulmonary embolus.the heart is enlarged.noted is asymmetric dilatation of the right atrium and right ventricle.the right atrium actually indents upon the right pulmonary veins.this suggests the presence of right sided heart failure.additionally reflux of contrast material is seen into the hepatic veins.there is no pericardial effusion.there are no pleural effusions.the lungs demonstrate moderate centrilobular emphysema that is asymmetric, worse in the right lung.there is right lower lobe bronchiectasis.there is also right lower lobe linear opacity felt to represent scar.the imaged portion of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.the descending thoracic aorta is ectatic and is at the upper limits of normal in caliber measuring 3 cm.
summary: no ct evidence of pulmonary embolus.cardiomegaly with marked right chamber enlargement, particularly the right atrium, which compresses the right inferior pulmonary vein.this is also seen in conjunction with reflux of contrast material into the hepatic veins.note is also made of a relatively diminutive left atrium, enlarged right ventricle, and marked left ventricular wall thickness.correlative cardiac echo is recommended.diffuse soft tissue infiltration of the mediastinum.this is worrisome for neoplastic infiltration.less likely consideration would include mediastinal fibrosis (but this entity usually demonstrates calcification).better differentiation between these two entities could be obtained utilizing mri, which often shows characteristic low signal intensity on t1 and t2 in the setting of fibrosis.proximal esophageal dilatation within the superior mediastinum likely related to the patient's known web at that location; however, some asymmetric apparent wall thickening is seen and correlative barium swallow may be helpful to more fully evaluate this region.right lower lobe bronchiectasis.moderate asymmetric centrilobular emphysema with right lung being most effected.linear opacity right lung base felt to represent scar.

text: a left-sided chest tube terminates near the cardiophrenic angle with a small to moderate left pneumothorax, decreased compared to prior.there is moderate left lower lobe atelectasis and a previously noted small left apical contusion is less conspicuous today.a 4- mm nodular density at the left apex (2:7) is not identified on the prior study.there is right lower lobe atelectasis and a small right effusion which is new.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no evidence for pericardial effusion.minimal scattered atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications are noted.a right central venous catheter terminates in the right atrium.
summary: no evidence for intrathoracic or abdominopelvic abscess.the sequela of high-grade traumatic liver injury is reidentified with high-density fluid within the lacerations, around the liver, and in the pelvis, consistent with blood products.decreased size of now small-to-moderate left pneumothorax with small right pleural effusion noted.4 mm left apical lung nodule not identified on prior and may be a post traumatic sequlae.in the absence of significant risk factors (ie smoking) or history of malignancy, no follow- up is needed.if these risk factors or history exist, consider 1 year follow-up chest ct.

text: there are post-surgical changes from laminectomy and posterior fusion in the lower cervical/upper thoracic spine.there is a mildly rim-enhancing fluid collection in the inferior posterior neck, incompletely imaged.tracheostomy tube is in satisfactory position.there is trace left pleural fluid.there is no right pleural effusion or pericardial effusion.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes by size criteria.there is a probable dependent atelectasis bilaterally.there are no focal nodules or masses.the central airways are patent.

text: assessment for pulmonary embolus is limited due to suboptimal opacification of the pulmonary arteries.there is no evidence of saddle embolus or lobar pulmonary embolus.some of the segmental pulmonary artery branches can also be seen, but only the proximal portion.distal segmental and subsegmental branches are not well assessed.there is no evidence of right heart strain.there is plate-like atelectasis in the left lung base, otherwise, the lungs show no consolidation concerning for pneumonia.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary adenopathy by size criteria.coronary artery calcifications are redemonstrated at the bifurcation of the left main artery.the enlargement of the pulmonary artery to 3.9 cm suggests underlying pulmonary hypertension.the ascending aorta is in the upper limits of normal in size for female patient, measuring 3.6 cm in diameter.the right mediport tip terminates at the superior cavoatrial junction.the left brachiocephalic vein is extremely attenuated and no contrast is seen within its lumen, indicating chronic thrombosis.there is opacification of multiple collateral left chest wall vessels including intercostal veins which drain into the azygous vein, and internal mammary veins.there is filling of the svc from the right internal mammary vein inferiorly; the patency of the superior portion of the svc is not assessed.a spinal nerve stimulator lead terminates within the posterior spinal canal at the level of t6-t7.apparent abandoned lead in the right posterior subcutaneous soft tissues is unchanged.coarse calcification in the right breast tissue is also unchanged.

text: as noted on the prior examination, there is extensive pulmonary contusion involving the left lower lobe with at least three different foci of discrete pulmonary lacerations, predominantly in the anterior basal segment of the left lower lobe.a medially directed chest tube is noted within the inferior aspects of the major fissure, with the tip lying adjacent to the mediastinum between the superior and inferior pulmonary veins.minimal residual pneumothorax is noted within the inferior recesses of the major fissure and in the anterior basal left hemithorax.a small residual hemothorax is identified layering dependently in the chest as well.the right lung is clear without consolidation, edema, or effusion.no suspicious pulmonary nodules or masses seen.minimal dependent microatelectasis is noted.the aorta is normal in contour, caliber, and course.the heart is normal in size with no pericardial effusion.soft tissue attenuation in the anterior mediastinum is likely residual thymus, given patient's age.the major thoracic airways are widely patent.the esophagus images normally.there is no pneumomediastinum.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.the bronchi are patent to the subsegmental level, though there is significant tracheomalacia.in the tracheo-esophageal space, there is soft tissue thickening, likely lymphadenopathy.there are multiple areas of consolidation throughout all lobes of the lungs, predominantly in the superior portion of the left lower lobe and apical portion of the right upper lobe.smaller foci of consolidation are seen within the right middle lobe and lingula.there is a moderate-sized right pleural effusion, layering dependently, measuring simple fluid density.there is also a smaller left- sided pleural effusion layering dependently and extending into the major fissure, also measuring simple fluid density.a punctate calcification is noted at the left lung base, likely a granuloma.a prominent prevascular lymph node is noted anterior to the aortic arch measuring 9 mm in short axis.there are other small mediastinal lymph nodes including a 7-mm left prevascular lymph node, 6-mm precarinal lymph node, and a prominent subcarinal lymph node which is not easily distinguished from the esophagus.probable hiatal hernia, incompletely visualized, is noted.there are dense calcifications within the native coronary arteries, particularly the lad and its branches.aortic valve calcifications are noted.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart is moderately enlarged.median sternotomy wires and cabg clips are noted.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic assessment.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.there are no bone findings of malignancy.multilevel degenerative changes are noted throughout the thoracic spine.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism within the main or segmental pulmonary arteries.evaluation of the subsegmental arteries is somewhat limited due to motion.there is moderately extensive atherosclerotic calcification within the lad and aorta as well as calcifications within the aortic valve leaflets and mitral valve annulus.lymph node enlargement measures up to 1.3 cm in the left hilus, 0.8 cm subcarinal, and 1.1 cm in the right hilum.increase soft tissue / adenopathy in the anterior mediastinum causing compression of left brachiocephalic ans svc.centrilobular emphysema is severe.large nonhemorrhagic pleural effusion layers posteriorly with complete collapse of the right lower lobe.smaller left pleural effusion is accompanied by extensive ground-glass opacity with patchy areas of subpleural consolidation in the left lower lobe concerning for infection and edema.the trachea and main stem bronchi are patent.right- sided pacemaker leads terminate in the right atrium and ventricle.markedly enhancing structure within segment via of the liver (3:131) is related to narrowing of the svc (also seen to extend into the left brachiocephalic vein) with prominent collaterals along the anterior chest wall.there are no bone findings of malignancy.
