text: there are multiple segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli involving all lobes of the lung.clot burden is extensive.there is mild enlargement of the right atrium, suggesting right heart strain.the aorta is of normal caliber with no evidence of dissection.heart size is normal with minimal pericardial fluid.there is a fluid collection extending retrosternally along the anterior mediastinum, measuring approximately 5.7 trv x 1.3 ap x 6.0 cc in dimension which may simply be postoperative fluid, though infection cannot be excluded.the sternal wires are intact and there is no evidence of sternal dehiscence.there is a clear fat plane between this fluid collection and the great vessels.extensive coronary artery calcifications and multiple cabg grafts are noted.there is a moderate left-sided non- loculated pleural effusion with associated atelectasis, within normal limits given the patient's post-cardiac surgery status.there are peripheral ground- glass opacities within the anterior right upper lobe which are nonspecific but may represent infectious or inflammatory etiology.no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, axillary, or hilar lymph nodes.this exam is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic assessment.the visualized portions of the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.prominent confluent anterior osteophytosis of the mid-thoracic spine is noted.
summary: extensive bilateral pulmonary emboli with suggestion of right heart strain.findings were posted to the ed dashboard at the time of the exam.retrosternal fluid collection, which may simply be postoperative fluid, though infection cannot be excluded.no evidence of sternal dehiscence.moderate-sized left pleural effusion with associated atelectasis.

text: there is no central, segmental or subsegmental filling defect to suggest a pulmonary embolus.the thoracic aorta appears normal.the chest tube in the left hemithorax is in similar position.enhancing pleural rim is again seen consistent with patient's known mesothelioma.the amount of pleural fluid appears unchanged.the complete collapse of the left lower lobe and the atelectasis in the left upper lobe look slightly worse.the ill-defined ground-glass opacities in the right upper lobe are minimally larger, the largest node now measuring 15 x 14 mm compared to 13 x 12 on prior, (3, 16).the heart is unremarkable.the previous effusion is not as well seen.the subcarinal nodal mass is 38 x 14 mm (3, 49) compared to 34 x 12 on prior.the margins of the para-aortic soft tissue density adjacent to the esophagus are less well defined, but similar in size to prior at 19 x 20 mm (3.78) compared to 21 x 14 mm on prior.as this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, the hypodensities in the liver and spleen are not as well seen as on prior.please refer to mr for further detail.
summary: no evidence of pe or aortic dissection.no change in extensive pleural masses consistent with known mesothelioma, pleural effusion slight worsening of atectasis of the left lung.

text: there is no evidence of aortic dissection or other acute vascular abnormality.there is no extravasation of contrast.the left ventricle is enlarged.there is prominent fat within the upper mediastinum.multiple small lymph nodes are seen in the prevascular, pretracheal, and subcarinal region.one of the subcarinal lymph nodes measures 1 cm in short axis diameter.no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy is identified.there is bilateral emphysematous enlargement of the air spaces, predominantly of the upper lobes.a sub-cm left upper lobe lung nodule is present.there is a small left pleural effusion and bibasilar atelectasis.the visualized dome of the liver, gallbladder, and superior portion of the spleen are normal in appearance.the soft tissue and osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of aortic dissection or other acute vascular pathology of the chest.left ventricular enlargement.emphysema, primarily upper lobe.multiple prominent lymph nodes within the mediastinum, including a 1 cm subcarinal lymph node.this finding is nonspecific.a sub-cm peripheral lung nodule is seen within the left upper lobe.six month interval reevaluation by chest ct is recommended to confirm stability.

text: a heterogeneous lobualated left thyroid lobe is enlarged to 3.7 x 2.6 cm.the pulmonary arteries are patent to the subsegmental level.the aorta and great vessels show extensive atherosclerosis .several borderline enlarged mediastinal nodes include a right paratracheal and an ap window node.extensive coronary artery calcification as well as post cabg.cardiomegaly is moderate.there is no pericardial effusion.bilateral effusions are moderate with left relaxation atelectasis and right atelectasis versus consolidation noted.the imaged upper abdomen including the liver and spleen appear unremarkable except to note a 3 mm gallstone without evidence of cholecystitis.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.moderate bilateral effusions and atelectasis.large lobulated left thyroid.recommend correlation with ultrasound.right lower lobe atelectasis versus pneumonia.

text: there is no significant axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.noted within the anterior mediastinum at the level of the ascending aorta is soft tissue density with complete obliteration of the normal fat in this location.this appearance extends inferiorly to the level of the zyphoid where open sternal wound is identified.these are related to mediastinitis.no focal organized fluid collection is appreciated.the heart is not enlarged.the lung windows demonstrate moderate centrilobular emphysema within the upper lung zone predominance.within the superior segment of the right lower lobe a calcified granuloma is identified in a subpleural location.additional pulmonary nodules are seen.specifically within the superior segment of the right lower lobe a triangular ground-glass nodule is identified.additionally within the left lower lobe within the lateral segment two 3 mm pulmonary nodues are identified without calcification.lastly a 2nd noncalcified 2-3 mm nodule is identified within the superior segment of the right lower lobe.within the imaged portion of the upper abdomen noted is pneumobilia.there is also some focal prominence of the distal common bile duct of uncertain etiology.correlation with abdominal ct could be performed.there is also unusual cortical enhancement of the visualized inferior pole of the left kidney.this could be related to the contrast bolus timing.again further attention could be paid to the left kidney during ct scan of the abdomen.the skeletal structures demonstrate no suspicious or sclerotic foci.again noted is the open median sternotomy wound at the most inferior aspect.
summary: findings concerning for mediastinitis with inflammatory change in the retrosternal region, as described above.the open median sternotomy wound is seen at the inferior aspect.multiple pulmonary nodules seen in both lungs, some of which are calcified.the noncalcified pulmonary nodules are nonspecific but may reflect noncalcified granulomas related to prior granulomatous disease.however, given the patient has emphysema followup in ___ months could be performed to insure stability.pneumobilia with focal dilatation of the distal common bile duct of uncertain etiology.these findings were communicated to the ordering team taking care of this patient.

text: no filling defect is noted within the main pulmonary artery and its branches to suggest pulmonary embolism.no acute aortic pathology is noted, however, the aorta is diffusely calcified.no pericardial effusion is noted.the heart is moderately-to-severely enlarged.there is biatrial enlargement with the reflux of the contrast material into the ivc and the hepatic veins.diffuse calcifications of the coronary arteries are also visualized.moderate right and small left pleural effusions are noted.moderate bibasilar atelectasis is visualized.there is moderate centrilobular emphysema is noted.
summary: status post aortobiiliac bypass with the aneurysm of the infra- renal aorta measuring 6.8 x 5.5 cm.mild haziness around the anastomotic site and the presence of hyperdense free fluid around the liver raise the possibility of contained aneurysm rupture at the site of anastomosis.no definite evidence of leak was noted at the time of scanning.complete thrombosis of both iliac limbs of the aorto- biiliac stent.severe biatrial enlargement with signs of severe right heart failure.no pulmonary embolism.moderate right pleural effusion and small left pleural effusion and moderate bibasilar atelectasis.multicystic atrophic right kidney.striated nephrogram, left kidney may be due to heart failure or renal disease.

text: as compared to the previous examination from ___, the soft tissue mass in the mediastinum that carries hypoattenuation center has considerably grown.the lesion is now extending to the right in the supra- aortic area and above.the tumor now ranges up to the thoracic inlet and encases the supra-aortic vessels and the aortic arch.several hypoattenuation areas in the mass have newly occurred, but there is no cavitation.the mass has a maximum diameter of 8 cm.there is newly occurred pleural effusion.the size of the pre-existing paraaortic lymph nodes has slightly increased.there is newly occurred small bilateral effusion.right basal dependent atelectasis, subtle parenchymal scarring.post-infectious scar at the bases of the middle lobe.
summary: interval progression of the large mediastinal mass has considerably increased in size since the previous examination of ___.newly occurred pericardial effusion.newly occurred pleural effusions.mild increase in size of pre-existing paraaortic lymph nodes.

text: the mediastinal great vessels are intact and there is no evidence of mediastinal hematoma.the heart size and shape is normal.there is no pericardial effusion.there are no pleural effusions or pneumothorax.no lymphadenopathy.there are no nodules, masses, or consolidations within the lungs.bibasilar dependent atelectasis noted.
summary: no acute traumatic injuries of the chest, abdomen, or pelvis.soft tissue lesion centered at the right l4 exitting nerve root with expansion of the neral foramen.findings are most compatible with a neurofibroma or schwannoma.recommend nonemergent mri to further assess.bilateral l5 spondylolysis.

text: this examination is unchanged from that completed earlier on the same date, with no evidence of aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism to the segmental level.subsegmental branches are poorly opacified and are degraded by respiratory motion.heart and great vessels appear unremarkable.no pathologically enlarged central or axillary lymph nodes are present.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.left lower lobe calcified granuloma is noted with the lungs appearing otherwise clear.included portion of the upper abdomen appears unremarkable.unenhanced images display contrast within the renal collecting system from prior exam.a few non-enlarged left hilar and left paratracheal calcified lymph nodes are again noted.
summary: no evidence of aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism.prior granulomatous insult evident by calcified nodules and lymph nodes.

text: there has been interval intubation, with the tip of the endotracheal tube just distal to the thoracic inlet.nasogastric tube is identified.the airways are patent to the segmental level.again identified are multiple borderline mediastinal lymph nodes which have not changed in size and appearance from the prior study.extensive coronary artery calcification is again seen.there is no pericardial effusion.there are moderately sized bilateral pleural effusions, with small loculated components, slightly increased in size on the left.throughout both lung fields, there is patchy, asymmetric ground glass opacity with multifocal areas of pulmonary consolidation, which again is most prominent in the upper lobes.there is preserved aeration in the extreme apex of the left lung and isolated segments of the right lower lobe.there remains mildly dilated bronchi within both lower lobes.no pneumothorax is identified.no pulmonary nodules or masses are identified.overall, the parenchymal consolidation looks slightly worsened, especially in the left lung base.the aorta and great vessels are unremarkable.contrast flows normally through the main pulmonary artery, to its segmental branches without evidence of intraluminal thrombus or emboli.the subsegmental levels are difficult to evaluate due to extensive parenchymal consolidation.no obstructing mass is identified.bone windows demonstrate mild degenerative changes but no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.slight increase in bilateral pleural effusions.persisting diffuse ground glass opacity with multifocal parenchymal consolidation in an asymmetric pattern.the parenchymal consolidation appears slightly worse, especially in the left base, and the differential continues to include diffuse multifocal pneumonia, ards, and less likely asymmetric congestive heart failure.stable appearance of borderline enlarged mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.

text: the pulmonary arteries opacify without evidence for filling defects.the appearance of the aorta is stable from ___.the mediastinal lymph nodes are unchanged, none meeting pathologic criteria.ng tube is present within the stomach.the bronchi are patent to the subsegmental level.there is new right lower lobe atelectasis compared to ___.right upper lobe pleural thickening measuring 2 x 1 cm is unchanged.there is a left upper lobe pulmonary nodule, unchanged from ___, ___.
summary: new pericholecystic fluid/inflammatory change is most predominant between the gallbladder and pancreas.this is likely be the sequela of pancreatitis, but cholecystitis cannot be entirely excluded.clinical correlation is advised.persistent but improving 5 cm peripancreatic fluid collection below the body of the pancreas.new 10 x 2.4 cm right abdominal wall fluid collection that likely represents seroma, but hematoma or abscess cannot be excluded.these findings were discussed with the emergency department house staff caring for the patient at 4 a.m.on ___.

text: overall, the appearance of multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules is increased on this examination.for instance, a right lower lobe nodule currently measuring 9 mm x 8 mm (4:34), previously measured 3 x 3 mm.an additional right lower lobe lesion currently measuring 11 x 8 mm (4:40), previously measured 8 x 6.in the right upper lobe, a 4-mm lesion (4:26) measured approximately 1 mm previously.in the left lung, a left lower lobe lesion measuring 5 mm (4:39), previously measured 3 mm.an additional lesion measuring 8 mm in the left upper lobe (4:31), previously measured 6 mm.a 3-mm lesion in the left upper lobe (4:14) was barely visible on the prior examination and in the right upper lobe a 5-mm lesion (4:15), also measured approximately 1 mm from the prior exam.mediastinal lymph nodes including paratracheal and subcarinal nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement and appear similar to the prior examination.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.no axillary lymphadenopathy is seen.the airways are patent to the segmental level.no pleural effusions are present.
summary: progression of metastatic disease predominantly in the posterior right upper quadrant of the abdomen and in the bilateral lungs.

text: several mediastinal plates are seen; separation of the sternal halves is still seen, particularly in the inferior aspect.additionally, a new large presternal fluid collection is present, greatest in the space between the topmost and secondmost plates.in the superior and the inferior aspect of the sternotomy, it appears to communicate freely with the retrosternal space (series 2, image 40), though the amount of retrosternal fluid is markedly diminished since the ___ study.there is no significant stranding or gas within the fluid collection.the fluid collection is somewhat broad- based, measuring approximately 3.0 cm a-p, 13.0 cm transverse.small lymph nodes are noted in the mediastinum, the largest measuring 6 mm in the precarinal region (2:21).the pericardium is slightly thickened and irregular, which is compatible with history of recent pericardial intervention; the focus of pericardial calcification is unchanged.the heart is otherwise normal in size, with extensive coronary vascular calcifications.lungs are notable for mild centrilobular emphysema.additionally, interstitial reticular opacities, most pronounced in the lung periphery and at the bases, are slightly worse than the last examination.a 4-mm lung nodule is seen in the right upper lobe (3:28).bilateral pleural effusions are again seen; the right is slightly larger than the previous, the left slightly smaller; both remains small.there is associated compressive atelectasis.this study is not designed to examine the abdomen, however, multiple low- density lesions in the liver are similar to the previous study; several of these are too small to fully characterize; the largest is in the left lobe measuring 23 mm, with fluid attenuation characteristics.a left kidney lesion measuring 10 mm represents a cyst.the kidneys are incompletely imaged, but fullness of the right collecting system is again seen.no mass lesions are identified in the imaged portion of the spleen or adrenals.there is a small layering radiopaque gallstone.
summary: new large presternal fluid collection, with apparent communication with the retrosternal space, but amount of retrosternal fluid is small and has decreased since prior ct.findings could represent postoperative seroma, but infection should be considered in the appropriate clinical setting.no discrete abscess identified.bilateral pleural effusions, small, right greater than left.worsening mild peripheral and basilar reticular and ground glass opacities.given their short interval worsening, a drug reaction should be considered.nonspecific interstitial pneumonitis would be less likely to have such a rapid progression.layering radiopaque gallstones.a right kidney cyst and liver cyst, unchanged.other numerous liver lesions are too small to characterize, but similar in appearance to previous study.fullness of the right renal collecting system is incompletely imaged; clinical correlation and/or imaging correlation recommended.4-mm right lung nodule, for which followup is recommended in one year to document stability.

text: there is severe emphysema, as previously seen.a calcified granuloma is again noted in the right upper lobe (2:17).there are small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right which appear decreased from the prior ct of the chest.no pneumothorax is seen.there is moderate cardiomegaly with severe atherosclerotic disease as previously seen.the patient is status post median sternotomy and cabg with non-united sternum.no evidence of endobronchial lesion is seen.no lymphadenopathy is identified.a three-lead pacemaker is in standard position.no pericardial effusion is seen.there is mils smooth septal thickening suggestive of mild fluid overload.there is a small-to-moderate hiatal hernia.
summary: superficial contusion in the subcutaneous fat of the left flank.otherwise, no acute traumatic findings.emphysema.small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right, decreased from the prior ct of the chest, with mild volume overload.cholelithiasis.distended bladder with bladder diverticulum.consider foley catheterization if patient is unable to urinate.probable fatty liver.dfddp

text: there are no pleural effusions.there are no focal parenchymal consolidations.in the right lung field posteriorly there is a 3-mm nodule which is unchanged.there are several tiny pleural- based nodules which are unchanged.there is no significant mediastinal or hilar adenopathy.within the left lateral subcutaneous tissues near the axilla, there are two soft-tissue densities which measure approximately 1 cm.these are not changed compared with the prior examination.in addition, there is a new 1-cm nodule within the left axilla superior to the other subcutaneous nodules.the heart and great vessels are normal in appearance.there is no pericardial effusion.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.the previously-noted precarinal lymph node currently measures 6 mm compared with 1.1 cm on the prior study.
summary: there has been no change in the small lung nodules.there is a new left axillary nodal mass.there is no change in the left chest wall soft-tissue masses.there has been increase in size of the retroperitoneal adenopathy.

text: the great vessels of the chest opacify well without evidence of pulmonary embolism.the aorta is normal in caliber without focal aneurysm or dissection.dependent secretions are noted in the left mainstem bronchus.material in the airway causes complete occlusion of the left lower lobe bronchus and partial occlusion of the left upper lobe bronchus.there is resultant complete atelectasis of the left lower lobe.there is a combination of consolidation and atelectasis of the left upper lobe with only a small portion aerated.also noted is partial occlusion of the right lower lobe segmental bronchi.however, the right lung is nearly completely aerated with only basilar dependent atelectasis of the lower lobe.there are scattered small patchy areas of consolidation of the right lung.peripheral septal thickening of the right lung indicates a degree of interstitial edema.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.the patient is intubated with the endotracheal tube terminating in appropriate position in the mid trachea.a nasogastric tube terminates near the gastroesophageal junction with the side hole in the lower esophagus.the upper abdomen is included on the non-contrast series and demonstrates a 5- mm stone at the left ureteropelvic junction.there appears to be dilatation of the left renal collecting system but this appearance could also be seen with parapelvic cysts and is incompletely evaluated without contrast.
summary: no pumonary embolism.atelectasis of the left lower lobe and a mix of consolidation and atelectasis of left upper lobe.findings are consistent with aspiration and post- obstructive pneumonitis superimposed on left upper lobe pneumonia.small bilateral pleural effusions.interstitial edema.nasogastric tube in a high position with tip near the gastroesophageal junction and side hole in the lower esophagus.advancement suggested.5-mm left ureteropelvic junction stone may be obstructing but evaluation of the left kidney is limited as it was included only on the non-contrast series.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at 11:00 a.m.on ___.

text: the patient is intubated with the et tube in satisfactory position.the tip of the ng tube now terminates in the distal esophagus.the aorta, heart, and great vessels all appear normal.no mediastinal hematoma is present.a left-sided chest tube is present with the tip of the chest tube pressing upon the upper left mediastinum lobe (2:9).there is a very small residual left basilar pneumothorax.the right lung appears normal.the airways are clear.
summary: left-sided chest tube with small residual basilar pneumothorax.the tip of the chest tube abuts the upper mediastinum and could be withdrawn further.multiple areas of subcutaneous tissue, most notably at site of chest tube entry and in the left paraspinal musculature where there may be a small hematoma.within this area of possible hematoma, no active extravasation is identified.no evidence for injury to the solid organs, or bowel in the abdomen or pelvis.no leak of rectally administered contrast.findings were discussed with the surgical trauma service including dr.___ ___ at approximately 10:30 p.m.on ___ in person.

text: the thyroid gland is unremarkable.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria.multiple small lymph nodes are noted within the mediastinum the largest of which are prevascular lymph nodes measuring 8 mm in short axis (5:23).the heart and aorta are unremarkable.the pulmonary arteries are patent down to subsegmental level.no pericardial effusions are present.the airways are patent down to the subsegmental level as well.the lungs show bilateral paraseptal and centrilobular emphysema.target lesion 1 measures 7 x 11 mm (prior measuring 7 x 3 mm, 5:20).target lesion 3 measures 9 x 11 mm (5:22, prior measuring 6 x 13 mm).target lesion 2 measures 10 x 7 mm (5:21, prior measuring 10 x 12 mm).target lesion 4 measures 10 x 17 mm (5:26, prior measuring 10 x 18 mm).no effusions or consolidations are present.
summary: interval increase in the size of target lesion 1 and 3.no new lesions noted.

text: the heart is unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion.there is no hilar or mediastinal adenopathy, and no axillary or supraclavicular adenopathy.thyroid is homogeneous.the esophagus is normal.the trachea and central airways are patent to the subsegmental level, with no endobronchial lesions identified.there are small nonhemorrhagic pleural effusions, with associated dependent atelectasis, right greater than left.there is no parenchymal abnormality to suggest infection.there is a 1.5-mm perifissural nodule on the right (4:131), as well as a second 2.5-mm nodule in the right middle lobe (4:127).no further nodules or masses are identified.this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, except to note grossly unremarkable appearance of the visualized liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands.there are no lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions concerning for malignancy.
summary: two tiny pulmonary nodules, one in the right middle lobe measuring 2.5 mm and one adjacent to the right minor fissure, measuring 1.5 mm.given the known history of malignancy, 3 month follow-up is recommended.small nonhemorrhagic effusions with associated atelectasis.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the central, segmental and large subsegmental pulmonary vessels are normally opacified.the distal subsegmental pulmonary vessels are not well opacified, limiting evaluation.there is a small left pleural effusion with lobulated appearance of the pleural surface.background emphysema, centrilobular in nature is present.there are two areas of consolidation in the right lower and middle lobe.in comparison with multiple prior studies including the radiographs, this region has repeatedly been consolidated to varying degrees of severity.there is a 1.5 x 3.1 cm left lower lobe subdiaphragmatic opacity (3:56).although this could represent atelectasis, given high risk attention on followup is recommended.there is also associated multiple extrapleural lymph nodes present in bilateral paravertebral regions.a large lymph node is present in the right paravertebral region, measuring 2.9 x 1.5 cm (4:37).similarly, large lymph nodes present in the left posterior extrapleural space (4:41), measuring 1.2 x 2.5 cm.these are slightly smaller than the prior study; however, the morphology and associated right lung abnormalities are highly suspicious for a malignancy.right hilar lymph node measuring 1.5 x 2.5 cm is present.there is also a 1.1 cm precarinal lymph node.multiple other smaller subcentimeter lymph nodes are present in the paratracheal station.atherosclerotic aortic, coronary calcifications are present.the patient has had prior valvular replacement.there is no sizeable pericardial effusion.the imaged upper abdomen demonstrates left nephrectomy with lobular nodular soft tissue in the nephrectomy bed, unchanged since the prior study.although in the setting splenectomy, this could represent regenerating splenic tissue, however, local recurrence is not excluded.limited non-contrast evaluation of right kidney is unremarkable.the adrenals are normal in appearance.multilevel degenerative disease is present in the vertebral column without suspicious intraosseous lesions.
summary: rll and rml consolidation, given recurrence in the same region and associated retrocrural and extrapleural adenopathy, is suspicious for malignancy, correlation with either fdg pet or tissue sampling is recommended.unchanged lobulated left splenectomy bed soft tissues, could represent regenerated splenic tissue, however, local rcc recurrence is not excluded.patchy lll opacity, could be atelectasis, however, metastatis is not excluded and attention on followup is recommended.coronary and atherosclerotic aortic calcifications.no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic syndrome.

text: the patient is intubated with et tube tip 3 cm from the carina.there is no filling defect in the central, segmental or subsegmental pulmonary arteries to suggest a pulmonary embolus.there is no thoracic or aortic dissection.there is diffuse patchy opacity in the right upper lobe.there are bilateral pleural effusions, which appears somewhat decreased from prior study with adjacent atelectasis.there are no pulmonary nodules.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is a 10 x 8 mm ap window node.there are multiple small pretracheal nodes, which do not meet criteria for pathologic enlargement.the heart is unremarkable.
summary: interval development of peripancreatic fat and pancreatic necrosis involving part of the head, and the entire neck and body of the gland.the presence of an enhancing wall around the necrotic tissue is suggestive of pseudocyst formation.compressed but patent splenic vein and no evidence of pseudoaneurysm formation.focal opacities in the right upper lobe, which may represent patchy areas of pneumonia.interval improvement in the bilateral pleural effusions with some residual adjacent atelectasis.interval improvement in anasarca and ascitis probable fatty liver.findings discussed with dr.___ covering for dr.___ on the evening of the study.

text: non-contrast images demonstrate calcified atherosclerotic disease of the thoracoabdominal aorta.no gallstones or renal calculi.
summary: left lower lobe superior segment mass and a smaller left lower lobe spiculated-appearing lesion may represent synchronous or metachronous bronchogenic carcinomas or metastases in the proper clinical setting.metastatic necrotic-appearing lymph nodes in the right paratracheal region.right lower lobe superior segment 4 mm nodule likely represents a small metastasis.no lytic, blastic or aggressive-appearing osseous lesions are appreciated.important findings were discussed directly by radiology fellow on call dr.___ ___ ___ with dr.___ ___ at 7:30 p.m.on ___ via phone.

text: the pulmonary arteries are well opacified and patent to the subsegmental level.significant left atrial enlargement is noted.there is no pericardial effusion.note is made of mitral annular calcification as seen previously.there is no pathologic hilar, mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is a focus of inflammatory ground-glass opacity within the left upper lobe (3; 30) new compared with prior.there is a small right pleural effusion with adjacent compressive atelectasis.atelectasis is also seen in the left lung base as well as along the minor fissure.the central airways appear patent.while this exam is not tailored for the evaluation of infradiaphragmatic structures, note is made of hiatal hernia.there is abdominal ascites, better characterized on the patient's ct of the abdomen and pelvis.
summary: no pe.small right pleural effusion.abdominal ascites.significant left atrial enlargement.

text: the study is somewhat limited due to respiratory motion.the patient is status post intubation.again, note is made of filling defect in internal jugular vein, which can represent clot, unchanged compared to the prior study.again, note is made of increased number and the size of perivascular and mediastinal lymph node, measuring 1.6 cm in short axis in carina, and measuring 1.5 x 2.3 cm in subcarina, and 1.3 cm node in right hilum, slightly increased in right hilum and subcarina compared to the prior study.note is made of bilateral pleural effusion, slightly decreased in amount compared to the prior study.in the lung window, note is made of patchy opacities in bilateral lower lobes, slightly decreased in right lower lobe.again, note is made of peripheral patchy opacity in right upper lobe and superior segment of right lower lobe, unchanged compared to the prior study.underlying lung demonstrates diffuse bronchiectasis and traction bronchiolectasis, probably representing underlying interstitial lung disease.again, note is made of diffuse ground-glass opacity, with interlobular septal thickening, increased compared to prior study, representing edema or diffuse infection.the airways are patent, and there is no endobronchial lesion.in the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, no gross abnormalities are noted.there is no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion in skeletal structures.marked scoliosis is vacuum phenomena and degeneration is again noted.
summary: unchanged appearance of filling defect in internal jugular vein, probably representing clot.mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy as described above, slightly increased in size in right hilum and subcarina.slightly decreased bilateral pleural effusion.patchy consolidation in bilateral lower lobes, slightly decreased in right lower lobe, with persistent peripheral patchy opacity in right upper lobe and superior segment of right lower lobe in this intubated patient, multiple consolidative opacities are probably representing either multifocal pneumonia or ards.underlying lung shows diffuse lung disease with traction bronchiectasis and bronchiolectasis, probably representing interstitial lung disease such as ipf or nsip.increase of diffuse ground glass opacity with interlobular septal thickening, which can represent worsening of edema, or diffuse infection such as pcp or virus.or potentially, this can represent worsening of underlying interstitial lung disease.

text: similar to the prior study performed without contrast, there is a large anterior extrapleural collection in the right hemithorax.with the benefit of contrast, it is markedly heterogeneous with large areas of fluid attenuation, a high-attenuation fluid-fluid level, surrounding rim enhancement, and multiple foci of active extravasation of vessels.one of the larger foci of active extravasation is seen on series 2 image #74.this is at the level of a non-displaced transverse fracture of the distal sternal body.foci of active extravasation are also seen at slightly more cephalad levels including at the inferior margin of the second sternocostal junction and at the inferior margin of the first sternocostal margin all along the course of the right internal mammary artery.these are presumed extravasations off direct branches from that vessel, likely the proximal aspects of the corresponding intercostal vessels.a component of this large extrapleural hematoma extends along the retrosternal space anterior to the mediastinum and heart.a corresponding anterior mediastinal hematoma is also present.no aortic injury is identified.there is mass effect on the heart, specifically the anterior aspect of the heart, principally the right ventricle.in addition to the large extrapleural anterior hematoma, there is a relative large free-flowing dependent hemothorax with a hematocrit level layering posteriorly in the right hemithorax.the combination of both of these hematomas, results in significant mass effect on the underlying lobes of the right lung with compressive atelectasis seen both in the right upper, right middle and right lower lobes.a small effusion is identified on the left.there is calcification over the apex of the right lung, presumably along the visceral pleura.no pneumothorax is present.there are no focal consolidations or areas of pulmonary contusion identified.the study was acquired predominantly in expiratory phase with inward bowing of the posterior membrane of the trachea and the major bronchi.however, otherwise the major airways are widely patent.incidental note is made of an aortic origin of the left vertebral artery, an anatomic variant.the aorta otherwise is intact with normal contour, caliber and course.there is scattered calcified plaque seen at multiple levels.there is no apparent aortic injury.there is fullness in the supraclavicular space on the right.this is incompletely evaluated on this chest ct protocol.timing was not optimized for solid organ evaluation given the concern for vascular injury.however, grossly there are no discrete traumatic lesions of the solid abdominal organs of the upper abdomen.a focal curvilinear calcification in the right hepatic lobe likely is reflective of prior granulomatous insult.there is a high-attenuation focus in the most inferior tip of the right hepatic lobe.this is most reminiscent of a flash-filling hemangioma although focal nodular hyperplasia or adenoma may also be considered.gallbladder is present but otherwise unremarkable.bilateral kidneys enhance symmetrically.there are small cortical scars on both kidneys presumably due to prior infection.conceivably, these may reflect prior small infarcts as well.a 10 mm x 30 mm hypoattenuated lesion is identified anteriorly in the pancreatic body.this is incidental and not related to trauma.no pancreatic ductal dilatation is evident.the stomach and small bowel are largely collapsed.no wall thickening or dilatation is evident.a normal appendix is identified.there is scattered stool throughout the colon.similar to the chest, there is scattered calcified and non-calcified plaque of the abdominal aorta and major branch vessels.eccentric irregular plaque is identified at the bifurcation of the right common iliac artery.no pathologic lymphadenopathy is seen within the abdomen or pelvis.there is no free intraperitoneal fluid or air.the urinary bladder is markedly distended.there is an enlarged prostate.the enlargement of the prostate is relatively non-uniform with an irregular focus of enlargement centered at left of midline causing mass effect on the base of the bladder.there is no apparent invasion.however, given the relative morphology of the enlarged prostate, an underlying mass lesion such as prostate cancer cannot be excluded.seminal vesicles image normally.
summary: there is active extravasation of the medial branches of the right internal mammary artery into a large presumed extrapleural anterior right hemithorax hematoma.there is some element of tamponade of this hematoma and a portion of it does extend along the retrosternal space.there is minimal at this point mass effect on the underlying heart.no apparent aortic injury.no obvious cardiac injury; however, the evaluation for such is limited on ct.large layering hemothorax posteriorly in the right chest as well.small pleural effusion on the left.as above, a non-displaced transverse distal sternal body fracture.this coincidentally occurs at the site of the largest focus of extravasation detailed above.no evidence of acute solid organ injury in the abdomen or pelvis.there may have been prior infections or infarcts of the kidneys as detailed above.enlarged and irregularly shaped prostate.underlying prostate cancer cannot be excluded.appropriate workup after acute presentation is resolved, may be pursued.hypoattenuated lesion of the pancreas, nontraumatic in etiology.further evaluation after emergent conditon is addressed should be pursued with referral to pancreas center and likely abdominal mri (without contraindication).the emergent results of the study were immediately placed on the ed dashboard as a wet read.the study was also reviewed in person with surgical consult, dr.___ ___, of the trauma surgery team at approximately 9 p.m.

text: the heart, pericardium, and great vessels appear normal.there is no pericardial effusion.the aorta is of normal caliber.central airways are patent.there is no pathologic mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is no pleural effusion.no pneumothorax is seen.there is bibasilar atelectasis.the lungs are otherwise clear.

text: there is no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria.there is no pneumothorax.a left-sided central line can be seen with the tip within the distal superior vena cava.there are multiple patchy consolidations seen within the left lower lobe suggestive of either pneumonia or an aspiration pneumonitis.peribronchial ground glass opacities are seen in the lungs bilaterally, which may be due to infection with possible aspiration.additional note is made of bronchiectasis seen most prominently in the right lower lobe suggestive of longstanding underlying pulmonary inflammation.the heart is normal in size.there is no pericardial effusion.the et tube is seen with the tip 3.3 cm above the carina.the nasoenteric tube tip is within the body of the stomach and the side holes are distal to the gastroesophageal junction.there are numerous locules of air seen surrounding the ng tube just proximal to the gastroesophageal junction likely representing intraluminal air surrounding the ng tube; however, possibility of extraluminal air at this region cannot be ruled out.there is no overt evidence of any large pulmonary emboli however this study is not tailored to evaluate this.the airways are patent down to the subsegmental levels.
summary: numerous distended loops of small bowel with air-fluid levels with decompressed descending colon and sigmoid colon.a clear transition point is not seen, but obstruction at the level of the anastomosis is not excluded.it is not clear if there is a transition point seen at the anastomotic juncture at the site of the previous right-sided colectomy.these findings raise concern for either an evolving/partial small-bowel obstruction or ileus.left lower lobe consolidation which could represent pneumonia and/or aspiration pneumonitis.peribronchial ground glass opacities in the lungs bilaterally, which may be due to infection with possible aspiration.additional note is made of bronchiectasis seen most prominently in the right lower lobe suggestive of longstanding underlying pulmonary inflammation.serpiginous enhancing air and fluid collection deep within the floor of the pelvis concerning for a developing abscess.possible second collection extending along the right pelvis, difficult to discern if this connects with aforementioned collection as one.several locules of free air seen adjacent to the region of the upper pole of the right kidney.it is unclear if this is residual air or if this represents new free air.ascites.foley catheter appears coiled within the bladder and should be retracted several centimeters.thickened gastric antrum.these findings were discussed in detail with dr.___ at 8:30 p.m.on ___.

text: no filling defect is noted to suggest pulmonary embolism.the soft tissue windows do not demonstrate any pathologically enlarged central lymphadenopathy, the largest node is noted within the prevascular space and measures 10 mm.moderate bilateral pleural effusion is visualized, right greater than left, with reactive atelectasis.small amount of pericardial effusion is visualized.the aorta is severely calcified and calcification of the mitral annulus is also visualized.the coronary arteries also demonstrate severe calcification.the tracheostomy tube extends into the right mainstem bronchus.diffuse ground- glass opacities are noted at both lung bases and there is diffuse bronchovascular thickening and increased septal marking in some areas.there are also more focal areas of consolidative changes in both lung apices and the right lower lobe.the visualized portion of the upper abdomen demonstrates reflux of the contrast into the ivc consistent with cardiac dysfunction.the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands appear unremarkable.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.moderate bilateral pleural effusion, right greater than left with reactive atelectasis.diffuse ground-glass opacities at lung bases, increased interstitial markings and reflux of intravenous contrast into the ivc suggest cardiac dysfunction.trachestomy tube extends into the right mainstem bronchus.focal areas of consolidative changes in the lung apices and right lower lobe are suggestive of aspiration or pnuemonia.anterior dislocation of the left shoulder and left clavicular fracture.

text: in one week, there is a new area of infiltration in the right upper lobe.the patient was exhaling during the procedure which explains the change in attenuation in the lung parenchyma.in the right lung apex (3:9), again seen is a small cystic structure containing a tiny nodule with adjacent right posterior pleural thickening that has increased slowly over the last examinations on ___ and ___, ___.a 3.5mm left lower lobe nodule (3:39) is stable.as for the remainder of the abnormalities seen on this examination, there is essentially no change including severe fibrosis, traction bronchiectasis of both lungs predominantly in the mid and lower lung zones with microcystic honeycombing.the lung apices show similar subpleural fibrosis and large paraseptal bullae, more severe on the right than the left.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes are essentially unchanged since the ___ examination of ___, still ranging up to 5 mm in the right upper paratracheal, 8 mm in the right lower paratracheal, and 7 mm in subcarinal area.the heart size is not enlarged.atherosclerotic calcification is seen involving the coronary arteries, the left anterior descending artery.calcification of the aortic valve is also noted and is of unknown clinical significance.the enlarged pulmonary artery, 3.3 cm, indicates pulmonary hypertension.limited evaluation of the abdomen demonstrates no remarkable abnormality.multiple bilateral healed rib fractures and left clavicle are again noted.the bony structures do not show any lesions suspicious for malignancy and infection.
summary: new pneumonia, the right upper lobe, could be due to aspiration.chronic severe pulmonary fibrosis likely end-stage sarcoidosis.pulmonary arterial hypertension.possible small right upper lobe mycetoma.left lower lobe 3.5-mm lung nodule, warranting a ___ month ct followup examination, if appropriate clinically.

text: in the right lower lobe (2:22) is a 2.5 x 1.5 cm cystic structure with surrounding atelectasis, this could represent a traumatic pneumatocele, or a bleb with surrounding pulmonary contusion.there are multiple foci of patchy opacity in both lungs, most pronounced in the right middle lobe (2:19).there is also a focus of pulmonary contusion in the left lower lobe (2:23).there is no pneumothorax.there are no pleural effusions.the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels bilaterally.the heart appears normal without pericardial effusion.the aorta is normal in caliber without traumatic injury.there is no adenopathy.
summary: minimally displaced manubrial fracture.multiple pulmonary contusions, most prominent in the right middle lobe.in the right lower lobe, at the level of t6, is a cyst which could represent a lung laceration.stranding of the fat on the left lateral abdominal wall, incompletely visualized.recommend clinical evaluation for possible injury to the soft tissues at the site.no evidence for traumatic injury to the aorta, or solid intra- abdominal organs.these findings were discussed with the surgical resident, dr.___ at the time of study acquisition.

text: the patient is status post placement of a chest tube that enters laterally, courses anteromedially and then terminates posteriorly in the mid left hemithorax.there is an enhancing thick pleural rind in the left consistent with known mesothelioma.there is slight decrease in pleural fluid after placement of the chest tube.otherwise, there is little change, again with complete collapse of the left lower lobe and with atelectasis in the left upper lobe.in the right hemithorax again, ill-defined ground-glass opacities are noted in the right upper lobe, with the largest lesion measuring 12 x 13 mm (2:9).no pleural thickening or pleural effusion is seen on the right.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.again noted is a small pericardial effusion; note is again made of abutment of the thickened left pleural surface along the left pericardium.a subcarinal lymph node conglomerate is again noted, measuring 12 x 34 mm.a para-aortic soft tissue density at the esophageal hiatus is again noted, measuring 14 x 21 mm and possibly representing a lymph node.limited views of the abdomen again show several regions of hypodensity that are not fully characterized on the current study and were better characterized on the previous mr abdomen.three hyperdense lesions are unchanged in the spleen.a 14 x 22 mm nodule is again noted in the right adrenal gland.no region of bony destruction is seen concerning for malignancy.
summary: extensive left pleural rind, consistent with known metastatic mesothelioma.slight decrease in left pleural effusion since placement of chest tube.otherwise, little change in exam compared to ___.

text: a very large and heterogeneously hyperdense left pleural effusion is present, with internal hyperdense regions measuring up to 46 hounsfield units, consistent with hemothorax although infection and/or underlying neoplasm cannot be excluded.this is markedly increased in size since the ___ ct examination.this has resulted in compression-related atelectasis with likely superimposed consolidation of the left lower lobe (3:33) and left upper lobe (3:30).pleural calcifications are consistent with prior asbestos exposure.diffuse biapical ground glass opacity is improved from ___.bilateral emphysematous change again noted.a 6 mm nodular density in right upper lobe (3:18) may be slightly increased in size although motion limits assessment.there is a mild amount of dependent atelectasis.no right pleural effusion is present.there is no pneumothorax.mediastinal lymphadenopathy is redemonstrated, not significantly changed since the prior ct examination.the heart size is normal, and there is no pericardial effusion.the great vessels are patent.limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate normal-appearing liver, spleen, pancreas, stomach, adrenal glands, and the upper poles of both kidneys.
summary: large left high density pleural effusion, markedly increased in size since the ___ ct examination, consistent with hemothorax.cannot exclude superimposed infection or malignancy.severe compressive atelectasis of the left upper and lower lobes secondary to the large pleural effusion with possible superimposed consolidation.bilateral ground glass pulmonary opacities have improved since ___ ct.mediastinal lymphadenopathy, unchanged.right sided pulmonary nodule, possibly unchanged (motion limits evaluation of size on today's examination).short interval follow up in 3 months is recommended.

text: there are no significant axillary lymph nodes.there are multiple small ap window lymph nodes that do not meet ct criteria for pathology.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart is mildly enlarged.the aorta appears to be intact.the pulmonary artery is slightly enlarged measuring 2 cm, which may represent chronic pulmonary artery hypertension.clinical correlation is recommended.this is unchanged to ___.the pulmonary artery branches are patent.there are no filling defects which suggest pulmonary embolism.there are mild calcifications of the coronary arteries.the suggestion of enlargement of the left pulmonary artery as seen in the chest radiograph is likely due to atelectasis of left upper lobe posteriorly and superior segment of left lower lobe.the appearance of the pulmonary artery is unchanged compared to the prior study.examination of the lung windows again demonstrate paraseptal emphysema with multiple subpleural blebs.there is interval worsening of the atelectasis of the posterior aspect of the bilateral upper lobes and lower lobes.there is basically complete atelectasis of the bilateral lower lobes.most of the segmental branches, however, are patent with the exception of the superior segment of the left lower lobe where you can see an abrupt cut off..there are very small bilateral pleural effusions.there are minimal atelectasis in the right middle lobe.limited images of the upper abdomen do not demonstrate significant abnormality.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the apparent enlargement of the left pulmonary artery is secondary to the overlapping of the atelectasis of the posterior aspect of the left upper lobe and superior segment of the left lower lobe.interval worsening of bilateral atelectasis involving the posterior aspect of the upper lobes and the bilateral lower lobes.this is described above in detail.unchanged appearance of fractures of the thoracic spine.the aorta is intact.mildly enlarged main ___ be secondary to pulmonary artery hypertention.it is unchanged when compared to the prior study.

text: note is made of enlarged right supraclavicular lymph nodes, measuring 11 mm in short axis, corresponding to the finding of recent pet study.previously noted right paratracheal node has been decreased in size.note is made of small left hilar node, measuring 4 mm in short axis.coronary arteries are calcified.there is no evidence of pericardial or pleural effusion.again, note is made of mass at the ec junction, with circumferential thickening of lower esophagus, extending to the cardia of the stomach.the size of the mass has decreased compared to the study in ___.in the lung windows, again note is made of ill-defined opacity in the right lower lobe within azygoesophageal recess, measuring 2 x 1.4 cm in diameter, associated with surrounding patchy ground-glass opacities, overall unchanged compared to the recent pet study on ___; however, new compared to the study in ___.the appearance of the lesion may suggest pneumonia or infectious versus inflammatory process; however, in this patient with esophageal cancer, neoplastic process such as metastasis cannot be totally excluded.the upper portion of the lungs is clear.there is no endobronchial lesion.mucous secretion in trachea is noted.in the visualized portions of the upper abdomen, again note is made of fullness of left adrenal gland, unchanged compared to the prior studies.there is no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion in skeletal structures.
summary: increased size of right supraclavicular lymph nodes, measuring 11-13 mm in short axis, corresponding to the finding of recent fdg-pet, suggestive of metastasis from esophageal cancer.decrease in size of ec junction mass, with circumferential esophageal thickening, inferiorly extending to the cardia.persistent ill-defined patchy consolidative opacity in right lower lobe, measuring 2 x 1.4 cm in diameter, associated with surrounding ground-glass opacity, as noted in most recent prior fdg-pet study; however, new compared to the study in ___.the appearance may suggest pneumonia or other infectious versus inflammatory process; however, in this patient with esophageal cancer, neoplastic process such as metastasis cannot be excluded.please correlate with clinical symptoms, and please closely follow the lesion to confirm resolution.decreased size of previously noted right paratracheal node and celiac nodes.coronary artery calcification.

text: ground-glass airspace opacification in the right upper lobe, 3b:149.bilateral opacification at the lung bases, bibasilar, likely could be atelectasis; however, superinfection cannot be excluded.there are bilateral small pleural effusions.there is a right picc line in place terminating in svc.portion of the vp shunt is projecting over the right paramediastinal area.there is a high positioning of the right hemidiaphragm.there is tracheostomy in place.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum, hilum, or axilla according to ct size criteria.

text: the imaged thyroid gland is normal.the heart is normal with trace pericardial fluid, similar to prior.a right-sided central venous catheter terminates at the cavoatrial junction.supraclavicular and mediastinal lymphadenopathy has decreased compared to the prior study.for example, a precarinal node is 2.4 x 1.4 cm compared to prior when there was a large conglomerate of nodes measuring 5.8 x 3.9 cm.the great vessels are widely patent and the aorta is of normal course and caliber throughout.although this study was not optimized for evaluation for pulmonary embolus, there is no large pe.there are moderate-to-large bilateral nonhemorrhagic layering pleural effusions, which have increased compared to the prior study.there is associated complete collapse of the left lower lung and near complete collapse of the right lower lobe.there is no new nodule, mass, or consolidation in the aerated portion of the lungs.there is no pneumothorax.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, there is extensive aortocaval adenopathy which has decreased compared to the prior study.for example, at the level of the kidneys, a conglomerate of lymph nodes measures approximately 9.2 x 4.2 cm compared to 11.4 x 7.3 cm previously.the upper abdominal aorta is unremarkable and the visualized portions of the renal arteries, and the origin of the sma and celiac axis are well opacified.there is slight fullness of the bilateral collecting systems, which is incompletely evaluated.
summary: increased bilateral pleural effusions with complete collapse of the left lower lobe and near complete collapse of the right lower lobe.overall decrease in mediastinal and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy compared to the ct torso performed one week prior.

text: there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes.once again seen are stable small 5-6 mm prevascular, pretracheal nodes.calcification of the aorta as well as coronary arteries is noted and similar to the prior study.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no evidence of pericardial or pleural effusions.there are no pulmonary nodules.the airways are patent at least to the level of the subsegmental bronchi bilaterally.
summary: no focal liver lesions identified.mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation.biliary drains noted.no focal pulmonary nodules.stable splenomegaly.stable left renal calculi.nonobstructing.enlarged prostate.unchanged compared to previous study.

text: the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no evidence of segmental or subsegmental pulmonary embolism.there is no evidence of aortic dissection.mild atherosclerotic disease is noted in the aorta.there is moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly.there is no pericardial effusion.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are moderate-to-large bilateral simple pleural effusions.there are associated consolidations, slightly larger on the right than the left.small air bronchograms are noted in the left consolidation.these most likely represent atelectasis, though pneumonia cannot be completely excluded.there is no pneumothorax.in the left upper lobe, there is a 3-mm pulmonary nodule adjacent to a vessel (4, 30).a second 3-mm pulmonary nodule is also present in the left upper lobe (3, 31).a 7-mm ground-glass nodular opacity is also present in the left upper lobe (3, 36).this exam is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.within these limitations, the visualized portions of the liver and spleen are unremarkable.there are no concerning lytic or sclerotic bone lesions.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.bilateral moderate-to-large simple pleural effusions.bilateral consolidations associated with the pleural effusions.these most likely represent atelectasis, although in the proper clinical setting, pneumonia cannot be excluded.7-mm ground-glass nodular opacity and two sub-4-mm pulmonary nodules in the left upper lobe.given the patient's history of cancer, per the ___ guidelines, a followup ct of the chest is recommended at 3 to 6 months.moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly.

text: heavy calcification of the left anterior descending, left circumflex and right coronary arteries is evident.a stent in the lad is noted.there is mild cardiomegaly.no pericardial effusion.calcifications of the thoracic aorta are also noted.post-contrast images demonstrate the presence of a small, 8 mm plaque at the level of the ligamentum arteriosum within the aortic arch.there are no filling defects within the pulmonary arterial vasculature.bilateral hilar lymph nodes are enlarged, measuring up to 12 mm wide.no pathologically enlarged mediastinal or axillary lymph nodes.lung windows demonstrate scattered pulmonary calcifications, the largest of which is located at the right lung apex and measures 7 mm (3:12).these may reflect prior granulomatous infection.a small right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis is evident.imaged portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.incidental note is made of splenic artery calcifications.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.

text: in comparison to the prior chest ct from ___, the pulmonary burden of disease is unchanged within the limitations of measurement across different ct acquisition techniques.a reference lesion in the left lower lobe (2:57) measures 10 x 8 mm compared to 13 x 9 mm previously.a reference lesion in the right lower lobe (2:51) measures 8.5 x 8.0 mm, compared to 14 x 9 mm.a third reference lesion in the left upper lobe (2:31) measures 9.5 x 9.0 mm compared to 12.0 x 9.0 mm.a nodule in the left lower lobe was also imaged on the prior abdominal ct on ___ and provides better size comparison due to similar acquisition technique and slice thickness.this nodule (2:53) measures 11 x 9.5 mm compared to 10 x 9 mm previously.there do not appear to be a large number of new millimetric nodules compared to the prior chest ct.once again, there is right hilar lymphadenopathy.however, there does appear to be some decrease in the most prominent lymph node, which measures 10 mm from 13 mm previously (2:35).
summary: overall, stable metastatic disease.most lung nodules have remained the same size or minimally smaller.the prominent right hilar lymph node is smaller than on the prior study.stable metastatic lesions within the liver.new, enhancing perirectal lymph nodes, not present on the prior study.

text: there is severe upper lung zone predominant centrilobular emphysema.since prior examination, there has been significant interval progression of airspace consolidation involving the entire right lung compatible with progression of known pneumonia.multiple air-fluid levels are noted in addition to areas of cystic spaces within this area of consolidation, with a large single air-fluid level seen spanning the entire right upper lobe.overall, though some of these airspaces may represent interspersed emphysematous cystic spaces, the appearance is concerning for progression of infection with necrotizing component.within the tracheobronchial tree, there are components of high attenuation, likely related to aspiration of known hemorrhage/secretions with some associated downstream atelectasis involving the right lower lobe.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism to the subsegmental levels.there is no evidence of aortic dissection.there is extensive atherosclerotic plaque, specifically involving the descending thoracic aorta.within this area of plaque, there is a small outpouching of contrast seen (4:55), most compatible with a component of penetrating atherosclerotic ulceration.overall, the appearance is unchanged from reference ct from ___.there is no significant mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is prominence of the main pulmonary arteries with the left main pulmonary artery measuring 2.6 cm and right main pulmonary measuring 2.8 cm.there is no significant pericardial effusion.support hardware including endotracheal tube, nasogastric tube, and a central venous catheter are in adequate position.there is no evidence of pneumothorax or significant pleural effusion.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.visualized portion of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism to the subsegmental levels.small area of outpouching of contrast, immediately adjacent to atherosclerotic plaque is seen in the descending aorta, most likely representing an area of penetrating atherosclerotic ulceration, unchanged since ___.significant progression of infectious process, now with extensive airspace consolidation involving the entire right hemithorax with multiple air-fluid levels, most compatible with a component of necrotizing pneumonia in addition to severe emphysema.likely aspiration/hemorrhage or secretions within the right lower lobe bronchi with associated atelectasis.

text: there are several mediastinal lymph nodes in the prevascular and right paratracheal areas as well as bilateral small axillary lymph nodes which do not meet ct criteria of lymphadenopathy.the heart size is normal.there is no pericardial effusion.there are several sub-5-mm pulmonary lymph nodes in the left upper lobe, series 3 images 25, 20, 18, 41, in the right middle.the pleural surfaces are smooth with no evidence of pleural effusions.the above described nodules are stable since ___ where even more pulmonary nodules were demonstrated.the images of the upper abdomen demonstrate normal liver, pancreas, and adrenals.small atrophic kidneys are seen bilaterally with a large number of cortical cysts.there are several calcifications is in the left kidney.the spleen size is normal.there is low density lesion in the mid portion of the spleen 1 cm in diameter measuring a soft tissue density of 55.
summary: no evidence of enlarged parathyroid gland.stable pulmonary nodules.further followup in one year is recommended to document stability.a low density spleen lesion which is too small to be evaluated by ct, ultrasound evaluation is recommended.small atrophic kidneys consistent with end-stage renal disease with the left nephrolithiasis.

text: there are faint peripheral ground-glass opacities anteriorly and laterally involving the anterior and posterior segments of the left upper lobe and to a lesser severity the lateral aspect of the superior segment of the left lower lobe.these findings likely reflect pulmonary contusion.there are more confluent opacities, likely two discrete foci in the posterior segment of the right upper lobe.these are felt to more likely represent aspiration.dependent atelectasis is seen in both lung bases.no underlying pneumothorax is seen.there is no superimposed edema.the endotracheal tube is identified with the distal tip at the ostium of the right main stem bronchus.a nasogastric tube is also incidentally noted terminating in the high esophagus.residual thymic tissue is noted in the anterior mediastinum.the aorta is normal in contour, caliber, and course.the heart is normal in size with no pericardial effusion.there is no pneumomediastinum.
summary: left pulmonary contusions and two foci of likely right upper lobe aspiration.right main stem bronchus intubation.retract 3-cm for optimal placement.nasogastric tube terminates in high esophagus and needs to be advanced into the stomach.no traumatic injury in the abdomen or pelvis.no fractures.results posted immediately upon interpretation to the ed dashboard.they were also reviewed in person with dr.___, of trauma surgery.

text: no pulmonary embolism is identified from the main pulmonary arterial trunk to the subsegmental pulmonary arterial vessels bilaterally.there is mild emphysema at the lung apices, mostly on the right.there are no pleural effusions or areas of lung consolidation.note is made of bibasilar as well as well as right middle lobe and lingular atelectasis.the heart is upper limits of normal in size, and note is made of calcification of the coronary arteries.the great vessels and pericardium are unremarkable.there is no mediastinal, axillary, or hilar lymph node enlargement.within the imaged portions of the upper abdomen, no abnormalities are seen.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.coronal and sagittal reconstructions: images reconstructed in the sagittal and coronal planes show no pulmonary embolism.
summary: no pulmonary embolism identified.bibasilar and middle lobe/lingular atelectasis but no areas of consolidation seen.mild apical emphysema, right greater than left.

text: there is evidence of diffuse ground-glass opacity within the airways in a peribronchial distribution.there is interlobular septal thickening.there is a moderate-to-large sized left pleural effusion.the airways are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.the heart is normal in size.there are coronary artery calcifications within the left and right coronary arteries as well as within the aorta.there is no pericardial effusion.there are prevascular and right upper paratracheal lymph nodes measuring up to 10 mm.there is a enlarged subcarinal lymph node measuring 13 mm.additionally, there is an enlarged, 10 mm cardiophrenic lymph node.there is no pathologically enlarged axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.limited images through the upper abdomen show stable low-density foci within the right lobe of the liver.additionally, there are multiple calcified gallstones within the gallbladder without evidence for cholecystitis.the imaged portions of the spleen and kidneys are unremarkable.the adrenal glands are normal.
summary: diffuse ground-glass opacities with septal thickening in a moderate to large left pleural effusion is consistent with congestive heart failure.enlarged lymph nodes within the prevascular, right upper paratracheal, and subcarinal regions could be secondary to chf.if a chest ct is required for lymphoma staging, a repeat chest ct is recommended after treatment for congestive heart failure.stable low density liver lesion.stable calcified gallstones without evidence for cholecystitis.

text: thoracic aorta is normal in caliber, without aneurysmal dilatation or evidence of dissection.at the level of the right main pulmonary artery, the ascending aorta measures 33 mm and the descending aorta measures 24 mm.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted in the coronary arteries and the aortic arch.heart size is within normal limits.no pericardial or pleural effusion.lungs are clear except for scarring in medial portion of the right lung base.limited visualization of upper abdominal organs is unremarkable.
summary: normal aortic caliber.no evidence of aneurysmal dilatation or dissection in aorta.coronary artery calcifications.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.surgical material along the left hilum represents prior left upper lobectomy.the heart and great vessels are within normal limits.bibasilar dependent atelectasis is noted.there is no pleural effusion.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.the thyroid is normal.there is no supraclavicular, axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.groundglass opacities and interstitial edema is worse at the right base, than the left.though not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, there is no abnormality in the visualized portions of the liver, spleen, or stomach.the 6-mm left lower lobe nodule noted on prior ct on ___ is stable (4:46).

text: several clusters of bronchiolar nodules in the right lung, in all lobes, and a small group of irregularly shaped nodules in the posterior segment of the left upper lobe adjacent to the major fissure, 4:90-99 are new.four lung nodules at the left lung base divorced from areas of bronchial abnormality, 3:47, 49, 51, 43, are all stable.rounded atelectasis at the base of the right lower lobe has several components, the more lateral is smaller and the more medial is larger today than four years ago.a of linear opacity and minimal bronchiectasis at the left lung base is probably scarring.minimal peribronchial infiltration and bronchial wall thickening in the superior segment of the left lower lobe is unchanged.moderately severe pleural thickening in the lower chest is smooth and unchanged.small layering nonhemorrhagic right pleural effusion is either chronic or recurrent.the adjacent parietal pleura is smoothly thickened but unchanged.there is no pathologic enlargement of central lymph nodes by size criteria, ranging up to 9 mm in the subcarinal station unchanged..a low- density central lesion in the right lobe of the thyroid gland is 14 x 24 mm, previously 17 x 22 mm.it indents the right wall of the trachea mildly.transvenous right ventricular pacer lead in standard placement.the study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation except to note the absence of adrenal mass or any lesion in the liver suspicious for malignancy or infection.plaque or mural thrombus throughout the descending thoracic aorta and in the upper abdomen is moderately severe and unchanged.the aorta is not dilated.
summary: right lower lobe lesion detectible on conventional radiographs is probably rounded atelectasis, of no active concern.bilateral basal scarring, pleural thickening and small right pleural effusion are chronic.new finding is multifocal bronchiolitis most likely mycobacterial and more likely, though not assuredly atypical species than tuberculosis.multiple subcentimeter pulmonary nodules stable for more than three years are presumed benign and do not merit followup.right thyroid mass or cyst grossly stable since ___.

text: cta neck: skin staples are seen along the posterior margin of the left sternocleidomastoid muscle at the level of the angle of the left mandible.there is a large associated underlying hematoma that is centered at left posterolateral neck between the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscle, primarily involving the levator scapulae, longissimus capitis, splenius capitis, and semispinalis capitis muscles.multiple foci of air are seen within this hematoma; however, there is no evidence of active extravasation.the hematoma extends posteriorly into the posterior paravertebral musculature including the semispinalis spinalis cervicis and multifidus muscle on the left side.there is no evidence of vertebral artery or carotid artery injury.the jugular vein is diminutive on the left from the vertebral level of c1 through c3 (at the level of the hyoid).there is no evidence of jugular vein injury.no carotid artery dissection.the patient is intubated and has an ng tube with secretions in the ___-, oro- and hypopharynx.

text: an 11 mm left thyroid nodule is newly identified, likely not visualized on the prior examination due to differences in technique.no supraclavicular, axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy is identified.scattered mediastinal lymph nodes are noted, however, not meeting ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.the thoracic aorta is non-aneurysmal throughout its course.the heart size is normal, and there is no pericardial effusion.no central pulmonary embolism is identified on this venous phase study.the tracheobronchial tree is patent centrally.in the bilateral lower lobes, however, there is diffuse bronchiectasis, circumferential bronchial wall thickening and distal mucous plugging.at the ends of terminal bronchioles in the right lower lobe, there are multiple nodules that have increased in size compared to prior.a peripheral right lower lobe nodule now measures 11 x 13 mm as compared with 8 mm on the prior examination (2:58).a nodular opacity slightly more medial is also enlarged measuring 16 x 9 mm (2:55).a nodule previously described as a peribronchial abscess within the right lung base has minimally decreased in size, now measuring 11 x 11 mm (2:62).no cavitary lesions are identified to suggest necrotic abscess formation.saccular bronchiectasis in the right middle lobe appears stable.there is no pleural effusion.
summary: unchanged bibasilar bronchiectasis, bronchial wall thickening, and mucous plugging.increased size of multiple right lower lobe nodular densities in centrilobular distribution.findings are concerning for progressive endobronchial spread of atypical infection such as aspergillosis or fungal infection, although inflammatory nodules could cause a similar appearance.recommend repeat imaging with ct to ensure resolution after treatment.no cavitary lesions within the lung to suggest necrotic abscess formation.no pleural effusion.left thyroid nodule.further characterization with ultrasound could be completed non-emergently, if it has not been done previously.sigmoid diverticulosis without sign of acute diverticulitis.

text: the heavily calcified aorta has a 1.3 cm mural thrombus in the distal aortic arch (2:19), present on prior exams, but not fully evaluated on noncontrast prior studies.a fusiform dilatation of the proximal descending aorta with a semilunar area of intra-mural thrombus in its anterior aspect between leaves of calcification suggests chronic, relatively contained aortic dissection, originating in an ulcerated plaque with a 1 cm base (2:31 and 602b:38), but not evaluated on the previous non-contrast studies.the maximum transverse diameter of the dilatation, 34 mm (image 2:31), was 32mm in ___ ___ and novemeber ___.minimal bleeding into the false lumen likely accounts for this enlargement.the patient is status post right upper lobectomy.the bronchial stump is intact and no enlarged lymph nodes or lung lesions concerning for local recurrence are observed.compared with ___, the gaseous component of the previous pleural collection has resolved while the fluid component has significantly decreased, now limited to the apex.there has been also reexpansion of the right middle and lower lobes, except for residual atelectasis om the medial segment of the middle lobe.a sub-3-mm nodule in the left lower lobe (4:187) has not changed since at least ___.previous ground-glass opacities in the left lung have resolved, suggesting prior infection.mild to moderate centrilobular emphysema is stable.retained secretions distal to the carina are still abundant throughout the bronchial tree.there is no central or axillary lymphadenopathy.calcification is extensive in the coronary arteries, aortic annulus and valve, and mitral annulus.the heart is mildly enlarged although this study is not designed for assessment of heart size.there is no pericardial effusion.a stable 4 mm hypodensity in the esophageal wall (4:52) with an attenuation of -65hu is a small lipoma.the thyroid gland is unremarkable and there is no supraclavicular lymphadenopathy.
summary: slight enlargement of proximal descending aorta aneurysm due to small dissection.short term follow up, with aorta cts in 3 months is recommended for assessment of stability.an ulcerated plaque at this level as well and a 1.3 cm mural thrombus more proximally in the distal aortic arch can be reassessed at that time.interval resolution of gaseous component with improvement of fluid component of previous hydropneumothorax.the remaining fluid is restricted to the apex.in spite of significant amount of secretion in the upper airways, there has been almost complete reexpansion of the right middle and lower lobes, with minimal residual atelectasis of the medial segment of the middle lobe.bronchial stump is intact and there has been satisfactory evolution of post-op changes, without evidence of local recurrence of disease.5 small left lower lobe nodule is likely scarring but continued assessment is recommended during scheduled surveillance studies for follow up of post resection right lung changes.resolution of ground glass opacities in the left lung suggest infectious/inflammatory etiology.chronic conditions such as extensive coronary arterial calcifications, aortic annulus/valve and mitral annulus calcification, esophageal wall lipoma, small right renal lesion and healed rib fractures are stable.
