text: there is thrombus within the right main pulmonary artery, right upper lobe pulmonary artery and interlobar artery.the interlobar artery thrombus is adjacent to the large right lower lobe mass that was seen on the prior study.the right lower lobe mass is larger in the interval, currently measuring 3.4 x 2.4 cm, compared with 2.7 x 2.1 cm on the prior exam.no pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymph nodes are identified.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.

text: status post right lower lobe sleeve resection.no other post- operative followups are available for comparison.along the staples line at the resection site, next to a region of local narrowing of the right bronchus (3, 35) there is a homogeneous hypodense area of 4 x 2 cm in diameter located medially to the staples.growth matrix of the lesion suggests a partially organized post-operative fluid collection.otherwise, there are no abnormalities.pre-existing parenchymal scars in both lungs are unchanged.there is no suggestion of recurrence.there is no evidence of enlarged hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes.uncharacteristic subtle pleural thickening is seen at the dorsal bases of the right hemithorax.no evidence of recent pleural effusion.extensive lateral emphysema, extensive airway wall thickening and airway wall irregularities, consistent with severe chronic bronchitis.a previous area of infection at the bases of the left lung has markedly decreased in size (3, 54).
summary: post-operative bronchial narrowing and partially organized fluid collection dorsomedially to the staple lines.no evidence of recurrence.no evidence of enlarged lymph nodes.no pleural effusion.extensive emphysema and evidence of chronic airways disease.

text: a right-sided port is seen with its tip terminating in the distal superior vena cava.the heart, pericardium and great vessels appear unremarkable apart from mild mitral anular calcification.no pathologic axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy is seen.the central airways are patent.the lungs are clear without consolidation or nodule.there is mild bibasilar atelectasis.no pleural or pericardial effusions are seen.

text: there is bilateral filling defects seen.on the right side, extending from the right main pulmonary artery, thrombus is seen to extend into the right upper lobe, right middle lobe and right lower lobe.the filling defects are seen to extend to the subsegmental areas as well.on the left side, clot is seen to extend from the left main stem to the left upper and left lower lobes.again thrombi are noticed to extend to the subsegmental levels.there is atelectasis seen in the dependent portion of the lungs greater on the left side than the right side.there are no calcifications or nodules seen.there are no pneumothoraces or significant pleural effusions.there are median sternotomy wires noted.the visualized portion of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.there are diffuse degenerative changes seen throughout the thoracic spine.there is no significant hilar, mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy.

text: the soft tissue window images reveal no significant axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.there is some soft tissue stranding around the pericardium anteriorly, likely post surgical changes.there is no evidence of pericardial effusions.the heart and the great vessels are unremarkable.there is no filling defect within the pulmonary vasculature.small left sided pleural effusion is noted.the lung window images reveal no areas of consolidation or lung nodules.the airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is mild to moderate linear atelectasis in both lungs.in the imaged portions of the upper abdomen, the visualized portion of the liver, spleen and left adrenal appear unremarkable.the osseous structures do not exhibit any suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.

text: large left upper lobe mass has decreased in size from 10.3 x 8.1 cm to 7.5 x 6.9 cm (image 17, series 2).the mass is more necrotic compared to the previous exam, and now contains internal areas of gas.left upper lobe bronchus remains obstructed with right upper lobe collapse, but there is less encasement and narrowing of the left main bronchus as compared to the prior ct.a large conglomerate nodal mass involving the left hilum, left aorticopulmonary window and left mediastinum has also decreased in size, previously measuring 6.5 x 5.8 cm and now measuring 5.0 x 3.9 cm (image 24, series 2).additionally, the mass is associated with decreased mass effect and encasement of the adjacent vascular structures.for example, although the left pulmonary artery remains surrounded by neoplasm and appears narrowed, its maximal anterior posterior dimension has increased from approximately 2 mm to 7 mm.similarly, the right pulmonary artery, which was previously moderately compressed with reduction in transverse dimension to approximately 17 mm, and is now less compressed with a transverse dimension of approximately 19 mm.focal impression upon the contrast opacified left atrium (image 27, series 2) has decreased in size and there is also less encasement of the left inferior pulmonary vein.the left superior pulmonary vein is not visualized and may be obstructed by the tumor.a moderate-sized left pleural effusion has slightly increased in size, and its configuration now suggests a potential loculated component laterally.partially calcified scarring at right lung apex appears unchanged with adjacent areas of minimal bronchiectasis and reticulation.new areas of ground-glass attenuation and consolidation have developed within the left lower lobe, with consolidation in the superior segment demonstrating a relatively round configuration with areas of small foci of gas and medially.an internal air bronchograms are also evident in this region.within the remainder of the left lower lobe, there is prominent ground-glass attenuation with only minimal areas of consolidation, most prominent in the posterior and lateral segment.emphysema is again demonstrated within the lung parenchyma.skeletal structures demonstrate a small sclerotic focus within a lower left posterior rib, presumably a small bone island.exam was not tailored to evaluate the subdiaphragmatic region, but note is made of a mild fullness of the left adrenal gland without change, as well as several hypodensities within the liver, incompletely characterized but also without change.comparison is made to more recent pet of ___.since that time, the left effusion is likely similar in size, although the apparent loculated component is new.the mass-like consolidation in the left lower lobe is also new since that study.
summary: decreased size of large necrotic left upper lobe mass, now containing multiple small foci of gas.decrease in conglomerate lymph node mass with associated reduction in degree of narrowing of the pulmonary vasculature, and decrease in apparent area of probable invasion of the left atrium.moderate left pleural effusion with apparent new area of loculation.persistent obstruction of left upper lobe bronchus with associated postobstructive atelectasis.new mass-like consolidation in superior segment left lower lobe and extensive ground-glass attenuation throughout most of the remaining left lower lobe, likely to due an acute infectious pneumonia.

text: small mediastinal lymph nodes are noted, not meeting ct criteria for lymphadenopathy.there is consolidation in the right upper lobe in the posterior segment as well as in the superior segment of the right lower lobe and involving the lung bases bilaterally.no areas of cavitation are noted.there are no lung masses.a left chest tube is seen and crosses the major fissure.the tip of the catheter is positioned immediately adjacent to the aorta.there are minute air collections in the pleural space, adjacent to the chest tube, along the lateral chest wall, as well as anteriorly, adjacent to the mediastinum and at the lung bases.multiple left rib fractures are seen.a 3-cm hypodense lesion in the medial segment of the left hepatic lobe is consistent with a cyst.the depicted portions of the pancreas, both adrenal glands, and both kidneys are unremarkable.the patient is status post splenectomy.

text: status post coil treatment of vascular malformation in the left lower lobe.mildly enlarged lymph nodes are seen, unchanged from prior study: a subcarinal lymph node measuring 1.2 cm and small hilar lymphadenopathy.numerous pulmonary nodules are again identified bilaterally.the largest pulmonary nodule is seen in the right lower lobe in anterior basal segment currently measuring 2.6 x 2.8 cm, previously 1 x 1.7 cm.on the other hand the right upper lobe lesion has decreased in size currently measuring 1 cm in diameter, previously measuring 1.5 cm in diameter (series 2, image 25).also a peripheral pulmonary nodule in left lower lobe has also minimally decreased in size.there is no evidence of new lesions.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.

text: incidental note is made of common origin of the left common carotid and right brachiocephalic arteries.otherwise, the heart and aorta appear normal.no pericardial effusion is seen.the main pulmonary artery is slightly prominent, measuring up to 3.6 cm, suggesting pulmonary hypertension.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph node enlargement meeting ct size criteria for adenopathy.a prominent right chest wall node measures 8 mm in short axis (2:25).there is a small left pleural effusion.dependent atelectatic changes are noted in both lungs.areas of atelectasis are noted in the lower lobes bilaterally, worse in the left lower lobe.however, no lung nodule, mass or consolidation worrisome for pneumonia is seen.5- and 6-mm diaphragmatic lymph nodes are noted (2:45, 48).while the current study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, note is made of a 12 mm hypodensity in segment vii of the liver which measures fluid density (2:51), consistent with a cyst.smaller 9-mm segment vi hypodensity is too small to characterize.the spleen is borderline enlarged, measuring up to 13.6 cm on axial imaging.no adrenal mass is seen.cortical defect along the posterior upper pole of the right kidney consistent with scarring.there are bilateral glenohumeral joint degenerative changes.bony defect along the posterior left humeral head may represent prior trauma.the patient is status post spinal fusion from t7 through t11, with bilateral fusion rods and bilateral t7-t11 pedicle screws, and with no evidence of hardware-related complication.there are also multiple bilateral rib fractures, with healed appearance to the posterior lateral right fifth rib fracture, but incompletely healed, subacute appearance to posterolateral left 7th, 8th, 9th, 10th and probable 11th ribs.

text: examination of soft tissue windows do not show axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.however, there is soft tissue density which infiltrates fat around the trachea but is slightly less bulky than on the prior examination.in addition, the region of enhancing soft tissue in the right upper lung zones in the region of the surgical bed appears slightly smaller than on the prior examination.a focus of calcification with a low density central region in the right lung apex likely represents a calcified/ossified muscle flap.the heart and mediastinum are shifted towards the right from volume loss.a small pericardial effusion is present, slightly smaller than on the prior study.examination of lung window shows retained secretions in the trachea.the diffuse pattern of interstitial thickening/consolidation which was present predominantly in the right lung on the prior study has largely resolved, and the amount of consolidation in the right upper lung zone on the prior examination has improved.slight focal thickening along the left major fissure remains present.a 1.5 cm focus of subpleural ground-glass opacity on the prior study in the subpleural left lower lobe has markedly improved, and there is a small 4 mm residual module in this location today (se 3, im 42).several scattered blebs are present.limited evaluation of the visualized upper abdomen is unremarkable aside from very slight fullness of the left adrenal gland which is unchanged compared to our earliest comparison of 10/___.examination of osseous structures show postoperative changes from right thoracotomy as well as vertebral body corpectomy.these are unchanged.
summary: overall improvement in the right hemithorax, with decreased interstitial thickening, consolidation, and pleural fluid/thickening since the previous postoperative study.residual soft tissue density replacing mediastinal fat and surrounding the airways.although possibly due to post-xrt change, pet/ct may be considered to rule out neoplastic involvement if warranted clinically.

text: since ___, the left-sided pleural effusion has markedly increased in size, with associated left lower lobe consolidation.of note, there are no air bronchograms.there is a new right lower lobe consolidation with air bronchograms which could represent a pneumonia.multiple bilateral scattered parenchymal nodular opacities and ground-glass opacities are again seen and approximately stable.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.the great vessels are unremarkable.there is no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.the airways are patent.

text: there are several small blebs along the pleural surfaces of the upper lobes.mild background centrilobular emphysema is noted.there is atelectasis at the base of the left lung.a small high-density nodule of the right lower lobe (3:50) is consistent with a granuloma.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted of the aortic arch and coronary arteries.the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber without dissection or aneurysm.there are no pathologically enlarged mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes.the pulmonary arteries opacify well and there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.limited evaluation of the upper abdomen shows no abnormality.there is an old fracture with surrounding callus of posterior left rib #5.

text: the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no evidence of pericardial effusion.bilateral loculated pleural effusions greater on the left ,are seen, with associated compressive atelectasis.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the patient is status post thoracic spinal surgery, and multiple rods and screws as well as a vertebral body cage is seen.there is subcutaneous emphysema in the soft tissues of the right posterior back, most consistent with recent surgical intervention.the central airways are patent bilaterally.multiple prominent mediastinal lymph nodes are noted, not significantly changed from previous study.the largest is a pretracheal node measuring 12 mm in short axis, meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.atherosclerotic disease with calcification is noted throughout the thoracic aorta, without evidence of dissection or dilatation.osseous structures are remarkable for postoperative change in the thoracic spine as described above.limited views of the upper abdomen are notable for a mildly distended gallbladder, but no secondary signs of cholecystitis.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.bilateral predominantly leftsided loculated pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.status post thoracic spinal surgery, with evidence of postoperative change, spinal hardware, and subcutaneous air.mild gallbladder distention, incompletely evaluated on this cta of the chest.

text: the patient is intubated.there is a moderate-sized right pneumothorax and a tiny left pneumothorax.there are dependent changes at the lung bases bilaterally.otherwise, there are no focal areas of airspace opacification.there is no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the visualized heart and great vessels are unremarkable.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level bilaterally.
summary: severe splenic laceration with free blood in the abdomen and pelvis.tiny focus of high density within the splenic hilum which could represent a a focus of extravasation of contrast.fractures through the right acetabulum, right inferior pubic ramus, right pubic symphysis and left sacral alar ___.at the immediate conclusion of this examination, these findings were discussed in person with the trauma team caring for the patient.

text: the study is markedly limited due to patient body habitus.there is no large pe.evaluation for subsegmental pe is suboptimal.the heart and pericardium are grossly unremarkable, without pericardial effusion.there is consolidation predominantly at the right lower lung, with interval increase in size of consolidation, and bilateral small patchy opacities in the lungs.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.an endotracheal tube is in place.there is ng tube in place, with tip above ge junction, above the conventional location.prominent lymph nodes are seen in the mediastinum.there is stable appearance compared to prior study.no enlarged lymph nodes are seen in the axilla.

text: an ett terminates 1 cm above the carina.a left subclavian central venous catheter tip terminates in the left subclavian vein.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.a small area of hyperattenuation within the anterior mediastinum represents residual thymus or mediastinal hematoma.there is a clear fat plane between this and the aorta.lung windows demonstrate opacity within the right upper lobe likely representing contusion as well as a small right-sided pneumothorax.
summary: small right apical pneumothorax.right lung contusion.retroperitoneal and extraperitoneal fluid more than ascites with shock bowel.small ivc and iliac arteries indicating hypovolemia and vascular contraction.comminuted right femoral fracture with retained bullet fragments.apparent right profunda femoris occlusion just distal to its origin with distal reconstitution.small bullet fragment in the wall or adjacent to the right proximal sfa near this level.the sfa is bulbous in appearance 5 cm distal to its takeoff as well which may be from acute injury.stranding and hematoma within the gluteus muscles and muscles of the right thigh.findings discussed with dr.___ from surgery

text: there is no evidence of pneumothorax.there is dependent atelectasis bilaterally.the patient is status post median sternotomy and cabg.there are coronary artery calcifications.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no significant axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.there is a small hiatal hernia.
summary: no acute traumatic injury within the chest, abdomen, or pelvis.old, healed rib fractures bilaterally.

text: there is no evidence of dissection.there are bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right with associated compressive atelectasis.there are scattered bilateral areas of ground-glass opacity, most prominent in the left upper lobe.there is thickening of the interlobular septa.there is a 14 mm right paratracheal and a 12 mm right paratracheal lymph node (short axis diameter).there are multiple other smaller mediastinal lymph nodes including small prevascular nodes, precarinal nodes, and hilar nodes.there is cardiac enlargement.a dual lead pacemaker device is in place with leads in the right atrium and right ventricle and third lead present in the coronary sinus.extensive atherosclerotic disease is again demonstrated with calcification of the aorta and coronary arteries.
summary: no evidence of aortic dissection.bilateral pleural effusions with patchy areas of ground-glass opacity, most prominent in the left upper lobe and interlobular septal thickening consistent with chf/volume overload.paratracheal lymphadenopathy.stable, likely liver cysts.multiple sclerotic foci of the axial skeleton, most of which are new compared to the exam of ___, worrisome for metastatic disease.a primary tumor such as prostate is associated with blastic metastasis.clinical correlation and correlation with patient's history is recommended.the above was discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of interpretation of the study.

text: patient is post tricuspid and mitral valve repair.multiple non enlarged shoddy lymph nodes are seen in both axillae, some with fatty centers.a temporary pacing wire is seen behind the sternum surrounded by some soft tissue thickening.this is likely related to post operative changed.there are no abnormal fluid collections within the mediastinum.there is scattered atelectasis throughout both lungs with a more focal area of atelectasis in the lateral basal segment of the left lower lobe.no pleural effusions or pneumothoraces are seen.
summary: scattered atelectasis.area of focal consolidation within the left lung base.no evidence of intra-abdominal abscess.no findings to suggest bowel inflammation.distended gall bladder without secondary ct signs of inflammation.if there is clinical concern for cholecystitis, recommend ultrasound of the liver/gall bladder, which is more sensitive for cholecystitis.

text: low-attenuation lesions in left lobe of thyroid and just posterior to the right lobe of the thyroid are unchanged.atherosclerotic calcifications are noted in the coronary arteries and the aortic arch.small mediastinal nodes are present, none of which meet the criteria for pathologic enlargement.a roughly triangular soft tissue density in the anterior mediastinum measuring up to at 17 x 11 mm in the axial plane is unchanged in comparison with the prior studies.it may represent lymphoid tissue or tissue of thyroid origin (thymoma).there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the central airways are patent to the subsegmental bronchi.mild emphysematous changes are most pronounced in the upper lobes.the patient is status post left lower lobectomy.a densely calcified nodule in the right lung base is compatible with granuloma, unchanged comparison with prior studies.there is a groundglass opacity in the superior segment of the right lower lobe, also unchanged in comparison with the priors.no new pulmonary nodules are detected.in the limited imaging of the upper abdomen, no suspicious lesions are detected.
summary: stable groundglass opacity in the right lower lobe.continued one-year followup is recommended to assess for a slowly growing bronchoalveolar carcinoma.anterior mediastinal soft tissue lesion, probably representing lymphoid tissue versus thymic tissue (thymoma), unchanged.

text: comparison is made to prior ct spine examination dated ___.
summary: multiple heterogeneously enhancing soft tissue masses within the posterior left lung likely centering within the lung extending into the lateral chest wall and causing mild bony erosion.a small linear calcification is noted adjacent to the pleura within the dominant mass.likley reprsenets a primary lung carcinoma, with mesothelioma or metastatic lesion from thyroid or renal cell carcinoma also within the differential.the lesion appears to be amenable to percutaneous biopsy.heterogeneously enhancing middle mediastinal left thyroid lesion.this likely represents a simple goiter but can be further evaluated with ultrasound if clinically indicated.cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.multiple right renal hypoattenuating lesions, some of which are clearly cystic and others which are too small to characterize.diffuse atherosclerotic calcifications.t1 compression fracture with multilevel degenerative changes throughout the spine, including grade 1 anterolisthesis of l5 on s1 and mild posterior disc protrusion of l3-4 intervertebral disc.findings were discussed with the caring physician ___.___ on date of exam at approximately 10:20 a.m.

text: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the aorta and great vessels appear intact.there are coronary artery calcifications affecting all three vessels.there are small bilateral axillary nodes, an 8 mm precarinal node, and a 9 mm right hilar node, and a 14mm left hilar node.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there is no pneumothorax.there is bibasilar atelectasis and dependent atelectasis.limited images of the upper abdomen demonstrate a 2.1 x 2.2 cm densely calcified mass in the falciform ligament of uncertain but doubtful significance.bone windows reveal no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.there are degenerative changes of the spine.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.three-vessel coronary artery calcifications.calcified mass in the falciform ligament, incompletely characterized, may be evaluated with dedicated abdominal imaging, on a non-urgent basis.14mm left hilar lymph node.

text: on the lung windows, there are bilateral pleural effusions, right more than left side with some associated atelectasis.in the right upper lobe, two lung nodules are identified anteriorly.the largest of which measures 8 mm in diameter.these should be imaged on followup ultrasound.on the mediastinal windows, at the level of the arch of the aorta, an outpouching is noted, which extends laterally.this measures approximately 7 mm in maximum diameter.again this is noted to be distal to the takeoff of the left subclavian artery.no significant pneumothorax noted.
summary: focal outpouching of the aorta just distal to the left subclavian artery which is probably confined by the expected location of the aortic wall and probably represents a small aneurysm with atherosclerotic ulceration.the relationship to the aortic wall is a little unclear and the possibility of a small penetrating ulcer is entertained grade 3 right hepatic laceration with some subcapsular hematoma.free fluid around the right kidney but no definite laceration identified.rib fractures bilaterally and right transverse process fractures noted.two brightly enhancing lesions in segment iv and caudate lobes, which are unchanged.

text: no intramural hematoma in the aorta is identified.a stable 1.9 x 2.1cm hypodensity is seen in the left lobe of the thyroid.no mediastinal or axillary lymph nodes meet pathologic size criteria for enlargement.the pulmonary artery is normal in diameter.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolus; dense atelectasis at lung bases limits evaluation of subsegmental branches.the aorta is normal in caliber and course.incidental note is made of bovine arch.the heart is normal in size.there is a physiologic pericardial fluid.an ng tube courses into the stomach.central airways are patent to the level of subsegmental bronchi.again seen are moderate bilateral pleural effusions, larger on the right where it appears partially loculated.right lower lobe atelectasis/collapse persists.ground-glass opacification in aerated portions of lungs bilaterally with some interlobular septal thickening, likely represents pulmonary edema.in addition there are patchy areas of more focal ground glass opacity in the upper lobes bilaterally for which superimposed infectious or inflammatory process cannot be excluded.the study is not optimized to evaluate the abdomen.within this limitation the transplant liver appears normal.the spleen and adrenals appear normal.there is no suspicious osteolytic or osteoblastic lesion.multilevel degenerative changes are seen at numerous levels of the spine.
summary: no pulmonary embolus.persistent moderate pleural effusions, larger and loculated on the right.persistent bilateral lower lobe atelectasis/collapse.mild pulmonary edema with additional nodular and patchy ground glass opacities in the upper lobes raising the possibility of a superimposed inflammatory/infectious process.left thyroid hypodensity, unchanged - consider outpatient thyroid ultrasound for further characterization when clinically indicated (non urgent basis).multilevel degenerative changes are seen in the spine.

text: large heterogeneous necrotic lesion in the right lobe of the thyroid is again seen, designated target lesion #1, currently measuring 45 x 42 mm, not significantly changed since previous exam.large, heterogeneously enhancing soft tissue mass in the anterior left lung, target lesion #2, currently measures 101 x 58 mm, previously 93 x 52 mm.this mass continues to abut the mediastinum, surrounding the left main pulmonary artery and left main bronchus.left main bronchial stent is in place, unchanged in position, and widely patent.there has been slight increase in size of right hilar adenopathy, currently measuring 14 mm in short-axis dimension.multiple small, sub-5-mm pulmonary nodules are not significantly changed, and nonspecific widespread small tree- in-___ opacities, predominantly within the right lung, are also unchanged.moderate bilateral pleural effusions are slightly increased in size.there is no pericardial effusion.heart and great vessels are unremarkable.
summary: overall, mixed response to treatment.stable appearance of some target lesions, but increase in size of large anterior left lung target mass.unchanged appearance of narrowing of the left main pulmonary artery and left main bronchus, with unchanged appearance of left main bronchial stent.slight interval increase in size of moderate bilateral pleural effusions.unchanged appearance of widespread metastatic disease within the abdomen and pelvis.soft tissue lesion adjacent to the posterior left costovertebral junction at t10 has enlarged, and abuts adjacent osseous structures.there is no definite osseous erosion or destruction, and the lesion does not encroach upon the neural foramina or the vertebral body.oncology table updated.

text: the major airways are patent up to subsegmental levels bilaterally.the main pulmonary arteries are well opacified up to subsegmental levels bilaterally without evidence of acute pulmonary emboli.minimal motion at the level of the left lower lobe, limits evaluation of the same.the thoracic aorta is normal without evidence of acute aortic pathology.an occluded left subclavian stent is unchanged since the prior study.the patient is status post cabg and mitral valve replacement surgery.minimal fat stranding in the anterior mediastinum and a trace amount of pericardial effusion, may relate to the recent surgery.intact multiple mediastinal clips relate to the recent surgery.incidental note is made of a stent in the left anterior descending and the right main coronary artery.bilateral small pleural effusions with associated basal atelectasis are noted.extensive consolidation in the left lower lobe and the left lingula, likely represent resolving atelectasis, however, superimposed infection cannot be excluded based on this study.a 3-mm right upper lobe pulmonary nodule (2:10) is unchanged since the earlier study of ___.this study is not tailored for evaluation of the subdiaphragmatic organs.however, within this limitation, no significant abnormalities are visualized in the imaged portion of the abdomen.
summary: no acute pulmonary embolism or acute aortic syndrome.minimal anterior mediastinal fat stranding and trace amount of pericardial effusion, may relate to recent surgery.bilateral small basal pleural effusions.left lower lobe and left lingular consolidation, likely represent atelectasis.however, superimposed infection cannot be excluded.3-mm right upper lobe pulmonary nodule (2:10) is unchanged since the earlier study of ___.if the patient does not have a prior history of smoking or risk factors such as malignancy, no followup is needed; however, if there are any risk factors, followup chest ct is recommended in a year.

text: there is a small amount of anterior mediastinal soft tissue density likely representing residual thymic tissue in a patient of this age.there is no evidence of aortic injury.the great vessels of the mediastinum have a normal appearance.there is no lymphadenopathy.the airway is patent centrally.the heart is normal in size and shape.no pericardial or pleural effusion is seen.the lungs are clear bilaterally with only mild dependent atelectasis noted.no worrisome nodules or mass lesions are present.
summary: no acute traumatic injury in the chest, abdomen, or pelvis.markedly distended stomach.hyperdense rounded lesions in the breasts may represent proteinaceous cysts.recommend clinical correlation.findings were discussed with dr.___ and the remainder of the trauma team immediately following scanning of the patient.sesha

text: in the chest, the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber throughout, without evidence of dissection, pseudoaneurysm or other acute abnormality.there is no mediastinal hematoma.the great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pulmonary embolus.the heart is normal in size and there is a trace pericardial effusion.lungs are clear without consolidation, pleural effusion, or evidence of contusion.in the anterior right middle lobe (4:158), there is a 2-mm pulmonary nodule, located peripherally.in the posterior portion of the right upper lobe, there is a tiny bulla.there is no other abnormality within the lungs.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to subsegmental levels.there is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy by size criteria.
summary: grade iv multifocal splenic lacerations with active extravasation/traumatic pseudoaneurysm formation, subcapsular hematoma and moderate hemoperitoneum, concurrent with apparent initial interpretation.normal aorta without traumatic injury.no other solid organ injury.no fractures.2 mm right middle lobe nodule.in the absence of risk factors for lung cancer, no followup is needed.several tiny renal hypodensities, too small to characterize.

text: the spiculated mass in the right upper lobe that was seen on the prior ct is markedly decreased in size, now measuring 14 x 15 mm.the satellite lesion posterior to this mass is also decreased in size.the nodule in the periphery of the right lower lobe is stable measuring less than 4 mm in diameter.there is a linear density in the left lower lobe periphery towards the midline with associated loss of volume which likely represents atelectasis versus scar.compressive atelectasis with effusion was seen in this area on the prior study.there is shotty axillary lymphadenopathy that does not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.in terms of the previously observed mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy, overall there has been marked improvement.specifically, the nodes seen in the left aorticopulmonary window, the right paratracheal region, the subcarinal region, the precarinal region, the right hilar region, and the cardiophrenic region are all improved.the largest node, in the subcarinal region previously measured 21 x 18 mm and now measures 12 x 13 mm.the nodular thickening seen in the pericardium is also markedly improved since the last exam.the vascular structures demonstrate almost complete occlusion of the right brachiocephalic vein around the location where the port-a-cath tip terminates.the superior vena cava is not involved.the other great vessels appear unremarkable.the pleural effusions seen in the last exam have resolved.the airways are patent.incidental note is made of emphysematous changes in the right and left lung fields.
summary: marked improvement in tumor burden, specifically, the lung nodules, lymph nodes, nodular pericardial thickening are all notably decreased in size from the previous exam.subocclusive thrombus in the right brachiocephalic vein at the tip of the catheter.this could represent a fibrin sheath or a clot at this site.stable appearance of the hypodensities seen in the liver and kidneys.

text: the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there are large bilateral pleural effusions.no pulmonary nodules are appreciated.an endotracheal tube is positioned with tip near the right main stem bronchus.left subpectoral shotty adenopathy measures approximately 1.7 x 1.3 cm.
summary: markedly heterogeneous appearance of the right lobe of the liver.foci of heterogenicity within the left hepatic lobe.the appearance could be consistent with diffuse tumor infiltration, however, given vascular compromise of the celiac artery and sma, superimposed infarction cannot be excluded.large bilateral pleural effusions.1.2 cm enhancing lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney.status post biliary stent placement with mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation.diminutive sma.abrupt termination of celiac axis near origin.findings were discussed with dr.___ on ___.

text: there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.the patient is status post sternotomy.the sternal wires are intact and the osseous fragments are closely apposed.no peristernal fluid collections are present.a small amount of fluid is present within the superior pericardial sac.this is likely post operative in nature.multiple mediastinal clips are present.aortic calcifications are present.the heart is at the upper limits of normal in size.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.emphysematous changes are present.bilateral dependent atelectasis is present.there are no consolidations.there is a left chest tube which enters the anterior mediastinum and is positioned with tip at the left lung base.there is no pneumothorax.several low attenuation liver lesions are present.the largest is located within the left lobe of the liver and measures 1.6 x 1.6 cm.both of these are low in attenuation and are likely consistent with simple cysts.the gallbladder is distended.the visualized portions of kidneys, pancreas, and spleen are unremarkable.there is stranding and subcutaneous fluid within the left upper flank and left lateral chest wall.no discrete fluid collections are present.
summary: intact sternal wires and closely apposed sternal fragments.no peristernal fluid collections.small amount of pericardial fluid extending into anterior mediastinal region.this is likely post operative in nature given recent surgery, but an infected collection cannot be fully excluded.small bilateral pleural effusions and dependent atelectasis.two low attenuation liver lesions, likely consistent with simple liver cysts.stranding with fluid density within the left upper flank/left lateral chest wall.this may be due to dependent edema if the patient has been lying on this side.a subcutaneous hematoma is another possible etiology.clinical correlation is recommended.

text: three round, smoothly marginated, noncalcified pulmonary nodules are identified within the left lower lobe measuring 3 mm (215,102), 5 mm (244,102) and 5 mm (267, 102).in retrospect, one of the 5 mm nodules located immediately above the level of the diaphragm was present on the prior ct, and apparently measured only about 3 mm at that time, but motion artifact limits accuracy of measurement.the remaining two nodules, one was definitively above the prior imaging acquisition, and the other was very likely just above the prior imaging acquisition.examination is otherwise remarkable for mild paraseptal emphysema at the lung apices.no suspicious lytic skeletal lesions are identified.a small sclerotic focus at approximately the t12 vertebral body level is without change from the prior abdominal ct scan.no enlarged mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes are present.heart size is normal.no pericardial or pleural effusion is identified.examination was not specifically tailored to evaluate the subdiaphragmatic region, but no substantial changes are identified since the recent abdominal ct, allowing for absence of oral and intravenous contrast, which reduces sensitivity of ct for detecting abdominal abnormalities.
summary: three left lower lobe nodules measuring up to 5 mm in diameter.apparent growth of a nodule immediately above the diaphragm since recent abdominal ct, although respiratory motion limits direct comparison and could potentially result in measurement error.depending on the influence of pulmonary metastases upon patient management, further evaluation with either a vats biopsy or a three- month followup ct may be helpful.small sclerotic focus at t12, most likely a bone island.

text: the pulmonary arteries are patent without evidence of filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.aortic and coronary calcifications are identified.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there are scattered prominent mediastinal lymph nodes which do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there are diffuse emphysematous changes of both lungs.bilateral pleural effusions are again identified.there has been interval development of a small left pneumothorax.compressive atelectasis is observed at the bases.visualized portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.an anterior cervical fusion plate is partially visualized.surrounding osseous and soft tissue structures are otherwise within normal limits.
summary: no pe.small left pneumothorax.diffuse emphysematous changes.moderate bilateral pleural effusions and associated basilar atelectasis.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of the examination.

text: the patient is status post resection of the right upper lobe with surgical stumps seen at that level.[????????what does this mean??????] post-radiation changes are noted involving the superior segment of the right lower lobe with air bronchograms that have not changed since the prior study.again seen is the chronic, right apical hematoma adjacent to the surgical resection site.the right middle lobe bronchi have medially displaced against the mediastinal pleural surface and they appear widened and patent.wall thickening, approximately 3.5 mm, of the trachea and the proximal portion of both main bronchi is stable.mediastinal, subcarinal, and periaortic low- attenuation lymph nodes that have not changed in size or attenuation on this study.there is no cardiomegaly and there is no pericardial effusion.there is no pleural effusion.atherosclerotic plaques involve the aortic arch, descending aorta, and the major vessels of the aortic arch, particularly the innominate artery.the bones do not show any lesions suspicious for malignancy.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, there is stable thickening and slight nodularity of the medial limb and body of the left adrenal gland.the right adrenal gland appears unremarkable.the remainder of the examination at the subdiaphragmatic level shows no abnormal changes.
summary: status post right upper lobectomy for lung cancer showing no residual tumor or tumor recurrence.stable radiation fibrosis, mainly involving the superior segment of the right lower lobe.stable, chronic right apical hematoma close to the surgical site.persistent stable wall thickening of the trachea and the origins of the main bronchi with no adjacent soft tissue masses,or lymphadenopathy might be radiation effect or chronic tracheitis.

text: there are no pathologically enlarged axillary or hilar lymph nodes.small mildly prominent subcarinal lymph nodes measure up to 4 mm in short axis, not significantly changed compared to the preoperative study.minimal atherosclerotic calcifications involve the thoracic aorta and its branches including the coronary arteries.there is no evidence for pericardial or pleural effusion.the thoracic aorta is of normal caliber.___ mm periaortic nodes just proximal to the aortic hiatus are also unchanged.lung windows reveal no nodules or masses.a small ill-defined opacity is noted at the extreme left lung base (2:54).elongation of the ap diameter of the trachea with respect to the coronal diameter is again consistent with saber-sheath trachea.
summary: status post billroth ii gastrectomy without overt evidence for metastatic disease.small periaortic and paraesophageal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for enlargement and are unchanged compared to the preoperative study.small ill-defined consolidation at the extreme left lung base is a nonspecific finding, though diagnostic considerations include aspiration/infection.equivocal focal pericolonic induration along the distal transverse colon suggest inflammatory changes and may be related to radiation change.posted to radiology results communication dashboard.

text: the thyroid enhances homogenously.this is a small 3mm axial diameter filling defect in the right internal jugular consistent with a fibrin sheath/thrombus.there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar pathologic lymphadenopathy.scattered small paratracheal and prevascular nodes are seen.there has been interval implantation of axillary bifemoral bypass graft.this is opacified along its course with no pronounced stranding along its portion and no perigraft fluid collection.the aorta is normal in caliber and course.the aortic root measures to 3.9 cm, top normal.there are atherosclerotic vascular calcifications including dense coronary artery calcifications.pulmonary artery is normal in caliber.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.central airways are patent to the level of subsegmental bronchi.there is a persistent moderate-sized right pleural effusion, simple in attenuation, with associated relaxation atelectasis.emphysematous changes are seen at the lung apices.a small left pleural effusion persists.there is no pneumothorax.
summary: slightly decreased size of multiloculated fluid collections tracking along the right psoas extending to involve the right abdominal musculature and inferiorly the iliac fossa.status post removal of aortic graft material.interval left axillary bifemoral bypass with patent grafts.no fat stranding or perigraft abscess.the distal femoral graft is not fully imaged.persistent large right pleural effusion and small left with adjacent relaxation atelectasis.small 3mm fibrin sheath/thrombus in the right internal jugular.

text: there is a tracheostomy tube in place.a tiny sub-cm right paratracheal lymph node is present.there is a small left pleural effusion.this is slightly decreased in size when compared to previous examination.the right pleural effusion has resolved.there is mild cardiomegaly.there is no evidence of pleural enhancement, that might suggest the presence of an empyema.there is associated patchy atelectasis at the left lung base.there is no evidence of abscess formation.no pneumothorax.numerous left-sided rib fractures are seen, some of which are significantly displaced anteriorly.in the imaged portions of the upper abdomen, the liver, pancreatic tail, and gallbladder are unremarkable.bilateral adrenal hemorrhages remain unchanged in appearance.there is a tiny low-density lesion in the upper pole of the left kidney which is unchanged from the previous examination, and likely is a cyst.
summary: no evidence of abscess formation.decrease in size of small bilateral pleural effusions.there is no evidence of pleural enhancement to suggest an empyema.there is passive atelectasis the left base.unchanged bilateral adrenal hemorrhages and multiple rib fractures.

text: tracheostomy tube is in standard position.mediastinal lymphadenopathy is grossly unchanged including a 9-mm ap window lymph node and a conglomerate of subcarinal lymph nodes measuring 26 x 21 mm.left hilar lymphadenopathy has grown from 8 to 12 mm.right hilar lymph node measuring almost 6 mm is unchanged.cardiac size is top normal.there is no pericardial effusion.small bilateral pleural effusions left greater than right have increased.bibasilar consolidations have also increased more so in the right base.there are persistent secretions in the main bronchi bilaterally and in the segmental bronchi of the lower lobes bilaterally.there is no new pe.previously seen filling defect in the right lower lobe, right middle lobe, and left lobe are unchanged.two small areas of ground-glass opacity in the left upper lobe (4, 41) and in the right upper lobe (4, 51) are new most likely inflammatory in etiology.right middle lobe opacities are unchanged could be due to atelectasis and or aspiration.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.the upper abdomen is unremarkable.there are no bone findings of malignancy.

text: coronary artery calcifications are noted.a trace pericardial effusion is noted.otherwise, the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.there is no evidence of a thoracic aortic dissection.there is no evidence of a pulmonary embolism.there is extensive collateral vasculature along the right chest wall, suggestive of chronic right subclavian vein stenosis.there are post-surgical changes following a right upper lobectomy, with stable post-radiation fibrosis in the posteromedial aspect of the superior segment of the right lower lobe.there are scattered centrilobular nodular opacities within the right lower lobe, slightly more pronounced compared to the prior study, with areas of bronchial wall thickening and mucoid impaction within several bronchioles to the right lower lobe.the findings are suggestive of chronic aspiration.mild emphysema is noted.there is no pleural effusion.no pneumothorax is evident.limited views of the upper abdomen reveal a gastrostomy tube.mild thickening of the left adrenal gland is similar in appearance to prior study.
summary: no evidence of pe.stable post-surgical changes following a right upper lobectomy with stable radiation fibrosis.centrilobular nodules with bronchial wall thickening and mucoid impaction in the right lower lobe, more progressed compared to prior study, suggestive of aspiration.findings were posted to the ed dashboard.

summary: no evidence for infectious process in the chest, abdomen or pelvis.continued increased size of heterogeneously enhancing posterior right hepatic lobe lesion.this remains an indeterminate lesion.again, top differential considerations would include hepatic adenoma or focal nodular hyperplasia.however, given the continued growth over the past few months, a more aggressive process is still considered.therefore, as previously suggested an mri with hepatobiliary ___ such as eovist is recommended.if indicated, percutaneous ultrasound-guided biopsy may also be considered.

text: patient is status post left upper vats.soft tissue adjacent to the surgical clip is most likely postoperative changes as is soft tissue thickening of the left fissure, attention should be paid in the followup studies.ground glass opacities in the right lower lobe are most likely due to dependent atelectasis.mild paraseptal and centrilobular emphysema predominat in the upper lobes is stable.there are no mediastinal axillary or hilar enlarged lymph nodes.patient is post cabg.there are calcifications in the coronary arteries.cardiac size is normal.the aorta is normal in caliber.there is no pleural or pericardial effusions.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.hypodense cortical lesions in the right kidney are likely cysts, too small to characterized.there are no bony lesions which are suggestive of malignancy.patient is status post median sternotomy.

text: there is extensive subcutaneous emphysema, worse on the right than on the left.despite left sided chest tube, there is a large left-sided pneumothorax.there is tiny residual right sided pneumothorax.dependent consolidation is present involving the right upper, lower lobes, as well as dependent consolidation at the left upper lobe as well.there is also significant atelectasis of the left lower lobe.there is significant thickening of the prevertebral soft tissues extending from the lower cervical spine to the level of the carina, probably relating to thoracic spine fracture (described below).no active contrast extravasation is seen.round soft tissue densities along the left parietal pleura may represent herniated fat or loculated fluid/hemorrhage.evaluation of the thoracic osseous structures demonstrates right-sided flail chest, with comminuted fractures at virtually every level.there also appears to be nondisplaced minimally angulated fractures of the left 7th and 8th ribs.there appears to be an extension-teardrop fracture of approximately t2 as well as a chance fracture across the superior endplate of t10.there is significant persistent angulation of the thoracic spine due to the t10 fracture.
summary: large left pneumothorax.right flail chest.bilateral pulmonary contusions, right greater than left.multiple lacerations (probable grade of the right kidney, with contrast extravasation at the interpolar region.thoracic spine fractures at the t2 and t10 levels, described above.air within the liver with a branching pattern predominantly within the right medial lobe.focal region of intense enhancement within the spleen of uncertain significance.this could represent posttraumatic contrast pooling or vascular malformation.stranding around the superior mesenteric vessels is seen with attenuation of the caliber of the superior mesenteric artery.focus of intense enhancement (series 2 image 83) could represent a focus of hemorrhage.multiple pelvic fractures as described above, with fracture of the symphysis pubis as well as mild separation of the right sacroiliac joint.10) extensive subcutaneous emphysema primarily involving the thorax.11) while the foley catheter appears to extend into the bladder, it takes an unusual leftward trajectory while passing through the prostate.bladder injury cannot be excluded.12) there are soft tissue densities within the pleural space on the left, measuring up to 1.5 cm in size.this could represent some regions of thoracic fat which has herniated in to the pleural cavity or loculated hemorrhage/fluid.initial findings were initially discussed with the trauma team at the time of the scan.additional findings (spinal injuries) based on evaluation of multiplanar reformatted images were also discussed with dr.___ at 1:00 am, ___.

text: though this exam was not performed as a cta to optimally evaluate the vascular structures, there is extensive clot seen within the left upper lobe pulmonary artery and extending into the branches (2:17).no additional pulmonary emboli are seen.a small 14-mm wedge-shaped opacity in the left upper lobe may represent an associated pulmonary infarct, though is nonspecific.there are multiple other additional patchy opacities within the right middle lobe (2:27) and lingula as well, which are concerning for infection.more plate-like opacities at the lung bases are more likely atelectasis.there is a moderate sized right and small left pleural effusion with significant associated atelectasis.left subclavian catheter terminates within the upper svc.a precarinal lymph node measures 8 mm.right paratracheal nodes measure 9 mm and 12 mm.there are extensive mitral valve and aortic annular calcifications.
summary: left upper lobe pulmonary embolism.possible small left upper lobe infarct.multifocal patchy opacities within the lungs concerning for infectious process.evolution of subcapsular hepatic fluid collection, which is more discrete and would be amenable to drainage.marked improvement in the size and appearance of the pancreaticojejunal anastomotic leak collection with pigtail catheter in place and minimal residual fluid remaining.omental fat stranding in the right upper quadrant, concerning for an omental infarct.findings were discussed with ___ ___ at 3 p.m.on ___.

text: there is moderate-to-severe underlying emphysema.the patient is post-left upper lobectomy with stable post-surgical changes.there has been an increase in diffuse ground glass opacification throughout both lungs.in addition, there is increased interstitial thickening with a few areas of somewhat nodular appearing opacification, particularly in the left lower lobe.bilateral pleural effusions are present, increased on the right since the prior examination.numerous enlarged mediastinal, precarinal, and subcarinal lymph nodes as well as right peridiaphragmatic lymph nodes are present.these are larger than on the prior study.the largest lymph nodes are seen in the subcarinal region measuring up to 17 mm and in the pretracheal region measuring 16 mm.the bronchi appear patent to the segmental level.a right-sided subclavian central venous catheter is present with its tip in the distal svc near the cavoatrial junction.dense coronary calcifications are identified.the aorta is also calcified throughout its intrathoracic course.there is no pericardial effusion.gallstones are present within the gallbladder.a calcified granuloma is seen posteriorly in the spleen.the remainder of the visualized upper abdomen is unremarkable.severe degenerative changes are seen throughout the thoracic spine.additionally, there is an old healed left posterior fifth rib fracture.
summary: marked increase in diffuse bilateral ground glass opacification, interstitial thickening, and right pleural effusion.there is also persistent left pleural effusion.the findings are most consistent with worsening congestive heart failure.differential diagnosis includes pulmonary hemorrhage, drug toxicity and atypical infection.increase in size of mediastinal lymphadenopathy, likely reactive.these findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of interpretation.

text: there are diffuse emphysematous changes of the lungs.there is no pneumothorax, focal consolidation, or suspicious nodule, there is trace atelectasis at the left lung base.the nodular opacity suggested on the prior chest x-ray is not appreciated on the current ct.the airway is patent to the segmental level.there is moderately enlarged mediastinal lymph node, difficult to accurately measure, but likely measuring about 1cm in short axis diameter, of uncertain significance.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are otherwise normal.the aorta enhances normally throughout its thoracic course.there is normal opacification of the main, and major segmental branches of the pulmonary arteries.there is suboptimal contrast peripherally, however, there is a small filling defect in an isolated subsegmental branch in the right lower lobe, best seen on series 3, image 32 & 33 on the axial imaging.it is also seen on the coronally obliqued reformatted images on series 106b, image 51.

text: the patient is intubated.a nasogastric tube is present, its distal most aspect is not included on the images and is likely within the stomach or proximal duodenum.a right-sided central venous catheter is identified with its tip in the region of the svc.the thyroid is grossly unremarkable.there is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.no pericardial effusion is present.the main, right, left, and lobar branches of the pulmonary arteries enhance normally.there is no evidence of intraluminal filling defect to suggest an embolus.the subsegmental branches are incompletely opacified.respiratory motion limits evaluation of the pulmonary parenchyma, however, there is a right-sided pleural effusion with adjacent consolidation containing air- bronchograms.linear atelectasis is present at the left lung base evaluation of the abdominal contents is limited on this examination however a collection likely containing surgi-cell (packing material) is present posterior to the right lobe of the liver with an associated drainage catheter .the entirety of the collection and catheter are not included on this study.no fractures are identified.no osteoblastic or lytic lesions are present.

text: on the contrast-enhanced images, only the proximal left carotid artery is included.the upper arch vessels and neck were not included in the study.there is an ascending aortic stent graft.there has been interval thrombosis of the focal aneurysm/pseudoaneurysm arising from the anterior ascending aorta and there is no longer contrast filling this structure.the ascending aorta is normal in caliber, measuring 3.4 cm and the descending aorta measures 2.8 cm.there is normal opacification of the proximal vessels of the great arch.again seen is aneurysmal dilation of the right brachiocephalic artery up to 2.3 cm.the left subclavian-left common carotid bypass graft is not included in the field of view.the central pulmonary arteries opacify normally with no evidence of central or proximal pulmonary embolism.there are several prominent mediastinal lymph nodes measuring up to 9 mm in the precarinal and 7 mm in the right paratracheal nodal stations, however, these are unchanged from prior exam and likely reactive.there are extensive coronary artery calcifications.right pleural effusion has increased slightly in size and increasingly loculated.the lungs are clear, with centrilobular emphysema in the upper lung zones.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.

text: an aorta is intact.there are no filling defects in the central pulmonary arteries.in the branch of the posterior basal segment of the left lower lobe are equivocal filling defects, 3:35 and 59.the contrast images were obtained at lower inspiration on the ostensible expiration images and show mild air trapping and anterior displacement of the posterior wall of the upper trachea air producing the diameters from 22.4 x 16.6 mm (2:9).a study protocol for assessment of tracheobronchomalacia could show more significant narrowing.secretions or a small region of tracheal wall thickening is present at the level of the aortic arch at the right junction of the membranous and cartilaginous walls.the only enlargement of central lymph nodes in the right lower paratracheal station, 10.9 mm across, 3:54.

text: the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber, without evidence of dissection.the pulmonary arteries opacify normally.no pulmonary embolism is identified.a right central venous catheter terminates in the upper aspect of the superior vena cava.there are calcifications of the aortic arch and branch vessels.median sternotomy wires and clips are consistent with prior history of cabg.there is a prosthetic aortic valve.nasogastric tube terminates in the stomach.there is extensive consolidation of the dependent portion of the right upper lobe.debris within the right upper lobe bronchus liklely relates to secretions, and therefore this consolidation may be due to atelectasis, although underlying infection cannot be excluded.there is dependent atelectasis at the lower lobes bilaterally and small pleural effusions.diffuse septal thickening with ground glass opacities is consistent with fluid overload/pulmonary edema.there are numerous enlarged and non-pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum.there are multiple prevascular nodes, the largest measuring 8 mm in short axis.an ap window node measures 1.2 cm in short axis, and an upper pretracheal node measures 1.1 cm in short axis.there are multiple lower pretracheal lymph nodes, and subcarinal lymph nodes, the largest of which measures 1.4 cm in short axis.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.

text: again, note is made of enhancing right-sided nodule measuring 15 x 17 mm in diameter, unchanged since ___.the patient is status post partial thyroidectomy with surgical clips.note is made of 11 mm right hilar nodes, unchanged since ___.again, note is made of coronary artery calcification.the heart is normal in size.no pathological pericardial or pleural effusion noted.note is made of minimal pleural thickening on the left.in the lung window, note is made of linear scarring at the left lung base, associated with 5 mm nodular opacity, unchanged since ___.again, note is made of noncalcified pulmonary nodules measuring less than 5 mm in bilateral upper lobes, unchanged since ___.no new masses or nodules identified.the airways are patent, and there is no endobronchial lesion.in the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, again note is made of multiple enhancing masses in the liver, representing worsening metastasis.the evaluation of the retroperitoneum and abdomen is severely limited due to artifact of surgical clips.again, note is made of bilateral renal masses with right adrenal metastasis, as mentioned in the recent mri abdomen study.multiple calcifications in the spleen is noted, representing prior granulomatous infection.one sclerotic spot in the thoracic vertebrae, unchanged compared to ___ ___.no other lytic or blastic lesion noted.

text: the thyroid gland is homogeneous without focal nodule.no supraclavicular or axillary lymphadenopathy is identified.scattered mediastinal lymph nodes are unchanged in size compared to prior and are not pathologically enlarged by ct size criteria.the thoracic aorta demonstrates mild atherosclerotic calcifications, though is non-aneurysmal throughout its course.there is no central pulmonary embolism on this venous phase study.the heart size is normal.trace pericardial fluid is identified, within physiologic normal limits.the patient is status post right upper lobectomy for prior lung carcinoma.post-surgical changes in the right hilum appear improved from most recent prior examination.there remains a moderate amount of pleural fluid, some loculated superiorly, with a focal apical loculation measuring 1.1 x 2.1 cm in coronal projection (105b:36).no residual air is seen within the pleural space to suggest bronchopleural fistula.mild soft tissue thickening along the surgical margin is likely secondary to postoperative changes (104:25).no enhancing mass lesion is identified at the surgical margin to suggest local recurrence.the central tracheobronchial tree is patent.however, there is new narrowing of the right main stem bronchus and right lower lobe bronchus; heterogenous opacities are seen centrally, with distal occlusion of the subsegmental bronchioles and diffuse bronchiole wall thickening.findings likely represent acute bronchitis with distal mucus plugging.an endobronchial obstructing mass lesion is less likely given the lack of atelectasis in this region.the left-sided subsegmental bronchi are widely patent.moderate centrilobular emphysema is unchanged from prior.beyond the post-surgical changes, no new focal pulmonary nodule or consolidation is identified.
summary: persistent non-hemorrhagic right pleural effusion with focal area of loculation superiorly measuring 2.1 cm.no residual pneumothorax is evident.post-surgical changes in the right hilum from prior right upper lobectomy.no enhancing mass lesion to suggest local recurrence.heterogeneous opacification of the right main stem bronchus extending into the right lower lobe bronchus with distal plugging and bronchial wall thickening, findings most suggestive of acute bronchial inflammation with mucus plugging.endobronchial lesion is much less likely given the lack of atelectasis.increasing heterotopic ossification at site or right chest wall thoracotomy.new linear lucency through the posterior right 7th rib may be related to bone remodeling, though close attention on follow-up is recommended.

text: the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.2 mm nodule is in the right lower lobe series 3, image 37.previously described nodule in the left lower lobe is not longer visualized.there are no mediastinal, hilar or axillary enlarged lymph nodes.dense coronary calcifications in the lad.cardiac size is normal.the aorta is normal in caliber.patient is status post esophagectomy.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.the visualized portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.there are no bone findings of malignancy.
