text: two or three nodular lesions are present inferior to the left lobe of the thyroid, which may represent lymph nodes, slightly larger than on the prior examination.the larger of these measures 17 x 18 mm today (previously 14 x 19).there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphenopathy.the region of the large and dominant left upper lobe lung mass is probably not significantly changed in the interval.on the prior exam, it measured 6.2 x 4.9 cm, and in a comparable measurement today, this is 5.9 x 5.7 cm.however, on today's exam, virtually the entire left hemithorax is filled with pleural fluid, with virtually total collapse of all remaining lung parenchyma.no frank obstructing airway lesions are seen.there is also a loculation of air lateral to the chest mass, which could represent a bleb or result from a hydropneumothorax.as a result of this large effusion, there is substantial shift of the midline structures toward the right.additionally, at the right lung base, there is an 8-mm pulmonary nodule, which has increased slightly in size since the prior exam, when it measured approximately 6 mm.emphysematous changes, particularly at the lung apices, are also of note.a second ground- glass opacity in the lateral right lower lobe in a subpleural position has greater conspicuity on today's examination, measuring approximately 5 mm in diameter.ct of abdomen without & with contrast: the patient is status post cholecystectomy.the liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and small bowel appear within normal limits.multiple retroperitoneal lymph nodes are present, measuring up to 8 mm in size in the left paraaortic region, and 6 mm in size in the porta hepatis.these lymph nodes were not noted on prior exam.there is no abdominal free fluid present.
summary: development of massive left-sided pleural effusions, with associated collapse of the entire left lung.this may also be associated with a small focal hydropneumothorax.no significant change in size of left lung mass.multiple pulmonary nodules, as described above.these appear more prominent than on prior study.new lymph nodes within the retroperitoneum and porta hepatis do not meet the criteria for pathologic enlargement but were not evident on the prior exam.enhancing nodular structure in the region of the right buttock.while this could represent focal hemorrhage from injection, metastatic foci should also be considered.preliminary report of these findings was provided for dr.___ after completion of the scan, ___.

text: there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the mediastinal vessels are unremarkable.the heart is normal in size.a small pericardial effusion is noted.there are no pleural effusions.several pulmonary nodules are seen, these are stable in size.no new nodules are identified.
summary: no change in comparison to prior examination of ___.1.bilateral pulmonary nodules stable in size.no new lesions identified.2.status post left nephrectomy with soft tissue adjacent to the nephrectomy clips.this is stable in appearance and consistent with scar tissue.no evidence for disease recurrence.

text: soft tissue windows demonstrate multiple intraarterial filling defects within the right lower lobe pulmonary artery and extending into multiple subsegmental arteries within the right lower lobe.there are no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymph nodes.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are unremarkable.there are no pericardial or pleural effusions.lung windows demonstrate no focal consolidations or pneumothoraces.there are a few 1-2 mm subpleural nodules of unknown clinical significance.there is mild bibasilar atelectasis.the airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.bone windows demonstrate diffuse degenerative changes, but no evidence of lytic or sclerotic lesions.multiplanar reformatted images confirm the above findings.
summary: extensive pulmonary embolism involving the right lower lobe pulmonary artery and extending to include multiple subsegmental arteries.tiny pulmonary nodules, within the right middle and lower lobes, of uncertain clinical significance.if indicated, a ___ month followup exam may be helpful in documenting their stability.note the patient's left arm iv access infiltrated towards the end of the injection bolus, with approximately 25 cc of iv contrast material within the subcutaneous tissues of the left forearm.compression and ice were immediately applied and the patient's er attending physician was immediately notified.

text: emphysema is severe and although an endotracheal tube is in standard position, the oblate configuration of the trachea suggests tracheomalacia, reflected also in moderately severe narrowing of the bronchus intermedius, diameter 5 mm.heterogeneous peribronchial opacification predominantly in the dependent regions of the lower lobes is consistent with pneumonia as shown by conventional radiographs.some of the ground-glass peribronchial opacification in the nondependent lungs could also be infectious.bilateral layering nonhemorrhagic pleural effusion is small on the left, tiny on the right, not of a size to suggest empyema.an 11-mm wide left lower paratracheal lymph node is the only central node pathologically enlarged.aside from mild-to-moderate atherosclerotic calcification and solitary mural thrombus in the descending portion, the thoracic aorta is normal.the main and intrapericardial right pulmonary arteries are borderline enlarged, 32 and 26 mm respectively.there are no pulmonary emboli.the heart is borderline enlarged with no chamber predominance and there is no pericardial effusion.
summary: resolving pneumonia in setting of severe emphysema sufficient to explain respiratory findings.small left pleural effusion probably of no active clinical significance.no pulmonary emboli.severe emphysema, sufficient to explain possible pulmonary arterial hypertension.

text: an 8 mm hypodense nodule in the right lobe of the thyroid is unchanged.an enlarged left hilar node appears slightly less prominent, measuring 15 x 9 mm in axial dimensions, compared to 19 x 10 mm on the prior examination.coronary artery calcifications are present.the pulmonary nodules are mostly similar to slightly improved.a left upper lobe nodule (lesion 1, 2:30) measures 19 x 14 mm, compared to 17 x 15 mm before, similar to minimally increased.a nodule in the superior segment of the right lower lobe (series 2, 2:27) measures 13 x 12 mm, which is unchanged, however, since prior measurements of 12 x 12 mm.a right upper lobe nodule (lesion 3, 2:29) measures 10 x 7 mm, compared to 10 x 8 mm previously, not significantly changed.however, two left lower lobe nodules are definitely smaller.the larger is a conglomerate of two nodules measuring overall approximately 13 x 9 mm in axial dimensions (2:36), compared to 16 x 12 mm previously.more inferiorly in the left lower lobe, a nodule that measured 14 x 12 mm previously now measures only 11 x 7 mm.there are several other nodules in each lung that mostly are little if at all changed, although a few smaller nodules less than 5 mm in diameter in the right upper lobe appear less distinct.this may reflect true improvement, although there is probably slight blurring due to motion artifact on this study.indicative is a previously well-defined nodule measuring 4 mm in diameter on the last examination that now measures only 2-3 mm.
summary: mostly similar to improved lung nodules, although one of the target lesions shows a very minimal increase in its measurements.stable appearance of the thoracic spine following fusion.

text: the endotracheal tube and the nasogastric tube are in place.the et tube should be retracted about 2 cm.the heart and great vessels appear unremarkable-althought there is dilatation of the ascending aorta to 4.4 cm.the patient's dialysis catheter terminates in the right atrium.atelectatic changes are noted at the lung bases.tree in ___ pattern of nodular densities are noted in the right lower lobe.there is bibasal bronchial wall thickening with distal mucoid impaction.no consolidation or pleural effusion is seen.the esophagus is dilated and contains debris and ng tube.aspiration should be considered.
summary: no cause for the patient's fever is identified.et tube should be retracted a little bit.this was subsequently discussed with dr ___ ___ by dr ___ ___.there is some atelectasis of the left lung and mild mucoid impaction multiple hypodense kidney lesions which are too small to characterize.stable left renal angiomyolipoma.

text: there is a left upper lobe lung mass measuring approximately 4.6 cm (transverse) x 3.3 cm (ap) x 3.6 cm (cc), causing complete collapse of the left upper lobe.the mass extends into the mediastinal fat at the level of the carina (2:21), although there may be still a small separation between this mass and the wall of the trachea.there is circumferential encasement of the left pulmonary artery (2:23 and 601b:22)by the lung mass with marked narrowing of the lumen.there is an approximately 1.5 cm segment where the lumen measures only 1-2 mm in diameter.while no pulmonary embolism is identified, there is a oligemia of the left lower lobe with smaller left pulmonary vasculature when compared to the right.a 6 mm x 3 mm pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe (2:31) and 2 mm nodule in the right upper lobe (2:32) are present.the remainder of the lungs are clear.a 4-mm paraaortic lymph node is present (2:21).however, no pathologically enlarged hilar or mediastinal lymph nodes are detected.no supraclavicular or axillary lymphadenopathy is noted.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.there is nodular thickening of the left adrenal gland measuring up to 9 mm, incompletely assessed on this single phase study.the spleen and other visualized portions of subdiaphragmatic organs are within normal limits.
summary: mass in the left upper lobe measuring up to 4.6 cm, causing complete collapse of the left upper lobe, most consistent with a primary lung malignancy.this tumor is centrally located and extends into the mediastinal fat.it encases the left pulmonary artery and severely narrows it causing relative oligemia of the left lower lobe when compared to the right lung.no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.left lower lobe pulmonary nodule measuring 6 mm x 3mm and right lower lobe nodule measuring 2 mm.nodularity of the left adrenal gland measuring up to 9 mm, incompletely assessed on this single phase study.

text: the lung window images demonstrate patchy peripheral areas of ground glass opacificaiton in the lingula and left lower lobe, probable reflecting a mixture of aspiration and atelectasis.there is linear scarring within the anterior left upper lobe.asymmetric interlobular septal thickening at the right lung base may reflect lymphangitic spread of tumor.there is a small right pleural effusion, partially loculated anteriorly, with enhancing margins posteriorly.extensive atelectasis of the right lower, middle and upper lobes are seen.at the apex of the right hemithorax, gas is seen within the pleural space.a vague area of irregular enhancement is seen adjacent to the right main stem bronchus, with irregular narrowing of this structure.irregularity of the contour of the carina is consistent with invasion.there is probably right hilar lymphadenopathy, although this is difficult to evaluate given the surrounding atelectasis.prominent left hilar lymph nodes measure up to 8 mm in short axis diameter.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.the heart is not enlarged and there is no pericardial effusion.in the imaged upper abdomen, several low attenuation lesions within the liver with surrounding enhancement are consistent with metastases.the superior gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands and kidneys are normal in appearance.no destructive osseous lesions are identified.
summary: central right lung mass causing irregular narrowing of the right main stem bronchus and invading the carina.there is an associated malignant effusion, with gas in the pleural space consistent with bronchopleural fistula.numerous peripherally enhancing low attenuation lesions in the liver are consistent with metastases.

text: no filling defect is identified within the pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolus.the thoracic aorta maintains a normal contour without evidence of dissection.the heart and pericardium are within normal limits.a left chest wall port-a-cath is present with catheter tip terminating within the distal svc.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.esophageal stent is seen extending from the mid esophagus to the gastroesophageal junction similar to a prior ct.pooled secretions are present within the stented portion of the esophagus.the esophageal stent is surrounded by soft tissue mass and shows moderate compression in the mid stent with the luminal diameter measuring 7 mm.esophatrast contrast administered during the exam demonstrates passage into the stomach.again seen are several gas pockets within the soft tissue mass adjacent to the mid stent, similar to prior exam which may represent focal esophageal perforation or related to tumor necrosis .compared to the prior exam there appears to be increased size of the esophagus mass, which now extends further along the azygoesophageal recess tracking posterior to the bronchus intermedius and along the right paraspinal pleura.the lungs show patchy opacities involving the right lung base as well as more focal nodular consoldation within the posterior segment of the right upper lobe.no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.no significant change in several prominent mediastinal lymph nodes.limited views of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.
summary: no evidence for acute pulmonary embolus or aortic dissection.status post placement of esophageal stent with interval increase in tumor extension along the right paraspinal region.again seen are foci of gas adjacent to the right mid stent, which raise the possibility of a focal perforation or related to tumor necrosis, essentially unchanged.patchy opacity within the right lung base as well as more focal nodular opacitieswithin the posterior segment of the right upper lobe which may represent pneumonia or aspiration.

text: pre-contrast images demonstrate no dense intramural hematoma in the aorta.post-contrast images demonstrate a large right pleural effusion and a large left pleural effusion.these have increased since the previous exam.there is worsened atelectasis and consolidation involving primarily the lower lobes.a new area of consolidation is present in the right middle lobe.there is increased intralobular thickening present bilaterally, also primarily in the lower lobes.the left lower lobe bronchus is compressed by soft tissue.this is best seen for example on series 4, image 72 and 71.there is extensive mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.a central line is present with its tip in the svc.there is coronary artery disease.there is aortic atherosclerosis.the bone lesions demonstrate no lytic or blastic lesions.the tip of the endotracheal tube is above the carina.images of the upper abdomen demonstrate a new low-density lesion in the spleen, which may represent an infectious process.there are low-density lesions in the liver, which are incompletely visualized on this examination, but abnormal lesions at the dome were nonvisualized on exam from ___.there is no aortic dissection.there is no dense intramural hematoma within the aorta on pre-contrast images.
summary: worsened bilateral multifocal pneumonia.increased pneumonia in the lower lobes also raises the possibility of aspiration.increased pleural effusions.diffuse thoracic lymphadenopathy.compression of the left lower lobe bronchus by tumor or by consolidated lung.no pulmonary embolism to the level of the segmental pulmonary arteries.

text: the soft tissue window images reveal significant reduction in the side of the left axillary lymph node.this currently measures 1.1 x 1.6 cm and previously measured 2.2 x 2.1 cm.there is no significant mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the heart, pericardium and great vessels are unremarkable.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.the lung window images reveal the previously seen multiple subcm nodular densities are not visualized.an area of ground glass opacity is visualized in this region which likely represents post radiation changes.a port-a-cath is visualized on the right side.no areas of consolidation are visualized.the airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.
summary: interval progression of disease with increased size and number of liver lesions along with a large area of perfusion defect.interval reduction in the size of the large left axillary lymph node.post radiation changes in the right lung.unchanged appearance of numerous sclerotic bony metastases.

text: 3.9 x 3.4 cm pretracheal lymph node conglomerate (5:17) was previously seen to be fdg-avid and is stable in size, prior 3.9 x 3.1 cm.right hilar node (5:28) is enlarged, measuring 1.4 cm, unchanged from prior, and was previously shown to be non-fdg avid.other calcified right hilar lymph nodes are likely secondary to prior granulomatous disease.a 6 mm pulmonary nodule in the right lower lobe (5:29) is unchanged from prior and was not previously fdg-avid.12 mm calcified right lower lobe nodule (5:41) is also unchanged from prior.there is bilateral dependent bibasilar atelectasis.no new pulmonary nodule or new pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the chest.the thyroid is unremarkable.multiple metallic clips are seen in the left supraclavicular region.the great vessels are unremarkable.sternotomy wires and mediastinal clips are present.the heart is of normal size.there is subendocardial fatty deposition in the left ventricle, likely related to prior infarct.the pericardium is intact without effusion.
summary: large pretracheal lymph node conglomerate, stable in size.no definite new extrathoracic metastasis.new 6-mm ischioanal fossa lymph node is of uncertain significance.1.4 cm right hilar lymph node, stable in size and previously non-fdg avid.unchanged 6 mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule.calcified granulomatous disease of right lung and spleen.

text: although respiratory motion of the lower lobes limits evaluation of subsegmental vessels, there is no evidence for central main lobar or segmental pulmonary emboli.additionally, there are no secondary signs of emboli including no evidence of right-sided heart strain.atherosclerotic calcifications involve the thoracic aorta and its branches, though the thoracic aorta is of normal caliber.several partially calcified mediastinal and left hilar lymph nodes represent prior granulomatous exposure.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the known soft tissue mass with epicenter at the level of the right atrium measures approximately 4.4 x 1.8 cm (3:72) compared to 4.3 x 2.4 cm on ___.narrowing of the superior vena cava by this mass is unchanged.a new small focal consolidation is noted at the right lung base medially.the left lung remains clear.a 4-mm right lower lobe lung nodule (3:65) is not significantly changed.a small amount of secretions are noted in the right mainstem bronchus.otherwise, the airways appear patent to the subsegmental level.although this exam is not tailored to evaluate subdiaphragmatic structures, limited evaluation of the upper abdomen reveals multiple stones within the kidney.a left upper pole renal cyst is partially imaged, with a smaller cysts noted in the right interpolar region.1.8 cm right adrenal mass is unchanged in size.bone windows again reveal high-grade compression deformity in the mid thoracic spine, unchanged.old healed left posterolateral fracture deformity of the tenth rib is unchanged.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.new small consolidation at right lung base may represent pneumonic consolidation or, in the setting of airway secretions, aspiration.perhaps slight decrease in size of cardiac mass compared to ct from ___, with persistent mass effect on superior vena cava.no change in size of right adrenal mass and right lower lobe lung nodule.

text: the uppermost portion of the lung apices are excluded from the examination.there is a 3-mm nodular density in the left lower lobe just adjacent to the major fissure (6:21).an additional 2-mm nodule is seen laterally in the left lower lobe (6:33), and there is a focal density along the course of the major fissure on the left (6:28).a tiny focus of branching ground-glass opacity in the lingula (6:33) is of uncertain significance.there are no pathologically-enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph nodes.numerous pretracheal and paratracheal, and prevascular lymph nodes are present, but do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.the central airways are patent.the heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.
summary: status post partial small bowel resection for metastatic gist tumor.although no pathologically-enlarged lymph nodes are identified, multiple small nodules in the omental fat and mesentery are noted and are indeterminate.these could possibly correspond to peritoneal studding seen at the time of surgery and therefore continued attention to these regions on followup imaging is recommended.two 5-mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodules.continued followup with chest ct in three months is recommended.tiny hypodensity in the left kidney is too small to adequately characterize.

text: there is moderate-to-severe upper lobe predominant emphysema.within the trachea, intraluminal secretions are seen (2:13).opacity in the right lower lobe may reflect atelectasis, though aspiration cannot be excluded.tiny bilateral pleural effusions are noted.no pneumothorax.multiple hypodense thyroid nodules within an enlarged thyroid gland are noted, predominantly on the left side.the main pulmonary artery is enlarged consistent with pulmonary arterial hypertension.there is no evidence of central pulmonary embolus.no evidence of mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy by ct criteria.pacer wires terminate in the right atrium and right ventricle.the heart is moderately enlarged and coronary artery calcifciations are present in the left anterior descending and circumflex arteries.no pericardial effusion is seen.the mid esophagus is mildly dilated and contains fluid.
summary: no acute traumatic injury within the torso.specifically, no evidence of acute rib fractures or liver lacerations.dilated left gonadal vein and pelvic varices, findings which can be seen with pelvic congestion syndrome and clinical correlation is recommended.thyroid nodules for which thyroid ultrasound is recommended for further evaluation if not done recently.right lower lobe opacity, possibly atelectasis though aspiration is not excluded, particularly as there are secretions noted within the trachea and fluid is seen within the esophagus.small bilateral pleural effusions.emphysema and evidence for pulmonary arterial hypertension.

text: the study is suboptimal due to beam hardening and streak artifact secondary to body habitus.ng and et tubes are in expected positions.no filling defects are seen within the pulmonary arteries or their major branches to the fourth order level.a basilar parenchymal opacification may be related to atelectasis or consolidation.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.the aorta and coronary arteries are diffusely calcified.fluid is seen layering within the oblique fissures.the heart size is at the upper limits of normal.several prominent mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet strict criteria for enlargement.there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.the visualized dome of the liver is normal in appearance.
summary: slightly limited study without evidence of pulmonary embolism.bibasilar areas of parenchymal opacification with adjacent small pleural effusions.these could represent atelectasis vs.consolidation.

text: there is increased burden of disease with multiple and numerous pulmonary nodules bilaterally, not seen on previous study from ___.lesion one within the hilar region measures 35 mm x 24 mm, previously measuring 31 mm x 23 mm.lesion two still on the right perihilar region measures 30 mm x 28 mm, previously measuring 32 mm x 23 mm.lesion three within the right perihilar region now measures 4.6 cm x 3.3 cm, previously measuring 4.3 cm x 2.9 cm.the right middle lobe lung nodule comprising lesion four currently, measures 37 mm x 35 mm, previously measured 24 mm x 24 mm.within the abdomen lesion five, which likely comprises a left adrenal lesion now measures 36 mm x 28 mm previously measuring 38 mm x 29 mm.the major airways are patent down to the subsegmental level.no pulmonary embolism or dissection is appreciated.the nodule within the left breast is similar in size and appearance, currently measuring 21 mm x 18 mm.
summary: there is substantial overall increase in tumor burden since previous study in ___.innumerous lesions are now identified within every segment of the liver, bilateral lungs, and several new lesions noted within the spleen.there is interval enlargement of the majority of target lesions which have been placed in the oncology table.there is enlargement of the soft tissue lesion abutting the right kidney consistent with worsening tumor burden.stable appearance of left breast subcutaneous nodule.increased size of periumbilical subcutaneous nodule.

text: no nodules are seen in the unenhanced thyroid gland.the thoracic aorta is upper limits of normal size measuring 3.9 cm in the ascending portion.there is no evidence of acute intramural hematoma or dissection.pulmonary arterial vasculature is well visualized to the subsegmental level without filling defect to suggest pulmonary embolism.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes, measuring up to 14 mm in the subcarinal region.there are dense atherosclerotic calcifications in the lad.there is a small pericardial effusion.a moderate left pleural effusion is seen.there is a small right pleural effusion.lung window images demonstrate bilateral compressive atelectasis adjacent to the pleural effusions.there is no worrisome nodule or consolidation.the study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.a 10-mm hypodensity in the left hepatic lobe (3:66) is too small to characterize.otherwise, the visualized portions of the liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas and bilateral adrenal glands and bowel are normal.
summary: no acute aortic pathology or pulmonary embolism.small pericardial effusion.moderate left pleural effusion and small right pleural effusion with adjacent compressive atelectasis.healed right 6th and 7th rib fractures.

text: marked vascular calcifications are seen along the coronary arteries.there is no axillary lymph adenopathy.a precarinal lymph node measures up to 1.4 cm in short axis.small hilar lymph nodes are also present, but not meeting size criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is a small pericardial effusion present.there are small bilateral pleural effusions as well.at the left lung apex, there appear to be loculations of pleural fluid particularly at the left lung apex, where there are lobulations of fluid density material along the pleura.in addition, fluid tracks along the varying fissures.several patchy opacities are seen at both lung bases, some of which represent atelectasis, although contribution of small foci of aspiration/pneumonia cannot be excluded.there is compressive atelectasis of the left lower lobe, with very little of the left lower lobe aerated.at the left base, there is also a 2 cm focus of patchy opacity, probably infectious in nature.limited evaluation of the visualized upper abdominal structures demonstrates left adrenal adenoma, with a small amount of ascites seen, and multiple surgical staples along the stomach, probably from prior bariatric surgery.there is a diffusely hazy and ___ appearance of the soft tissues, suggesting diffuse edema/anasarca.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.unusual-appearing left-sided pleural effusion with areas of loculation.the actual lobulated appearance of this is not typical for a simple pleural effusion.after treatment and resolution of the acute process, a follow-up ct of the chest is recommended for further evaluation of this finding to evaluate for pleural thickening.there is a small pericardial effusion and ascites, with appearance of generalized edema/anasarca.multiple focal patchy opacities within both lungs probably represent sequellae of aspiration or pneumonia.

text: the thoracic aorta is ectatic and heavily calcified.there is a circumferential intramural thrombus surrounding the aortic arch and especially in the descending aorta which is very tortuous.the extent of the intramural thrombus has increased compared to prior study from ___.at the level of the distal thoracic aorta the ap diameter of the aorta has increased from 3.5 to 4.3 cm since prior study from ___.there are several ulcerated plaques within the descending aorta.the celiac, supermesenteric and renal arteries are patent.there is an infrarenal aortic graft with an intramural hematoma.the size of the infrarenal aneurysm has decreased in size in the interval.the aortobifem bypass is patent.there is no evidence of filling defects within the main pulmonary artery and its branches.the heart size is in the upper limits of normal.there is no pericardial fluid.there is a tiny left pleural effusion.the right lobe of the thyroid is enlarged and has several hypodense nodules.there are no enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes.there is a small amount of fluid in the superior pericardial recess.lung windows demonstrate bilateral centrilobular emphysematous changes which are more prominent in the upper lobes.there are bibasilar dependent atelectases.there are extensive degenterative changes in the thoracic spine.
summary: ulcerated plaque in the descending aorta.increase in the extent of the circumferential intramural hematoma in the descending aorta.right adnexal cyst, follow with ultrasound is suggested.findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of the exam.

text: the heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion.the aorta is of normal caliber throughout without evidence of intimal flap.there is a prominent ductus bump, which was also present on the prior study.the central and segmental pulmonary arteries are well opacified without evidence of filling defects.heterogenous density within the superior vena cava is consistent with mixing.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.the lungs are clear, apart from a small amount of thickening of the left major fissure.there are no pleural effusions or pneumothoraces.there is no pathologic axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are small lymph nodes in the ap window region.the osseous structures demonstrate no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions, no fractures.the visualized upper abdomen appears unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of central or segmental pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.

text: again, notice made of perivascular, paratracheal, and right hilar lymphadenopathy, measuring 1 cm in short axis in right hilum.the heart is normal in size and there is no evidence of pericardial effusion.prominent bilateral hilar axillary lymph nodes are again noted.notice was made of empyema in the right lower thorax, associated with air and chest tube in pleural space, decrease in amount compared to the prior study.associated atelectasis in the right lower lobe is also decreased.the underlying lung has mild emphysema.the airways are patent and there is no endobronchial lesion.no new consolidation or mass is noted.in the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, possible splenomegaly is noted.there is no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion in skeletal structures.
summary: persistent mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy as described above.decrease of the amount of right and associated atelectasis, with chest tube.underlying emphysema.probable splenomegaly.

text: there is a 5-mm nodule on the right upper lobe, which is unchanged compared to ___, but appears smaller compared to ___.in the superior segment of the right lower lobe there is an ovoid opacity with somewhat lobulated margins.this is difficult to measure but appears unchanged compared with ___, and is slightly less dense-appearing, and perhaps slightly smaller compared with ___.there are few, if any, residual septal lines noted at the right lung base.a few faint, scattered areas of peripheral ground-glass opacity have also improved in the interval since the most recent prior study.there are no airway lesions.there is no effusion or pneumothorax.there is significant lymphadenopathy involving the right paratracheal, precarinal, subcarinal, ap window, and left hilar regions.at all of these locations, however, the lymph nodes have decreased in size compared with the prior study.these lymph nodes have a low-attenuation appearance.for example, the right paratracheal lymph node previously measured 28 x 19 mm.currently, it measures 21 x 12 mm.the imaged portions of the upper abdomen reveal splenomegaly and no other focal abnormalities.the bones are unremarkable.
summary: overall improvement in mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy compared with ___, with associated improvement in faint ground-glass opacities.right upper lobe 5-mm nodule and ovoid right lower lobe superior segment opacity are unchanged compared with the most recent prior study but improved relative to ___.there are no new abnormalities detected.

text: there are a number of filling defects in the subsegmental branches of the right and left lower lobes.no large central thrombus is identified.there are moderate bilateral pleural effusions.the lung windows demonstrate a diffuse symmetric ground glass opacification which has a ___ type appearance.no masses or consolidations identified.
summary: bilateral subsegmental pulmonary emboli confined to the lower lobe vessels.appearance of the lungs are most likely due to either fluid overload or aords.bilateral pleural effusions.

text: the opacified pulmonary arterial tree demonstrates multiple filling defects consistent with pulmonary emboli.several small, left apical pulmonary emboli of second or third order subsegmental arteries are evident.multiple right apical emboli are present, as well as a large clot in a first- order right upper lobe segmental branch.additional pulmonary embolus is present within a right posterior branch.the visualized lung fields demonstrate small bilateral pleural effusions with associated atelectatic changes.there is a 4-mm nodular density within the right upper lobe which in retrospect was present in the previous examination from ___ and appears larger in size.this is concerning for a possible metastatic focus.there is a prominent, 9-mm pretracheal lymph node which is not enlarged per ct criteria.otherwise, no significant mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy is present.limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate numerous low-attenuation foci within the liver consistent with metastatic disease.
summary: multiple bilateral subsegmental pulmonary emboli, as described above.interval increase in size of small right upper lobe lung nodule, concerning for a potential metastatic focus.small bilateral pleural effusions.multiple liver metastases.

text: there is bibasilar dependent atelectasis with small bilateral pleural effusions.there is scattered bilateral emphysema and bilateral apical scars which appear unchanged compared to previous examination.the patient is intubated and there is a gastric tube present within the esophagus.the balloon cuff on the endotracheal tube distends the trachea and deforms the esophagus.there are scattered mediastinal lymph nodes that are not enlarged by ct criteria.the origin of the coronary arteries is normal and the cardiac ___ are normal in appearance.there is no evidence for pulmonary embolism, dissection, or aneurysm.there is minimal atherosclerosis of the aorta.there is minimal calcification of the coronary arteries and there is no valvular calcification.
summary: marked distention of the distal duodenum and jejunum with thickening of the mucosal wall concerning for ischemia, though could represnet shock bowel.there is no evidence for vascular insufficiency.there is no evidence for small bowel obstruction and distal loops of small and large bowel are normal in appearance.there is mild periportal edema as well as a small amount of ascites surrounding the liver and free fluid in the pelvis, likely due to patient's volume resuscitation.the right femoral vein catheter turns back on itself within the lumen of right external iliac vein and would needs repositioning.the balloon of the endotracheal tube cuff appears to distend the trachea and deform the esophagus.would recommend changing the inflation pressure.no evidence for pulmonary embolism.old left rib fractures and degenerative changes.the results of this study were communicated with dr.___ ___ at approximately 11:00 a.m.on ___.

text: again noted is an area of scarring in the left upper lobe consistent with prior radiation therapy.no concerning lung parenchymal lesions or pleural effusions are seen.no pneumothorax is identified.no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes are seen.there is a small hiatal hernia.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.incidental note is made of bilateral fat-containing bochdalek hernias, similar in appearance to prior examinations.
summary: no ct evidence of acute intrathoracic or intraabdominal abnormality.stable appearance of radiation changes in the left upper lobe.possible left-sided hydrocele partially imaged on this examination.

text: a 2.4 x 1.2 cm lobulated, partially spiculated lesion at the right lung base, stable over ten days, is quite vascular with two pulmonary artery branches coursing through it.the tissue plane between the lesion and the diaphragm is preserved.lungs are otherwise clear.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy and no pleural or pericardial abnormality.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are normal.a 6 mm, low attenuation region in the posterior right hepatic lobe, not fully characterized on this exam and likely splenic cyst are unchanged since the abdomen ct.the adrenal glands are normal.there are no bone lesions suspicious for malignancy.
summary: possible right lower lobe lung carcinoma.any ct scans earlier than ___ should be consulted to see if this is a longstanding postinflammatory or congenital abnormality.if chronicity cannot be documented pet scan or sampling should be considered.tiny liver lesion, probably benign, but warranting attention on future imaging.

text: the visualized thyroid enhances homogenously.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.there are prominent prevascular nodes (series 2, image 31) measuring to 7 mm, but none meeting ct pathologic size criteria.the pulmonary artery measures 2.8 cm, normal in caliber.there is no pulmonary embolus.the visualized aorta is normal in caliber and course without dissection.the heart is normal in size.there are no significant vascular calcifications.there is no pericardial effusion.central airways are patent to the level of subsegmental bronchi.there is atelectasis within the lingula and left lower lobe.there is no pulmonary mass, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax.there is mild paraseptal emphysema (series 2, images 13, 18).in the visualized abdomen, the liver, spleen, kidneys, adrenals, and pancreas are unremarkable.there is a prominent node anterior to the left lobe of the liver (series 2, image 84).incidental note is made of numerous splenules (series 2, image 76).
summary: no pulmonary embolus.no aortic dissection.mild left basilar atelectasis.mild paraseptal emphysema.

text: the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no significant mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the central airways are patent to the subsegmental bronchi.the previously reported patchy opacities in the right upper lobe have nearly completely resolved, compatible with resolving pneumonia.minimal ill-defined residual opacities are now present.no new nodular opacities have developed.skin thickening and post-surgical changes of the right breast are again noted.multiple right axillary lymph nodes are noted, the largest of which has slightly increased in size to 13.1 x 7 mm (was 11 x 7 mm).the other right axillary lymph nodes not meet the ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.in the limited imaging of the upper abdomen, cholecystectomy clips are again noted.a rounded low-density lesion in the spleen is unchanged.no adrenal nodule is detected.
summary: near resolution of patchy right upper lobe opacity, consistent with a resolving pneumonia.post-treatment changes of the right breast.minimal interval enlargement of a right axillary lymph node that now measures 13 x 7 mm.small low-attenuation splenic lesion unchanged.

text: right-sided pigtail catheter is again seen with the tip in the anterior pleural space.there has been marked decrease in size of previously seen loculated right-sided fluid collection.small amount of persistent pleural fluid and gas is seen.more focal area of consolidation in the right lower lung with air bronchograms is again seen.there has been interval decrease in size of the small left pleural effusion.6-mm nodular opacity at the left base (2:44) likely represents subsegmental atelectasis.heart and great vessels appear grossly stable.a 1.4-cm paraesophageal lymph node is again seen; 11 mm subcarinal node appears slightly larger compared to previous study.scattered mediastinal and axillary lymph nodes appear relatively stable.augmentation of the right lower lobe bronchial stamp with fatty material appears unchanged from prior study.small amount of subcutaneous gas seen along the right chest wall, in the region of previously seen chest tubes.there is also a 1.4-cm rounded relatively low attenuation lesion in this area, possibly representing seroma.limited views of the upper abdomen appear grossly unremarkable.paracaval lymph nodes do not appear significantly changed from prior.
summary: right-sided pigtail catheter seen within the pleural space anteriorly.there has been marked decrease in size of the previously seen loculated right pleural collection with a small amount of persistent pleural fluid and gas noted.decrease in size of left pleural effusion.5-mm nodular density at the left base likely represents atelectasis, although attention to this area on followup studies is recommended.otherwise, no significant change from prior study with multiple paraesophageal and mediastinal lymph nodes again seen.

text: examination of soft tissue windows demonstrates well-apposed appearance of the sternum to the level of the lowest sternotomy suture.however, inferior to this most inferior suture, there is residual separation of the inferior sternum.fluid collection is seen between the 2 sides of the sternum, measuring up to 2 cm tv by 5 cm ap size (previously 2.8 x 1.2 cm).in addition, more superiorly, posterior to the region of sternotomy sutures, there is persistence of soft tissue density thickening, slightly more prominent than on the prior examination.a small focus to the left of the sternum (series 2, image 23) was present on the prior examination.there is trace pericardial effusion.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right, which have increased slightly since the prior examination.no significant axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.coronary artery calcifications are again noted.examination of lung windows demonstrates increased left apical parenchymal density.in addition, there is persistence of atelectasis and ground-glass opacity associated with this within both lower lobes dependently and the left upper lobe dependently.mild ground-glass opacity is also seen along the right major fissure, again probably associated with atelectasis.a small 7 x 11 mm subpleural right upper lobe focus is persistent in appearance, which could represent a small infectious or inflammatory focus.evaluation of the central airways to the segmental bronchi bilaterally demonstrates patency.limited evaluation of the visualized upper abdomen is unremarkable.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic osseous lesions seen.
summary: close apposition of the sternum to the lowest sternotomy suture.increased fluid collection between the sides of the sternum which is inferior to the lowermost sternotomy suture, with slight increase in the size of this collection.we cannot at this time differentiate postoperative changes from an infectious dehiscence.right upper lobe subpleural opacity has somewhat polygonal appearance, probably representing focal infection or inflammatory change.however, followup examination in 3 months is suggested to ensure stability.

text: there are large, bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right, with reactive atelectasis.there are increased interstitial and alveolar opacities throughout the remaining lungs, which likely represents fluid overload.there are no filling defects within the pulmonary arteries to indicate a pulmonary embolism.the aorta is of normal caliber throughout the chest without evidence of aneurysm or dissection.an ng tube terminates within the stomach.there are coronary artery calcifications.there are scattered, non-pathologically enlarged axillary, superior mediastinal and pretracheal nodes.there is mild soft tissue stranding throughout the subcutaneous tissue suggestive of anasarca.vicarious excretion of contrast is seen within the gallbladder within the upper abdomen.
summary: large, bilateral pleural effusions with reactive atelectasis.diffuse alveolar and interstital opacities within the lungs consistent with fluid overload and/or left ventricular heart failure.no evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.

text: an endotracheal tube is seen terminating in the high trachea.within the lung in the right upper lobe, there is a 1.7 x 3.0 cm mass which extends along the bronchial tree towards the hilum.within the paratracheal region in the ap window, subcarinal region, and in both hila, there are necrotic-appearing lymph nodes in conglomeration.in the paratracheal region they measure up to 14 mm, in the subcarinal region they measure up to 18 mm.there are also small prevascular lymph nodes which have the same appearance.elsewhere in the lungs, there are several other pulmonary nodules, including on images 3:10, 30, 31, 39, 52, and 32.a nasogastric tube extends into the stomach.the heart size is not enlarged.there is a small amount of pericardial fluid.there is extensive aortic valve calcification as well as coronary artery and mitral annular calcification.the thoracic aorta is heavily calcified throughout.there is a right-sided chest tube in place, which terminates in the posterior region of the hemithorax.a small hydropneumothorax remains on the right.several minimally displaced rib fractures on the right are also noted with subcutaneous emphysema.
summary: lung mass in the right upper lobe with several other pulmonary nodules bilaterally as above.extensive medial and hilar lymphadenopathy.left adrenal lesion.all these findings are highly suspicious for metastatic lung cancer.multiple right-sided rib fractures with small right hydropneumothorax.chest tube in place.compression deformity of the l2 vertebral body.

text: there is a larfe soft tissue defect in the anterior chest wall with erosion of the sternum, particularly the mid-body.the upper and lower portions of the sternum are involved with mottled mineralization.streak artifact from the contrast bolus limits evaluation of the right clavicular head.the left clavicular head appears unaffected.minimal haziness in the anterior mediastinal/retrosternal fat is likely reactive and there is a preserved fat plane anterior to the aorta without evidence of invasion into the heart or great vessels.a 1.1 cm left prevascular lymph node is seen (4:44).there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.non-contrast imaging demonstrates no aortic intramural hematoma.following the administration of iv contrast, the thoracic aorta opacifies normally without dissection or aneurysm.the pulmonary arterial tree is well opacified without evidence of filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.there is no pneumothorax or left pleural effusion, but a trace right pleural effusion is seen.the thyroid is without nodules.bronchial secretions are present in the right bronchus intermedius.lung windows demonstrate no worrisome nodules, masses, or consolidation.there is bilateral apical pleural and parenchymal scarring.right dependent basilar atelectasis is seen.the imaged portions of the abdomen demonstrate heterogeneous liver enhancement, which may be secondary to arterial phase contrast.hypodensities within the right liver (4:97, 112) are too small to characterize.the upper portions of the kidneys enhance symmetrically.a hypodensity within the upper pole of the right kidney is too small to characterize (4:117).the spleen, and limited views of the stomach, bowel, and pancreas are unremarkable.incidental note is made of a replaced left hepatic artery originating from the left gastric artery.
summary: complete erosion of anterior chest wall soft tissues and the mid sternal body.no invasion into heart or great vessels.enlarged left prevascular lymph node measuring 1.1 cm.no pe or dissection.bronchial secretions in the right bronchus intermedius may represent some degree of low level aspiration.findings posted to ed dashboard and discussed with dr.___ ___ and dr.___ ___ 10:30 a.m.___.

text: a nasogastric tube is seen in place with tip in the stomach.there is an endotracheal tube in place, in good position.there is extensive density stranding anterior to the sternum within the subcutaneous tissues, with no collection well circumscribed.the sternotomy appears widened, up to 1.3cm.there is satisfactory opacification of the pulmonary vasculature with no evidence of pulmonary embolism.main pulmonary artery measures 3.2 cm, unchanged from prior.aorta is of normal caliber.there are moderate vascular calcifications within the aorta.the heart is enlarged with asymmetric enlargement of the right atrium.there is a right-sided central venous catheter with tip in the right atrium.there is a large right-sided pleural effusion and a moderate sized left pleural effusion with bilateral dependent atelectasis.no significant lymphadenopathy.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.nonspecific, bowel wall thickening of the right colon at the hepatic flexure and sigmoid colon.findings are non-specific, with differential including inflammation, infection and ischemia.large right pleural effusion and moderate size left pleural effusion with dependent atelectasis.severe, diffuse vascular calcification, heterogeneous appearance of the liver on post-contrast images with a severely enlarged right atrium, most likely in keeping with congestive heart failure.extensive atherosclerotic changes in the pelvis with patent surgical bypass anatomy as outlined above.moderate intra-abdominal ascites.the results were conveyed to the referring vascular surgery resident, dr.___ ___, at 4:30 p.m.

text: no significant mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy is present.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.no pleural or pericardial effusion is identified.lung window images demonstrate two, small, less than 5 mm, well-defined, non- calcified pulmonary nodules within the left lower lobe.additionally, within the superior segment of the right lower lobe, there is a tiny, non-calcified, peripherally located 2-mm pulmonary nodule present.all of these nodules are unchanged since the prior study.no focal areas of consolidation are identified.the intrathoracic trachea demonstrates an increased anteroposterior diameter relative to its coronal diameter, findings consistent with a saber-sheath trachea deformity.additionally, at the level of the aortic arch, there is a small posterolateral diverticulum of the trachea, which is an incidental finding.the airways are patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, an ill-defined low-attenuation lesion is again identified within the right lobe of the liver, unchanged since the prior study.visualized portions of the adrenal glands, kidneys, spleen, and pancreas are within normal limits.
summary: three, less than 5 mm, small pulmonary nodules located within both lower lobes.in this patient with known metastatic colon cancer, these findings could represent metastatic disease; however, benign non-calcified granulomas are also a possibility.a three-month follow-up ct scan of the chest is recommended to evaluate for stability of these findings.saber-sheath tracheal deformity, a finding consistent with copd.ill-defined lesion within the right lobe of liver consistent with metastatic colon cancer.

text: ct chest: the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.anomalous origin of the left vertebral artery from the aortic arch is noted.the lungs are clear.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusions.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.incidental note is made of a small hiatal hernia.
summary: t12 chance fracture with 4mm retropulsion of fracture fragment at t12.l1 superior endplate compression fracture.mri is recommended to further evaluate for spinal cord compression.probable interspinous ligamentous rupture at t12- l1 with splaying of the spinous processes and evidence of adjacent hematoma.trace free pelvic fluid.no evidence of injury to the solid or hollow viscus.

text: chest without and with contrast lung windows demonstrate dependent areas of airspace consolidation in the lung bases (3b:104) with thickening of the interlobular septa and ground-glass opacities noted in the lower lobes, right middle lobe, lingular segments, and posterior right upper lobe and periphery of the right upper lobe.there is relative sparing of the lung apices.paraseptal emphysematous changes are noted in the lung apex.no significant axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.prominent 1.2-cm ap window lymph node (3a:36).the central airways and proximal bronchi are patent.no cardiomegaly or pericardial effusion.no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.no thoracic aortic dissection.no main, lobar, or segmental pulmonary emboli are identified.
summary: pulmonary parenchymal changes of ground glass opacity and thickening of interlobular septae with relative sparing of lung apices, detailed above, with appearance suggestive of noncardiogenic pulmonary edema type pattern.mild dependent lung lower lobe basilar areas of consolidation could represent sequela of aspiration and/or early pneumonia in the correct clinical setting.colonic diverticulosis.intra-abdominal surgical changes of a recent roux-en-y procedure.no evidence of bowel obstruction.no main, lobar or segmental pulmonary emoboli.important findings were discussed directly with the ordering clinician, dr.___ ___ 12:26 pm cta chest w&w/o c&recons, non-coronary; ct abd & pelvis with contrastclip # ___ reason: pe protocol - eval for pe, infiltrate admitting diagnosis: gastrointestinal bleed contrast: optiray amt: 130 ______________________________________________________________________________ final report (cont) ___ ___, at approximately 1:45 p.m.on ___ by radiology fellow on call, dr.___ ___ ___.

text: there is no mediastinal, axillary, or hilar lymphadenopathy.the main airways are patent bilaterally.the lungs are clear with no nodules or diffuse opacities.the heart ___ are normal in size.there are scattered atherosclerotic calcifications within the thoracic aorta and coronary vessels as well as a hemodialysis catheter terminating at the cavoatrial junction.the intrathoracic aorta is not aneurysmal and there is no evidence of dissection.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.
summary: stable appearance of multiple focal arterial aneurysms and dissection, without evidence of rupture to explain patient's hypotension.extensive pneumobilia which may be explained by prior sphincterotomy, if this is the case.however, enterobiliary fistula cannot be entirely ruled out.eccentric bladder wall thickening, which is new from ___.correlation with urinalysis and urine cytology recommended.recommend non-urgent ultrasound and depending on findings of above, possible urology consultation.subacute-to-chronic fracture of the right inferior pubic ramus, new since ___.chronic renal disease associated with hemodialysis.

text: there is a large left pleural effusion, without internal septation or pleural enhancement.pleural fluid is relatively low density, consistent with simple fluid.there is mild compressive atelectasis.on the right, there is mild dependent atelectasis, but no pleural effusion or consolidation.the large left pleural effusion results in mild rightward mediastinal shift.the heart is normal in size, without pericardial effusion.within the distal svc and the left brachiocephalic vein, there are small filling defects consistent with nonocclusive thrombus.on the ___ ct, a central venous catheter was in place at the site of current thrombus.great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there is no hilar, mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy by size criteria.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to subsegmental levels.
summary: large rim-enhancing fluid collection in the splenectomy bed measuring 12.6 x 8.3 x 10.8 cm, concerning for abscess.no evidence of enteric fistula at this time, as there is no oral contrast within the collection.a percutaneous drainage catheter terminating posteriorly within the collection appears adequately positioned, but does not appear to be well functioning.this is amenable to percutaneous revision or new catheter placement.smaller intra-abdominal fluid collections adjacent to the xiphoid process containing small foci of air.additional collections are not well defined, and do not represent abscess at this time.large left pleural effusion without septation, pleural enhancement or other evidence of infection.mild bowel wall thickening, particularly in the left upper quadrant, likely reactive.nonocclusive venous thrombus in the svc and left brachiocephalic vein at the site of prior central venous catheter.findings discussed with dr.___ by dr.___.

text: more than a score of lung nodules ranging in diameter from a few millimeters to 12 mm are either new or larger since ___.the 12-mm nodule in the right middle lobe, 4:195, is new, near the site of prior wedge resection.a 10-mm right lower lobe nodule at the same level is new as is an 8 mm nodule at the left lung base, 3:55.examples of growing nodules are 3 at the same level in the right upper lobe, 3:30, 10, 9, and 11 mm respectively, previously 2, 5 and 9 mm.the volume of soft tissue at the site of the left upper lobe wedge resection is thicker than generally seen, but not necessarily an indication of local recurrence, and could be due, instead, to hemorrhage and atelectasis.there are no spine lesions suspicious for malignancy.
summary: multiple pulmonary metastases, increasing in size and number since ___.no other evidence of intrathoracic malignancy.

text: there is a right anterior pneumothorax.there is a tiny left medial and anterior pneumothorax.there are no signs of tension.extensive ground-glass opacities and focal airspace consolidations of the right lung are compatible with pulmonary contusion.rounded lucencies of the anterior right lung base are consistent with laceration (4:38).linear opacities at the left lung base and at the medial left are nonspecific and may be atelectasis, contusion, or aspiration.there is no pericardial effusion.there is a small amount of subpleural fluid.the aorta is intact, without evidence for acute traumatic aortic injury.the central pulmonary arteries opacify normally, without central pe.there is no pericardial effusion.the airways are patent bilaterally to the subsegmental level.
summary: extensive right pulmonary contusions.left peripheral and basilar linear opacities may reflect aspiration, atelectasis, or contusion.right pneumothorax.tiny left pneumothorax.no signs of tension.right middle lobe pulmonary laceration.grade ii segment vii liver contusion.no evidence for active extravasation.indistinctness and slight enlargement of the right adrenal gland may reflect an adrenal hematoma.right seventh, eighth, and ninth rib fractures.large right arm laceration with foreign bodies adjacent to the humerus, incompletely evaluated.comminuted right mid clavicle fracture.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ upon initial interpretation of study.

text: there is a tracheostomy tube in similar position.the adjacent fluid collection is improved, however.multiple small mediastinal lymph nodes are essentially unchanged.the heart, great vessels, and pericardium are unremarkable.as before emphysematous changes are noted with prominent biapical bullae, particularly at the right apex.there are persistent small bilateral pleural effusions although improved.there is persistent consolidation/atelectasis at the left lung base, but the appearance is again improved since the prior study.similarly there has been partial resolution of opacities in the lingula and at the right lung base.
summary: improving multifocal consolidations in the lungs.suspected sigmoid diverticulitis.the findings were discussed with the surgical resident caring for the patient at the time of interpretation.

text: an endotracheal tube terminates 2.5 cm above the carina.the lungs demonstrate patchy areas of upper lobe consolidation and other areas of subpleural ground- glass opacification, which likley represent pulmonary contusion.bilateral atelectasis is also noted.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.there is no pneumothorax.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.no evidence of large pulmonary embolus.

text: the examination is technically limited secondary to poor bolus timing.no filling defects are seen within the central or segmental branches of the pulmonary arterial vasculature to indicate pulmonary embolus.suboptimal opacification of the subsegmental distal branches limits interpretation.calcifications are seen within the coronary vessels.the thoracic aorta is ectatic, without evidence for aneurysmal dilatation or dissection.the airways are patent to the level of the subsegmental bronchi bilaterally.no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph nodes are seen.lungs demonstrate bibasilar linear opacities consistent with discoid atelectasis.mild bronchial wall thickening at the lung bases is likely inflammatory in etiology.there is no pneumothorax.there is mild stable apical scarring, right greater than left.no pericardial or pleural effusion is seen.in the imaged upper abdomen, large bilateral renal cysts as well as a moderate hiatal hernia are identified.
summary: no evidence of central or segmental pulmonary embolism.technically suboptimal study for evaluation of the more distal subsegmental branches.bibasilar atelectasis.thoracic spine kyphoscoliosis and ankylosis.

text: soft tissue window images demonstrate two small mediastinal lymph nodes, which were not pathologically enlarged by ct criteria.again seen is an area of low attenuation within the left thyroid lobe, which is stable in comparison to the prior study.no pericardial effusions are seen.the heart is normal in appearance.lung window images demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis, and tiny amount of pleural fluid at the left lung base.additionally, there is evidence of peripheral interlobular septal thickening, which may reflect changes from pulmonary vascular congestion.there are tiny peripheral nodularities in the lung, which may represent tiny areas of atelectasis.no pneumothorax is seen.there are scattered areas of ground glass at the lung bases.limited images of the superior portion of the abdomen demonstrate no abnormality within the visualized portion of the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, or stomach.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.there is aneurysmal ectasia of the aortic root, which measures 4.1 x 3.7 cm.stable left thyroid lobe nodule.areas of scattered ground-glass opacity, interlobular septal thickening, and atelectasis, findings which were consistent with mild chf.

text: there is no axillary, hilar or mediastinal adenopathy identified.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion identified.the pulmonary arteries are patent to the subsegmental level and without filling defects.extensive perihilar ground-glass airspace opacities are identified which are symmetric and bilateral.no discrete mass or consolidation is noted.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate extensive abdominal ascites.

text: there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.no pericardial effusion is identified.there are moderate coronary artery calcifications.the heart is mildly enlarged.there is a small left pleural effusion.there is an air space opacity within the left lung base either representing atelectasis or pneumonia.there is a subpulmonic fluid collection with thickened surrounding pleura which enhances consistent with an empyema.the size is slightly smaller compared to prior study from ___, when chest tube was present.
summary: reaccumulation of intraabominal abscess within the left upper quadrant.left pleural collection small in size with thicked, enhancing pleura likely representing empyema, decreased in size compared to prior.stable partial chronic thrombus seen within the portal vein and splenic veins which are markedly dilated.

text: the pulmonary arterial system is well opacified and there are no embolic filling defects.the aorta is normal in caliber and there is no evidence of dissection or aneurysm.note is made of a moderate left and trace right pleural effusion.there is no pericardial effusion.the lungs are notable for left lower lobe and right lower lobe atelectasis.in addition, note is made of faint areas of ground-glass opacity as well as smooth intralobular septal thickening, in particular in the upper lobes likely related to congestion in the setting of the aforementioned pleural effusions.the heart and great vessels are normal.note is made of bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy with a representative right hilar node, measuring 9 mm (7:49).in addition, there are multiple small lymph nodes in the upper mediastinum as well as supraclavicular region (7:9) which are not enlarged by size criteria, though are notable in number.incidental note is made of a right posterolateral tracheal diverticulum (7:9).additionally, incidental note is made of a bovine arch configuration to the great vessel anatomy.a left peripherally inserted central catheter ends in the lower portion of the superior vena cava.the study is not tailored for precise characterization of subdiaphragmatic content.those included however are notable for an enlarged left lobe of the liver extending beyond and lateral to the spleen.osseous structures reveal no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.moderate left and trace right pleural effusions with overlying pulmonary atelectasis.bilateral prominent hilar lymph nodes as well as numerous, though not frankly enlarged upper mediastinal and supraclavicular lymph nodes.close attention to these areas is recommended given the history of known malignancy.these results were discussed over the telephone by dr.___ with ___ ___, apn at 12:07 on ___

text: the visualized portion of the thyroid appears normal.there is no axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.an endotracheal tube is noted terminating 6 to 6.5 cm above the carina.bilateral pleural effusions are noted, massive on the right and moderate on the left, with associated bilateral lung atelectasis.no pneumothorax is seen.right-sided ij central line is noted with its tip at the cavoatrial junction.the aorta shows no evidence of dissection.calcified atherosclerotic disease is noted throughout the arch as well as in the coronary arteries.there is fusiform dilatation of the descending aorta to 4.5 mm in diameter.there is no pericardial effusion.the pulmonary artery shows no evidence of filling defect down to the subsegmental level.the patient is status post right upper lobectomy.
summary: distal aortic occlusion with thrombosis of the infrarenal abdominal aorta, proximal common iliac arteries and ___.distal reconstitution of the common femoral arteries bilaterally via collaterals from the inferior epigastric arteries and deep circumflex iliac arteries, with retrograde filling of the external and common iliac arteries.given the presence of these collaterals, the distal aortic occlusion is likely chronic.massive right, and moderate left, pleural effusions with associated atelectasis.status post right upper lobectomy.distended gallbladder with wall thickening and surrounding fluid concerning for acute cholecystitis.a right upper quadrant ultrasound is recommended for further evaluation.fusiform dilation of the descending aorta to 4.5 cm in diameter.

text: the examination is compared to ___.the sternotomy wires are intact.other than on the previous examination, the sternotomy is not consolidated and re-sternotomy is likely.anterior to the sternotomy (2, 10) a small approximately 15 mm fluid collection with a small gas inclusion is seen.both ventrally to the sternotomy and post-sternally, there is stranding of the subcutaneous and mediastinal fat, with a diffuse increase in the fat attenuation values.the areas of fat stranding have in part direct contact with pericardium (2, 29) but there is no evidence of pericardial effusion or of localized mediastinal fluid collection.some lateral portions of the pericardium, however, show minimal thickening (2, 25).status post cabg and aortic valve repair.status post mitral valve repair.small bilateral pleural effusions, not present on the previous examination.areas of atelectasis at the left lung bases, minimal left ventral pneumothorax of millimetric dimension.no substantial mediastinal lymph node enlargement.no other lung parenchymal disease, in particular no evidence of pulmonary edema.

text: no pulmonary embolism is identified from the main pulmonary arterial trunk to the segmental pulmonary arterial vessels bilaterally.there is a large left pleural effusion and moderate right pleural effusion with associated dependent and compressive atelectasis.the heart, pericardium, and aorta are unremarkable.no intrathoracic masses are seen.there has been interval enlargement of the left enlarged axillary nodes, the largest now measuring 1.6 x 1.7 cm, previously 1.0 x .9 cm.no pneumothorax.

text: 64-row mdct was performed from the thoracic inlet to the base of the lung following administration of 130 cc of optiray intravenous contrast.there is a bright focus possibly representing a metallic density to the right of the trachea seen on series 2, image 14.question if this is related to something aspirated which may have been aspirated.clinical correlation is advised.tip of the endotracheal tube is just at the thoracic inlet.there is no pneumothorax.there is almost complete collapse of the right upper lobe.clinical correlation and correlation with bronchoscopy is recommended.there is dependent atelectasis at the base of both lungs.the ascending thoracic aorta is normal in contour.there is no evidence of dissection.there is no aortic aneurysm.there is no pericardial effusion.there is air within the subclavian vein extending to the svc.there is good opacification of the pulmonary arteries.the patient is status post right breast reconstruction.

text: current study is compared to prior exam of ___.there is a new, 2-mm nodule within the right upper lobe (series 3, image 19).there is also a new pleural parenchymal nodularity on the left which can be seen on the same image.the remainder of the lung findings are unchanged including the ill-defined left lower lobe lesions.there has been no change in the hilar and mediastinal adenopathy.in particular, the previously measured lymph node within the right hilum which measures 8 mm, measures 8.8 mm at present.the heterogeneous and ill-defined paraesophageal mass lesion is overall unchanged in size and appearance as well.no definite pulmonary arterial filling defects.the aorta and great neck vessels appear unremarkable.there has also been no change in the metastatic focus involving the region of the right scapula.the liver is homogeneous without focal masses, the biliary tree is not dilated, and the portal vein appears widely patent.the left adrenal gland again demonstrates metastatic involvement, unchanged compared to the prior exam, and the right adrenal gland appears normal.the left kidney demonstrates a contour abnormality within the mid pole medially, and there is an approximately 18 mm focus which is strongly suspicious for either metastatic disease or second primary, this appears to be more prominent than on the prior exam.the pancreas and spleen are unremarkable.nodularity adjacent to the spleen, most likely a splenule, unchanged.there are scattered small retroperitoneal lymph nodes and although not meeting size criteria for pathologic enlargement, demonstrate fairly intense enhancement and are most consistent with metastatic disease.these are unchanged as well.the visualized loops of large and small bowel appear normal.
summary: compared to the prior exam of ___: 1.new 2-mm right upper lobe nodule as described, additional new pleural parenchymal nodular "scar-appearing" focus on the left, suspicious for metastatic disease.2.no change in remaining pulmonary parenchymal abnormalities, hilar and mediastinal adenopathy.3.no change in left adrenal involvement and scattered enhancing retroperitoneal lymph nodes.4.findings are consistent with a left renal neoplasm involving the mid pole medially which appears to be more conspicuous compared with the most recent prior two studies.

text: the lungs are clear.no pulmonary masses or nodules identified.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.the thoracic aorta is normal in caliber.the central pulmonary arteries opacify normally.high density material in right paratracheal region (2:17) is stable dating back to ___, likely calcified lymph nodes.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.atelectasis at the lung bases is mild.

text: no filling defect in the pulmonary artery to suggest pulmonary embolus.there are moderate atherosclerotic changes in the thoracic aorta; combination of soft and hard plaque.at the aortic arch, there is a contrast outpouching into the aortic wall, likely ulcerated plaque (3:29).tracheal stent has been placed, terminating approximately 2 cm above the ___.there are bilateral stents in teh main bronchus, which appear patent.there is a similar volume loss in the left lung with similar leftward shift of the mediastinal structures.the pulmonary opacities with air bronchograms and more inferior septal thickening at the left lung may represent post-obstructive pneumonia, radiation changes or aspiration.the lll superior segmental bronchus and lul bronchus remain occluded.there is ground-glass opacity of the dependent right lower lobe, which could be related to aspiration; however, less apparent to prior.there is small left pleural effusion.there is no pneumothorax.there is underlying emphysema in the lungs.there are multiple supraclavicular lymph nodes, left greater than right, which appear similar.there is a prominent right paratracheal lymph node.there is no pericardial effusion.heart size is normal.there is stable circumferential left pleural thickening with multifocal calcifications suggesting prior pleurodesis.

text: extensive centrilobular nodular opacities and peribronchial thickening which predominate in the upper lobes have improved in the interim.small segmental atelectasis in the left lower lobe is new.small pericardial effusion is stable.trace left pleural effusion is new.patient is post median sternotomy and cabg.extensive coronary calcifications are in the main left coronary artery, lad, circumflex, and pda.the airways are patent to the segmental level.numerous mediastinal perivascular, subcarinal, and right hilar lymph nodes have decreased in size; for instance, a superior right paratracheal lymph node measuring 19 x 15 mm was 21 x 18, a 15-mm precarinal lymph node was 20 mm, and an 18-mm subcarinal lymph node was 21 mm.there are no bone findings of malignancy.degenerative changes are seen throughout the spine.in the upper abdomen, extensive calcifications are in the splenic artery, otherwise the upper abdomen is unremarkable.
