text: there has been no significant change in the conglomerate mediastinal soft tissue mass extending from the pretracheal to subcarinal regions.the mass encases and narrows the right main pulmonary artery.it also encases the central bronchi, right greater than left.the right main bronchus appears occluded; however, there is still some residual aerated right upper lobe.the left bronchial tree appears patent.the large right pleural effusion is not significantly changed in size but there are signs of greater right hemithorax volume loss with interval shift of the trachea to the right.there is persistent collapse of the right middle and lower lobes.within the remaining aerated portion of the right upper lobe, there is new consolidation, which may represent superimposed infection in addition to partial atelectasis.interstitial thickening of the right upper lobe is suggestive of lymphangitic spread of tumor.there has been no significant change in ground- glass opacity of the left upper lobe and lingula.there remains a small left pleural effusion causing compressive atelectasis of the basilar left lower lobe.there is fluid tracking in the left major fissure.there is no change in a moderate pericardial effusion.limited evaluation of the liver, spleen and kidneys is unremarkable.again seen is fullness of the left adrenal gland, which is unchanged.
summary: no significant change in large confluent pretracheal and subcarinal mediastinal mass with encasement of the central bronchi and right pulmonary artery.no significant change in size of large right pleural effusion with associated collapse of the right middle and lower lobes.interval worsening of right hemithorax volume loss with shift of trachea to right.new consolidative opacity of the remaining aerated right upper lobe, which is concerning for superimposed infection (althogh my represent progressive atelectasis).unchanged ground-glass opacity of the left upper lobe and lingula which is nonspecific.unchanged small left pleural effusion with associated left basilar atelectasis.stable left adrenal gland fullness.stable moderate pericardial effusion.no change in diffuse osseous metastases.

text: the heart is enlarged, with coronary artery and aortic atherosclerotic calcifications.there are filling defects within multiple segmental pulmonary artery branches bilaterally, compatible with multisegmental pulmonary emboli.these involve branches to the upper lobes bilaterally to a greater extent than to the lower lobes.severe centrilobular emphysema is present.a ground-glass nodular opacity within the left upper ___ measures 5 mm (3:41) and is unchanged.previously noted nodule in the right lung base is not seen, likely due to slice selection.there are moderate bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, with associated atelectasis and aspiration/pneumonia of the adjacent lung.additionally, high-density material within the atelectatic left lung base is compatible with aspirated barium.tiny nodular opacities in a bronchovascular bundle, particularly within the right middle ___, ___ be reflective of prior granulomatous disease or lymph nodes.mediastinal lymph nodes are in the upper limits of normal.
summary: multisegmental bilateral pulmonary emboli.atelectasis and aspiration/pneumonia of the lung bases bilaterally, with aspirated barium seen within the left lung base.fluid overload, with anasarca and moderate bilateral pleural effusions.colonic wall thickening, also involving the rectum.although some of the wall thickening may be attributable to volume overload, these findings are again compatible with a pancolitis such as pseudomembranous colitis, improved from ___.area of stricturing and narrowing of the hepatic flexure, compatible with known colonic malignancy.perirectal abscess, measuring approximately 2.7 cm.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ at 5 p.m.on the day of the study.

text: there is no pleurally based mass identified.there is loculated fluid in the minor fissure which has a somewhat mass-like appearance on the plain film.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.the patient has emphysema.there is bilateral air space opacities in the mid to lower lung zones right greater than left.some areas of this appeared nodular due to underlying emphysema distorting its appearance most likely.the central airways are patent.there are multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes and subcarinal, hilar, tracheobronchial and paratracheal locations.there is coronary artery calcification.the upper abdomen is within normal limits.the bones reveal degenerative changes in the thoracic spine.there are bilateral calcified pleural plaques suggesting prior asbestos exposure.the abdominal aorta expands to 3.7 cm in infrarenal location and tapers to a normal size.the entire abdominal aorta is not imaged on this study and additional dilatation below this level cannot be excluded.there is extensive vascular calcification.
summary: no discrete mass identified.extensive emphysema with bilateral air space opacities and bilateral pleural effusions tracking into the minor fissure on the right giving a mass-like appearance on plain film.the lung findings are most likely to be related to diffuse infection, and the adenopathy above may be reactive.however, given the patient's underlying risk factors for lung cancer with emphysema evident and evidence of prior asbestos exposure, follow up chest ct in 3 months after appropriate treatment is recommended to ensure resolution of the adenopathy and parenchymal findings.infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 3.7 cm.the entire abdominal aorta is not imaged and a dedicated ct aortogram could be performed if clinically warranted.

text: endotracheal tube is seen with its tip at the carina.the ng tube is also seen with its tip in the proximal stomach.the mediastinal great vessels appear intact.there is no evidence of mediastinal hematoma.the heart is normal in size and shape.there is no pericardial effusion.there is no lymphadenopathy in the axilla, mediastinal or hilar distribution.lung windows demonstrate bilateral posterior airspace consolidation, which likely represents a combination of atelectasis and aspiration.no worrisome nodules or mass lesion appreciated.no pleural effusions are present.there is no pneumothorax.the central airway is patent.
summary: bilateral airspace consolidation in the posterior lungs, likely a combination of atelectasis and aspiration.hypervascular renal lesion arising from the lower pole of the right kidney.this lesion appears very suspicious for renal cell cancer and further evaluation is recommended with multiphase ct or mri.this finding was discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of this dictation.additional hypodense renal lesions are most compatible with cysts.cholelithiasis.diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.fat-containing inguinal hernias.et tube tip positioned at the carina.recommendation for retraction has already been discussed with dr.___ of surgery.small hypervascular liver lesions, incompletely assessed though likely fnh or hemangioma.this lesion can also be fully characterized on multiphasic ct or mri.sesha

text: there is heavy atherosclerotic calcification of the thoracic aorta and great vessels.there is cardiomegaly and coronary artery calcification.there is no pericardial effusion.after administration of iv contrast there is evidence of thrombus in the right main pulmonary artery as well as segmental and subsegmental branches of the right upper lobe pulmonary arteries.no thrombus is seen within the left pulmonary arteries.small mediastinal lymph nodes are demonstrated which are numerous but not enlarged by ct criteria.scattered air space disease is seen within the right middle lobe and right lower lobe which may represent atelectasis, infection, or infarction given evidence of pulmonary embolism.there is bibasilar atelectasis.there is no evidence of pneumothorax or pleural effusion.limited imaging of the upper abdomen demonstrates evidence of splenectomy with small fluid collection in the left upper quadrant measuring 3 cm which contains gas consistent with post-surgical changes.small amount of fluid measuring 2.4 cm x 1.6 cm is seen adjacent to the pancreatic tail.
summary: evidence of pulmonary embolism on the right as described with air space consolidation within the right middle and right lower lobes which may represent atelectasis, infection, or pulmonary infarction given evidence of pulmonary embolism.limited evaluation of post-surgical changes in the left upper quadrant as seen on prior ct abdomen and pelvis.findings were discussed with the resident taking care of the patient at completion of the examination.

text: no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy is identified.the lungs are clear.no pulmonary nodules or fibrosis are identified.there is minimal bibasilar atelectasis.the heart and great vessels are normal in size.
summary: two rim-enhancing masses within segments 5 and 6 of the liver measuring up to 2.4 cm, worrisome for metastatic disease.stable solid enhancing and cystic pancreatic masses.evaluation of the kidneys and retroperitoenum are severely limited due to the extensive clip artifact.small masses and interval growth may be missed given the limitation.

text: the airways are patent to subsegmental levels bilaterally.the previously detailed multifocal bilateral consolidations are markedly improved since ___.there is near- complete resolution.large bilateral pleural effusions are enlarged.associated with this is bibasilar atelectasis.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.
summary: marked resolution of previously seen pulmonary opacities with residual, enlarged bilateral pleural effusions.moderate amount of ascites as well as gallbladder wall thickening, which is likely related to third spacing as opposed to cholecystitis.persistent splenomegaly.findings discussed over the telephone with dr.___ ___ by dr.___ at ~5:45pm on ___

text: 8 cm mass within the left lower lobe grows into the left lower lobe bronchus and is associated with complete collapse of the left lower lobe.the post-radiation changes of the left upper lobe and superior segment of the right lower lobe are noted.mild atelectasis of the right lung base is noted and the remainder of the right lung is clear.the left pleural effusion is small.partial calcification of the mural thrombus in the left main pulmonary artery indicates it is chronic.aside from an one 11 mm prevascular node, no central nodes are pathologically enlarged.the endotracheal tube and ng tube are in the standard positions.small amount of pericardial effusion with no evidence of tamponade.22 x 31 mm right thyroid lobe and a calcified 13 x 12 mm left thyroid nodule.there is a 22 x 20 mm left adrenal mass, which cannot be further characterized on this study.there is also a 7-mm enhancing lesion within the right lobe of the liver.calcified granulomas of the liver are noted.the gallbladder, spleen, left adrenal gland and the superior pole of the kidneys appear unremarkable.
summary: 8 cm mass of the left lower lobe grows into the left main stem bronchus and is associated with complete collapse of the left lower lobe.post- radiation changes of the left lung and the superior segment of right lung are noted.chronic, nonoccluding embolism within the left main pulmonary artery.right adrenal mass, which cannot be further evaluated on this study.differential diagnosis includes metastasis and adenoma.if further evaluation is required, mri of the abdomen or ct of the adrenals can be obtained.7-mm enhancing lesion of the right lobe of the liver.differential diagnoses include flash-filling hemangioma and fnh.fracture of the proximal left humerus.

text: in the right upper lobe is a 7.6 x 7.2 x 7.6 cm mass, which has increased in size since the previous examination.there is increased ground-glass opacity in the periphery of this mass (2:17).this mass extends medially, invading into the mediastinum and causing obliteration of the right upper lobe apical bronchi, unchanged.the azygos vein is obliterated as well as the pulmonary artery supplying the right upper lobe, stable.within the right middle lobe is a 5.8 x 3.6 cm mass, increased in size since the prior examination.multiple subcentimeter size nodules within the right lower lobe are grossly stable to somewhat increased in size.a small pleural effusion on the right is larger.there remains areas of linear enhancement along the pleura concerning for pleural metastatic invasion.a 1.9 x 1.6 cm node along the right anterior mediastinum (2:20) has increased in size.subcentimeter nodules in the left lung (3:18, 29) appear stable.the thoracic aorta appears normal.the main pulmonary artery is enlarged measuring 3.6 cm, somewhat increased.however, apart from the obliteration of the right upper lobe pulmonary artery due to the mass there is no evidence for pulmonary embolus.no pericardial fluid is present.there is a small left effusion.there is fluid within the esophagus which is only somewhat distended.there is extensive soft tissue within the mediastinum (2:19) in an area of invasion.a 4-mm prevascular lymph node (2:19) is present.there is no significant axillary lymphadenopathy.limited views of the upper abdomen appear within normal limits.
summary: increased size of right upper, and right middle lobe pulmonary masses.the right upper lobe mass invades into the mediastinum causing obliteration of the right upper lobe bronchi, and right apical pulmonary artery.increased size of a right pleural effusion with pleural enhancement concerning for pleural invasion.some areas of increased ground-glass opacity, particularly in the periphery of the large pulmonary masses.while this most likely is due to tumor extension, pneumonia is not entirely excluded.small left effusion with stable subcentimeter left-sided pulmonary nodules.enlarged main pulmonary artery, but no evidence for pulmonary embolism.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolus.the heart remains normal in size.the great vessels are normal.there is unchanged ill-defined fat stranding and metallic clips within the anterior mediastinum, presumably the location of thymoma resection.the appearance of this region has not changed since prior exam.the patient is status post median sternotomy.the airways are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.there is stable appearance of left paramediastinal lung fibrosis and traction bronchiectasis in the left upper lung lobe consistent with prior radiation to this region.there is mild ground-glass opacity at the right lung base, which may reflect dependent changes.there has been interval progression of the multiple pleural lesions, which are either unchanged or larger in size compared to the previous study.for example, a lesion abutting the major fissure now measures 37 x 33 mm, previously measuring 27 x 27 mm.another lesion at the left lung base (3:76) now measures 13 mm x 33 mm, previously measuring 10 mm x 26 mm.multiple metastatic masses are again seen in the left upper quadrant.a previously seen mass abutting the greater curvature of the stomach now measures 19 x 26 mm, which previously measured 12 mm x 27 mm (3:78).another mass abutting the greater curvature of the stomach now measures 16 x 28 mm (3:69), which previously measured 15 x 18 mm.again seen are multiple masses along the left lateral aspect of the pericardium.note is made that a fat plane remains between these masses and the myocardium (3:64).please note this examination was designed for evaluation of the chest and only a small portion of the upper abdomen was included.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.interval progression of metastatic lesions, including increase in size of left pleural and left upper abdominal masses.the fat planes between the lesions abutting the greater curvature of the stomach are effaced, which could reflect invasion of the stomach.stable appearance of the thymus surgical bed in the anterior mediastinum.

text: the tracheostomy tube terminates 2.6 cm above the carina.there is a left-sided picc with tip terminating in the cavoatrial junction.the tracheostomy tube appears to enter the airway from the right, displacing what appears to be fluid filled proximal trachea to the left (5, 1).the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.there are bilateral small pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis.allowing for significant respiratory motion, there is likely a component of interstitial edema.central airways are patent.assessment for focal lesion is highly limited.
summary: small bilateral pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis.large abdominal ascites.nodular liver contour suggestive of cirrhosis.large volume splenic infarct and bilateral renal infarcts, compatible with history of endocarditis and septic emboli.anasarca.findings reported to dr.___ via phone at 5:50 pm on ___.

text: comparison to a ct dated ___ (prior to debridement).dense left upper lobe consolidation in the anterior aspect (2; 26) has slightly worsened with more extensive airspace opacification since ___.the posterior consolidation is not significantly changed.the left upper lobe bronchus previously occluded, now demonstrates mild re-opening however is very narrowed (2; 28-30).the left apex demonstrates increased air or gas as there is minor aeration of the apicoposterior segment bronchus and bronchioles peripherally, new since ___.interval dilation of bronchioles and branching lucencies in the left upper lobe are most consistent with bronchiolectasis.a well-circumscribed, rounded, gas-containing cavity in the left upper lobe (2:27) is most likely due to recent debridement rather than cavitatory necrosis, and is in the location of the previously seen low attenuation lesion.the extensive post-obstructive pneumonia, atelectasis and postoperative gas limit measurement of the primary lesion.ground-glass opacity and multifocal consolidation in the left lower lobe has progressed, this may relate in part to aspiration and in part to compressive atelectasis by the enlarging left pleural effusion.the left pleural effusion has also enlarged and appears non-hemorrhagic.a small right pleural effusion and minor right lower lobe atelectasis have developed.right paratracheal, subaortic, prevascular adenopathy is unchanged since ___, the largest node in the subaortic space, measures 17 mm (2:24).there is no pathologic enlargement of the axillary or supraclavicular lymph nodes.the cardiac size is normal.there is no pericardial effusion.the study is not tailored for evaluation of the upper abdomen, only to confirm normal-appearing adrenals.lower thoracic spine degenerative disease is moderate to severe.
summary: progression of left upper lobe atelectasis and consolidation as above.status post recent debridement with gas in the area of the previously seen lesion and re-opening of the left upper lobe bronchus, as above.there is stenosis of the left upper lobe bronchus, however there is mild increase in aeration of the apicoposterior segment with peripheral dilated bronchioles.progression of ground-glass and consolidation in left lower lobe, possibly related to aspiration and in part to compressive atelectasis due to enlarging left pleural effusion.small right pleural effusion with adjacent atelectasis.unchanged lymphadenopathy.

text: 11.5 x 14.6 mm noncalcified soft tissue nodule in the right lower lobe, 3:50, has not grown since ___ when comparable diameters were 16 x 12.6 mm.thin section imaging shows relatively low density characteristics, averaging 18hu.patient has had right thoracotomy and proximal right middle rib osteotomy.this was presumably related to mild right pleural thickening, calcification, and subpleural atelectasis, all unchanged since ___.left pleural surfaces and the pericardium are normal.minimally enlarged central lymph nodes are stable ranging up to 11 mm in the right lower paratracheal and 10 mm in the prevascular stations.this study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation except to note the absence of adrenal mass or any irregularities in the liver concerning for malignancy.
summary: right lower lobe nodule (non-fdg avid as of ___ pet/ct scan) has not grown since ___.followup recommended for 8-12 months.small number of borderline enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes, unchanged.pleural thickening, calcification, and subpleural atelectasis unchanged following right rib resection.

text: extensive heterogeneous soft tissue mass containing coarse calcification is present within the mediastinum and right hilar region, circumferentially encasing and irregularly narrowing the distal trachea, carina, and the main bronchi bilaterally, with almost complete airway obstruction on the right upper lobe bronchus and proximal left main bronchus.the bronchus intermedius and right middle lobe bronchus are also mildly narrowed by this mass.the right upper lobe pulmonary artery is obstructed by this mass due extrinsic compression, and the right upper lobe segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries are unopacified, and pulmonary embolism or thrombosis within these vessels cannot be excluded.the remaining central branches of the pulmonary arteries are normally opacified, without evidence of pulmonary embolism.the distal svc is severely circumferentially narrowed by the mediastinal mass, however, no proximal collaterals are identified, and the vessel remains patent.there are multiple partially calcified lung nodules, with the two largest ones measuring 12.5 x 9.4 cm in the right middle lobe (image 64), and measuring 10 x 12 mm in the lingula.there are multiple other smaller calcified nodules in the lungs compatible with granulomas.there are patchy ground- glass opacities within the right upper, right lower, and left lower lobes which are non-specific, and could represent an inflammatory or infectious process.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.in the heart, there is a small pericardial effusion.there is marked coronary artery calcification.there is a question of pericardial node, (image 2:97) measuring 20 mm in diameter.the aorta is normal in caliber without evidence of dissection or aneurysm.the descending aorta is seen with significant vascular calcification and atheroma.there is 1-cm focal hypodensity in the left thyroid lobe, compatible with a thyroid nodule.the evaluation of abdominal parenchymal organs is limited, but there are multiple punctate calcific foci in the spleen and the right hepatic lobe, consistent with granulomas.there is no free air or fluid in the intra- abdominal cavity.
summary: extensive soft tissue mass in the mediastinum and right hilum containing calcification with marked attenuation and encasement of the central airways, obstruction of the right upper lobe pulmonary artery, and distal svc.differential diagnosis for these findings include fibrosing mediastinitis and lung cancer.evidence of prior granulomatous disease.patchy areas of ground-glass opacity within the right upper, right lower, and left lower lobes which are non-specific, but may be due to an infectious or inflammatory etiology.left thyroid nodule.clinical correlation is recommended and thyroid ultrasound can be performed for further evaluation.right upper lobe segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries are not opacified due to obstruction of the right upper lobe pulmonary artery, and pulmonary embolism within this region is not excluded.extensive aortic calcification and atheroma without evidence of aortic dissection or aneurysm.non-opacification of the right upper lobe pulmonary artery, could be secondary to the compression from the mediastinal mass, but cannot exclude pulmonary embolism or thrombosis in the right upper lobe.no evidence of pulmonary embolism in other parts of the lungs.

text: airways are patent up to subsegmental level.there are bilateral pulmonary airspace opacities, which are nonspecific, could be due to aspiration, infectious or inflammatory process.no pleural or pericardial effusion is seen.heart size is normal.there is no filling defect in the pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolism.there is no evidence of aortic dissection.there are no enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum, hilum, or axillae.
summary: no evidence of acute aortic syndrome or pulmonary embolism.bilateral nonspecific small patchy opacities in the lungs.differential diagnosis includes infectious and inflammatory etiologies, as well as aspiration.recommend clinical correlation and follow-up.

text: again note is made of somewhat ill-defined right hilar nodule measuring 2.5 x 2.0 cm, increased in size compared to the prior study, worrisome for increasing metastasis.the mass abuts the bifurcation of right middle bronchus.there is 2.3-cm nodule abutting the pericardium anterior to the left hilum, increased in size compared to the prior study, most likely representing increasing metastatic lymphadenopathy.coronary arteries are calcified.there is bilateral pleural effusion, larger on the left, associated with atelectasis, new compared to the prior study.there is no significant pericardial effusion.coronary arteries are calcified.in the lung window, there is peripheral opacity in right lower lobe, likely representing small foci of atelectasis.tiny left apical nodule measuring 8 mm is again noted.previously noted right lower lobe nodule is not confidently identified on this study.in the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, no gross abnormalities are noted, however, the evaluation is somewhat limited due to motion artifact.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.there is no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion in skeletal structures.
summary: increase in size of right hilar nodule measuring 2.8 cm, with increase in size of 2.3-cm nodule anterior to the left hilum, worrisome for increasing metastasis.7-mm nodule in the left apex.previously noted right lower lobe nodule is not confidently identified on this study.new bilateral pleural effusion with left lower lobe atelectasis.small peripheral opacity in right lower lobe, most likely representing atelectasis.unchanged small thyroid nodules.

text: there are extensive bibasilar consolidations, infections of this site cannot be fully excluded.there is a left lower lobe 8 mm pulmonary nodule (2:22) and a right middle lobe 5-mm pulmonary nodule (2:21), both stable.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, greater on the left.there is mild centrilobular emphysema.smooth septal thickening within the lungs bilaterally, suggests mild pulmonary edema.there is extensive calcification of the thoracic aorta, but no aneurysm.there is extensive coronary artery vascular calcifications.the patient is anemic as the vascular walls are more dense than the intraluminal blood.there is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the lobes of the thyroid are heterogeneous with hypodense nodules.
summary: extensive gastric mucosal thickening, worrisome for malignancy.soft tissue density mass moderately displacing the left kidney with adjacent osseous destruction, concerning for a metastasis.soft tissue density masses within the right hemisacrum and left illiac ___.these findings are concerning for metastatic disease.status post cholecystectomy with dilatation of the common bile duct.periportal edema.extensive degenerative changes of the thoracolumbar spine with scoliosis.extensive coronary artery disease and aortic calcifications.atelectasis in bilateral lung bases, although infection cannot be excluded.there are small bilateral pleural effusions and evidence of mild pulmonary edema.heterogeneous thyroid.ultrasound could be performed on a non-emergent basis for better evaluation if indicated.diverticulosis without diverticulitis.findings were communicated to dr.___ ___ at the time of study interpretation.further evaluation with iv and oral contrast ct is recommended.

text: airways are patent up to subsegmental level.there are bilateral pleural effusions, worse on the right than left.the right pleural effusion is only minimally hyperdense and not particularly suggestive of a substantial hemorrhagic component.bilateral multifocal areas of ground- glass opacity, and consolidation appears improved compared to prior study particularly in the upper lobes.there is a solid soft tissue nodular opacity about the pleura, measuring 1.9 x 1.2 cm, (2:28), which appears slightly smaller compared to prior ct from ___.there is interval improvement in previously- seen conglomerate opacity at the right lower lobe.there is a persistent hydropneumothorax.there are multiple small mediastinal lymph nodes.there is a prosthetic device at the left atrial appendage, consistent with a therapeutic device for afib.coronary artery calcifications are seen.there is a trace pericardial effusion.
summary: right-sided hydropneumothorax.bilateral pleural effusions but no evidence for a substantial hemorrhagic component.minimal hyperdensity may be associated with slight hemorrhagic content, however.mild interval improvement in the widespread pulmonary abnormalities.no evidence of retroperitoneal bleed.omental fat stranding inferior to the tip of the liver, could be congestive, focal of unclear significance, without nodularity.

text: respiratory motion particularly at the lung bases limits evaluation for pulmonary embolism in subsegmental arteries, otherwise there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism to the segmental level.the aorta is normal in caliber.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.lower density of the blood in the heart compared to the myocardium suggests anemia.mediastinal, hilar and axillary lymph nodes are small, not meeting size criteria for adenopathy.the central airways are patent to the segmental levels.in addition to dependent atelectatic changes and plate-like atelectasis in the left lower lobe, there are peribronchiolar nodular opacities predominantly in the left upper lobe but also in the right upper lobe and to a lesser extent in the lower lobes.while the current study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, note is made of nodular thickening of the left adrenal gland, which is incompletely imaged.the spleen is also incompletely imaged but measures up to 12.3 cm on axial imaging.there is redemonstration of s-shaped scoliosis of the thoracic spine.there is no region of bony destruction seen concerning for malignancy.
summary: assessment for subsegmental pe is limited due to respiratory motion particularly in lung bases.otherwise no evidence of pulmonary embolism to segmental levels.peribronchiolar nodules with adjacent ground glass opacities are suggestive of an acute infectious etiology but are not specific for a particular organism and may be due to viral, mycoplasma, mac or bacterial etiology.however nodular opacities are not typical for pcp.probable anemia.

text: a large thrombus is seen originating at the junction of the right axillary and subclavian veins extending proximally to the confluence of brachiocephalic veins and proximal svc.there is minimal extension into the proximal right internal jugular vein.in comparison to ___ exam, there is only minimal change in the position of the thrombus, which is now seen in the very proximal part of the svc.the subclavian vein is prominent in caliber.multiple bilateral small segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli described on ___ exam are not well characterized on current study due to differences in technique.there are no pathologically enlarged, axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes.no distinct pulmonary mass or nodule is identified.there is no focal consolidation.small left pleural effusion is seen with adjacent area of compressive atelectasis.there is no pneumothorax.heart size is top normal.there is no pericardial effusion.right hilar calcified lymph node is unchanged.this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation; small-to-moderate amount of ascites appears increased in size from prior exam.large hepatic cyst is stable in appearance.periesophageal varices are again noted.
summary: large thrombus originating from the junction of the right axillary and subclavian veins extending proximally into the confluence of brachiocephalic veins and the very proximal segment of the svc.there is also a superior extension of the clot into the right internal jugular vein.in comparison to ___ exam, there is only minimal change is size and position of the clot, with miniminal extension into the proximal svc.multiple bilateral segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli characterized on ___ exam, are not well evaluated on current study given the differences in technique.stable appearance of a hepatic cyst.mild interval increase of the small to moderate amount of ascites.

text: this examination is slightly limited by respiratory motion in this ventilated patient as well as streak artifact generated by the patient's arm down by his side.allowing for this limitation, no pulmonary embolism is identified.the patient is intubated with an endotracheal tube terminating in the mid- trachea.there is an ng tube passing through the esophagus.a swan-ganz catheter is present with tip in the main pulmonary artery.the heart is normal in appearance and there is no pericardial effusion.there are multiple lymph nodes in the mediastinum.the largest discrete node is located in the prevascular space and measures 1 cm in short axis dimension.there are also small hilar lymph nodes bilaterally.lung windows reveal dense consolidation in both right and left lower lobes posteriorly with right lung involvement greater than left.patchy foci of consolidation and ground glass opacities are present throughout both right and left lungs.the airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi.there are small bilateral pleural effusions.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: dense bilateral pulmonary consolidation affecting the right lower lobe and, to a slightly lesser degree, the left lower lobe.bilateral pleural effusions.the findings are in keeping with multilobar pneumonia.no ct evidence of central pulmonary embolism.as described above, it is difficult to exclude small peripheral pulmonary emboli with certainty.

text: multiple calcified nodes measuring less than 5 mm are seen in the right hilum, left hilum, sub carinal and in the precaval region.the size of these nodes do not approach the significant limit for mediastinal lymphadenopathy.diffuse coronary artery calcification noted.atherosclerotic changes noted in the ascending and descending thoracic aorta.sternotomy sutures noted.areas of parenchymal scarring noted in the right middle ___, ___ suggest focal areas of atelectasis.a 4 mm nodule seen in the left lower ___ near the hemidiaphragm is unchanged compared to the prior study.previously visualized nodule in the right perifissural region is not currently visualized.no new lung nodules detected.the heart size appears normal.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.
summary: decrease in size of the segment vii liver lesion.areas of hypoattenuation surrounding the lesion may represent post-treatment changes.enlarging segment ii liver lesion, now measuring 16 x 11 mm and previously measured 10 x 8 mm on ___.stable bilateral adrenal gland enlargement with a small adrenal adenoma on the right side.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.unchanged 4-mm noncalcified left lower ___ nodule.the other lung nodules seen in the prior study currently are undetectable.no new lung nodules detected.

text: there are no enlarged mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes.there are bilateral axillary lymph nodes which have increased in size and number compared to the prior study.the largest one measures 9 mm in short axis diameter.there is minimal pericardial fluid.there is a small amount of left pleural effusion.lung windows demonstrate interval improvement in the bilateral ill-defined pulmonary nodules,there is a residual hazy opacity in the right upper lobe measuring approximately 1 cm.there is a residual nodule in the left lower lobe which measures 1.2 cm and is surrounded by a hazy area of consolidation.this also appears improved in the interval.there has been interval development of a small left effusion which extends into the major fissure.
summary: interval decrease in size and number of pulmonary nodules, no evidence of intrathoracic or intraabdominal abscess.

text: comparison made with a ct abdomen (which included the lung bases) dated ___.a peripherally inserted central venous catheter is in satisfactory position with its tip at the cavoatrial junction.the tracheostomy and nasogastric tubes are in satisfactory position.there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.there is mild generalized cardiomegaly.bilateral pleural effusions and lower lobe atelectasis are moderately severe and have increased since previous imaging.smooth septal thickening is noted in the aerated lung in association with diffuse ground-glass opacity, which in conjunction with the history of cardiac arrest and the degree of significant subcutaneous anasarca indicate moderate pulmonary edema.there is no pathologic enlargement of the mediastinal, axillary, or supraclavicular lymph nodes.mild degenerative joint disease involving the entire thoracic spine is mild.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.enlarging bilateral pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.mild pulmonary interstitial edema in conjunction with extensive anasarca.the result was communicated to dr.___, internal medicine resident, at 3:30 p.m ___.

text: there is a moderately-sized left pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis.atelectatic changes on the dependent portions of the right lung are noted.the heart and great vessels are normal in size.there is no evidence of vascular injury.there is rupture of the left hemidiaphragm with herniation of the stomach, spleen, and loops of small bowel into the left hemithorax, and retraction of the central tendon.no rib fracture is seen.
summary: left hemidiaphragmatic rupture with herniation of the stomach, spleen, and loops of small bowel into the left hemithorax.left moderately-sized pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis.no evidence of intraabdominal bleeding.no evidence of liver or spleen laceration.the findings were discussed with the trauma service at the time of the interpretation.

text: the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is a 5-mm subcarinal lymph node.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.there are bilateral patchy ground glass opacities with upper lobe predominance.a 1.0 x 1.0 cm low-attenuation lesion is seen within the right bronchus intermedius.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: 1.0 x 1.0 cm low attenuation focus within the right bronchus intermedius.direct clinical correlation with bronchoscopy should be performed.patchy ground glass and peribronchial opacities with upper lobe predominance likely secondary to aspiration or inflammation.other less likely causes would include hypersensitivity pneumonitis or rb-ild (if there is a history of smoking).close clinical correlation is recommended.a three month follow-up chest ct can be performed for further evaluation.?? ?? ?? ??

text: numerous non-pathologically enlarged pretracheal, carinal and subcarinal lymph nodes are present.the heart demonstrates calcification of the lad and left circumflex coronary arteries.the great vessels appear normal.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, with adjacent atelectatic changes.in addition, there is a non-specific, patchy density within the lingula adjacent to the left heart border.there is an ill-defined area of ground-glass opacification in the right middle lobe adjacent to the heart.the visualized soft tissues demonstrate several punctate calcifications within the left breast.correlation with physical exam and mammogram is recommended.
summary: soft tissue mass involving the t6 and t7 vertebral bodies with significant bony destruction and impingement upon the spinal cord.there is destruction of the l4 vertebral body as well.neoplastic vs inflammatory.several punctate calcifications within the left breast.correlation with physical exam and mammogram is recommended.small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.numerous non-pathologically enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes.

text: since the prior examination from ___, there has been marked improvement in multiple diffusely scattered areas of ground-glass nodules, some of which demonstrated cavitation, now with only minimal residual ground-glass opacification demonstrated within the lower lobes.there are no newly occurring focal parenchymal opacities or pulmonary nodules.in the site of the known treated left upper lobe non-small cell lung cancer, a fiducial seed is demonstrated.there is nonspecific peribronchovascular ground-glass opacification, similar in extent since ___, with no residual solid component, that is nonspecific, likely related to post-treatment changes with plus or minus component of the resolving process from ___.a prominent right hilar lymph node is stable.there is no new mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.tracheobronchial tree is patent to the subsegmental level.a 2.7 x 1.8 cm anterior mediastinal soft tissue lesion demonstrates increased fat attenuation, most compatible with a component of thymic hyperplasia.a right approach port tip is in stable standard position, terminating within the cavoatrial junction.there is a small hiatal hernia.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.two hypodense liver lesions demonstrated within the right hepatic lobe (series 2, image 51 and series 2, image 55) have been previously characterized as hemangiomas from ct torso examinations from ___ and ___.there is cholelithiasis without secondary signs of cholecystitis.there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification with areas of atherosclerotic plaque demonstrated involving the infrarenal abdominal aorta.the visualized upper abdomen is otherwise unremarkable.
summary: marked interval improvement of diffuse ground-glass nodules since examination from ___ with only minimal residual ground-glass.in the absence of systemic chemotherapy, this process is unlikely related to metastatic disease.although nonspecific, it may represent a resolving infectious etiology or smoking-related etiology such as langerhans cell histiocytosis.no specific signs for tumor recurrence.nonspecific peribronchovascular ground-glass opacification in the left upper lobe, likely be related to post-treatment changes and resolving diffuse inflammatory/infectious process.

text: there is a 3 cm fluid collection in the left breast, likely a seroma.there is no significant axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymph node enlargement.there are no pleural effusions.there are no pulmonary arterial filling defects to suggest embolism.lung windows show dependent linear and ground-glass opacities bilaterally, likely representing atelectasis.bone windows show no lytic lesions.
summary: bibasilar atelectasis.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.

text: there are large bilateral pulmonary emboli extending from the main pulmonary arteries to the lobar and segmental pulmonary arteries of all lobes.while the caliber of the main pulmonary artery is within normal limits, enlargment of the right ventricle suggests right ventricular strain.scattered atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications are noted.the aorta is of normal caliber without evidence of acute aortic pathology.calcified mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes demonstrate no interval change.there is no pleural effusion with a small pericardial effusion.lung windows reveal no focal consolidation or evidence of infarction.a calcified granuloma in the right lower lobe is unchanged.although this exam is not tailored to evaluate abdominal organs, limited evaluation of the upper abdomen reveals a right adrenal lesion which, although unchanged in size, does not meet ct criteria for adenoma on noncontrast images.scattered prominent mesenteric lymph nodes are incompletely evaluated.bone windows reveal no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: large bilateral pulmonary emboli with evidence of right heart strain.small pericardial effusion.adrenal lesion cannot be classified as adenoma.recommend nonurgent evaluation with adrenal protocol ct or mri if this has not been characterized in the past.

text: multifocal consolidations are seen in both lungs, predominating in the right upper lobe and bilateral lower lobes.consolidations are superimposed on underlying bronchiectasis and fibrotic change.background emphysema is apparent on thin-section images, which predominates in both upper lobes in a centrilobular and paraseptal distribution.one more focal rounded area of consolidation is seen in the posterior left lower lobe, measuring 2.1 cm tv x 2.1 cm ap x 2.0 cm si (4:179 and 6:38).several subcentimeter nodular opacities are seen in the right lung apex superior to a more confluent solid consolidation, which may represent quiescent non-quiescent foci of this consolidation vs.focal nodules.there is a granuloma at the left apex (4:48).there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.axillary nodes are not enlarged.a left hilar node measures 9 mm in the short axis (2:31).calcified nodes are seen in the left hilum inferiorly.other mediastinal nodes do not appear particularly enlarged.the right hilar opacity appreciated on radiograph corresponds to an elongated right pulmonary artery.the right pulmonary artery measures up to 2.4 cm in diameter.there are coarse calcifications of the thoracic aorta and arch, and mural thrombus is noted in the descending thoracic aorta.the left atrium is enlarged.coarse coronary artery calcifications are seen.several clips are noted in the left breast.there is a large hiatal hernia.the exam is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis.several calcified granulomas are seen in the liver and spleen.the gallbladder is markedly distended, measuring 9.1 cm in length and 4.5 cm in transverse dimension.a small gallstone is seen dependently.rounded low-attenuation lesions are seen in the pancreas, including a 6-mm lesion in the proximal pancreatic body and a 1.5 cm low-attenuation lesion in the lower uncinate process (2:61).there is some calcification of the right adrenal.some calcifications of each kidney appear vascular in nature, while others may represent non-obstructing calculi.there is heavy atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta and branches.there are no bone findings concerning for malignancy.there is mild left convex scoliosis centered at the thoracolumbar junction.
summary: multifocal conglomerate opacities predominate in the right upper lobe and both lower lobes, superimposed on bronchiectasis and fibrotic change.the findings are most compatible with multifocal pneumonia, in the appropriate clinical setting.however, at least one area is rounded and more confluent, as described in the left lower lobe.bronchoalveolar carcinoma cannot be excluded.close interval follow up is recommended to assess for this possibility, with special attention to the left lower lobe area described.centrilobular and paraseptal emphysema, upper lobe predominant.evidence of prior granulomatous infection.coronary artery and aortic atherosclerosis.distended gallbladder.two low-attenuation lesions of the pancreas as described, measuring up to 1.5 cm.these may represent ipmn.large hiatal hernia.jr

text: previously noted 17-mm right hilar node measures approximately 15 mm on today's study, not significantly changed.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.again noted coronary artery calcifications.the heart and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion.there has been interval development of small right-sided pleural effusion.again seen a nodule in the right upper lobe, that measures 13 mm today, compared to 15 mm previously.there has been an interval development of typical radiation changes in the right paramediastinal distribution, with fibrosis and distortion of the normal anatomy.again noted are several calcified granulomas in the left lung.there are no new lung nodules.
summary: no evidence of disease progression, no hilar mass.interval development of small right pleural effusion and radiation fibrosis in the right paramediastinal lung.unchanged size and appearance of right upper lobe nodule and right hilar lymphatic node.findings were discussed with dr.___ at 12 p.m.on ___.

text: the left apical lung mass (target lesion #1) has enlarged.it remains difficult to measure but has increased in size from approximately 2.4 x 1.3 x 2.8 cm on the prior study of ___ to 3.3 x 2.6 x 6.2 cm (4:11, 500b:37).ill-defined right middle lobe nodule (target lesion #2) is now better defined and has enlarged from 10 x 5 mm to 12 x 8 mm (4:30).in addition, there is interval development of additional nodules in this region (4:31, 34, 37).in addition previously described third spiculated nodule in the anterior right upper lobe has enlarged and expanded with apparent satellite lesions; this lesion previously measured 1.4 x 1.3 cm and currently measures 3.2 x 1.8 cm (4:25).additional new nodules can be seen in the right upper lobe (4:16, 19) as well as in the left upper lobe (4:27).again there are dependent atelectatic changes.there is new small left pleural effusion.the central airways remain patent and there is no pulmonary embolism.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes are again seen.while many are unchanged in size for example, precarinal lymph nodes measuring up to 8 mm in short axis, some of these appear to have increased in size, for example, right paraesophageal nodes previously measuring 6 mm in short axis and now measuring 11 mm (4:31).otherwise, the appearance of the heart and great vessels is unchanged, with coronary artery calcifications again noted.there is no pericardial effusion.
summary: overall progression of disease with increase in size of pre-existing pulmonary lesions as well as increase in number of pulmonary nodules.increase in size of some mediastinal lymph nodes and also two paracaval nodes in the abdomen.enlargement of small hypodense lesion in the spleen.new minimal left pleural effusion.the oncology table in careweb has been updated.status post left nephrectomy, without evidence of local recurrence.tiny gallstone without evidence of cholecystitis.sigmoid diverticulosis without diverticulitis.

text: moderate centrilobular emphysema is unchanged, most significant at the right apex.inflammatory change and scarring at the right lung apex is little changed.there are post-surgical changes of left upper lobectomy, chest wall and flap reconstruction, with a normal post-operative appearance to the left lung hilus and bronchial stump.there has been interval involution and contraction of post-operative hematoma and fibrotic scar.mediastinal structures are shifted to the left as a result.the airways are otherwise.the thyroid gland is normal in appearance.there is no central lymph node enlargement.pleural thickening with calcification is unchanged.the ascending aorta is ectatic measuring 4.2 cm.the pulmonary arteries are well opacified and are patent to subsegmental levels.there is no pericardial effusion.there is calcification of the aortic valve annulus and of the coronary arteries.although this exam is not tailored for the evaluation of structures beneath the diaphragm, it shows a small radiodense gallstone within an otherwise normal-appearing gallbladder.there is no lytic or blastic bony lesion.
summary: no evidence of new or recurrent malignancy.flap repair and chest wall revision intact.emphysema and scarring unchanged.

text: the opacified pulmonary arterial tree does not demonstrate any filling defects indicative of pulmonary embolus to the level of the subsegmental pulmonary arteries bilaterally.there is no significant mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.emphysema is again noted throughout the lung fields, most severe at the bases.there are fibrotic changes and bronchiectatic changes involving the posterior aspect of both lower lobes.the endotracheal tube is in satisfactory position.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are identified in the visualized osseous structures.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.severe emphysematous changes.

text: open surgical defect is present in the upper left breast, with internal gauze packing.there are no drainable fluid collections.right subclavian catheter terminates in the mid svc.thoracic aorta and central pulmonary arteries are unremarkable.heart size is at the upper limits of normal, without pericardial effusion.coarse calcifications are noted in the left anterior descending and circumflex coronary arteries.moderate bilateral pleural effusions are present, left greater than right.these demonstrate a partially loculated morphology, with internal attenuation of 30 hounsfield units, suggestive of complex fluid/malignant effusion.there is adjacent compressive atelectasis.there is a 5-mm nodule in the right middle lobe (3:18).multiple prominent intrathoracic lymph nodes are present, measuring 14 mm in the precarinal region, 8 mm in the right hilum, and 10 mm in the subcarinal region.there is no axillary or internal mammary adenopathy.
summary: bilateral moderate pleural effusions, likely malignant effusions.5-mm right middle lobe nodule and prominent intrathoracic lymph nodes.large right lobe hepatic metastasis and innumerable nodal metastases in the porta hepatis, mesentery, and retroperitoneum.

text: note is made of markedly atherosclerotic thoracic aorta with tortuosity, with calcified and noncalcified atherosclerotic plaques, as seen previously, however, there is no evidence of dissection.the pulmonary artery is mildly enlarged, measuring 3 cm at the main trunk, however, there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.evaluation of subsegmental branches of the lower lobes are somewhat limited due to motion.subclavian arteries are not visualized in this study on post- contrast images.there is 1.4-cm precarinal node, overall unchanged since prior study.there is enlarged right hilar and infrahilar node, measuring 2 cm, overall unchanged since prior study.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.there is excessive collapsibility of the right main bronchus, suggestive of bronchomalacia, however, evaluation is limited.there is mucous secretion in the left main bronchus.again note is made of moderate centrilobular emphysema.there is peribronchial thickening bilaterally in lower lobes, more marked and increased since prior study in right middle and lower lobes, with faint patchy opacities at the right lung base, suspicious for inflammatory or infectious process.there is no pneumothorax.there are degenerative changes of the thoracic spine with ossification of anterior longitudinal ligament.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion is noted.in the visualized portion of the upper abdomen, no gross abnormalities are noted except for dense calcification of the aorta and splenic artery, however, the evaluation is limited.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.limited evaluation for subsegmental branchies in the lower lobes due to motion.atherosclerotic and tortuous aorta with calcified and noncalcified plaques, however, no evidence of dissection.centrilobular emphysema.peribronchial thickening in bilateral lower lobes, with increased patchy opacities in the right lower lobe, worrisome for infectious or inflammatory process in this area.please note that subclavian arteries are not visualized on post-contrast study on this study.

text: cta: there is a long type a aortic dissection.small hemopericardium is present.however, the rca, lad, and left circumflex artery remain well opacified.the dissection extends the entire length of the aorta and through the common iliac arteries bilaterally and to the level of the mid right external iliac and proximal right internal iliac arteries and also the proximal left internal iliac artery.the true lumen is very small in the descending aorta and occludes the two right renal arteries.the right kidney is completely infarcted.a small amount of clot is noted within the proximal single left renal artery.however, the left kidney continues to enhance normally.both the celiac trunk and superior mesenteric artery originate off the true lumen which is markedly compressed by the false lumen.the celiac artery is only faintly opacified, although the liver remains perfused.however, the splenic artery is not opacified and the spleen is completely unopacified.the proximal superior mesenteric artery also demonstrates only a faint amount of opacification with contrast; however, the mid and distal aspects of the sma including the distal mesenteric arteries remain well perfused with no evidence of ischemic injury to the bowel.the inferior mesenteric artery also originates off the false lumen but is well opacified throughout.
summary: long type a aortic dissection with a small hemopericardium.rca, lad, and lcx remain opacified.dissection extends through the common iliac arteries and into the proximal left and right internal iliac arteries and mid right external iliac artery.complete infarction of the right kidney and spleen.small amount of clot in the proximal left renal artery although the left kidney remains normally perfused.liver remains perfused but the blood supply in the celiac trunk appears tenuous.blood supply in the proximal superior mesenteric artery is also tenuous although good flow is seen distally.inferior mesenteric artery remains normally opacified.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___, vascular fellow, at 4 pm on ___, via telephone by dr.___ ___.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the heart and pericardium are within normal limits.no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph nodes are seen.bilateral pleural effusions are present (right greater than left).there is diffuse ground glass and patchy parenchymal opacity within both lungs (left greater than right).an element of pulmonary edema may also be present.limited views of the upper abdomen, limited views of the liver and spleen are within normal limits.no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions are identified.reformatted imaging: images were reformatted in the coronal and sagittal plane and were essential in evaluating the patient's pulmonary arterial vasculature and showed no filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.diffuse bilateral areas of patchy parenchymal and ground glass opacity (left greater than right) a nonspecific finding that could represent an infectious or inflammatory process.no areas of pulmonary parenchymal consolidation are seen.small bilateral pleural effusions (right greater than left).mild pulmonary edema.

text: there is a moderate right and a small left pleural effusions.within the lung parenchyma there are patchy opacities with bronchial thickening and a "tree and ___" appearance.this is most likely related to an infection and atypical ___ such as mycobacterium including ___ should be included in the differential diagnosis.no discreet nodules or masses are seen.there is compressive atelectasis of the dependent portions of the right lower lobe due to the right pleural effusion.there are multiple mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes seen, none of which meet size criteria for pathological enlargement.no pulmonary embolism is identified.there is a moderate hiatal hernia.there are severe degenerative changes in the thoracic spine.the patient is also severely kyphotic.coronal and sagittal reconstructions support the above findings.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.moderate right pleural effusion with associated compressive atelectasis of the dependent portion of the right lower lobe.small left pleural effusion.scattered opacities in bilateral lung parenchyma with bronchial thickening.this is most likely related to an infectious and atypical ___ such as mycobacterium, including ___ should be considered in the differential.

text: there has been interval improvement in the previously seen scattered ground glass and nodular opacities, particularly in the lingula.there are persistent dependent consolidations with associated small effusions.an endotracheal tube and right subclavian catheter are again present in stable position.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.there are no new focal areas of consolidation.the airways are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.
summary: unchanged appearance of the transplant liver as discussed previously with patent hepatic vasculature.improvement in the multifocal patchy and ground-glass opacities in the bilateral lungs with persistent depending consolidations.slight interval increase in amount of fluid in the left upper quadrant and in the pelvis compared to the ___ study.

text: there is a large ascending aortic aneurysm complicated by pseudoaneurysm formation most likely due to a penetrating ulcer.the orifice of the penetrating ulcer lies approximately 4.5 cm distal to the aortic valve and extends over craniocaudal distance of 2.5 cm.in total, including both the pseudoaneurysm and true aneurysm, the maximum diameter of the descending aorta is 6.7 cm.there is an adjacent intramural hematoma which extends along the ascending aorta but does not reach the origins of the great vessels.the penetrating ulcer forms effectively a pseudoaneurysm along the right lateral border of the aorta measuring approximately 2 x 4.4 cm.the arch of the aorta is tortuous but otherwise unremarkable; however, the descending thoracic aorta is aneurysmal with a maximum diameter of 4.5 cm at the level of the carina.this is causing compression of the left main bronchus as it passes anteriorly.the heart is diffusely enlarged with most marked enlargement of the right atrium.in addition, there is significant reflux of contrast into the ivc which is also distended.the pulmonary vessels are normal in caliber indicating likely tricuspid valvular disease.there is adequate opacification of the pulmonary arteries to the subsegmental level and no pulmonary embolus is seen.there is a pericardial drain in situ with a small amount of pericardial fluid still seen.it is difficult to measure the density of this material accurately; however, it seems to be denser than simple fluid raising the possibility of a hemopericardium, correlation with the drain output is recommended.there are large bilateral pleural effusions causing compressive atelectasis, otherwise, the lungs are grossly clear.the study is not tailored for evaluation of the subdiaphragmatic structures; however, visualized portions of the liver are unremarkable in appearance.
summary: ascending aortic aneurysm complicated by a penetrating ulcer arising 4 cm from the aortic valve.this ulcer is wide-mouthed with a 2.5 cm intimal gap seen.intramural hematoma extending along this pseudoaneurysm proximally but not reaching the origin of the great vessels.cardiomegaly with marked enlargement of the right atrium suggests tricuspid valve disease.large bilateral pleural effusions.dual-lead pacemaker in situ.dr.___ discussed the findings with dr.___ ___ by telephone at 2:20 p.m., ___.

text: scattered axillary and mediastinal lymph nodes measure up to 11 mm in short axis.no pathologically enlarged hilar lymph nodes are seen.the patient is status post median sternotomy and cabg with atherosclerotic calcifications involving the thoracic aorta and native coronary arteries.the main pulmonary arteries appear normal.there is no pericardial effusion.an endotracheal tube appears well positioned.a left central venous catheter terminates in the upper superior vena cava.lung windows reveal moderate left greater than right pleural effusions associated with a minimal amount of atelectasis.extensive peribronchovascular ground-glass opacities extend from the hila bilaterally.no lung mass is observed.a moderate amount of secretions are noted in the lower trachea and carina.
summary: diffuse bilateral peribronchovascular ground-glass opacity more likely represent edema than infection.moderate left greater than right pleural effusions.anasarca with mild ascites and mesenteric edema diffusely.hypodense splenic and hepatic lesions of unclear etiology or chronicity without priors.secretions in trachea near carina raise risk of aspiration.

text: there is no evidence of pulmonary embolism to the subsegmental levels.the aorta and great vessels are unremarkable with no evidence of acute aortic syndromes.there is extensive atherosclerotic disease involving the thoracic aorta and its major branches and the coronary arteries.re-demonstrated are extensive prominent mediastinal lymph nodes.for example, there is a subcarinal lymph node (3:49) that demonstrates interval enlargement since most recent prior examination now measuring 16 mm in transverse diameter where on prior examination it measured 10 mm.in addition, there is a right hilar lymph node (3:39) now measuring 17 mm in transverse diameter where on prior examination it measured around 9 mm.several paratracheal lymph nodes have also demonstrated interval increase in size, for example, (3:39), there is a 10-mm in short axis lymph node that is enlarged from 7 mm.in the prevascular space, there is a 13-mm in short axis lymph node that is roughly stable in size.there is no axillary adenopathy.clips are noted within the right axilla, and post-biopsy changes are noted within the right breast.re-demonstrated is severe emphysema within the lungs.subpleural scarring is noted within the right middle lobe.bibasilar reticulated pattern has increased since examination from ___ and also ___; however, there has been also interval development of patchy opacification in this region.there is no evidence of pneumothorax, pleural, or pericardial effusion.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.partially imaged portions of the liver, spleen, and stomach are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.continuing interval growth of central mediastinal lymphadenopathy that could be related to lymphoproliferative reaction, inflammatory conditions with metastasis thought much less likely though not entirely excluded.interval development of patchy opacification within the lower lobes.given rapid increase superimposed infection and/or aspiration is suspected.there may also be a background of radiation change and copd.severe emphysema.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.there is no pneumothorax.left lower lobe collapse is unchanged.abnormal areas of ground glass attenuation are re- demonstrated in the left upper lobe and scattered foci in the right upper lobe.no definite endobronchial lesions are seen.right lower lobe wedge shaped opacity is unchanged in appearance, and demonstrates contrast enhancement, possibly representing an area of post- obstructive atelectasis due to mucus plugging.area of probable discoid atelectasis adjacent to the minor fissure is unchanged.multiple small mediastinal lymph nodes are again seen, but none meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.small left pleural effusion is unchanged.there is no right pleural effusion or pericardial effusion.heart size is normal.coronary artery calcifications are unchanged.old right rib fractures are seen, with nonunion of one of the fractures.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.
summary: unchanged appearance of left lower lobe collapse.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.unchanged appearance of wedge shaped right lower lobe opacity, which enhances post-contrast.this may represent a postobstructive process due to mucus plugging.unchanged small left pleural effusion.unchanged coronary artery calcifications.

text: the heart and pericardium are unremarkable with resolution of previously noted pericardial effusion.no filling defects are identified in the pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolism.there is unchanged appearance of a saccular aneurysm along the inferior aspect of the descending aortic arch with intraluminal thrombus within.no intimal flap is identified to suggest dissection.evaluation of lung parenchyma demonstrates ill-defined regions of subpleural ground-glass opacity within the right upper lobe which is new since previous study.a 3-mm non-calcified pulmonary nodule is noted in the right lung apex (4:12) which is also present on previous study from ___.the major airways are patent down to the subsegmental level.no axillary, mediastinal or hilar adenopathy is present.there are bilateral small pleural effusions left greater than right with associated passive atelectasis.scarring is still present in the right upper lobe and the left lung base.
summary: no dissection or pulmonary embolism is identified.there is a stable small saccular aneurysm along the inferior aspect of the descending aortic arch.new small regions of subpleural ground-glass opacity in the right upper lobe.appearance is nonspecific.small bilateral pleural effusions left greater than right, new compared to the previous examination.

text: as seen previously, and unchanged, there are multiple scattered mediastinal lymph nodes, some of which are at the upper limites of normal in size.there are minimal bilateral hilar nodes, non- enlarged, and unchanged.no significant axillary nodes are seen.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are stable.the lungs are clear without nodules, masses, or areas of consolidation.no pleural effusions.
summary: stable appearance to mediastinal, perigastric, and mesenteric lymph nodes compared to prior exam of ___, which do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.however, the increased total number of lymph nodes identified is somewhat atypical, the significance of which is unclear.small to moderate sized hiatal hernia.
